review_content: Great bed and breakfast. We stayed in the 1st floor king suite. Amazing location just one block from kings. The room and staff were impeccable. Parking was easy. The breakfast was very nice. You can get snacks, coffee, or tea around the clock. The included wifi was more than adequate. The only reason I didn't give this place a 5 was that it can be a bit noisy from the street and from people walking in this older house and from above. Little bit of a creaky house thing going on. So I would suggest staying on the second floor. Also, the breakfast was good for me (who is not a huge breakfast guy) and consists of cereal, fruit, breads and pastries, and a couple of rotating items like ham croissants one day and grits and an egg biscuit bake the other. Be aware that this isn't a huge eggs and bacon type of breakfast some people may be expecting with a B&B.Highly recommended place to stay and dogs are welcome.The location is perfect. But, my husband and I stayed in room 1 and there was a street light in the window that was shining through all night.  They need curtains. we are pretty rough today from lack of sleep.Also, we ended up paying more than what we were quoted when we made the reservation. We also stayed at King George across the street this weekend, it was much better.We stayed here for a few days while in Charleston on vacation. For the relatively low price, it is good. Friendly staff, great location. The free parking is a huge bonus.Don't expect a real breakfast.  Apparently that only happens on the weekends, when staying here is more expensive. That doesn't bother me because there is so much good food in Charleston.  There is real coffee (not hotel junk) that the wife says is delicious.   This is an historic hotel near college of Charleston built in 1787 I think.  The floors may well be original.  I would advise not walking on them in socks because they are crazy slippery.  The room is nice and clean.  The cleaning staff is efficient.  My complaints are 1) the heat doesn't really work and 2) there is a hot tub where there should be a regular shower.  We were here when it was cold (for here) and the heater basically blew cold air.  The thermostat said it was 70, but it clearly was not.  This same failure occurs at my office building where cold air blows on us all and the management company claims that the thermostat says 68 so there isn't a problem.  Right...The shower is a problem.  A hot tub should never be combined with a shower.  If you are going to have. Shot tub, it needs to be a stand alone unit.  This isn't a 5 star spa/hotel and a hot tub is unnecessary.  Worse, it interferes with taking a shower because it makes getting in and out more difficult than it normally would be. I'm not 100 years old, but it is some effort to step into an empty hot tub because the idiot who installed it did not make it flush with the floor as a hot tub should be but instead basically dropped it on the floor and caulked it in where it sat. This is an issue the hotel should address with the contractor.  The wife comments that the hotel has soft towels, which she says is unusual.  The staff is not wasteful she  says, meaning that the shampoo and conditioner does not get thrown out and replaced every day.Great location and super cute Charleston inn!  We stayed in the carriage house and the room was very nice and clean.  My only complaint would be the beds were not the most comfortable but they were horrible either.  Quaint and charming with a friendly and helpful staff. They put out cookies every night, which was a nice treat!  Highly recommended for a nice Charleston visit!Very pretty house inside and out. The location is pretty good except for the very loud late night college crowd.Quaint little inn on a quiet side street with enough parking to accommodate one car per room (there are only 14 rooms). The staff is very friendly and helpful. Keep in mind that this is a very old home, all original hardwood floors, so you can pretty much hear every move that is made in upstairs and adjacent rooms. Bedding and towels are very clean. The bathroom in my room needs some serious updating though. The ceiling has been patched a hundred times and there's a rotting old trap door up there that frightens me a bit. But if you're in Charleston and don't plan on spending a lot of time in your room, it's sufficient, clean, and charming. Daily breakfast is served (yay, hard boiled eggs! Happiness!), afternoon tea, sherry, and cheese/crackers every day from 4-5, and my favorite thing...the baking of the cookies around 7:30pm...the smell is divine. These are left out for guests overnight alongside a pitcher of ice water. Midnight snack ready. Very close to amazing restaurants and tons of shopping!A nice little B&B that is in a quiet neighborhood near the College of Charleston. It is one block over from King Street (think shopping) and a short walk from the market and East Bay St (think dining/drinking/waterfront) The staff was very helpful and friendly, although I did overhear a few snotty conversations between staff members about each other. However, when they interacted with guests everyone was completely pleasant. The breakfast was good even the coffee (which is hard for me to say good coffee since I tend to be a "coffee snob"). The rooms were spacious and comfortable. There is cable and WiFi available, and while I do not go on vacation to watch TV the actual TV sets are the size of my computer monitor (21").The place does need a little renovation. Ceilings were cracking, large holes in the guttering, & peeling wallpaper,.I can put up with this because of the location that is far enough away from East Bay street to be lots cheaper than the average B&B closer to the battery. A nice choice in downtown Charleston.Such a great place to stay. Location is perfect, walking distance from everything - right on top of King's for shopping, around the corner from Market, a hop skip and a jump from the battery.The charm of the house is matched by the charm of the service. Breakfast on the back porch near the courtyard was intimate, delicious, and a great start to a beautiful day.The room rate is a little pricey, but worth it for the unique atmosphere and complimentary tea time and breakfast.The only thing keeping this from a 5 is the antique beds, which though beautiful, are a little noisy for a romantic weekend in an old home with paper thin walls. Just a heads up :)We have stayed here a few times and it is a nicely restored Inn in a convenient location. You can park here which is a plus. You can walk from here to all the downtown areas.Ebony was nice enough at the check-in. Poor girl is sitting there trying to learn the job it seemed while Leeanne comes over and embarrasses her with quick responses as if she's a moron. Then Leanne was cool enough later to be moody again for my wife asking for ice. I don't like Leeanne. The place is cramped as usual B&Bs, but very pretty. Ugh, why do I always pick B&Bs?! #canIdoThis #isThisAllowedEbony was cool the whole time.This past November, my family and I visited Charleston just before Thanksgiving, and settled on the Barksdale House Inn as an off the beaten path, quiet place to stay.  Located in a generally quiet neighborhood near the College of Charleston, the Barksdale House is a bit off the beaten path, while still within an easy walk to Market and King Streets as well as the waterfront.The house itself well decorated, and maintains its' historical air while still being modern in its' amenities.  There are actually two buildings; the front house and then a back, newer building.  The main house only has a small common space, however the staff make the dining area and kitchen available to guests as needed, which was a nice touch.  Our rooms had gas fireplaces, and  comfortable beds which set the mood in the spacious rooms for a feel of "Old Charleston".Weekend breakfasts were buffet style, and consisted of some traditional hot entrees like Scrambled Eggs or Potato Cakes, along with fresh fruit and pasteries.  During the weekdays they served a cold continental breakfast.  While filling and of a good variety, we found it to be a bit lacking for a Bed and "Breakfast".  The staff during our stay were all quite pleasant, and had good recommendations for  things to do or places to visit in the area.  The staff we interacted with were students at the College,  and more than accommodating for our requests.  We were even able to arrive early in the morning and leave our luggage until check-in on the day of our arrival as well as  leave our luggage again until the evening of the day of our departure, which was a nice touch.Overall a great quiet place to stay in Charleston.My girlfriend and I stayed for two nights in room 8 and I've never been more satisfied. The breakfasts were great and free breakfast in bed is worth the entire stay. I would recommend this to anyone who is tired if staying in hotels that all Look and feel te same. And with a 1 minute walk from the best shopping in the south my girlfriend was extremely happy. Will be back again.The Inn is in a great location and has free parking, all a plus. While our room was big and comfy we didn't have any towels upon arrival. We had to ask for them and didn't even get a full set. Breakfast is...really blah. If we had to do it all over again we'd skip breakfast and go to a cafe. The services was 50/50. During the day there was the sweetest lady who really tried to make everything great. The evening shift girl was extremely unfriendly and very clearly did not want to be there.  Although the Inn is not a 5 starer I would stay here again.Very nice place. Perfect location -walk to shops, food n etc. Charming and clean, quiet, updated electric n plumbing, good array at bkfst .  good staff but no staff after 8 pm - part of a chain of bnb's.I stayed at Barksdale with my mom and our Toy Poodle after Christmas. We both had time off work and decided to take a trip to Charleston for a couple of days. We chose Barksdale because it was dog-friendly and in the center of town. It was clean, our room spacious, had parking, and most importantly within walking distance to everything. We drove to dinner one night because it was chilly out, but otherwise we walked everywhere with our pup. The staff was friendly. They have a small breakfast in the morning and some tea/snacks around 4. We chose to eat out one day and caught the weekend breakfast before we left. We're pretty independent and didn't hang around the b&b much, but if you just need a place that you'll feel comfortable keeping your dog and close to the action this did the job.I love this place and will stay again.  We stayed the week prior to Thanksgiving and had our dog in tow.  We were concerned about the reviews of the staff initially but needed a place that would accommodate our dog.  The staff was incredible. Wesley checked us in the first evening and made us feel at home immediately. Room was clean, well maintained - it is an old house so prepare for old house charm - we had a creeky spot in our floor. I tried to avoid it for the sake of the people staying in the room below.  Water pressure in the shower was fantastic and the water was very hot. Bed was super comfy. Breakfast on the weekend, was mini omelets (containing meat), pancakes, muffins, fruit and cereal. Coffee/tea as well. It is served in the main house complete with roaring fire. The only downside I see is if you are in one of the rooms at the front of the house. You may hear breakfast noise in these rooms if you're not an early riser. The breakfast atmosphere is great for chatting with the staff/guests to exchange dining or touring advice. The location is a block and a half off King st, the shopping and dining area in the city. Couldn't be better!Good location and free parking. BUT! DON'T STAY HERE! We had a two night stay here. While we were out enjoying Charleston a pair of my valuable and sentimental earrings given as an anniversary gift were stolen from our room!!! The theft was reported to management of the Barksdale but they were very ambivalant about it. Reminded us of the "waiver" we signed, blah, blah, blah. We had not expected a whole lot, but this was unforgiveable. Of all our third world travels, nothing like this has ever happended. A perfect get-away weekend spoiled. So you don't take valuables....then think about the hair found on the sheets, the not so clean bathrooms,no tissue, etc. etc. rather worn and forelorn, and staff with apparant sticky fingers! DON'T LET THIS HAPPEN TO YOU! a fine city with plenty of options. This shouldn't be one of them!The good:Free parking.  Location was great, just steps from King Street which is full of shopping and restaurants, and only about a 20 min walk to the Battery, Rainbow Row, etc.  Room (we stayed in Room 9 I believe, on the third floor with two beds) was very clean, and it had its own thermostat which was nice.  Hot breakfast on the weekends, and it was delicious.The bad:Unlike most bed and breakfasts, the only common area is a room which has a desk/office set up in half of it for the employees, and the other half is where the breakfast buffet goes.  There are metal tables w/ tablecloths in the hallway and outside on the porch for you to eat at.  The porch itself is serviceable but kind of dirty with dead bugs and trash bins taking up one end.  There is no real place to sit and relax, other than the tables in the hallway or porch- so the only place to relax really is your room.  Most bed and breakfasts I've stayed in have a big comfy living room for you to relax in, as well as a nice dining area- rather than have that, they chose to fit in as many rooms as they absolutely could.  During breakfast, the employees kept up a constant stream of complaints to each other- it's a little hard to enjoy breakfast when you are stuck listening to employees complain to each other about the guests, having to do check in/check out of guests, complaints about their personal lives, complaints about other employees not getting there on time, etc etc.  Highly unprofessional, and the number one rule in customer service is don't complain about the customers in front of them.  The bottom line is that the Inn is definitely serviceable, but you feel like you are in a "bargain" Bed and Breakfast, even though the price might not reflect it.  If you are looking for a romantic B & B experience, and a beautiful place to stay, go elsewhere.  If you basically want a clean place to sleep, in a decent location with free parking, this place is great.Okay, the inn was nice, but I thought the breakfast on Saturday could have been better.  Big fan of their parking area, which means you don't have to pay to park at this inn like some other in Charleston.The location was good, the parking was free, the nightly rate was inexpensive.  The bed linens were obviously clean, but the rest of the room I am not so sure about.  There was a tissue box with 1 dirty tissue in it and a dead bug in the corner upon our arrival.  While terrified of bugs, I do understand that this is the South and so I gave the benefit of the doubt and just thought it got missed.  We received a phone call after our first night asking if we wanted housekeeping services.  I typically would say no, but since the room was not adequately cleaned prior to our arrival we said yes.  It was not cleaned even still.  No one stepped foot inside.  Our first morning brunch was good because we went to Blossom Restaurant.  We decided to enjoy our inn and sample breakfast the next day which was yogurt and waffles that you had to toast and sit in a hallway to eat.  The staff was nice, but didn't go out of their way to welcome you.  The bed while clean, was extremely uncomfortable.  Charleston was just lovely and while this experience did not ruin our travel through town, it certainly didn't add to it.  During this trip we stayed in 5 cities, and we've traveled a decent bit in the past, so I feel confident in my review.  Knowing what I know now, I would not stay at this Inn again.  Charleston is a very walkable city, so location, free parking, and a cheap rate don't outweigh the negatives for us.  I guess my biggest issue is that the website described luxury including turndown service, which we did not witness.  Our review may be limited since we only stayed 2 nights, but I honestly wouldn't have stuck around for a third to gamble.

Stayed here on our arrival night in Charleston. Landed at midnight, headed over, checked in, slept, left, and had no issues.So it's been a week since my stay here and I'm still mad about it. I booked a room through Priceline out of necessity because my flight was getting in too late to drive where I needed to go that night. After multiple delays, I finally got to charleston after 230am and just wanted to crash in my room. Too much to ask, apparently. Upon waiting to check in, there was a couple at the desk ahead of me complaining that they had just checked in to find their room was used and not cleaned. This was a bad sign of the fate that awaited me. After I checked in and walked into my room, a cloud of smoke greeted me and the entire room smelled like an ashtray. I had confirmation from my booking that I was in a non-smoking room. (Sidenote: this is 2015. Are companies still concerned with catering to their smoking customers?? You can't smoke anywhere else, why still have smoking rooms? Yuck.) So as the clock rounded 330am, back downstairs I marched to tell the uncaring gentleman at the front desk named Michael that my room was smoking and should be non, to which he replied with the happy news that it was the only room that was available and I had no choice but to sleep in it. He also told me that booking through a third party site didn't guarantee the type of room I would get. As if this was my fault and should have known that?After weighing my lack of other options, I accepted my fate of sleeping in the death stick cloud for the few hours I was going to get. Michael then offered to refund my money for the incident (I was surprised to learn he was the manager) and mentioned I just needed to sign something when checking out. So the time came for me to check out, and shocker: the girl at the front desk had no notes or information about what happened or a refund for the room charge. She took my number and told me someone would call me to get it worked out. Surprise, no one has called. I waited a week to see if the charge would fall off. Nope. So now I have to do the legwork with the hotel and my credit card to get a refund for what was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. If this was a Motel 6, I'd expect this kind of thing and let it go. But not for a room that was over $100/night. Believe my and the other reviews and do not stay here.Smallish and older with a dated feel. It ran a distant second to the spiffy Hampton at Broadway Myrtle Beach.Our small room felt quite crowded with a desk,  tv cabinet, couch, bed, etc.Our door stuck, needing either a tug to open or a hip-check to close.Free parking. So-so wi-fi. Unipressive location behind a Waffle House.OK breakfast in small lobby dining room,Friend and polite staff. Always have coffee and tea available in the lobby. Nice little gym. Breakfast from 6-10 AM. Free wifi. Comfortable beds and pillows, very clean. I will definitely be coming to stay here again. Van driver very friendly.We was not offered another room. So we just went to CVS to get a candle and air freshener. For the price I would not recommend this hotel unless it is your last option. The restaurants made this trip great. We did a lot of walking so made sure u have some good shoes.We don't expect much but quietness to be able to rest at night, clean bathroom and comfortable bed to sleep in. This hotel offers all three. Complimentary wi-fi and breakfast certainly help too.For $140 a night they get one star. This place is dirty and gross. I would have gone to the front desk and checked out and go to a better hotel but I have a flight to catch in 5 hours..Between a 2 and 3 - I'll go with 3 because of the good staff; most of the hotels shortfalls are not their fault.  Our first room had a issue, the staff got right on it and moved us to another room.  The new room was better but...toilet ran - aggregating.  Rest of hotel is old - stained hallway carpets.  This does not represent the Hampton (or Hilton) brand very well.Not your typical Hampton Inn.I travel to Charleston pretty regularly with work, and while I usually choose Hilton brands, I had yet to stay at this particular site. It's okay, but there a couple issues I have. They did let me check-in early, so I appreciated that. The front desk was friendly as well. But aside from those to high-points and the great breakfast, the rooms were just okay. No microwave or fridge which is a pain, and the amenities are pretty bare.In the end, it's a hotel that I stay in while on business. That being said, I'll probably head back over to Mt. Pleasant next time. This just wasn't great.Nice place but housekeeping is inconsistent.  Had to call two out of three days just to get the in room coffee refreshed, its like they ignored that part of the room which annoys me as it is 7am now and i don't have any coffee in my room.  No apologies , just frustration from the front desk when i call.First night it took three trips to the lobby to get a working set of keys.  New girl at the desk finally sent up maintenance, who radioed her back and said 'i don't know - my key worked' and i said 'i told you i knowhow to work a key' - and she returns with 'yeah but he is using your key'.  She wound up giving me another room but making me feel like an idiot. (Maintenance man had used his key for the first room, not the third wrong set she gave us)Unfortunately I chose this hotel chain because of past experience,  but, this is the worst stay that I have ever had at a Hampton Inn,  from the beginning it was a disaster,  from not being able to get a taxi to the hotel,  to waiting 2 hours for food delivery,  to a non working remote that took three trips to front desk to resolve,  and now breakfast is not even ready when they advertise it being ready  at 5:30am, it's now 6:49 am and it's still not ready, really, don't come here run as quickly as you can. I give it minus one star.  Oh yeah, it's smells and not the cleanest bring Clorex wipes.Room not ready when arrived late afternoon. Booked 3 months in advance. Staff did not care. One star due to service at this price.How do you know that your hotel is disgusting. When you have to ask the front desk for Clorox wipes to clean the pubic hair and urine from the toilet seat.  Unfortunately, I had to ask three times to switch rooms and the one with the pubic hairs was the cleanest one.  I can go on but my recommendation is to go elsewhere.  The entire City was sold out this weekend or I would have left immediately.This is a pretty average Hampton Inn location.  The staff is very friendly, the room is clean and comfortable.  They don't have a business center per se, just a couple of computers in the lobby that are ancient and slow.  The wi-fi was pretty good.  Convenient location near the airport and lots of restaurant options nearby (of the chain variety.)Friendly southern hospitality. Clean, comfortable,  great service and reasonably priced.Evening Reception during the week, breakfast to go during the day.  Friendly staffThe grouchy, older front desk lady did not like us at all. I have no idea what we did to her, but she was just so rude.It is near the airport and they provide free shuttle service. It is a bit outdated, but the staff and breakfast were good.

Nice, clean hotel with a friendly staff. Beautifully decorated for Christmas. Would recommendI have been an IHG Gold member for over 10 years. When I travel I always stay at an IHG or SPG hotel. I came here because of the proximity to the amount Pleasant Pier, and area. I reserved a room with a refrigerator and a microwave. I arrived to a room WITHOUT either. Because I came here specifically to see my son, and not on "vacation" or "business," it is imperative that a 10 hour, 620 mile trip is as economically efficient as possible. (Money spent should be on my child, not the place we stay).Not only do I get a room without a fridge or microwave, the hotel cannot and will not accommodate me by bringing one to my room. I have stayed in many hotels. I have paid for Internet, for a fridge, and for a microwave. I can't even pay extra here because these people are apparently retarded.Finally! We fished on the pier, have fish and went to the nearby Whole Foods to get a dinner to grill. I can't grill my food on the property.As much as I have patronized IHG hotels in the past, one would think I could use a portable grill. I WILL NOT come back to this hotel. My son is 12. And in the school months I come to him. This is my first and LAST time at this Holiday Inn.Very clean, very helpful staff.  We went on a local government discount and received breakfast for free; the buffet was very filling, the service was OK.  The evening bartenders were very helpful with tips and advice about local eateries, they prepared us for a wait at the restaurant we were going to go to so we had a plan B in place.  Super convenient to downtown.Really good hotel here. I thought this Holiday Inn will be ghetto, small, etc. I was wrong. The view from outside is better decent. You can already tell that it's a little upscale. Apparently all the rooms doesn't have a mini fridge unless you ask which I did but it didn't come with a microwave. I've been to worst hotels and they had a mini fridge AND a microwave. But whatever I didn't trip so much about that.The front desk is very professional and polite. We went in and out of the hotel and was greeted every time.High speed interest? Nope we were on the highest floor which is the 5th and the Internet was slow.I'm surprised none of the other reviews mention the noise.All the doors in this hotel slam shut.  I mean SLAM.  For a few bucks they could fix this with rubber doo-dads on the jam.  But no, it's random SLAM as you are trying to sleep.There was a truck in the parking lot outside my window every morning that must have been doing laps in reverse.  Beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep, beep for 15 minutes every morning at 6:00 a.m.  The mini fridge sounded like an idling mack truck in the room, but at least I was able to turn in off, unlike the morning symphony of door slamming as folks started leaving their rooms, a few hours after the last door slam of the returning night owls.Don't expect quiet here.Housekeeping took the nearly full shampoo container out of the shower, but did not leave me a new one.  They also threw out bars of soap that I had only used once.  Wasteful.  The lighting in the room was weird.  There are two light switches at the door when you enter.  A "master" switch (which does not control the light next to the bed) and another switch for some of the other lights.  Really odd.  Why do that?  No one has that in their home.  Really confusing every time I entered the room.The breakfast spread was huge and offered at no additional charge.  I was very impressed by the variety.Our stay seemed to start off well. Room had a fridge and maybe a little dated but seemed clean.  Unfortunately as we were getting ready to leave which was very early in the morning we encountered bed bugs. We saw it least 3. It was in room 529. We called the front desk they came to take pictures as they saw it too. Waiting to hear from management in the morning as to what they can do about this. We feel grossed out and now keep checking ourselves for bites. Also the headache of trying to disinfectant luggage etc. Thanks holiday Inn for ruining our vacation.  Think twice before staying here!My family and I were in town this past weekend for a wedding, and we were very happy with our stay at the Holiday Inn. Our room had a king-sized bed, sofa-bed, refrigerator and sink and was very spacious. The staff was very friendly and accommodated our request for an early check-in even though we arrived earlier than anticipated. We weren't crazy about the breakfast buffet, but since we had a refrigerator, we just bought some breakfast and lunch supplies at the Trader Joe's right down the road. The hotel is located right off Highway 17 and close to restaurants, grocery stores, and a short drive to the beach and downtown Charleston.Really liked it here. Clean with excellent service. Super close to the battleship museum and a short drive to downtown Charleston and the beach. We were really happy with the price vs the quality!If want to stay some where close to downtown Charleston; this is a good location. You would just be a few miles from one of the nicest beaches in charleston, isle of palms. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and comfort. The price can be a little pricey over the weekend but it's worth it.Let's start with I am a platinum member for this hotel chain. I checked in after 8 hours of traveling and they offered me an up-grade. The up-graded room they gave me was already being occupied by a family with an infant. Boy, they were surprised when I walked into the room. So I went down to get another room. So now at this point they down graded me back to a regular room.     The next day I retuned from work to find that housekeeping did NOTHING to my room other then bring in the newspaper. They left the bed unmade, dirty towels on the floor. To top off everything the Internet signal here is very weak and drops connections all the time. As a business traveler I will not be staying at this hotel again.Booked this hotel WAY in advance for the Bridge Run.  The room was okay, and the front desk friendly enough, but super rough on the wallet especially Bridge Run weekend.  I guess all the hotels have super inflated prices for that one weekend of the year when everyone flocks to Charleston.The good trade off was that I was 2 miles away from the start line so I was able to walk to the start, instead of worrying about parking, logistics, etc.Even for the price I paid, still had to grab breakfast somewhere else since they were charging at the restaurant downstairs.  Glad someone mentioned it to me before I started shoveling food onto my plate in the morning (the next morning after the run).  Just had a banana and muffins for the runners the morning of the bridge run, which was nice... but far from complementary.Very friendly staff, comfortable beds, and a great location. Others feel that it is overpriced, but I got a good deal on Priceline. The only real downside was the lack of complimentary breakfast or mini-fridges. Furthermore, the hotel restaurant was seriously overpriced and its food is nothing to write home about. However, the front desk staff have good suggestions on places to eat, and their suggestions are economical choices, too. In spite of the breakfast issues, I enjoyed my stay here.It is in a great location, right on the other side of the bridge so only a few minute drive to downtown Charleston.  They are pet friendly, with a cost.  Hotel room was clean and the staff was friendly.This was a good hotel. since I was running marathon weekend this was the only one  I could get but... staff was very nice and accomidating+ gave us a breakfast.This was a decent hotel for the money....I bid for it on Priceline and got it for $89/night. Of course you worry until you get there. But when all was said and done, I thought it was great! My only complaints was that there was no complimentary breakfast buffet (which is nice when you are traveling) and there was no refrigerator in the room...which also is helpful. There was some construction going on our floor...I think something to do with an ice machine that leaked. By the time we left a few days later, they were also fixing the lobby as well (I think from the same issue). So it wasn't pristine...but honestly not bad at all. The location is great...about 3 miles from downtown Charleston. So it's an easy drive right over the bridge and take the first exit to downtown. Really simple and much cheaper than staying in the downtown area of Charleston. So if you're looking for the Charleston experience, but you don't want extra expense with your hotel, I'd definitely look at this place! We had a nice time!Friendly and helpful staff, although the rooms smell like chlorine and bathrooms smell like cigarette smoke randomly. I won't be coming back here anytime soon.I'm not sure why it says this hotel has been renovated.....the lobby is ok but the rooms surely have not been renovated....at least not the room I stayed in. Plus, the room always felt somewhat damp even with the AC running constantly. If you are coming here on business be wary. This is one of the slooooooowest internet connections I've seen. I can barely send a simple email let alone load google maps which takes FOREVER. Just ridiculous. The staff here has always been nice though. The bar has two beer taps and not a microbrew in site. I asked the front desk if they could scan a document for me and they replied they did not have a scanner. Seriously?? How is it possible that a hotel doesn't have a scanner in their office? Once agian...not a business friendly hotel if you have alot of work to do on the computer.This was the last hotel I stayed at on my trip to the South. It was a priceline pickup The bathroom was updated. The room was updated. The pillows were comfortable. Over all, it was a great room for the price. It was literally a 5 minute drive across a beautiful bridge into Charleston. There is a $30 dollar hold on you credit card for the duration of your stay which is a low price. Breakfast is not complimentary, but available. The hotel includes "friendliness features". Forgot your shaving cream, they'll give you a free travel size bottle at the front desk. Their is a coin operated washer and dryer on every floor. The only detraction was a very noisy heating unit for my bedroom. It was loud enough to wake me up when it turned on in the night.This place is WONDERFUL! We got a super cheap rate from Hotwire for our anniversary weekend and I can say that we will be back!  The room was well appointed, clean, and comfy.  Same for the bathroom.  It was close enough to downtown Charleston for us.  Unless you are paying $400 a night for a luxury hotel right in the middle of downtown, you WILL have to drive to get to anything, so why not stay across the bridge and save your $$$ for the local cuisine!  The staff was super nice, but not very helpful when asked about places to go/eat...etc.  Charleston is world renowned for its food, so we asked the front desk guy where a good place for breakfast was.  His recommendation was for the restaurant in the hotel, which is fine, but when pressed for other suggestions, he said he ate at home.  So, if the staff had been a tad more helpful with "local" suggestions I would have given this 5 stars.  Really, really, really impressed.

Nice place to stay for either a short or long visit to the Charleston area. Just across the bridge in Mt. Pleasant you are about 7 minutes into downtown and all the sights to see. Minutes to beaches and tons of places to have breakfast, lunch or dinner. This is a very convenient location.Typical Hampton Inn with the complimentary breakfast in the lobby area. The lobby is very comfortable, open and clean. All the staff were super sweet. I think this property might be a little older and even though it looks like they had a renovation in the past I feel they should do another minor facelift to the rooms. Don't get me wrong, they are good but they could use some additional lighting, new sofas and updated bath area. Can't comment on the pool area as we didn't use it, or even see it. I would most definitely stay here again and would recommend this property to others.I enjoyed my stay in the Charleston area very much but my time at the Hampton Inn was another story. Upon entering the building I was greeted with a smell that one can only describe as an old animal hospital recently turned into a hotel. The smell in my room led me to believe perhaps that's where the stillborn baby calves were delivered. Someone suggested the smell was caused by the humidity. This is not a side effect of humidity I was previously aware of. My friend saw a cockroach in the bathroom on our first night and I killed one in the bedroom on the second night. That's two more cockroach encounters than I would like to deal with when staying in a hotel.The staff were very friendly and helpful, no complaints there. There was a pretty good selection at the continental breakfast, again, no complaints. However, I probably wouldn't stay at the Hampton Inn animal hospital again when visiting the Charleston area. There are several hotels nearby (including one in the same parking lot) that I would stay at before staying here, unless I was feeling lonely and wanted the company of cockroaches.Nothing special. Shower had a little mold in grout at bottom. Tv stopped working every night at 3 a.m. this is an older Hampton. The one closer to IOP is much nicer.In December 2015 it was a $12 uber ride to downtown and the room was very nice, great selection at vending machines, has a coffee bar and a great breakfast. very competitive price. I highly recommend this hotelI have stayed here a few times now and it is always nice and friendly, they have a nice clean pool.The fact that they are pet friendly is what makes us come back everytime!Decent property. Rooms clean and newer building. Pool is a little bit small. There was a convention ir something going on bc lots of rude people staying there. Front desk was really polite and helpful. Found a hair in the shower which was really gross! The manager apologized.Awesome hotel. Super clean, it didn't even seem like a Hampton. It seemed like a more upscale hotel. The only complaint I have was the shower had hair in it that was not ours.BEWARE OF BEDBUGS!!!!After checking in I inspected the bed as I usually do upon arrival and found several brown/red bugs and black hairs in the bed!! This was the worst hotel experience I have EVER had. We complained in the reception and got a room at the Best Western located next door. This hotel was extremely outdated and not at all equal to the room that we has booked at the hampton inn but since the Hampton inn was fully booked and it was midnight we had no choice but to stay there. Either way, we preferred that to the bed bug infested Hampton Inn. I will NEVER stay at a Hampton inn ever again- extremely disappointed and disgusted!!!I enjoyed my stay here. Very clean, nice staff, and good bed. If you're visiting Charleston, I would definitely recommend this hotel simply because of the price. You can stay across the bridge for $120+/night, but this is literally 10 minutes from downtown. So either you can pay for parking in the downtown hotels and be closer, or just drive the 10 minutes and pay cheaper rates on metered parking.I also thought that this location was nice because it's about 10 minutes from Sullivan's Island. Downtown Charleston is great, but it's nice being really close to the beach as well. A little tip though-- the complimentary breakfast is nothing to write home about. It's good if you're on a budget and want free breakfast, but I wouldn't expect to really fill up there. Right down the street is Charleston's Cafe which is good and moderately priced breakfast. They also have free wi-fi and a microwave in each room. Nice perks!If driving 5-10 minutes across the river to find parking is all that's needed to save $30-50 on a room; I'm all in!This is place to stay if you're going to be visiting Charleston and don't want to fork out for the downtown establishments and would like to avoid being near the airport.The breakfast is above average considering it's free, but I'd recommend a few other places like Charleston's Cafe just down the road.The rooms were super clean, with no funky smells and the staff was super courteous. Oh, and the WiFi is free. You can't ask for much more!Fantastic place. Just across the bridge. Less expensive than staying downtown. Very friendly staff. Decent breakfast. Very quiet AC/heat.Enjoyed my stay here during the cooper river bridge run, the check in staff were great with our late check in.  The room was very nice, very clean and very comforting overlooking the pool area.  The free breakfast was just enough to tide us over until lunch.  I didn't get to enjoy the workout facility but I would love to return on my next trip.  If you're not familiar with the area, it's a little hard to find as it is kind of hidden.I booked this place because it is one of the few Hilton properties in the Charleston area that allows pets (up to 40 lbs) and I had HHonors points burning a hole in my pocket.  At just 35,000 points a night, this place is a bargain.Located at Patriot's Point just over the Ravenel Bridge from Charleston in Mt. Pleasant, this hotel is just a stone's throw from all the attractions this region has to offer.  It's about a mile from the USS Yorktown, under five miles to Charleston's historic French Quarter, and under ten miles to neighboring islands.Because I travel for work and am usually put up in four-star properties in big cities, I always cringe about staying in three-star places, particularly in smaller towns like Charleston.  But this place far surpassed my expectations.  It's incredibly clean and our room was very spacious.  We stayed on what I'm assuming was the dog hall, which is near a dog-walking area just outside, equipped with duty bags and a trashcan for disposing of pet waste.  It didn't smell like pets, so that's a major bonus.The staff are very friendly and the free breakfast is a huge money saver.  Waffle station, pastries, muffins, crumpets, bagels, oatmeal, cereal, fruit, hard-boiled eggs, yogurt, and some egg / gravy / hash browns combo.  This big is sadly not really vegetarian-friendly, as inconsiderate guests use one spoon for both dishes, even though there are two spoons there to use, so the scrambled eggs had sausage gravy mixed in on one day, and the home fries had ham scrambled eggs mixed in the next.  Boo.The folks staying here are mostly families, with some older and younger couples traveling with pets.  Not really the trendiest hotel clientele, but if you don't plan on just hanging out in the hotel all day, then it really doesn't matter.As aforementioned, pets up to 40 lbs are welcome.  They do say when you check in that you are not allowed to leave pets unattended in your room, except at breakfast time.  They provide contact information for area kennels and say that if you do leave your pet unattended in the room, you will be fined $150 if s/he disturbs other guests, and you will not receive housekeeping services that day.  We had our dog friend with us all day long---Sullivan's Island Beach, James Island County Park, lunch, then walking around the French Quarter, all in the uncommon heat of early September---and it would have been cruel to drag the lil fella to dinner with us, too.  Basically what I'm saying is, if you have a quiet pet (our guy never barks, except while playing at the dog park), and you put in your do not disturb sign, then you're fine letting your buddy sleep while you go out for dinner, etc.In sum, I'd recommend this as a great pet-friendly budget hotel.  We were very satisfied with our stay here.Good value hotel with comfortable rooms and a quiet environment. Close and conveniently located to downtown Charleston and the beaches of Sullivan Island. The only thing annoying was the spotty room service every day. Sometime we would come back at 4 pm and the room had not been done even though the hotel was partially empty. We always thought that the room service did this deliberately in order to avoid having to clean the whole room because obviously, at 4 pm we didn't want room service. However, we would stay here againI was a bit nervous about this hotel because their website was a bit random...but all nerves were thrown out the window upon my arrival. Of course I was super late for check-in (thanks airlines!), but the staff was very helpful and expedited my check-in so I could get some beauty sleep.  The room itself was on the small side, but modern and clean. The bathroom was really nice and the amenities were spot on. A very nice place to stay!Clean, quiet, good value.  B'fast area gets crowded and nowhere to sit.I was on vacation and I checked into this hotel. The rooms were nice, modern and plush just how I like it! I really enjoyed my stay and it wasn't too far of a drive to downtown Charleston. Highly recommend it!The address for this hotel shows up as 255 Sessions Way, but I think either address will work for GPS navigation.  It is a GREAT location if you plan on visiting Patriots Point.  You could honestly walk there if you wanted to, although there are a couple hotels that are within better walking distance (we drove, because it was really hot).  The hotel itself had all the standard Hampton amenities (breakfast, high speed internet, cookies in the evening, etc).  The outdoor pool was a good size so we used that quite a bit.  Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again for the price.Close to foot of Bridge for easy into Charleston Downtown . Great space for price . Staff was very friendly . Breakfast was good but hard layout made eating down stairs difficult . Over all one of the nicest Hamptons :)

hotel_name: Hyatt Place Charleston Airport Convention Center
review_content: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The staff is super friendly. I was very very impressed with the breakfast staff. I watched them accommodate several request from other guest (some very particular request) with no hesitation and a smile. The location was excellent. It is between two highways, 526 and 26. It is around the corner from the outlet mall, Walmart, gas stations, and lots of food options. We were there for a weekend... Friday evening to Sunday afternoon. We were able to visit several beaches, malls, the harbor, eat, and more without more than a 20 minute drive to any place.This place is your average Hyatt. But I gave it 4 stars because the good outweighed the not as good. The good: friendly staff, big shower, free breakfast and Wi-fi, close to the airport, clean, free parkingThe not great: loud - you can hear all the traffic and sirens from outside as well as people in neighboring rooms when they are loud, elevators are slow as turtlesGlamorous this hotel is not, but it provides and good bed and shower when you need or want to be close to the airport.The room was great.The pool was great.The location is decent, planes fly overhead.The front desk is great, but guest services has some bad eggs.The internet is paid for... Really?The breakfast is fair.Overall, this hotel does not fulfill the expectations that the price sets.Overall nice stay - very clean property with friendly staff. Great breakfast with a good variety. Only complaint is that wifi did not work during the duration of the stay. Parking was also slightly limited at night as it filled up very quickly.Checked in last night 3/29/15.  During check-in, we were greeted by friendly staff; it was easy and quick.  There are two entrances (one in the rear) which is closer to the elevators but needs more lighting outside. Room was clean but as soon as I turned on the heater to 72 - there was an odor (maybe cleaning solution) that odorized our room like perfume.  Not too pleasant but once heater was turned off - odor stopped. It's spacious and open.  Wished there were (2) televisions.  Well, didn't drive to SC just to watch TV.  There is a mini-fridge which is always convenient when traveling with children.Bathroom (toilet & tub) is very tight but manageable. Wish the fan and light were separate switches.  It's convenient that the the sink is outside of the toilet to allow others that may need to wash up can do it without waiting for someone in the toilet. Day 1 - exercise room is well lit with free weights, (2) treadmill w/ video, and more.  There are small towels to keep dry and cleaning wipes to wipe down the equipment before & after workout.  Breakfast is nothing to boast about.  Very simple.  Funny Starbucks sign posted but cups are Seattle's Best.  Highlight of breakfast is the Yogurt (Activia).Day 2 - breakfast was alright.  Kids had no interest.  Staff are polite and professional.  The facility is kept clean.  Conveniently located near outlet mall and lots of eateries.The longer we stayed breakfast got worse. The sandwich breakfast meat was dry, the bagel and English muffin sandwiches was hard. Just ate the same thins each morning Actiivia yogurt with cottage cheese and tomato juice. On our next visit to Charleston will not be returning here.  The room rate doesn't not fit the quality of stay and service. Nothing against the staff it just that breakfast could be better is quality, taste and variety.DO NOT PICK THIS HOTEL!So, we had some major issues with this hotel. We had two bikes with us, and we called ahead and the staff informed us that they have room in storage for our bikes but when we arrived they do not. So, we ended up having to put the bikes in our room and they can only give us a room on the 2nd floor.Then, this is a pet friendly hotel so we had our dog with us, but we didn't know there is $75 additional charge until the day we check out. How is this even expectable? We called the general manager when we get home (since she was off on our check out day), she was very rude and told us, she would have found storage for our bikes and that the additional pet fee is standard. Well, we understand but first, she wasn't there, so it doesn't make a difference if she could have found room for our bikes. Second, I would be ok with the pet fee if I have known up front. How could you charge someone extra fees without informing them up front?Each time we stepped into the Hotel we were greeted very kindly. The bar and snack area was very nice. The room was very elegant, clean and spacious. I slept on too of the couch and I found it pretty comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel. And hooray for free parking!This hotel is great. Staff was very friendly and professional. Room was spacious and clean. Plenty of parking. Close to the outlets ,the airport and a bunch of restaurants.  Within walking distance of the convention center. I definitely would recommend a stay here if you're looking for a clean moderately priced place.I just can't give five stars.I asked for a high floor and ended up on two.On three there is a ginormous wildebeest stomping on every square inch of my roof.Sure it is not the hotels fault that fat people are inconsiderate, but they could use better quality building products to deaden the sound.Love this place! I spend 5 days per month on average, living in hotel rooms. On this occasion of a ten day business run up and down the east coast, I was fortunate to have my company book me at this hotel.I have never stayed at a Hyatt Place. Very boutique-like and trendy. From the moment I arrived at the airport to be picked up by their free shuttle and during my stay, the staff has been amazing. I am on day three of my 5 day stay and they treat me like family.Speaking of the free airport shuttle, the shuttle is available for any run within a 5 mile radius of the hotel which includes being taken to the North Charleston Visitors center to catch a shuttle downtown.They have free wifi in the rooms and a nice free breakfast spread in the mornings including several varieties of breakfast sandwiches if you are on the run. Two nights per week they have a hosted wine/beer hour two nights a week at the lobby bar.If at all possible try to request a corner king room which is very quiet.I am going to be a tourist for the next two days and could have moved to a hotel closer to downtown, however this stay is an excellent value and a good base of operations. I will be back on my next stay!The staff was great and very helpful however I woke up with 12 bed bug bites on my back and three days removed continue to deal and alleviate my scarred back. Stay away from room 414 or be sure to wear a full wet suit to avoid such a horrendous ordeal.I love this hotel!  I will always return here whenever I'm in Charleston, and encourage everyone else to do so as well.  The staff is spectacularly friendly; the rooms are so nice and new and clean and well set-up; the place is quiet and comfortable.  I am a Hilton Honors Gold Level member, who foolishly chose the Home2 Suites down the road for our first night in CHS after a long flight from CA.  Let's just say "never again" and will forego the earning of Hilton points to earn my Hyatt points here :)Excellent customer service! I don't know if this is just a characteristic of the "South" (I'm having good service everywhere in Charleston!) but they were very attentive to my every need and if something took longer than 10 seconds they apologized profusely... to my confusion. The food here is pretty good! I usually am expecting awful food from hotels of this type (no offense!) but their food is actually delicious and well-presented. I tried their breakfasts, nachos, pizza and burger. Their burger was only OK but the rest were pretty good! Tied for first place would be their breakfasts and pizza--they are excellent. While they don't have as wide a range of breakfast items as other places like Embassy Suites, I think they have higher quality ingredients here and are prepared better. First time I've had perfect scrambled eggs! Usually I get them too soggy or too dry or just "wilted" from being left out too long. Here they were just right! I ate lots of them and I usually hate scrambled eggs. I also really liked the interesting "refrigerator" for their drinks which consists of a countertop that's frozen. It's kind of like a hotplate except cold. Very cool!I also like that these rooms are sort of like suites (they are not true suits because they lack a wall--they have only a divider) and they have sofabeds with QUEEN mattresses... what?!?I also think the blond lady who does everything at the reception desk and food desk is really cute and helpful! The manager was a bit strict with her, I felt, though. She did some amazing multitasking in front of me (I would have gone crazy already in her place) and was able to help me while talking to a bagillion other people. Tee hee, not to be rude but the manager reminded me of Marci from MWC. Short hair and businessy--not that that's bad or anything. When the manager helped me she was also very helpful and nice as well.Great, modern hotel with surprisingly large rooms. We arrived in Charleston this past Friday night just before midnight. The shuttle to the hotel stops running at 12AM, but the girl who runs the nighttime front desk was nice enough to pick us up (she was heading out to pick up an Army band that was out at a bar anyway). She also went above and beyond and dropped us off to a 24 hour Walmart en route so that we could pick up all the things that TSA made us throw away at the airport.The room was spacious, had a sectional sofa with ottoman, king sized bed, and a large flat screen TV that swiveled so you could watch from the sofa or the bed. The bed itself was a posturepedic of some sort (you sink into the bed, in a nice way of course) and had tons of pillows. The TV has a media hook up for your laptop or other media players.They also offer a complimentary breakfast complete with baked goods, cereals, eggs, sausage, and juice bar.You'll have a nice time here.Easily the most fabulous hotel in North Charleston! I originally intended to travel with others and reserved a double queen. Less than 24 hours before arrival I was able to call and seamlessly switch to a king room as my plans changed. I thought I was just getting a regular king room with a bed in it. My goodness! This was suite style, and featured an awesome sectional sofa with pullout sleeper and ottoman. Since the weather was gloomy this trip, I spent more time indoors than I anticipated. The sectional and 42" flatscreen tv was a MUCH welcomed addition to the room, I felt right at home! Also features a minibar and office nook for those who need to work. The bed was very, very comfy, bathroom only had a shower which was fine for me, bathroom vanity features pull out dresser drawers-fabulous-and the full mirror doubles as a closet. There is a cafe attached to the downstairs check-in desk that you may purchase sandwiches, soup, drinks and pastries from 24 hours a day. I attended a conference at the convention center; they do offer a shuttle but it's literally right behind the hotel in walking distance so I rarely used it. Parking is above ground in an open lot and FREE. Location convenient to the interstate and every restaurant imaginable. HIGHLY, HIGHLY recommended!A plus. Stayed four nights. Very comfortable, extremely clean and quite rooms. Also numerous restaurants near by. There is no doubt if I travel through this area again I am going to stay here. Also shuttle to and from the airportCan't beat this place. Nice modern rooms. 24 hour food. Indoor pool. Still smells new like it is. Highly recommend.The staff here is amazingly friendly! The rooms are spacious, modern, and clean. Nightly managers get together with free food and drinks.

My husband and I were extremely pleased with King George IV Inn- from the moment we drove up the brick-laden driveway right up to the easy check-out. The woman who greeted us and showed us to our room was wonderfully friendly and helpful, there was snacks, coffee, tea, etc available 24 hours a day, and the breakfast had a delicious assortment of foods. The best part was the room; it was historic, nicely decorated, very cozy and very clean- and it had WiFi. The owner was friendly and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this B & B.My boyfriend and I came and stayed here the weekend after thanksgiving and it was nothing short of a great experience. It was both of our first trips to Charleston, and we couldn't have picked a better place to spend our weekend. Everything was decorated for Christmas, including our room (room number 4) which was absolutely beautiful! the owners were kind and helpful in pointing us where to go and what to see. Whenever we come back to Charleston, I plan to book here again!I can not say enough great things about our stay at the King George IV Inn- what a gem of an inn located in downtown Charleston. When I was looking for a place to stay in Charleston, I was surprised that a B & B was one of the best priced places in the whole city- and it was worth every penny. I would recommend this place to anyone- Charlene was fantastic. She cooked our breakfast every morning, provided excellent Charleston & restaurant recommendations, and made our stay perfect. Our room was beautiful- we stayed in Room #5- which had a small kitchen w/ a fridge, a full size bed w/sitting area, two closets, full private bathroom, and a shared balcony with the room next door. The room was spotless and well cared for during our entire stay. I will certainly be staying here the next time I come to Charleston- don't look any further for a great place to stay!My boyfriend and I took our first vacation together this past weekend. We stayed in a room on the first floor at the King George IV Inn. The inn is located right next to the College of Charleston's gym and right around the corner from campus so a lot of students are in the area. It's also conveniently located between King and Meeting streets so many great restaurants and shops are very close by. The room was nice but it did smell a little musty in there. You can't open the windows because of bugs and animals but once you let the AC run for awhile it mellows out a bit (or maybe you just get used to it I don't know). We were definitely the youngest couple there, everyone else was easily twice our age but I thought that was kind of charming! But it's definitely an older crowd, so keep that in mind. The owners are a super sweet couple, I only met Terry but I spoke to his wife on the phone and she seemed very sweet as well. Terry gave us a very detailed run down of the area and where to go to and what to see. They also make a lovely breakfast in the morning with eggs, waffles, hash browns, grits, and bacon. It changes up every morning but there's always eggs and bacon. (I haven't been to any other bed and breakfasts though, so not sure how this would compare somewhere else). We had a very lovely stay for our first trip together and I would definitely go back.I found this place last minute and the location and setup worked out perfectly! The rate was also very reasonable! Charlene was very helpful with area tourists suggestions and the breakfast she put out daily was delicious. I will absolutely be recommending this place to friends and going again soon, especially during the off season with the even lower rates! The bedrooms were clean and charming!I'm so glad that we found this bed & breakfast! I can't gush enough about this place. This was our third stay here and that's saying something. Room 5 is our favorite room: it has a small kitchen, private balcony, and roomy bathroom. Room 6 is nice too, but I felt the bathroom was too small (no counter space). It's beautiful at Christmas, though.When you arrive, Terry (the owner) will sit down with you and give you a map of downtown Charleston. He highlights all the hot spots and what to avoid so that you can make the most out of your visit. I really appreciated that! He told us about Christophe's and I can't thank him enough!The location is great; minutes away from all the places to see. We never drive anywhere when we stay here, so bring some good walking shoes if you want to see Charleston at a different perspective. From here to the Battery is about a 10-15 minute walk.The housekeeping staff is the best. Charlene is a sweetheart! We had the pleasure of chatting with her during breakfast one morning. And I for one am a huge fan of the breakfast. Terry does a fantastic job with his made to order omelets. The breakfast area is always available, so I found that nice when we were out late and wanted a quick snack when we returned.Also, each room has it's own journal that contains entries from past occupants. They highlight places to try and places to avoid. So, make sure you submit your own entry! This is definitely our go-to bed & breakfast anytime we're in Charleston. It definitely makes you feel like you're in a different time, where time slows down and southern hospitality shines.we were traveling without any advance reservation and stopped at the Charleston Visitor Center . they were terrific help and we got a room at a very reasonable rate. Room 5 is the best. sitting room, queen bed, kitchenette,  old fashioned tub. would definitely stay here again. only complaint was breakfast was mediocre. scrambled eggs and bacon self served. got the same at chain hotels. Staff was very attentive and friendly.Staying in an old house turned B&B ran by a couple with over 15 years of ownership under their belts is just what you'd expect to find in Chuck Town. Well, by golly, we struck gold with this joint. Owner, Terry, and his wife have a wonderful operation with plenty of cozy rooms outfitted to feel like an early 1900's-style living room. Talk about southern living. We stayed in room 3. Second floor, gigantic shower, tons of lounge space, and one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in away from home. My wife and I agree that we wish we had that bed in our home. Giant four-poster with a mammoth mattress. Me likey, me want. Breakfast is cooked fresh by Terry and served promptly at 8:30 every morning. Not a bad deal when you need to forgo an expensive Chuck Town breakfast elsewhere. Oddly enough, this place has some of the more competitive rates we saw around town. Take a look as I'm sure they'll fluctuate, but they seemed to be much lower comparatively. Beware of the small parking situation they have out back. If you're driving a gigantic SUV, you'll have to cram in. Maneuvering with pilot precision required. Next time we find ourselves in the historic district, we're staying here.We love to stay in historic buildings and dine family-style with other guests in a cozy breakfast room, especially in a beautiful old city like Charleston, so the King George was perfect for us. The owners and staff of this place are amazing--after only two days we felt like part of the family. A very relaxed and relaxing place, with lots of character. The inn is very well located, and everywhere we wanted to go in downtown was walking distance. We can't wait to go back!This place was great! We couldn't find a hotel in Charleston under $300 a night and this place offered a great deal! We stayed in a room that shared a bathroom but with a sink and mirror in the room, it wasn't a big deal at all! The breakfast was just what we needed to start our day and spend our calories and money on lunch and dinner and the delicious food at Fleet Landing.We highly recommend this place to anyone staying in Charleston. The location couldn't have been beat! We will definitely return.Very clean and very close to all of the downtown action. You will park your car and walk to everything. This is an original single row home that gives you the feel for the rich history of Charleston. The hotel has its own history, just ask the staff!  Breakfast is good, eggs, bacon, sausage each morning with fresh fruit, English muffins, bagels, yogurt, cereal.....something for all tastes.  Ms. Charlene is a wealth of information about where to visit, eat and how to get around. We found the road out front to be a bit noisy but that will be anywhere you go in the city. The inn has ear plugs in the breakfast room as well as snacks out at all times. Sodas and water are available for $0.50 each. Our room had its own bathroom, a mini fridge and kitchenette area. It's room 6 and is probably cleaner than any hotel or B&B I've ever stayed in. We took our bikes and highly recommend it for touring the city streets, however we didn't see any other tourists on bikes so doesn't seem really popular.  See my other reviews for stuff to do in Charleston.Really beautiful b&b, really fantastic location. The owners were wonderful - on our first day we were sat down and had a long discussion about things to do and where to eat in Charleston, given some cookies and coffee, and coupons for a few restaurants.  Room was beautifully decorated, and we especially loved having our own little balcony and staircase. Really great price!I am removing just one star for the same thing that the other reviewer mentioned - compared to other b&bs, breakfast could have been better. The eggs were really good (scrambled with sun-dried tomato and red peppers!) but the bacon and sausage and waffles were all microwaved. Of course, still better than what you might get at a motel, and the company was fantastic - really nice conversations over the breakfast table with other nice couples. Overall a fantastic b&b!What a charming and quaint B&B! Beautifully restored 250-year-old house, well decorated rooms, and we loved the period furniture. Terry was helpful and informative and helped make our stay wonderful! We stayed in Room 7 with a shared bathroom with Room 8. But having your own sink & mirror in your own room is very convenient. Also, the most comfortable bed you will ever sleep on!We will definitely return!The staff is very friendly!! My Mother and I stayed here (with her service dog) Terry and Debra-the owners were very attentive and are genuinely great people. The B and B is so beautiful and authentic. I feel like I'm in the 18th century.  Great location....in the heart of Charleston!! You can't beat the price either:) a must stay!!Couldn't have asked for better. This is a great B&B. We stayed in room 7 and shared the hallway bathroom with room 8. We had no issues with this whatsoever. Loved the atmosphere,the breakfast,the owners, and the price. Will definitely stay here again next time we're in Charleston.We found the King George through the Visitor's Center and got a great rate as a last minute rental.  Very convenient to downtown, nice, clean, private, great breakfast, nice staff, and a great rate as a last minute special on Friday night!I might have a higher rating if we didn't have to share a bathroom, but for 129 a night, the location can't be beat.Skip the breakfast that is provided (microwave bacon and a tray of scrambled eggs?)  made that mistake the first day.  The second day we headed out and went into a city that has such great food options.  Say hello to Hominy Grill for me.  yaow!The water pressure in the shower went from cold and soft as a kitten spitting to hot and razor sharp, removing all the skin.But, the room was comfortable and the location was key.  Just between king and meeting on george, with a parking lot in the back.I would stay again, but would want my own bathroom (many of the rooms do have their own, but space was limited due to the festival in town).I stayed at this inn for one night as a solo traveler. It is not a luxury B&B, but my room was beautiful and the service was fantastic. It is not particularly close to the battery/White Point Gardens, Waterfront Park, or Market areas, but it is definitely close enough to walk easily. Apparently there is also a shuttle that can pick you up, but I prefer to walk when in Charleston. I would stay again and would absolutely recommend this inn to solo travelers, business travelers, and travelers on a budget.

Stayed here in November 2012 for a couple of days. Our company hosted our incentive trip in Charleston last year and we stayed at the Planter's Inn - we had to have at least 15-20 rooms so I don't even want to imagine what the bill looked like, but one can imagine. The rooms themselves are fantastic - large, comfortable beds, nice TVs, decent bathrooms (some have jet tubs, which mine did), and uber-comfortable robes. As it was 50 and raining when we were there, coming back after a few hours of walking and soaking in a hot tub and wrapping up in a giant robe was pretty nice, let me tell you. And yeah, I'm a guy. Problemo?Location has to be pretty perfect. Right next to the market and down the street from a ton of food and shopping. If you're looking for more finer dining, Planters Inn has the Peninsula Grill as well. Apparently the coconut pie is world famous, and better be for $11 a slice!Anywho, I would love to stay here again but it's a bit out of my price range. Need to travel on the company's dime again!Took me awhile to sit down and write a review for this Relais & Chateaux property.Shout out to the Manager who is FIVE stars.  What a nice lovely gentleman who went above and beyond.  He is an asset to this hotel and deserves whatever accolades can be bestowed upon him.Shout in to the Owners who get negative stars for pulling the pet friendly policy the prior owners offered.  In this day and age, there are those of us upscale travelers who enjoy traveling avec chien.  Why in the world would you be so anti pets?  It simply doesn't make sense.  The Carlyle in NYC welcomes them, for Heaven's sake, as do many other upscale hotels around the country.I did not like my room one bit.  It was most definitely not like staying in a standard Relais & Chateaux.  I could go on and on about it but I won't.  My initial bell man was also a joke.  Again, not in line with the Relais & Chateaux ambiance.  Items that were in line with what Relais & Chateaux stands for, however, aside from the Manager, included the overnight desk clerk.  This lovely lady had great energy and kindly found me some soy milk early in the morning with a pleasant, welcoming Southern charm.  The afternoon tea/coffee and cookies were delicious and made you feel as if you were being entertained in the parlor of an old charming southern plantation.  And, the coconut cake found in the restaurant is actually trademarked and is A+++.  You can easily take some to go and enjoy on the road.   The manager is most definitely THE standout of the hotel but if you are traveling with le chien, then try the Wentworth Mansion or the new Kimpton being built downtown.It would not surprise me in the least bit if this place loses their Relais & Chateaux designation.I hate to be picky, but I was really expecting more. Front staff was welcoming, and I commend the inn on their attentive hospitality. The room is where I felt disappointed, though. Unfortunately, I did not try their restaurant. I stayed in a double queen room. The beds were turned down in the evening, and the sleep was impeccable. The armchairs were comfortable, but there was only one footrest. It also would have been nice to have slippers provided to wear down to the parlor, which is stately and stocked with cider, coffee, and "Carolina apples." The apples are meh, like red delicious quality. As for my nitty gritty complaints: There was a single window in the bedroom, which couldn't sufficiently light the room naturally. The bathroom didn't boast a luxurious bathtub as depicted on their website; it was a standard tub/shower combo built into the wall. I honestly expected to be enjoying a bubble bath in a marble tub, as suggested by their distinguished reputation. The hand towel rack kept falling off the wall. And the full length mirror on the door clattered whenever it was opened. Moreover, the bathroom door hit anyone who was using the sink, which was illogically placed adjacent to the door despite a wide counter space.Oh, and there were no orchids in the room as advertised in their pictures.Great staff, location, rooms, linens and beds, with a clean historic, yet updated decor.  Wish we had a longer stay! We will be back! Andrea at the front desk was lovely and very helpful!Great location to most of the sites in the downtown area.  The room service was not good.  requested hot water and tea bags delivered to the room.  water was not hot.  No decaf coffee available in the lobby in the morning.  Tried to use hot water instead no one seems to be checking to make sure it was replenished.  Asked the person at front desk to have some tea in the lobby during the day after 20 mins no one showed up.Attention to detail is lacking for the prices charged for a room.went here late April '15 for Mariana's BD and our 1 year anniversary. Room was beautiful and staff was extremely helpful. Centrally located in the heart of the historic district and within walking distance of everything we wanted to see in the downtown areaI had the pleasure to stay at the Planters Inn for three days in the beginning of July.  This was my first visit to South Carolina and I must say I loved it.  The Planters Inn is a lovely and quaint hotel oozing in southern charm.  I have to tell you ladies that the Planters has the best looking male staff I have ever seen.  Not only are they great to look at but they were so accommodating .  The room was spacious, the bed large(I have to admit I have never slept in a bed so high off the ground),the sheets soft and inviting after a day exploring lovely Charleston.  We enjoyed the continental breakfast during our stay which was elegant,no gas station muffins here. The service was top notch,everyone was pleasant,southern hospitality at its best.This is an excellent hotel.  As soon as we pulled up to the door, the valet was there ready to assist with luggage and to valet the car.  The valet radioed the front desk to our arrival and our check in paper work was ready by the time we got to the front desk.  The staff was very courteous and efficient.  The front desk manager asked about our dinner plans for the weekend and then made a reservation for us at The Peninsula.  Andre, the valet, was now ready with our luggage to show us to our room.  From getting out of the car to getting into our room was a matter of minutes.  The entire stay was great.  The room was spacious and clean, the staff was very attentive and friendly.  The Peninsula bar and the restaurant were also great.  Again, the bartenders and servers were great at their jobs and friendly as well.  I will definitely stay here again.Just incredible hospitality. Period. Beautiful hotel. Clean rooms and courtyard was so nice. Fresh coffee all day everyday. Was like I was being waited on 24/7, serious southern hospitality! Hotel is right on Main Street, walking distance to everything!! Pull up to front entrance of building. Bell hops will greet you to take luggage and park your car!! (I didn't know where to park and ended up in employee parking- oops.)Outstanding customer service! Our favorite place to stay in Charleston. Thank You Jake.Although the hotel has nice lobby and helpful staff the location of the hotel is at a busy intersection.  ask for a room overlooking courtyard, otherwise expect a noisy room.  Even with earplugs I was up all night hearing people, cars, and trucks go by. Not the cleanest room found extra pillows in closet with a drool spot and the other had hair on it. Needless to say I will not be recommending this to friends.Nice hotel in great location but for some reason charleston hotels feel no need to conduct any updates. Rooms have a great old school feel but could use some refresh in the actual room (new toilets and showers might be nice). Wallpaper and everything else could also use an update. Service is nice but most of staff has yet to graduate college.Definitely pricey at $300+ a night but this is a fantastic little gem right in the heart of historic Charleston.  Only a block away from shopping on Kings Street and immediately adjacent to the Market Street shops on Meeting Street, the hotel has it all.  Home to the fabulous Peninsula Grill (you have to eat there, no ifs, ands, or you know whats).  Also home to the Mercato next door (Italian and a nice bar).  Just one block away from Toast, the best breakfast place in town and home to a fabulous tiny bar with a master mixologist as the bartender - Matt).The service at the Planters Inn was impeccable.  From the cleanliness of the rooms to the turndowns at night and the fluffy robes.  Large bathrooms and oh so quiet.  The bed was firm and perfect.  A great place to spend three nights.  The front end staff in this large inn were also responsive to every single wish.  Couldn't ask for more.Second stay in 3 years and again very enjoyable.  Great staff and large rooms and bathrooms.   Had breakfast in the room this morning with the family and it was perfect.  Courtyard rooms may provide a little extra privacy but I did not find the outer room a problem.  Close to market and high end shopping as well a number of very good restaurants. Will definitely stay here again in the future.Along with death and taxes, one of the sure things in life -- at least to this point -- had been the flawless pampering, albeit at a price, you could expect at a hotel or restaurant affiliated with Relais & Chateaux. In the last couple of years we've dined at Per Se, Daniel, and Eleven Madison. We've stayed and dined at The Inn at Little Washington, The Surrey, and Blantyre. The quality of product and service at each has been exemplary. Few, if any, nits to pick. So little did I expect to be doing my own troubleshooting for the Internet service at Planter's Inn in Charleston.Let me back up a bit. We just got back from a three-night stay at the Planter's Inn. On the whole, the experience was satisfactory. Our suite, #201, was nicely appointed and spacious.
