The hotel restaurant, The Peninsula Grill, provided us with one of the better meals of our trip and the housekeeping services were friendly and efficient. The bathroom was a bit under-appointed and the television remote baffling, but these shortcomings were too trivial to rise even to the level of annoyances.I'm not a good complainer. I'm just not good a being a squeaky wheel. When a hotel provides good service, very little squeaking elicits an adequate and immediate dose of grease. The first night at Planter's Inn, I noticed that the wireless Internet in our room was all but useless. When I mentioned this to the front desk, they sent up a bellman (the same one who had parked our car and handled our luggage) who simply turned the wireless off then on again. When this did not improve things, he apologized, suggested I try the business center, took my $5 tip, and left. Using the business center entailed going to the front desk, getting the key, going to the 4th floor, doing the work, then returning the key back down to the front desk. Not a big deal, but not quite up to my R & C expectations. The hotel, after all, had done nothing to lessen the inconvenience of the experience. Perhaps the bellman could have offered to fetch the key for me, particularly as I had tipped him for a service that he shouldn't have had to provide (one expects the wireless to work, after all) and that he had failed to repair.When I returned the key to the front desk, I mentioned that the wireless on my laptop had worked just fine in the business center. In fact, all my devices seemed to work well everywhere in the hotel except in our room. I asked about the possibility of changing rooms. The receptionist to whom I spoke said he'd "look into availability." I hesitated long enough to be sure that he wasn't going to take care of this then and there and went back to the room expecting to hear from him. I'll save you the suspense -- the call never came. I didn't ask again; remember, I just don't do the squeaky wheel thing.By our third night at the hotel, the amount of work I had to do online had accumulated to the point that this reluctant wheel was forced to squeak just a bit. I called the front desk and reminded them of the problem. They responded by giving me the toll-free number of their Internet provider! Mind you, they didn't volunteer to call the service themselves -- they expected me to do it!I wasn't pleased, but I placed the call. Turns out, the number they gave me was the cell phone of an employee of the ISP. He gave me the correct number to call. I was on hold for exactly 17 minutes when we had to leave for our dinner reservation, so I left a message to call me back after 9:00. Of course that call never came. And had it come, I wouldn't have expected it to do much good. I really did find the service lapses shocking, given that this is a Relais & Chateaux hotel. The staff was young and seemed inexperienced. For example, entering the hotel, the doormen would often be engaged in such intense conversation with each other I felt I was imposing by expecting them to open the door.The next day we were off to a lovely B&B in Raleigh that I'll review when I get the time. The wireless there worked flawlessly, even from our private hot tub! Ahhhhhh!The best location in Charleston across the street from the marketplace on Market and Meeting. Gorgeous, quiet, spacious, well-appointed room. Exceptional service, very comfortable beds with turn down service (#217) and the coconut cake at the Peninsula Grill is a must if you're a coconut cake fan!We had a wonderful stay at the Planter's Inn, which can be expected of a Relais et Chateaux Hotel.The hotel is located right in the heart of the historic Old Town, and is the perfect location to explore that part of town on foot.  The high-end shops are one block away, the horse-drawn carriages are around the block (the hotel gave us tickets as part of our package) and the Market is right in front of the hotel.  The hotel is surrounded by the nicest little stores, not touristy at all.The hospitality and friendliness commences as soon as you pull up in front of the hotel.  There is only standing room in front of the hotel, but the valet immediately opens your door, takes care of the luggage and then parks your car.The hotel feels very safe as a key is needed to operate the elevator to go to the rooms.  The room we had was very spacious and felt like home.  It was very clean, was quiet despite being on a busy street and it looked good as well.  The whole hotel had an old charm feel.  Free wi-fi was available throughout the hotel, including the rooms.  It was a little slow and spotty, but it did the trick for me.Breakfast was delicious, and can be a la carte or a $10 buffet.  The buffet selection is not big, but it is of the highest quality.  They have some amazing grits and sausage gravy, so definitely splurge on the a la carte choices.  All the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and checkout was a breeze.  The best part of the hotel is the restaurant,The Peninsula Grill.  Be sure to make a reservation because this restaurant is the best in town, and you can tell by the fact that it is very busy.  The food is delicious; and they serve the best Coconut Cake in the US.  Often statements like those prove not to be true, but in this case it certainly was.Charleston is one of the nicest cities I have been to recently, and I would love to go back.  I would not hesitate to stay at the Planter's Inn again.Great location but nothing particularly memorable about the hotel. It's good quality yet nothing stands out.My boyfriend brought me here for Valentine's Day, and we had an AMAAAZING experience. The Planter's Inn is small, but very nice and quaint. From your first step on the property, the staff here definitely shows you what Southern hospitality is all about. The rooms are very classy and comfortable. Through the hotel, my boyfriend was able to have home-made chocolates and roses waiting inside. Actually, my boyfriend asked for a room with a jacuzzi tub, but we were first taken to a room without one. He called in, and staff graciously showed us to the appropriate room. Both rooms were equally beautiful. And again, staff was very courteous and hospitable. Location is great and very central to many great places downtown. Overall, we had a great time in a very beautiful and relaxing setting.This hotel is amazing. One of the nicest luxury historic hotels I've been in. The room furnishings are top notch and the location is perfect for exploring downtown Charleston. The staff attend to every need without being obtrusive.
review_content_20: We stayed at the Planter's Inn for our wedding night. The room was beautiful and charming. The bed was so comfortable we actually fell right to sleep! The only thing I regret is not buying that teddy bear they place on the bed or the extra soft robes. I wasn't to thrilled about the room service food in the morning but all in all it was wonderful.Planter's Inn and the Peninsula Grill have both gotten a (rare) 5 star review from me. From the room, to the service, to the location I can't say enough good things (thus a 5 star review it is).We got a package deal for a "deluxe king" in their "piazza" wing, which in addition to the room included valet parking and continental breakfast (or half off full service breakfast) at the Peninsula Grill. First, the room - I want the room in my house - it was filled with furniture that had touches of southern detail, especially a four poster bed and luxurious linens that I wanted to pack up in my luggage and take with me. The room didn't skimp on modern conveniences either, with central HVAC, noise insulating windows, a jacuzzi tub, and complimentary wifi throughout the hotel. Service was top notch, from the (cute-to-boot) valet to the concierge to the room service (we came back to find the results of the evening turndown service - two bottles of water, a filled ice, drawn curtains, two creme cookies and a teddy bear perched on the bed pillows).Location was great, about a 10-15 minute walk to the battery and the shops of city market and king street are right outside the door (personal plus, Ben & Jerry's a couple of storefronts down on Market!).Without a doubt one of the best hotel stays I've had.Actually I would give this establishment 3 1/2 stars.  First off,  Planter's Inn was a lovely and charming place.  However, upon arriving, the front desk clerk was alone and trying her best to take care of 5 people at once.  She called for help but did not get any until a third try.  The clerk was wonderful and was certainly apologetic  to everyone.  Not her fault in any way.  We were disappointed in our room as the toilet 'ran' for about 30 seconds every 20 minutes.  Also, there was 'something red' on the drapery (looked like blood) and the underside of our  cream colored bedspread had green stains on it. I did take pictures and showed it to the front desk upon leaving.  The only reason for even saying anything was so that the drapes could be changed before the next occupants. As we were getting into our car the desk clerk came running out telling us the manager said "this is unacceptable" and a credit would be given...didn't really expect anything...good thing as it has been  over two weeks and have not seen any credits thus far.  For the amount of money this room cost ($350/night), one would think the maid would catch this.  Morning coffee. $8.50 for room service plus tax and gratuity. Enough for 1 person. Complimentary coffee was in their guest salon...however, we had to go down 3 floors and out in the rain into the main building to get it. I suppose it would have been better if the weather had been sunny.   Perhaps 'in room' coffee service would be something for Planter's Inn to consider in the future.  The valet parking attendants were spectacular !  The young men that helped us with our luggage were fantastic.  Very knowledgeable  of area.  They were a great help.  Exceptional staff but other offerings were none better than any $150 dollar room.This place was very charming!!The front door man (Allan) quickly befriended us and made our experience in Charleston a great one! The hospitality of this small hotel was amazing and really one of a kind. The room was beautiful! It had a jacuzzi tub which I mysteriously found myself drawn to every single night! The bathrobes were amazing as well! I cannot find one as soft or as warm and I am trying! The room service was great! Everyday we would come back from our adventures and find gifts of pralines and chocolate and nice comforting music. The location is perfect. You are right in the middle of all the hustle and bustle of the markets in South Carolina but it is quiet enough to be restful. I loved the fact that we did not have to worry about parking at all. The valet took care of everything for us and they were as nice and speedy and could be!Stayed at the inn for a long weekend and had a really nice stay here.  The hotel was in the perfect location, right across from the Market and within walking distance to King Street.  I thought our room was great and the bed was extremely comfortable.  If we ever travel back to Charleston, I would stay here again.We were late by 7 hours getting in due to an accident and emergency medical treatment.  Could have been the worst day, but they had everything ready including a pedicab to get us to Circa 1886 for dinner.  I appreciated the feeling that they were taking care of us.  Given what we went through, it was truly appreciated.  Beautiful room, great location next to everything, and excellent service.Wonderful Staff, Beautiful rooms. VERY nice place to stay. Will certainly make a return visit.The Planter's Inn is a great small hotel. The decor in the room was fantastic; simple and classic southern. Everyone on staff was very hospitable and they greeted you with a Mr. and Mrs. every time. They even had standing reservations for us at the Peninsula downstairs (a true treat). The beds and linens were top notch, but the bathrooms could use an update. The tub was an early 90's jet.... I felt that a claw foot tub would have been more appropriate considering the rest of the decor.  We were able to walk to all of the restaurants and visit all of the attraction within minutes. Very good location if you plan to take in a lot of the scenery in old Charleston. If you are going to stay for multiple nights, be aware of the valet charges. The concierge got my wife a hair appointment in minutes at a top-notch salon before we had dinner at the Peninsula Grill downstairs.I really enjoyed my stay at the Planter's Inn. What sticks out the most is the service. Everyone who worked their was really friendly & helpful. They gave us some great tips on where to eat (and they weren't all restaurants the hotel owns, though they did that too). The room & the bathroom were large. The location of this hotel is also great. It was close to everything we did practically. We had a rental car but only needed to use it when we drove to the plantations. Two thumbs up!The Planter's Inn is a gem of a small inn in a central location. Our large room facing the courtyard was beautifully decorated with a fireplace and a large bathroom. Our comfortable four-poster bed came with its own welcoming teddy bear. The bathroom was large and there were nice bathrobes and toiletries.To get the most out of the inn it is best to make use of the fabulous associated restaurant, the Peninsula Grill. (Remember to make dinner reservations when you book your room.) In addition to dinner, when the weather is fine the lovely courtyard is a wonderful place for breakfast and for sipping drinks bought at the bar.The amenities would get the Planter's Inn four stars; the fifth star is because of the staff. The employees of both the inn and the restaurant are charming, exquisitely polite and helpful.This Inn was great and in the heart of downtown. Nightlife is waking distance, the market is across the street, the food is great and the rooms are amazing. My wife loved this inn. I highly recommend it.The Planter's Inn of Charleston is, as are many others, a historic hotel.  It has been around for God knows how long.  I first discovered it while looking for a nice, established hotel for my wife and I to stay on a weekend venture into the historic area of Charleston.The biggest plus Planter's has going for it is location.  It sits on the corner of Market St. and is adjacent to King Street--some of the finest shopping areas you are likely to find in downtown Charleston.  Everything is within walking distance.On the negative, the facility was under renovation of the exterior which was not mentioned on any of the pamphlets, booking sites, or when a call was placed to the front desk for reservation verification.  While this eyesore didn't affect the interior, it certainly limited the view my wife and I would have enjoyed from within our suite.  Additionally, upon arrival, it was discovered that the desk staff or booking agent had withheld incorrect dates for our stay.  They weren't expecting us for 2 more days apparently.  After some chat, they apologized and placed us in an upgraded suite (still, with limited to no visibility out of the rooms windows).The beds were fantastic 4-poster, the service (overall) was wonderful, and our stay was good.  I would certainly consider returning -- but it is doubtful that I would pay the same rates.  Overpriced for what you get in my opinion.Note: Our stay was from Aug. 16-19th 2007.  Construction is completed at this time (or seemed to be when we recently passed by the hotel around the first of August 2008).A great place to stay.  My wife and I stayed there after one night at the Doubletree down the street.  The Planter's Inn offered top notch service with southern hospitality.  Great location and remarkable rooms makes this a place to return.  The next time in Chucktown we are staying here.  The breakfast was outstanding and the wait staff offered the best service of our trip.This unassuming hotel is exceptional. The staff is attentive and inviting, but not intrusive. The rooms are spacious and well-appointed. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to other travelers.This hotel is walking distance from everything worth seeing in Charleston.  It is right outside of the market and just on the other side of that is the waterfront. If you exit out of the hotel in the other direction you are right next to Charleston's response to Rodeo Dr.  Our room was beautiful and the toiletries in the bathroom are worthy of packing up with your luggage, but save some to use in the luxorious bathtub while you're there.  The beds were so comfortable and the decor was beautiful and frilly and antique.    There is a lot of history in this hotel which makes it fun to explore. The service at the hotel is outstanding.  Unfortunately we did not get to eat  at the world class restaurant downstairs but it smelled delicious and the courtyard seating looked so cute.    Guess I will just have to go back.  We went in January and it was great because the weather wasn't too bad and since it was the off season the city was pleasantly buzzing rather than annoyingly.  Check what's open during this tile thought because we weren't able to go on a boat because the company we chose wasn't running during this time.I found this hotel utterly charming and quaint.  The service by the bellman Eric was outstanding, he just wanted us to love the hotel as much as he did and made us feel welcomed and relaxed.  The room was plush, gorgeous bedding and I just love the 4 poster bed with the pineapple motif.  Not the normal stuff we get where I live by any means!  It's a small lobby with a wonderful staff.  I did hear noises that added to the 'ghost' experience but only on our first night.  The bathroom was luxurious - jetted tub and lighting was fabulous.  Would love to spend more time there.I rarely take the time to write a complaint about a poor experience, but after a recent stay at Planters Inn, I did.  This is not a four-star hotel.  I've had better service at a Hilton Garden Inn.  It's certainly not up to Relais & Chateaux standards.  The staff was nice enough, but clearly too inexperienced and not thoroughly trained enough to provide first-rate guest service.  They had limited knowledge of nearby restaurants ("check out the menu book in our parlor"), persistent calls to our room which woke our infant daughter despite a "do not disturb" sign on the door, and LOUD noise from cars roaring by until 3AM on Saturday night.  I guess for noise reasons, their location is a blessing and a curse.  Location and nice room sizes are about the only thing this hotel has going for it - there are many other better options in Charleston.  I would never stay there again, but if it's the last room in town, ask to stay in room away from the street.PS - My written complaint was never really followed up by management - which for me is confirmation they really don't care.The staff knocks this place up a notch. It's right across from the Market in downtown Charleston - great location. The valet parking costs $18. Not sure what other choices are available. The room w/ king size bed is large w/ desk, loveseat style bench/couch, cushy bedding, huge bathroom. There's a nice sitting room on the street level w/ water, lemonade, etc. The bar was a great place for a cocktail and some oysters.I agree pretty much with the previous reviewer.  For anyone who knows real quality this is not the level of luxury you'd expect for this class of hotel and at this price point.  The location is excellent.  The lobby area is somewhat charming.  But we were housed in the rooms in the adjacent annex which (except for the four-post bed) were on par with an architecturally uninteresting mid-level hotel.  The room was odd and the hallways and stairwells were ropey.  I probably would not go back as it wasn't a good value for the money.  The staff were fine but definitely not a cut above.  The one request we made of the concierge (to arrange tickets to a house and garden tour) was that we'd have to do that ourselves. They were also too apt to recommend the other restaurants in Charleston that are owned by the same company that owns the hotel, as opposed to what they personally liked.  Overall good but not great.  For the money we paid it was a disappointment.

hotel_name: Holiday Inn Express Charleston Dwtn - Ashley River
review_content: Very comfortable stay! The front desk receptionist was very polite and greeting upon checking in (customer friendly).The bedroom was small yet comfortable. The bedroom balcony overlooks downtown Charleston (which was a nice morning view). Morning breakfast was tasty and filling (get off to a good start). Would recommend!Great location to downtown, less than 5 minutes either way. Parking is free, but pretty limited. Always have to drive around the lot a few times. Staff is really friendly and helpful about local aspects.The hotel quality and amenities are very good. The front desk staff are not customer service oriented. And because it's more than just one person, the leadership is clearly supporting a culture where the customer is a transaction. I was traveling on my motorcycle and there was a severe thunderstorm warning. I asked to park my bike under the front awning out of the way of vehicles needing to pass through. I was challenged with this request and was told shed check with her manager and get back with me--but never did. I'm on a 3,000 motorcycle trip, an IHG member who has been staying in a Holiday Inn Express all along the way (10 days), this was the only place that challenged me on parking there. The other places even encouraged me to just in case it might rain. Don't ask them about a phone charger to use either. They have a big box of lost and found and won't loan you a charger to use during your stay--not even for a few minutes. Not even if you are a Club member. There are other hotels nearby and I'd recommend you find one of them instead of this place. These people don't care about you. Just your money.As you would expect from a Holiday Inn Express. Speedy check-in, free parking which is nice in a downtown area and the general accommodations were mostly on point. 2 things---gym AC was in the blink which made for a great sweat but it was a bit much. They were working on it but, whew, was it hot!  AC in room was SUPER loud. Coworker said the same thing about their room. Hotel is new and it's always nice to stay in a newer property. Breakfast is also as expected. Nothing special but the general basic items you get at a HIE. Lots of good places within a mile to walk to for dinner. The area in general is under a revitalization and that is nice.Parking far, far away to the other side of the building!  The light in our bathroom, too noisy, since it also turns on the fan.  Bathroom too small, I don't like the tiny counter space, I'm using my desk to put my bathroom stuff, afraid they'd fall down the toilet!Tub no longer, updated to shower with 2 glass doors, a plus!I'll update tomorrow, after breakfast!Update: While we're the last ones to eat breakfast, before closing, I've come to observe the busboy.  He sprayed cleansers to the table, wipe them, with a rag, then he used the same rag to 'dust' the dirt or crumbs off the rug, to the floor.  Then he used  the same rag, to clean the table.  They also do not have hot cocoa!The room was adequate and the bed was comfortable. Parking is ample and secure. The location was just outside of the main town area. Traffic is heavy so it does take longer than you would expect to get to desired destination. There were some annoying construction noises nearby and a light shining on our window..the curtains helped some. Once during our stay there was a fire evacuation...apparently one of the guests tried to smoke in their room. Breakfast isn't bad but, there may be a wait at times for items to be replenished. Customer service was very good.Significantly below expectations for HI Express.  While I didnt expect a luxurious property, I was disappointed to find rooms that were dingy and dark (very limited light in the rooms), noisy due to doors slamming and exterior air handling machinery, and to top it all off 1/2 of the parking lot blocked off so there was no place to park.  This property is also not located in a convenient area of Chaleston.  right next to freeways so not walkable at all.Great value for the price and location.While it's not "downtown", it is about 1.5 miles (pretty walkable) or accessible by free trolly that picks up right outside the parking lot. It also has free parking and a great breakfast spread (fruits, juices, coffee, cinnamon buns, eggs, meats, yogurts, cereals, grits, oatmeals, and biscuits and gravy). They also have coffee/tea 24/7 as well as cookies they bring out mid-afternoon.You could tell it was recently renovated. The common areas and rooms were all a very modern Ikea-like style with dark wood, bold green colors, and patterns. The staff were very friendly and courteous. They didn't hesitate to explain to us about the free trolley, give us suggestions for dinner, and other sightseeing tips. They even gave us toiletries when the cleaning ladies seemed to have forgotten them.Don't, however, expect a very good view from the windows (unless you are above floor 5 on the odd side). You'll see a parking lot or construction or the highway. No biggie - we were just sleeping here.Well the heat was a bit noisy which woke me up at night and made it hard to watch TV. But other than that, I couldn't really pinpoint any major problems. I think we'd stay here again if we were in the area and didn't want to shell out $300+ for the Old Town 'quaint' experience.Stayed at this location last night and I honestly don't know how the negative comments can be justified. I am a Hilton diamond member and this hotel can be compared to any Hampton Inn. Typical breakfast food was fresh. The room was clean. The AC unit did run all night but did not bother us. I would stay again. The staff was extremely helpful and courteousWhile in the area on vacation, my mother was hospitalized and I needed a room for a night or two.  This hotel had a local number, so I called it and pressed 2 to reach the front desk. With no other information other than my name, they held a room for me.  I was treated like royalty upon arriving there after 9.  Dierdra at the front desk was a total gem and she even offered to move her car so I'd have a place to park!.  I was given a very clean and comfortable room and stayed there 2 night.  Breakfast buffet is better than many restaurants.  Plentiful coffee at all times, including a small pot in the room.  Everyone is nice and they even have a small laundry, but it is $2 each for the washer and dryer.  This is my first experience with a Holiday Inn Express, since I'm not much of a traveler, but I will definitely consider them my next trip.Good enough for the price. Good view facing the Ashley River. Room itself is alright: clean enough, roomy, adequate. A/C is rather noisy. The little Juliet balcony is a nice touch. Breakfast also adequate. Good free parking. In contrast to many reviews that say not convenient to downtown, I say it is convenient. Many Americans are no longer used to walking more than a few blocks and rely on motorized transport -- unhealthy loving. If you're used to living in a walking place like Tokyo, Paris, Hong Kong, this type of walking is absolutely normal. We liked it.When reading reviews there was a mix that made it hard to decipher what this place was like.  My mother-in-law had been here once before and raved about their room so when we arrived and expected Awesomeness!  NOT!  We arrived to a disoriented front desk clerk and hand towels spread over counter and on the floor.  When you get the 7th floor and a 2 queen room, it's great; but if you get 4th floor with a king bed, be prepared for disappointment.  Rooms on 4 are dated and cramped and don't have mini fridge; rooms on 7 are spacious and have a fridge.    Horrible views and the rates are high, even though we had a discounted rate, and the housekeeping barely cleaned our room or made our bed.  Next time we will bring our RV and stay in Mount Pleasant.The hotel was nice...probably the cleanest hotel I ever stayed at.  I would love to stay there again for that reason.  Be careful of what they charge you.  I was quoted a price at the front desk.  I received my bill for the 4 days I stayed there at the end of my visit.  It was way way more than it should have been.  I took the bill down and the girl adjusted it.  I noticed after I had left the hotel that I was still overcharged by $40 dollars for two of the nights.  A slight overcharge is one thing, but double?  That is hardly excusable.Hotel itself is very nice and clean. The staff was ok. BIG downside was parking they have a very small parking lot if you happen to leave for dinner and come back you are lucky if you find a spot. Some people were parking in the grass.  Hotel is in a very busy place but it is in a convenient location easy to get to popular locations throughout Charleston.I am giving 4 stars overall for the hotel, but would give 5 stars if I could to one employee in particular.. Diedra at the front desk! As opposed to the "night shift" staff who was there when we checked in, Diedra greeted us with a smile in the morning and answered all of our questions about the Charleston area. She was also extra friendly to our dog, which always puts you at the top of the list in our book! She suggested specific areas for us to check out.. which all lived up to the hype! The hotel in general was nice, but since we visited right after a hurricane had the expected flooding/leaks/etc.We stayed here on an overnight to Charleston. It took less than 5 minutes to drive into downtown Charleston making this WELL worth the cost savings at not staying downtown. The room was very nice, modern, and bed very comfortable. We had a hard time regulating the temp though. Nothing would happen when I used the electronic gauge and only did something happen when my husband messed with the wall unit. Weird. The breakfast was basic but a nice to have. The parking lot was a bit of a cluster on a Sat night. We came back to the hotel around midnight and we got the last spot on the far other side close to the road. There were people parked at curbs.Other than that, great value and comfortable place to stay.Nothing special about this hotel. We had a pretty good rate through Hotwire, so no complaints there. The parking is free and plentiful which is nice. We didn't try to walk downtown or take the free trolley. Driving isn't bad at all to downtown. Meters don't run after 6 or on Sundays. The free breakfast was decent, but the healthy options might have been a bit lacking. This area did not have excessive noise at any time of the day. We did have an issue at midday on a Tuesday. We were trying to get ready for a wedding, but the front desk said a city water pipe broke and we were without water for over an hour. Nothing to really fault the hotel for, but I'm not sure if it will be an ongoing issue.The staff was always very friendly and the room was clean and comfortable. Wifi was slow but free.Great hotel! Rooms were clean and there was a nice mini-fridge to keep any food or drinks we wanted to keep. There was a great pool area with lounge chairs and tables for relaxing as well as a great patio on the front of the hotel to hang with friends after a long day out exploring.My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights and found it a perfect base for visiting the Charleston area. The hotel is 5-15 minutes from pretty much any place you might want to visit in the city as a tourist and 20-25 minutes to the beach, etc.  The hotel staff were very friendly and provided some great food recommendations. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable.The main parking lot gets difficult in the evenings, though you could always park in an adjacent lot of another business; not ideal but it's the only option given the lack of street parking.All Smoke and Mirrors. I stay in a lot of hotels, this one may have been remodeled recently, but feels like some time ago. As in 20yrs ago. Its beat up, next to the highway and tucked into a changing neighborhood thats still very seedy around it. If you do not want to spend money and be a ways from where all the action is happening in Charleston, this is where you go. We booked it based off reviews looking to save money on our last night. Wished we hadn't
review_content_20: I stayed here while on a business trip. I didn't do any of the booking so I can't comment on that or the pricing, but as a hotel I was very pleased and would aim to stay here again in the future.I was given a room with two queen beds. This also included a small table with two chairs, a coffee maker, a microwave, and fridge. Others I was staying with were given a king room that didn't have a fridge or microwave and commented that the room was small, so depending on what you want, be careful which room type you book. The main reason I was impressed with this hotel was the beds. I do not sleep well ever, and I REALLY don't sleep well in hotels, but the beds here were comfortable enough to rival mine at home, and each bed had soft and firm pillows (with soft and firm embroidered on the pillowcase) so you could chose what you like best. Wifi passwords were written on the hotel key envelops but I didn't use it at all. Others in my group mentioned watching netflix at night so they were obviously using the wifi no problem. The gym here had one elliptical, two treadmills, a rowing machine, some free weights, and some yoga mats and was very clean. The staff here was very friendly and the front desk provides extra amenities at no charge if you ask. I had forgotten toothpaste and they were able to provide me with a cute travel colgate. A continental breakfast was included in the price of the room which had your basic fruit, bagels, toast, cereal, as well as some "higher end" breakfast items such as pancakes, eggs, sausage, and cinnamon buns. I only ever ate the bananas so I can't comment on the food much. A word of advice for breakfast is to get there early. It begins at 6:30 am and I was there at that time most days; however, our last day checking out we walked through the lobby at 9 and breakfast was an absolute zoo.I am HI platinum elite, so I know something about Holiday Inns. 90 room nites in 2013 at the IHG hotel chain. This HI Express is well above the average and exceeded only by the one in Beckley WVA, near Tamarak. Free parking is so rare in Charleston as to rate one extra star all by itself. The breakfast was exactly the same menu as at all the rest, but extra attention was paid to detail. The biscuits were always fresh, I suspect they cook multiple small batches all morning rather than just a few big batches. The bed was quite comfortable, the AC worked fine, and the coffee was good.Special tips: get an odd numbered room on a floor above 5, and you can actually see the river.Set the AC fan to ON, rather than AUTO, and it will not cycle off and on all night. The compressor still cycles, but it's not as noisy.We were planning a last minute trip to Charleston for the weekend and every hotel downtown was wayyy out of budget - high season prices!We decided to take the Hotwire route and got this 3-star hotel for a good price. The location is convenient, maybe 5-10 minutes to drive into downtown or a 15 minute trolley ride. You can walk through the parking lot to catch the free city trolley (DASH). I believe they run every 20 minutes or so, but the hotel has maps at the front desk. This hotel also has free parking, so that's a big savings compared to downtown hotels.  The hotel is recently renovated, so everything is clean and modern. We were impressed that every staff member was so friendly and welcoming - everyone we saw throughout the hotel was smiling and saying hello to us. Very refreshing!Our room was also clean and modern, the bed was comfy and there was a new TV and a hairdryer in the bathroom (shower was also great, very hot, good pressure). There is safe in the room, but if the previous guest did not clear the code, you have to call to get it reset. The person who came to reset it for us was just as friendly as the rest of the staff and took care of it for us. Breakfast was included with our stay, it included: cereal, pancakes, eggs, biscuits, bacon, toast/muffins, yogurt, juice/coffee/milk. They also had bowls of fresh fruit throughout the eating area. It got really busy around 9-10, so make sure you go a little early to beat the rush. They were trying to keep up with everyone coming down at once, but they kept running out of the "hot food." We just went earlier the second day and it was fine. There isn't a bar or restaurant on site, but we checked out the rooftop bar next door at the Marriott one night - it was really nice (but pricey). Something for you to check out if you want to stay pretty close to your room.So that was all the good stuff. I only have one gripe about this place. The air conditioning unit was unbelievably loud. It woke me up every time it started to run. It sounds like a plane is taking off! If the management doesn't believe this complaint, they should try sleeping in room 810 one night. We were there with family and they said their air conditioning unit was just as loud as ours. So, if everything else convinces you to go here and you're a light sleeper - bring your ear plugs!!! I was wishing I had some every time that beast came on!Throw your GPS out the window.No matter what, it is hard to find the entrance to this place. Very poorly marked.The parking lot is small, and the front desk will warn you not to park in certain areas or else you'll get your car towed. Forget swimming in the pool before 1 or 2 o'clock, because the sun is blocked by the building until then.The beds are comfortable and the rest of the room is adequate. Not the fanciest hotel I've been to. The breakfast they serve is great. Good coffee, delicious cinnamon rolls, (not tried: cereal, pancakes, biscuits, fruit, orange juice, etc). Nice selection.  Very friendly and helpful staff.Wish they had a bar!Stayed last night, Memorial weekend...nice decor & colors in lobby with wood floor/carpet combo....combination of earthy browns and cool aqua tones, in rooms as well.   Enjoyed front patio with chairs and tables, didn't get to the pool..as the sun doesn't hit that side until maybe noon.  There's a fitness center and business center as well.   Breakfast selection was just right and neatly arranged.  I loved the cute little  petite omelets neatly stacked in upright position.Staff was friendly, comfortable bedding and pillows..fyi..room with two queen beds have fridge/microwave combo...the kings do not.  Pay a little more and get the rooms with view which will have a balcony with Ashley River view.  I had a room with a limited view from the balcony and view of a roof next door and Mcdonalds...not pretty.What I noticed most was how soundproof the rooms are compared to most hotels I stayed in the past.  My room was close to the elevator, but it was not noisy and people walking by was barely a muffle.  I could not hear anything from the rooms beside me and the hotel was sold out this weekend.Holiday Inn Expresses include breakfast, but no restaurant or bar.  The kiosk in the lobby directs you to dining options in the area  and attractions.  We chose to drive a short distance away to the Holiday Inn Riverview atop the Ashley River and have dinner in their rooftop restaurant and bar which offers great food and a view of the Ashley River.Forgot my toothbrush and they gave me a complimentary one at the front desk.Good convenient location in the downtown area and fresh new look, clean...plush bedding and pillows.   A step up for an economy brand....oh and FREE parking...a rare thing in downtown Charleston!First time in Charleston.  Booked the hotel online, rates less pricey than the expensive historic district.   Ok, so the good:Very friendly, accommodating staff!Free breakfast, saves the cost of one meal per day.Again, cheaper rates.Could be better:Not convenient to the downtown Charleston . You have to take a shuttle or cab.  Shuttle runs erratic, none after 8:30pm. You can't walk, it's too far.The room we booked did not have a refrigerator.  The room was small and AC unit is very loud.Located near highways, so noisy all the time.After visiting Charleston next time will stay in the downtown area, just easier.Made my reservation by phone so I could be sure there would be a refrigerator in the room (because of medications) and to ask about leaving car there while going on a cruise. When I arrived there was a problem with the parking answer I'd been given. Wouldn't have been a problem at all except that the manager told me the conversation when I made the reservation "never happened," constantly interrupted me, and yelled at me. There was no refrigerator, and when I asked for one, instead of just getting one, the desk clerk started lecturing me that rooms with king beds don't have them. The worst service, and rudest treatment I've ever received at a hotel. Choose a different Holiday Inn Express.This place is great! Super easy check in with friendly employees. This isn't a "fancy" hotel but being a moderate price it was what I was expecting. It's updated and modern. The ceilings are LOW but that's ok. There wasn't a refrigerator in our room (not sure if that goes for all rooms or what). Free wi-fi and free parking. This hotel is technically located "downtown" but it's not in the heart of the action so you'll probably have to drive to the downtown area (no sidewalks or anything). The pool is small and underwhelming but I can't imagine many people going there for the pool so you know.We stayed here for one night on a getaway to Charleston. My wife got a deal with an online booking, and off we went. Aside from the standard issue hotel stuff, this place doesn't really have anything revolutionary, which I didn't expect, but just worth noting. They offer free breakfast which is pretty extensive, cinnamon rolls, biscuits, eggs, bacon, gravy, fruit, yogurt, cereal, juice, bagels, the works. The bacon looked a little scary, but everything else was reasonable quality for free. The rooms are nice, clean, and have reasonable sized bathrooms, some even have small balconies. Location was nice, it's almost exactly 1 mile from "downtown". If it weren't for the terrible rainy/cold weather we likely would have just walked, since parking is a huge inconvenience in Charleston. Only reason I gave this place 4/5 is because while everything is fairly new, it just seemed like they rushed the construction, so they cut some corners on the way. Just small stuff like uneven caulking, rough edges on trim, and some cheap appliances. But hey, it's just a hotel, nothing worth getting upset over. If I stay overnight in Charleston again, I wouldn't be opposed to here. It's nice to not be all the way downtown, and it's reasonably priced.After we booked this room through an online service we realized that is was on the outer edge of their "downtown" envelope.  I doubt that many visitors would consider this hotel to be "downtown."  It is a good 1.5 miles from the visitor center and another mile from the area around, and north of, the battery.  There is very little that you can walk to from the hotel except for a McDonalds.  Charleston does run a free shuttle bus down to the visitor center from this area.  I understand that the trip takes about a half an hour.  We intended to take the shuttle, but the day was cold and damp, with a misty rain, and when the shuttle did not arrive within ten minutes of the scheduled time, we decided to get out of the rain and drive to the visitors center, which took less than ten minutes, but then we had to pay for parking.The rooms and bathrooms are not very large and are very tight.  We ran out of tissues in the bathroom and they left a new box sitting on the sink rather than in the dispenser.  Toiletries that were used were not replaced, and the used tea bags were not replaced.  The bed was very comfortable.One of the benefits listed for this venue is free parking, but the lot is not large enough for a busy night, and many of us had to be creative one evening in carving out spots for our cars.  The hotel is also situated next to a busy highway, so there is a lot of highway noise at all hours of the day and night.  When we asked at the desk for restaurant recommendations nearby, they were less than useful and did not come up with anything except the nearby fast-food establishments.  There are some good restaurants less than a mile from the hotel, but with bad weather we needed to drive.  The local neighborhoods have very little parking, so you need to be prepared to drive around for a bit.The free breakfast is typical of this sort of hotel and is not bad.  The breakfast food staff were excellent in insuring they did not run out of food, and in clearing tables as people finished their breakfasts.Needless to say, I would not stay there again and would not recommend the Holiday Inn Express Charleston "Downtown" - Ashley River.Front desk staff has been great..room..great..pool great.. My only complaint is not all the TV stations work other than that the room is  clean the staff is professional.. And went beyond the norm to satisfy my needs can't wait to stay here againThis hotel opened recently (March 2013) and some things look amazing (clean bedding, fresh paint) but other things look like your average, older, cheaper hotel (shower/bathroom, ac unit) plus there's still paint on door frames/etc. It was previously a Best Western, hence the old stuff. But the staff was very friendly and the lobby inviting and clean.When we arrived to check in to our room, we were told that they gave our room away to someone else and tried to give us a single bed and a roll away cot. We had already booked and paid for a room that had two beds. After telling the front desk person that we needed two beds since there were 3 adults and 1 child, they remembered that there was 1 room left that had two beds. The room they gave us was made for a disabled person to be able to use easily.., This would not have been an issue at all, but the shower is not user friendly at all. The shower head does not stay mounted on the holder and the standing shower did not hold any water in. By the time you are done with your shower, half of the bathroom is soaked. Also the fridge that came with our room was broken and the air conditioning unit did a crappy job of keeping our room cool. It was set at 66 degrees and made our room feel like it was around 75 or so. Also they have more rooms than they do parking spots.... We were told to make up our own parking spot. For the money that we spent here and all the hotels I've stayed in, this was one of the worse ones.Walls are paper thin. Take something to help you sleep because the street noise and the conversation from the next room will keep you awake. On the plus side, very helpful front desk staff and convenient location. Would think twice before staying at this location again.This hotel just opened this year, so it's nice and clean. The breakfast is pretty decent, but the eggs were so salty they were inedible. The staff was super helpful and the rooms were clean and spacious. The only complaint on the rooms was that they use a super noisy A/C unit that looks like it time traveled from the 1980's to get there. It was RIDICULOUSLY noisy! For a Holiday Inn Express it wasn't too bad. There is a nice pool (no stairs into the pool, just ladders, which is kind of weird). I stayed here free using my reward points, but I don't think I'd pay to stay here.Nice hotel, clean.  Close to the medical complex and ball field.  Nice fitness room.  Outside pool, we didn't try it.  Not right in the tourist district but there is a bus a few blocks away.Stayed here during a recent trip.  It was our first time to Charleston and we were really excited.  The Hotel  had everything you would need at a great price.  The complimentary breakfast every morning was great.  We did have one issue with the room.  However Rebecca the GM handled the situation very quickly and professionally.  She ensured that we will continue to stay at her Hotel whenever we are in Charleston.Thanks RebeccaBy holiday inn standards this location is inferior. Yes its a quick drive to downtown and you're thinking you'll save some money... But at what point is it worth it. This place isn't cheap but your room certainly feels like it. So small my wife and I bumped into each other and the walls constantly. So dark you can't even get shave or apply makeup in the bathroom. Better off researching other places.I had a great stay here last weekend. The staff was so friendly and helped me out on a couple of occasions. I was in a room with 2 beds and it was clean and there was plenty of room in the room, the bathroom was a little small though. There was a fridge in the room which was helpful. I didn't think much of the hotel until after I left and realized I left an item in the room. Jackie was able to help me out in a professional timely manner, which I am so thankful for.Similar to many of the other posts, I travel weekly so as a IHG Platinum Member I have seen my fair share of HI's.   This experience was during a family vacation using some rewards points and I was told that our room on the 5th floor had a "view"...of the other hotels maybe...but certainly not a water view.  I can get past that but obviously the hotel was booked solid every night causing many to park on the lawn or in the gravel lot next door that turns into a pond every night when it rains and then finally having to park 2 lots away because we came in later.   I might even look past that but to make things worse, each morning there was a long line for breakfast because they ran out of food several days in a row and even ran out of regular coffee....how does this happen this is your business? The staff was friendly that's why I give at least 2 stars but it seriously makes me reconsider where I stay in the future.  The bathroom was tiny,  the balcony door handle and lock were broken, and they do not offer pay per view family movies.  Very disappointed in a place that I've come to expect a great experience each time.
review_content_40: Just returned from 5 day vacation in Charleston.  This facility offers very good value.  Nearby trolley stop to downtown.  The staff deserves a five star rating.  Always friendly, and consistently willing to go the extra mile to make our stay enjoyable.

review_content: Spoiled and pampered for 3 days, it will be difficult to readjust and return to our real lives tomorrow. The French Quarter Inn was a splurge for us, and was it ever worth it.SERVICE:  What an awesome staff. Everyone from the bell boys, check in agents, cleaning staff, food service employees, and manager were all excellent, attentive and genuinely kind and amazing. Can't say enough about how welcome we felt.FOOD AMENITIES:  Breakfast was large bowls of fresh berries or melons with pineapple,  cereal,  greek yogurt,  mini quiches, pastries, salami, cheese, bread and bagels, even with smoked salmon and capers today. Beverage choices of fresh juices, champagne,  coffees, and different teas with various honeys, lemon milk,  cream and sweeteners. Wine and cheese reception was abundant  with pinot grigio, chardonnay, merlot, or cabernet. At least 3 cheese were offered each day, salami, olives, garlic, fig jelly, dried fruit, grapes, bread and crackers. In the evening, we gorged on homemade cookies and port, skipping the cold milk offering. Throughout the day, coffees, teas, water, lemonade and treats such as m&ms and jelly beans were offered 24/7.  This doesn't even include the treats at turndown service in your room or the complimentary waters which were replenished daily. OTHER AMENITIES: Bikes are complimentary and available for cruising around town. Unfortunately, it was cold and windy so we were unable to take advantage of this during our stay. There is a nearby gym available for use during your stay, just ask.ROOM: We graciously accepted a complimentary upgrade from queen room to queen suite. Wow...Huge spacious area with additional sitting room and fireplace. The bathroom also had a great shower and garden tub with bath salts to relax. Large towels and comfy bath robes were also luxurious, as were the Bigelow bath products.  The beds were comfortable and they actually have 7 pillow options and a concierge if you wish a specific type. NEGATIVES ???: We did have a problem with our room during our last evening which necessitated us to change rooms. Can you believe that the manager,  Mark, actually drove in from home to speak directly with us and make sure that everything was okay? He even adjusted our bill and gave us his card to assist us with reservations for our next stay. Even the next morning,  he found us and apologized again for the inconvenience and thanked us for being understanding. Wow! Again,  the customer service is amazing. We are about to leave this heavenly place, but can't wait to return to Charleston. Of course,  we will definitely be staying at the French Quarter Inn! !! Thanks to all who made our stay amazing!A comfortable and well thought out hotel. You can't beat the location next to the market. Anise checked us in with champagne and an explanation of all their extras. Breakfast, wine and cheese in the early evening and port with warm cookies later. The room was large with a great bathroom and big shower. We could have had a choice of 7 pillow types, but ours were fine. Everyone we came in contact with was outstanding.This place is very expensive but worth every penny if you can afford it.  We were here for our wedding and they treated us like movie stars.  The suite we got was incredible and very clean.  Most importantly for me it was also very nice and cool in the southern heat ;)The women that work at the front desk really go the extra mile to help you out with whatever you need and they are a gold mine of ideas for fun things to do locally.  I'd really recommend getting a room with a balcony if you can, we did and it was a lot of fun setting outside in the morning before it got too hot just watching the tours and tourists going by while you eat a delicious breakfast and take in the cool, sea breeze.  Highly recommended!Terrible start to our Christmas.  After many hours of driving we arrived only to be told our room would not be ready as promised by the 4pm check in time.  I had several teenagers that needed showers to get ready for dinner and we missed our first dinner reservation as a result.  While apologetic, there is no excuse for the substantial delays we encountered.This was pretty out of our norm in terms of hotels we frequent with kids. However, that was exactly the point of this trip. I wanted to take the kids to a place that wasn't Disney World or the beach for once. I wanted them to experience the history and culture of a great city such as Charleston. There was only one small hiccup, which was having to ask for pillows three times in 5 hours for the pullout. The king suite was charming. The best thing about this hotel is the location and the service. The breakfast, wine and cheese in the evening, and milk and cookies at night had us sold! The bellhops were very nice and helpful. I'd definitely stay here again.What a wonderful place! Here for my mother's Bday and it's exactly what I thought it would be based on photos and reviews. The service from Valet, Front Desk, and the Reception was exceptional. We still have one more night to go and wish it was longer, what a treat.This was one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. I came here with my daughter for her Birthday and some mommy daughter time. The visit started with the reservation desk offering us a glass of champagne, a pillow menu, and wine and cheese reception every late afternoon. Bed turndown every night with a sweet treat. The staff is amazing and always meeting your needs! Will definitely come back!PROS:-Amazing front desk service, both a place to check in and for great concierge service -Who doesn't love included breakfast with cereal, fresh granola, bagels, quiche, fruit, coffee, fresh juices, mim. osas!?-Cheese/wine reception was nice and the late night cookies are a good touch-Fabulous location in the French Quarter, easy walking distance to amazing restaurants (my favorite of which was Husk) and less than a block away from the marketCONS:-Unadvertised demolition in Sept / Oct 2014 (unclear end date) with expected noise as there is drilling on the ground floor and guests sleep on floors 1,2,and 3. -Housekeeping was spotty, we once requested they come after 5 PM (per their protocol!) and they never came. No fresh towels even!-No hot food at breakfast, no scrambled eggs or meats-If you actually think about it, this place somehow has a great rating while hosting basically NO basic amenities. There is no pool, not even a gym.-Incorrect times for the meals are presented to you in the room booklets. It says breakfast runs until 11:30 on the weekends but we were disappointed to find no food left when we came down at 10:35.We had an issue with the renovation noise (drilling at 7:30 AM!) and discussed with the acting manager Scott. He offered us a worse room on a lower floor, next to the breakfast service and closer to noise on the street. I felt frustrated to be treated like this but he seemed to think that offer (which was graciously refused) fixed the problem. I considered cutting my stay short but was so busy I didn't want to deal booking another hotel. I spoke to him later and he was determined to make things right which I appreciated. This hotel certainly has a strong sense of customer service.Overall this hotel has great front desk service, a great breakfast, and an amazing location but is not worth over $350/night given the lack of luxury amenities. Also, I would strongly recommend phoning ahead to make sure there is not drilling during your stay. Will be trying elsewhere (maybe Wentworth mansion?) when I return to Charleston in a few months!Attention to detail is a trait lost on many hotels these days, but not the French Quarter Inn. This is one of the best (if not the best) hotel says I've ever had. Check-in went quickly and smoothly and started with a glass of champagne for my wife and I. We were upgraded to a corner room with a terrace - a pleasant surprise, though unfortunately it was too cold in January to really take advantage of it. The wine and cheese reception takes place daily from 5:30-6:30. No, the cheeses are not exotic or all that different from what you could buy at the supermarket, but overall the service was good and the wine enjoyable. By 8:30 they've switched to milk and cookies before bed. Grab a glass of Port and take it up to your room which has since been turned down.Complementary breakfast in the morning can either be enjoyed in the lobby or room service can deliver it to your room. We tried room service the first morning and went down the second. Room service is certainly very convenient, but you get a better selection if you go down to the lobby (including mimosas). The food is as good as I would expect from any continental breakfast. Other things I enjoyed about FQI... the restrooms on the main floor had actual linens rather than paper towns or air dryers. The rooms have Blu Ray players and they keep a cabinet of discs down in the lobby (no outrageous $20 pay-per-view movies here). There are bicycles available for guests who want to ride around the peninsula.And of course... LOCATION! This is one of the most centrally located hotels in Charleston. Across the street from the City Market and walkable to just about anything you would want to do on the peninsula. French Quarter Inn looks pricey on paper but the value is definitely there. I'm already planning a trip to return next year.For weeks I searched for the perfect hotel to spend a few days with my husband and 4 year old son before our new born arrived, so I was looking for comfort, location, amenities and price. I could not have chosen the best hotel ever.On the day of our departure, our town got hit with 13 inches of snow, and I was determined to get away for the weekend. When I spoke with Ashley about my options she was helpful and courteous. At no time was she rude about their cancellation policy. Based on her excellent customer service, I was very motivated to make it to Charleston, SC.We arrived to the French Quarter Inn much later than we had expected because of inclement weather and traffic, but Mr. Gil was absolutely wonderful with checking us in. He offered me cookies and milk (being 8 months pregnant, I could not drink) and my husband got his glass of champagne and cookies. He helped us with our luggage and ensuring that we settled right into our hotel room. He even came back up to our room to help us figure out how to manage the television remote. Mr. Gill also told us about the breakfast option where we could order our breakfast food to our room as opposed to going downstairs for the over the top breakfast each morning. I cannot express enough how this options was a God send for me. Again, being 8 months pregnant, I cannot move as fast, and I did not feel like getting up early to get ready just to grab breakfast for my boys. This option was AWESOME to say the least, because I actually could enjoy my vacation by not having to grab breakfast, but having it delivered to our room each morning. My recommendation: Moms, take advantage of this option :)Michelle was also very helpful in providing information about possible tours and other sightseeing options around Charleston. I would bug her day or night and she was always very pleasant, accommodating and knowledgeable about what I could find around town. My recommendation: Always call the front desk or stop by because they may have coupons that you could use for local sightseeing tours, restaurants or other venues in or around Charleston.The cheese and wine reception: EXCELLENT!!! Anna and Linda were always very nice and helpful. There was something for everyone to eat, even my 4 year old. What was nice about this reception was the variety of food and drink, so it was not limited to only drinking adults. Kids and pregnant women were included when they came up with the menu option for the cheese and wine reception.  I can honestly say that the beds were very comfortable. And turn down service was very nice and they always came with a special treat: Home-made chocolate and water.  The bathroom was roomy, the showers were awesome, and the amenities included with the bathroom were excellent. The hotel in general was clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. All the staff would made sure to acknowledge you and greet you, even my 4 year old, which was nice to see because old southern charm is still alive in the south. Overall, I would give the French Quarter Inn FIVE stars for their excellent service and wonderful amenities. I was so impressed with this establishment, I plan to return once the baby is a few months old, but my goal is to stay at their sister hotel in the fall: The Harbor View Inn.Thank you for reading my review and recommendations.Our honeymoon was wonderful and this hotel is out of this world! Everyone was so nice and always available to help. I will say that my husband and I are in our early 40's and were the youngest people staying here. This is more of an elegant, quiet hotel if that's what your looking for :)Was here in June 2015. One of the best hotels I had stayed in. Was in balcony room on third floor. Service and attentiveness to detail were great.  Room was fantastic. Bed was super comfortable and shower had awesome pressure. Location was perfect right in middle of old Charleston. Only thing I might improve is quality of the breakfast.  Would definitely come back if I returned to Charleston.This place is amazing!! The staff are very friendly and are their for your best experience-This is what customer service should be. Wished we could stay longer. The front staff were professional and smart, and helpful.  Glori took care of us making sure we enjoyed our stay. Wel loved this hotel and we will be back. Thank you so much for making our short trip special. Such nice staff.  Thank youThis is one of the best hotels anywhere.  It has a perfect location.  The rooms are lovely.  The new bathrooms are large with plenty of storage.Michelle and Scott went out of their way to accommodate us wh en we requested a larger room facing the street.Don't even think of staying anywhere else.Top quality all around. Excellent service. So many places could learn a few things from the service and attention to detail here. Expensive but worth it. Don't forget there is no pool.Stayed twice here now.  Absolutely love it!  The service is top notch.  A hotel that you simply enjoy all that it has to offer.  Great quaint seating areas to enjoy all their specialty services, such as wine and cheese or evening cookies and milk.  Wonderful patios.  Turn down service with treats!  Gorgeous hotel in the heart of Charleston within walking distance to everything!  Our favorite hotel world-wide hands down!I won't get into detail but this place is top shelf.  No reason to stay anywhere else.Everything is the way it should be and you will have a great stay.We look forward to our next trip.The only place to stay at in Charleston if you're looking for a luxury hotel.The service is amazing. Champagne on arrival. Wine and cheese every night. Cookie and milk at night time. Breakfast included every morning. The rooms are elegant and bathrooms updated. Service from check in to checkout flawless. I've stayed at Charleston Place which is also a nice hotel. The FQI is on another level. comparable or better than ritz and four seasons. If you go to Charleston and want a nice hotel stay here.Stayed here for the second half of my Charleston trip and loved the service here. The staff went above and beyond with their customer service. The front desk always referenced me by my name and the wine/cheese servers remembered my wine preference and would fill up my glass without being asked. I also go upgraded to a suite room overlooking the market. The hibiscus water in the lobby was so refreshing after walking outside and the jelly beans were a cute touch. It was a wonderful experience and would recommend it to anyone looking for an intimate hotel.I have never been so taken care of at a hotel. The staff gave impeccable service, even sending two women in at once to clean the room and turndown the beds in record time. The amenities provided are just delightful - champagne and lady fingers upon arrival, Wine and cheese before dinner time, cookies and milk later in the evening, and coffee and tea whenever you want it. Everyone on staff was so friendly and really seemed to genuinely care about each customer. And we were given an upgrade to our room, which was so lovely with a colonial French decor. I highly highly recommend this hotel. It is worth every extra penny.
review_content_20: It is always the details that make a place like French Quarter Inn excellent. I was a bit skeptical, and I didn't keep my hopes up before arrival. I've stayed at many supposedly great hotels and got dissapointed more times than I can remember. Maybe it was my low-set expectations or the great service (actually great everything!) at French Quarter Inn that made our trip to Charleston excellent. Hotel doesn't look "grand" from outside. However the interior is fresh and clean. You can see the Southern influence in the decor , but it is not overwhelming by any means. The check-in was smooth. We were upgraded to a room with a terrace overlooking the market and offered a glass of champagne (just like everyone else). Our room was quite big. Again, we were upgraded, so I think we got one of the bigger rooms in the hotel. I usually don't care much about the size or decor since I am not even there most of the day, however it was great to know that we were going to come back to a great room after walking around all day long.Breakfast is complementary. They can even bring it to your room w/o any additional charge. We thought we would utilize the nice terrace just for that purpose. They have everything you can ask for: eggs, salmon, bagels, pastries, etc. You won't need to go outside for breakfast.As most other reviews have already mentioned, there are drinks and snacks in the lobby area throughout the day. We didn't attend the wine and cheese reception, however we definitely utilized the homemade lemonade and iced tea.What I really liked about FQI and the main reason I will be back is the great staff. Even if you are not feeling good for some reason, they will make you smile. You can stay at a great hotel with rude staff, and you probably won't be back. You can stay at a mediocre hotel with good staff. You may not stay there again, but you won't regret your decision. You can stay at FQI where you will get great service in an amazing setting, you will be back for sure.There is simply no better place to stay in Charleston.  We have tried other hotels but now just automatically book a room here because we are never disappointed. From the champagne welcome at the desk, to nightly wine and cheese, immaculately appointed and clean rooms, robes, turn-down service, great breakfast, and friendly bell staff, you can't go wrong.  Can't wait till the next visit!We stayed at the French Quarter Inn for our 30th wedding anniversary and were 100% pleased.  From the moment we arrived, we were met with wonderful hospitality.  Check in was a breeze, our room was beautifully appointed.  The balcony had a lovely view of the bridge.  We were gifted with delicious chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of Proseco.  The valet was as pleasant and helpful as can be.  Delicious nightcap along with fresh-baked cookies closed a beautiful evening.  We highly recommend it and would go back next time we visit the area.  A truly terrific experience.I never understood how someone could live in a hotel for any extended period of time.After spending several days at the French Quarter Inn, not only did I completely understand the draw and desire, we were ready to move in.Exceptional service  from manager to front desk to maids to valets with rooms that are amazing.From the different snack services throughout the day to the coffee and tea service on every floor to the turn down service, your little belly will never be without a friend.Seriously, we loved the FQI so much that, if wasn't available, we'd change our travel so we could stay there again.We absolutely could not imagine a better hotel for us!  We love high quality and hate stuffy and pretentious.  FQI is highest quality and truly exceptional, but not stuffy at all!  I can't praise the staff enough, from front door to maid service.  I now that I an gushing, but this hotel is really that exceptional!  Yes, it is expensive, but it has value to match and exceed the cost!  We look forward to our next visit.We can't wait to go back and stay at the French Quarter Inn again!  This hotel is phenomenal and the staff gets 5 stars!  We were greeted by a friendly front desk staff who offered us a glass of champagne upon arrival. After our car was valet parked, our bags were brought to our room for us. We took advantage of the pillow concierge and had luxury pillows brought to the room. It is an exceptionally clean hotel as well. The bathrooms are very large and the shower is large enough for more than one. :) The breakfast is complimentary and has croissants, cheese, fruits, bagels, coffee, juices, and of course, champagne. We will most definitely go back. We booked through Hotel Tonight, so our room that originally cost $319 per night was only $199. What a great deal!!Full disclosure:  we did not stay here.  Instead, we got caught in a storm today and the carhop downstairs was really sweet and conversational while we waited for a dry moment to duck out.  30 minutes later, when we realized there wasn't going to happen any time soon, we went inside to find a gift shop where we hoped to find an umbrella to purchase.  The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and stately, but the key here is the service.  Knowing we weren't staying at the hotel, the concierge gave us two complimentary umbrellas and offered to lend me her rain boots, simply asking that we drop them off when we were finished.  How sweet!  True Southern hospitality, and I know where we are staying next time we visit Charleston...Stayed for 3 days in April 2014. Location great. Accommodations very nice. But the sales pitch on web site makes this Inn out to be a four star hotel which it is not. Service is what segregates the good from the great. The champagne upon check in? Front desk forgot, we had to ask for it. We changed rooms after first day as scheduled (availability issue, nothing to do with Inn) and were told they would call when new room ready. Never received call. This is not the service of a four star hotel. There are several other apparently comparable hotels in same area in historic downtown area. Suggest you look at price. We paid almost $500 per night for the larger patio room. Oh, TV not high def.The Hotel is very classy. We had a very good experience. My husband and I flew in from NY for our son's Navy nuclear power school graduation.  The hotel is clean and very friendly.  Loved all the special treats like the great buffet breakfast and the champagne for Mimosas every morning. Also, the champagne at check-in, and the wine and cheese in the afternoon.  All the employees that we came in contact with were pleasant, friendly and professional. They seemed to really care about making our stay special.  The manager Scott helped us out by getting us special reservations at one of Charleston's best restaurants. (we were remiss in not placing reservations in advance). Scott was available every day and would make a point to seek us out to see how we were enjoying our stay.  The valet car parkers were genuinely concerned for our well being and always offered good suggestions.  I especially liked the breakfast server I think her name was Cindy. When  I mentioned that the hot water was not as hot as I usually like it for tea she went back and brought a carafe of boiling hot water.  This is how a hotel should operate. The big name hotels should operate like The French Quarter.Outstanding!  Wonderful hotel in every sense.  Location - fabulous.  right on the market, walk to everywhereHotel - the happy, friendly staff really made my stay wonderful.  Every member offered assistance (w/o asking), jumped right in when asked and couldn't have been any more hospitable.  From the front desk, housekeeper, bellmen, servers - everyone.  My family stayed recently for a reunion type weekend.  We had @ 10-15 rooms.  All of my guests said the same thing.  Love, love this hotel.  The rooms & bathrooms are nice too,  Comfy beds. Every aspect of the hotel and more importantly its staff are exceptional.  Definite stay in Charleston.I can't say enough wonderful things about French Quarter Inn. The staff is friendly, the facilities are charming, the rooms are very comfortable, and the little extras they offer really make a difference. The Inn is located in the heart of Historic Charleston and is a short walk to some of the best restaurants and historic homes and museums. My family and I stayed at the Inn for 3 nights in July 2013 which was just the right amount of time for what we wanted to see and do in the Charleston area. The room had two really comfy queen beds which was great after having stayed at earlier hotels in Washington, D.C. and North Carolina which only had double beds. The free WiFi was a nice plus as well.Every morning, we awoke to a wonderful breakfast downstairs where we could choose to eat indoors or outdoors on the patio (we also had the option of having breakfast brought up to our room). We could choose from organic Greek yogurt with fresh fruits, an assortment of very good breads and pastries (not the dry and processed-tasting types that you get at lower-end hotels), warm quiches, lots of fruits and delicious juices (my favorite was the grapefruit juice which is saying a lot because I normally don't like grapefruit juice). When we would return to the hotel in the middle of the day, we'd re-energize with the coffee, tea, lavender lemonade, and "detox water" that's available 24/7 as well as the endless supply of M&M's and Jelly Belly's. Every night, there was warm, homemade cookies and milk to help us slumber that much better. Although the Inn was undergoing construction (remodeling the bathrooms), we weren't bothered or inconvenienced by the work. The staff would great about leaving us letters in our room with information about the construction work that day that may impact us. I have no reservations in recommending that you stay at French Quarter Inn.Absolutely adore this hotel from the charming and gracious staff to the delicious food. The breakfasts, wine and cheese reception and cookies and milk are enough food for the whole day......but of course we didn't stop there, there's too much good food in Charleston. It's in a great location by the Market, King Street and Museum Mile. Would definitely come back on our next visit.   Oh.....and the glass of champagne upon check-in and the free bicycle rental.....lovely touches you don't find many places!!!!freebies all day long, staff was great. we got in room massages too! Would definitely go back, location was perfect.Oh man, this place is fantastic!I came to Charleston to attend a wedding with my parents and my dad picked French Quarter Inn for our two night stay. The hotel itself is very beautiful and clean. There are only 3 or 4 floors in the entire building, so it feels a little more quaint that most hotels. It's also in a walkable area, so you don't have to worry about getting your car from the valet.One thing I really enjoyed about French Quarter Inn was all the amenities offered to guests. When you check in they offer you a glass of champagne (I'm definitely a fan of this!). In the early evening they have wine and cheese and later in the evening they offer milk and cookies. Coffee, tea and lemonade are always available in lobby and there is coffee and tea available on each floor from 6am to 10pm (I believe).Everyone from the front desk to the valet to the maids were very friendly. The atmosphere here is great and I would gladly stay here again!We check in early so our rooms were not ready.  But Jennie was great and assured us our rooms would be ready by three and they were.  She was very personable, remembered our names and gave us a great dinner suggestion after we told here where we had made reservations for our 3 day trip.The hotel is in the historic district about two blocks from the water but it is centrally located.Upon check in they give you a glass of champagne.Our room at 250.00 per night was large.
