His charming and informative stories and southern history tales brought 1700-1800's Charleston alive.  She also recommended some fine restaurants and kindly booked them for us. And, handed us direction cards for each suggestion, including a visit to the famous 1200 year old Angel Oak tree on James island.  Prior to leaving she also provided self guided walking tour maps for Savannah and Beaufort which were helpful given we were headed to Hilton Head. Plus, she suggested a stop at Shelton cathedral ruins en route too.  The room we had was specious, clean, we'll appointed, and quiet.  Only complaint was upon our arrival the checkin clerk was sick and coughing and not very pleasant. However, Andrea the conserve more than made up for that. One other aside is that it is unfortunate that this Courtyard Marriott doesn't offer a complimentary breakfast even for elite level club members.I was completely impressed with the customer service of the Marriott Courtyard staff, and especially Kevin in concierge.  He was so helpful in assisting us map out our few days in town, even making reservations at restaurants on a very busy weekend!  It's so enjoyable to see someone enthusiastic about their job, and to do it so well.  He definitely made our trip more enjoyable, and productive.Not the newest Courtyard ever but nice and clean. Lobby and common areas have new Courtyard upgrades. Excellent location for King Street and the market area. Front desk staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Good parking rates for big city and all the Courtyard amenities which the kids love. I would recommend especially for a nice family trip.I have only positive things to say about this place. The staff is SO friendly and accommodating! The hotel itself is newly renovated, clean and in a great location. I look forward to staying here again the next time I'm in Chucktown.A perfectly nice little three star hotel in the historic district of downtown charleston. I was able to get a great rate on priceline, the hotel included free internet, and the parking wasn't too exorbitant. The rooms were clean and large, the staff were friendly, and it was all around a good experience.  I'd happily stay here again.Awesome hotel! Friendly staff and so clean!!!! Will stay at that hotel every time I stay in Charleston!  Free wifi!!!I've stayed in several hotels in charleston. This was my favorite. We had a suite and it was spacious and the dining table was huge. Perfect for eating in our room with our small child. Everything was clean and the bed was comfortable. This was a very nice hotel for a great price.  Location is good as well, but be warned the parking is self parking, not valet and costs $16 a day. We couldn't get a spot in the garage so we had to park at the church across the street. But our room faced the lot so we could keep an eye on our car and the lot was fairly well lit. Highly recommend this place.We were surprised and very pleased that the many reviews lauding Kevin McQuade, the property's concierge are indeed accurate. Lovely newly restored hotel in a great location, and we too landed a great last-minute priceline deal. Nice warm pool and exceptionally friendly staff.Better to stay at the nearby (and beautiful) Embassy Suites or even the attractive Hampton Inn both of which are a short walk away. Both offer free breakfast and classic surroundings.

review_content: This Hampton inn location is located in the historic district of downtown charleston, conveniently located near major shopping centers of king street as well as some of the finest restaurants in the area.As all Hampton Inn's, this one serves their free breakfast between the hours of 6 and 10, they offer indoor seatings as well as outdoor ones when and if it's not too humid or rainy.Rooms are always clean but they need a major remodeling as some of the furniture in the rooms are a bit old school.My favorite part is their nice size outdoors swimming pool, a good place to unwind after a long day of work.We enjoyed our weekend stay.  The kids loved going down for breakfast in the morning.  Room was clean and comfortable, if small.  The hotel readily provided us with a pack n play, babysitter referral and pizza menus when asked.  The vending machine on our floor took credit cards. I did not notice any mildew or cigarette smells as others have noted.  I would definitely stay here again.I really enjoyed staying here and I felt more and more at home each day. Breakfast is rather shit but has good variety. Rooms are also kinda small. But they have free coffee 24/7 and the staff is always friendly and helpful. Gym is nicer than average (with a cable rack). My boss will definitely thank this hotel for having a good business center with actual functional computers where I did some urgent emergency work. What makes this hotel really ideal is its location. it's next to the visitor center bus hub where a lot of tours and bus lines start. It's also really walkable to the maritime center where you hop on boats, and the posh French Quarter, the old market, and the residential West Side with bunch of authentic local restaurants.Great location - and you'll pay for it. At $300 a night with a discounted wedding party rate, you will be scratching your head about what you get for those bucks besides location. Mold in the shower, sheets with holes, cobwebs and otherwise lazy housekeeping services that haven't had an eye for quality over the years will leaving you wondering how Hilton hangs it's name out front. There was one person at the front desk with a line of 7-8 people deep, going through a painstakingly and obviously broken, lengthy check in process. Said her coworker "had to go do something."Great location and the $$ is right ($125+$17 for parking/city owned garage). Old and needs remodeling, noisy walls and outside traffic. The trolley stops on Meeting St allow you to leave your car in the garage. Friendly staffVery nice staff nice rooms clean lots of space plus breakfast right in the middle of the historical city lots of indoor parking however there is a $15 charge the tourist bureau is right across the street and one block to the main street. It's at Hampton Inn so you can expect something good insideWe made reservations several weeks early as we were going to zip through Charleston for one night.  We arrived around 2:00 pm and were told the room wouldn't be ready until 4:00 pm.  We went exploring the historic district and was kind of shocked to see how far the drive was to the real historic area, would not of been able to walk that and back before dark.We grabbed dinner so we didn't get back until 7:00 pm assuming that was more than enough time for our room to be ready. Managed to snag the one last parking spot (not sure where we would of been directed to if the lot was full). We were given the cards for 619 and liked the fact we were going to be up high with a good view.  Off we went dragging along our luggage in an elevator that smelled like cigarette smoke, only to find a family taking care of a baby and another child running in and out of 619.  Back to the counter we went.Frantically we were given a new room, 339.  Believe me when I say this is a hike!  Up the smoke smelling elevator again we had to jog around a dozen or more room service carts as it appeared the whole floor was being cleaned at once.  I counted off the paces from the elevator, 110 paces approximately 330-feet, longer than walking the length of an NFL football field, and passing over three dozen EMPTY rooms, dodging around the dozen carts and passing by all the cleaning staff along the way.  By the second round trip we were spent and ended up spending the entire evening sitting in the room with the peeling wallpaper in the bathroom as we didn't want to deal with any more hassle nor what we would of faced with a full parking lot.In the morning we looked but there was no hotel information at all in the room for breakfast or anything.  So we went back the football field length hike to the smoke scented elevator, down to the breakfast room where we paid almost $20 for two little muffins and a two cups of coffee.  Couldn't wait to get the heck out of this place.Three stars for location (I walked to all my destinations in charleston when I stayed here), friendly staff, decent breakfast, and multiple charging ports in the room.  Minus2 stars for noise... Hard to get quality sleep when you can hear the traffic outside and the plumbing in your neighbors bathroom.My overnight stay with my partner at the Hampton Inn was terrific! It smelled of fresh prunes and had terrific service, though the Coca-Cola machine did not work, hence my frustration. Because of the machine, this is no longer a five star hotel, but a four star one.Stayed here for an evening on a short trip with the family. The staff was really good and provided great information on some local businesses. The location was great for walking everywhere. The value was what I expected for the location. We'll probably stay here again.After a long morning of Kayaking down in Bowens Island, we were exhausted as we had to hastely wake up, pack up and move out of the Inn of Charleston, at the Air Force Base... and on top of that we hadn't planned on hitting any traffic on our way to go Kayaking. Needless to say, by the end of our 2hr morning Kayaking session we were dog tired! We desperately needed to find a place to stay, and we wanted to get cleaned up really bad, as we were very salty from our romp in the Marsh! After a bit of searching on yelp, I was about to call a very pricy B&B, but the GF said why don't you give Hampton a call (which was also on my list, but not 1st choice). So I gave them a call, and I spoke with a gentleman named Kevin. He quoted me a price that was already cheaper than what we found on Expedia, travelocity, or whatever online garbage we were looking at. And then I asked if he could offer me a Military discount, or AAA discount. And man did he ever give us a great Bargain! I without hesitation agreed to take it. He was extremely Helpful, and polite. He even gave us a better address than what was listed to put into our gps! And when we arrived, the beautiful ladies at the front desk were so polite, charming and helpful... They explained all the amenities that the hotel had to offer to include the free breakfast, and the hours of the gym, pool, and business center... and their southern twang, and beautiful southern belle apperance made my heart skip 10 beats!!!So after putting our bags away, and moving the car up to the garage I had to go check out the pool. Which was just outside the main lobby, in a very pretty, and quaint courtyard. My only complaint thus far is that the pool is fairly dirty with leaves, and pollen junk etc. I am very thrilled with this hotels location, and its close proxcimity to the king st bars. So we can have a few drinks this evening, and not have to worry about driving!Also a major plus for us was that they allowed us to check in 2 hours early. Which was fantastic, because like I said before we were very salty and yearning for a shower from our crazy Kayaking excursion in the Marsh...We have enjoyed visiting Charleston every January for the past 7 years.  We make it a point to stay at the Hampton Inn-Historic District.  The staff is great and helpful  in every way possible.  The community areas are clean, and the breakfasts are a nice way to get the morning started.  The hotel is located directly across from the Visitor Center, and the free trolleys run unitl 9 p.m.I would have given more stars if it weren't for the following: the room we stayed in the first night smelled strongly of mold/mildew.  When we complained, the room was sprayed with deodorizer and an air purifier was furnished.  The problem is not the air; the problem is moldy carpet, walls or furniture.  The air purifier did not work!!  We asked for a new room the next morning, and the staff immediately relocated us.   Let me be clear, my complaint is not with the staff - their service is great.  My complaint is that the underlying problem with that particular room needs to be addressed by replacing the smelly carpent, followed by a deep steam cleaning and drying of the room.Very comfortableOutstanding staffBreakfast goodRooms clean and comfortable beddingWould returnI was seriously underwhelmed by this hotel.  I was incredibly surprised by the smell of decades and decades of stale cigarette smoke in the lobby and rooms - I haven't encountered that in a long time at a major chain hotel.  The carpets felt damp and dirty on our feet - we wore flip flops at all times in the room.  We had to kill a cockroach in the bathroom in our first thirty seconds in the room.  The shower head was hilariously dysfunctional.  And the decor, from the '80s silk flowers in the hallway to the depressing paintings on the walls, was drab and sad, and repairs in evidence were clearly focusing more on holding the building together than on modernization.  That being said, the staff was really nice.Wonderful place to stay in historic Charleston.  Very clean and super friendly.  Offers complimentary water for you outings out.Rooms were very clean and the staff was very helpful. It was nice to have breakfast taken care off every morning so it was one less expense. You can't be the location. We were able to walk everywhere and didn't need to rent a car.Charleston is one of those places that is saturated with great places to stay. The Hampton Inn is a great place at a great price! I stayed here for a night while working in the area. The Hampton is walking distance to everything you want and nestled in the heart of Charleston. We arrived a the smell of hot chocolate chip cookies in the foyer as we checked in. The staff were gracious and accommodating to my request fo a room that is high and away from the elevators. The room was large, and yet quaint and comfy. Free wifi, and a window with a view. It can get sort of noisy with the live music so if you are there to go to bed really early, this may not be the place for you. For me, it was fine. My room was clean and bed was super comfy.The breakfast.... holy crap! If you walk away from this breakfast hungry, there is something wrong. There were lots and lots of options to choose from. Hot and cold food and drink items, and a plethora of fresh fruits to nosh on. I look forward to returning to the Hampton in Charleston, either for business or pleasure. Southern hospitality at its best!We had a really nice stay here. Family of five (including one preschoolert) on vacation exploring Charleston. Great location, literally across the street from all three free trolley stops and the visitor center.  We did walk back from the Market area once, which was a little long but very doable. The trolleys are nice to catch, and they are pretty frequent. We paid a little more for a room that had a door to the cool courtyard and pool area, which we were glad we did. Room was plenty spacious. A little older place, but very well maintained. Spacious lobby and (free) breakfast area. Breakfast, by the way, was changed up just a little every day, which was a nice touch. We even caught afternoon cookies one day. Staff that went out of their way to be friendly, often greeting us with, "Hey guys! How was your day?" Or, "Where are you off to this evening?" Generous with loaner umbrellas and bottled water, too.Just a very nice stay and reasonable rates. Cool location and atmosphere.The Hampton Inn is in a great location for walking around Charleston. And if you get tired a pedi-cab ride home should never cost you more than 11 bones, which is nice. Especially since walking plus carrying a baby can really tire you (me) out. AND they are right across the street from the free shuttle stops that take you around the city which is awesome if you time your leaving just right.Besides the location the rooms are pretty nice, there is a pool, and they have a decent continental breakfast, even offering "to-go" bags filled with a muffin and fruit if you're in a hurry and not going out to breakfast somewhere in the city.The downside is there is no bar for drinks and no restaurant for room service. And there are no mini-fridges for storing beers you may bring back to the room. Other than that I can't think of any complaints.You do have to pay to park in a garage as they don't have their own parking, but it's $12 for 24 hours which doesn't really seem that bad to me. All in all, it's a good place to stay in historic Charleston if you aren't looking for a cute bed and breakfast or boutique hotel experience.Being our first time staying overnight in Charleston, we wanted to make sure that the hotel we chose would be comfortable, close to shopping and dining, clean and affordable.  This hotel definitely met all of those standards.  We rented 1 room with a king size bed and pull out couch for 2 adults and 3 children (2, 4, & 10).  We were given a handicap accessible room, which was great!  The room was HUGE, the beds were pretty comfy (I hate staying in hotels bc the bed we have at home has spoiled me), there was a fridge, microwave, desk, nice large bathroom and a view of the pool from our room.  I also loved that they served a large breakfast buffet, really helped us save money on food while in the city.  The first day we were there we parked in the parking garage next to the hotel ($14/day) and didn't touch our car again until it was time to leave.  The children's museum was directly across the street, right next door was a fantastic restaurant called Coast, a gelato place and a french bakery.  Then around the corner was tons of shopping, a beautiful park where there was a market/festival set up.  It really was the PERFECT location.  The staff was great too.  When we arrived our room was not yet ready so they took our bags and locked them up in the back office so we could go grab some food.  There were always willing to offer suggestions for dining and activities.  My 2 year old hurt himself in the elevator at one point and they rushed to help us.  There was even one of the staff that baked cookies everyday at 5:30pm (which the kids LOVED).  We will definitely be back when we stay in Charleston again.
review_content_20: The absolute best choice for a very reasonably-priced hotel in the historic area. It's not incredibly fancy, like all Hampton Inns, but the historic building is loaded with charm and it's within walking distance to the Battery, lots of great restaurants and many historic sites. Charleston is consistently rated as the most polite city in the US and the staff here delivers on that reputation. The breakfast is filling and complimentary, but you may want to get there early before the vultures descend, picking it clean and taking up all the tables. The lemony ice water offered in the lobby is also refreshing in the hot humid summer weather. Yes, you have to pay for parking but considering the location it is very reasonable.First time I stayed in Charleston I came here. 100% recommend. Great spot in the city in the heart of the upper king restaurant scene. Great location, great service. I always recommend and it's reasonably priced!We stayed here during a family visit to Charleston.  Although parking was 12$ daily, and there was no option for valet, AND the fact that it is on the outskirts of the main historic district, it provided a fine stay for the price. The hotel is across the street from the visitor's center, which Is a nice feature if you are interested in taking any tours either through Charleston or to Fort Sumter.  The free trolley stops virtually at the front door, so this location is definitely nice for leaving your car and either walking or taking advantage of public transportation.  There are also some great eats nearby, with Coast Bar and Grill next door and several yummy treat shops down the street. Also, if you stay here, don't miss happy hour down the street at Joe Pasta. Their cocktails were stiff and at a great price. Regarding the hotel itself, it was fine. We stayed in a suite with a mini fridge and a microwave, which was a nice touch. Also, the complimentary breakfast each morning met our expectations and was a nice way to save a few bucks. Unfortunately, due to the weather we were unable to use the pool, but it looked very relaxing. Overall, a pleasant experience. Unless you want to splurge on a boutique hotel, this Hampton Inn offers excellent value and a pleasant stay.After staying accross the street at the Embassy Suites, this place was junk.  The room was 1/3 the size and I was lucky enough to have construction on my hallway and I had to navigate the hotel map to find my room.  The front desk made no mention at check in about the painting 2 doors down and offered no appoligies.  I am glad I spent 1 night.  Stay at the Embassy Suites right accross the street.Great location!  The room was a little small but the bathroom was a nice size.  The facility seemed new and everything was very clean.  The bed was very comfortable and their breakfast was great.  We had just checked out of the Marriott which was in great disrepair and smelled bad.  It was a pleasure to stay here.I've stayed at a lot, and I do mean a lot of Hampton Inns, but this one is the best. It has a perfect location in the heart of the historic district of Charleston. The lobby is huge, which is perfect for meeting guests, and the room I ended with, #146 is one of the largest rooms I have ever had in any hotel including those of the St. Regis and the Ritz. For a Hampton, however, it is a little on the pricey side, but worth it.We stayed here for 2 nights and chose the hotel mostly for it's excellent location. It was close to just about everything- in fact we didn't even have to take the car out at all the entire time we were there. We walked to dinners, museums, and shopped on kings street.      The hotel was clean and the room was spacious. It was a little pricey for a Hampton Inn- 149 per night. The one thing that I found unpleasant was we woke up to an army of ants crawling all over a cookie we had in a plastic container- gross! The staff quickly took care of it and sprayed- but it was still enough for me not to want to bring any leftovers back to the room. Staff was very friendly. I probably wouldn't stay here again, even though the location was wonderful.Gracious, efficient, and convenient, with a bonus of lovely grounds.  Location is terrific -- at the northern end of the historic district, and very convenient to the razzle-dazzle on King Street PLUS the tourist bureau, across the street and several of the walking-tour sites within a block or two.Arrival parking, entry and check-in are perfect; with convenient, indoor, long-term parking at $14 daily. Indoor-outdoor breakfast buffet is a step-up from routine chain motel breakfasts, but not Zagat. Roomy, pleasant lobby-slash-dining area (Why don't they offer pm bar and snacks there?).  Pool is 100% clean and very pleasant!  Concierge advice was spot-on for us. A+!Decor and furnishings in halls and rooms are somewhat generic, but not at all shabby. Our room was clean and perfect. Note: Ask for the pros and cons before booking a ground-floor, pool-side room.Another Note: Hampton's "800" reservation service reported no vacancies, but phoning the Inn directly got us the booking we sought.I have to agree with the 7 other reviewers (the good and not so good comments). The location is primo (like most real estate), the rooms 2nd and then the amenities (free breakfast and WI-FI).It is close to or have easy transportation to all the tourist type attractions. The 3 free trolley lines have stops very near by. The Visitors Center and the Children's Museum is in next block. Your are 1 walking block from King Street with lots of restaurants, shops and bars. There are at least 3 restaurants with decent ratings within "shout-in" distance, as us southerners would say. There are 5 floors and 3 modern elevators. Like another reviewer said, lumpy but nice duvet bed cover.Yes, the WI-FI download service is slow & the TV service suck. Getting a TV show on-line is not worth the effort because of buffering delays. There is no pay-for-view TV service. One Showtime channel is the only premium station (no HBO). The room has a newer digital capable flat screen TV. However, all the channels showing were analog. Seems like a waste. (I tinkered with the menu and did not find a HD channel.)  I hope they the IT person knows that we know the difference. The shows were grainy and definitely not HD quality. We should have been sight seeing but with the heat index 100+ and warnings to stay inside; we spent more time inside the hotel than planned. Okay, rant over. That is my 1 demerit item.Nice sizable, rooms. Breakfast is very adequate, saving the cost of 1 meal. The eating space & lobby is attractive. Friendly staff. Clean hotel. Nice courtyard and pool area. We'll be back........; in cooler weather next time. I hope they upgrade the TV service but it is not really a show stopper for me.The staff and location were great. The room was small and could use some serious renovations. The walls are thin. If you are expecting to has wifi in your room, think again!  The signal in my 4th floor room was nonexistent. We could hear the people in the adjacent room watching television and talking. I certainly didn't enjoy my cold shower on Sunday morning. The next time I am in town, I'll stay somewhere else.The hotel is well located... There are great restaurants and shops within a comfortable walking distance. Their prices are high for what you get, though. We were greeted with a roach in our bathroom climbing on our toiletries. They ultimately comped our night in the room and moved us the next day which my wife really appreciated. However, the room we were moved to was dark, didn't have a fridge like our first room and ultimately not as nice as the first one. Parking is $14.00 day in the adjacent garage but that's par for the course in Charleston, parking is an issue all over the city. The breakfast was not good and suggest you look elsewhere. There is a market close by on Saturday mornings in the summer that has great food vendors among other things.The Hampton is definitely a little pricey compared to some of your other options around, but there are a few advantages to staying here.Pros:-Right in the middle of the city; walking distance from a bunch of cool things-Once parked, you probably won't need to move-Clean rooms, plenty of towels-Comfortable beds-SUPER nice staff. No joke-Free WIFI-Complimentary breakfastCons:-Parking is $12 for up to 24 hours. This is a separate garage right next to the Hampton. -A floor of non-smoking rooms are still getting 'aired out'. A small reference to the non-smoking rooms - we were initially placed in one which reeked of smoke, but were switched without hassle. The room we ended up staying in still had a slight hint of leftover smoke, but will probably dissipate with time.I wasn't a fan of most the items at the complimentary breakfast. While plentiful, I felt the quality was lacking. However, I can't complain about the overall quality of my stay, which I must admit was very enjoyable.Tip: When you get to the hotel, just park in the small lot outside the lobby, check-in, bring all your stuff into your room, then park in the garage. It'll make your life easier.Our reservations were lost, but the hotel was very nice. It was walking distance to everything, which was great. Parking is extra, but that is the case for all the hotels downtown.One of the surprises for me regarding Charleston was just how high the hotel prices are. This Hampton Inn was one of the lower priced options near the Historic District and...it was great. A block off King Street, lots of easy access to fantastic restaurants. Very close to Rhett Aikens house, right next to the very charming Charleston museum. Hotel was clean, we lucked out with the quiet factor, staff was very friendly and helpful.  We had a small issue in that they had switched over from air to heat but it was a 80 degree day. Maintenance was there within minutes of our call to switch our room back. Would stay at again if I'm back in the area.When a group of ladies from out of town roll in with 3 bellhop cart fulls of items, with 1 of them being completely full of alcohol, it is the TRUE test of a hotel, service and amenities.Being in town for a bachelorette party, we chose the Hampton Inn Historic since it honored Hilton Rewards and was centrally located to all the hot spots we wanted to hit (O-Ku, Chai's Loungue, Club Pantheon @ night, The Market & King St during the day).Upon early check in, we had a super sweet bellhop who seemed to really enjoy his job - and that makes such a difference! The room was nice and cool upon entry, spacious enough for a group of 4, with a clean bathroom (with granite!) and a courtyard view.Throughout our 3 day stay, the staff and front desk staff were always on call, pleasant and attempted to fufill our every wish: do you have a cd player we could borrow? sorry, no. can we have 6 extra towels, 4 extra pillows, 4 sets of toilettries and 3 toothbrushes? yes! and delivered within 5 minutes. We didn't eat much breakfast but upon leaving we tried it and it was good - turkey sausage, lots of cereal and yogurt options, and a self-serve waffle maker which we all enjoyed fiddling with :) Of course, the true mark of a great hotel is what happened when we left 4 evening dresses in the closet - they overnighted them to us (thought we did pay for it!) and was very easy to deal with.Overall, a great location, nice hotel, good staff and the parking wasn't stupidly expensive ($12). I'd definitely come back again!This hotel was prime location to farmer's market, king street, trolly stop, great restaurants- couldn't be better!  The room was so clean and designed with quality.  Breakfast was a great spread- staff was so pleasant and helpful!  Truly enjoyed this stay- the only thing I would foreworn about is the parking which is not managed by the hotel but by the city- very rude, mistrusting, and I was inconvenienced upon departure by a mistake on their record keeping.  Parking is $14/nt for hotel guests but honestly if you have an opportunity, bring your vehicle elsewhere, I hate to support places that lack customer service.  No reflection on the hotel though- they were top notch!We got the best room in the house, top floor corner room! Very pleased with the staff, they were extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was decent and the bed was soooo comfortable!In the typical Hampton Inn fashion, this hotel was very good. The rooms were clean, the hotel was clean, and the staff was friendly and helpful. Of course, you can't beat the free wi-fi and the free breakfast! In fact, the breakfast at this Hampton Inn was much better then ones I have stayed in before. Also, this hotel did not have the extremely loud and annoying window air conditioning unit. But the hotel wasn't perfect. The TV in the room runs off of DirectTV. This is normally okay, but when heavy clouds or rain comes in, forget about watching TV, the signal drops. And to make matters worse, there was a large thunderstorm while staying at the hotel. The building was struck by lighting followed by a large power surge. Then the fire alarms went off. Luckily, the power surge had caused them to trigger and not a fire.Perfectly serviceable and well located hotel.  The sheets and linens could be updated a bit but that is my only really negative.  And even that...for most hotels of Hampton Inn level these would be about the same, the thing is that especially when Charleston has an event, hotel prices go through the roof--so for a Hampton in, everything was fine. for the price they charged I'd expect a little more.Free coffee and breakfast, and free internet, that is a good deal, though!And a very good location.Great service, Great hotel and the staff is the best! Great area with access to museums and restaurant/bars.
review_content_40: Great place to stay for a reasonable price and location in the heart of the historic district of Charleston. A few blocks from all the restaurants and shops- easy to walk to because parking can get expensive. There is no private parking on premises but a city owned lot next to it--- $14.00 a day to park- pretty steep so keep that in mind when you are pricing out your rooms per day. But overall worth it in comparison to other hotels in the area that jack up the prices for the rooms but give you free parking. Nice hotel, clean rooms with fluffy pillows and of course--- free breakfast.Awesome value. Perfect location. Friendliest southern hospitality. Clean rooms. Comfy beds. Abundant breakfast included. Great rates.Stay at Hampton for the wonderful service! The employees treat you like you're staying at the Ritz. The staff are absolutely wonderful, professional and very friendly. There's a lot of singing and laughter that gone on here. The rooms are comfy and a little small and noisy on the first floor. But no one complained when we requested a room change or a late check out. The amenities include breakfast and free internet (FREE! Some higher-end hotels don't even included free internet) HIHD is also very close to shopping, nightlife and public transportation. It was in walking distance of art galleries, rows of antiques stores, clothing stores and trendy restaurants.Hotel is great for walking to all of the things Charleston has to offer. Its a bit on the outskirts, but still very close to city center. King Street is close. The best part is the pool and its court yard. The staff was friendly, and upgraded us to a king suite over looking the pool, which was fantastic because it also had a walk out to the pool. (Only first floor rooms have direct outside access). There are lovely restaurants close by 39 Rue de Jean is right around the corner and offers an excellent French Cuisine.Rooms were very clean but had standing water in the shower...everything else great!Comfortable beds, great breakfast and wonderful location.Pros:  -Nice court yard with a pool.  -Super friendly staff.-Good location-More upscale than your usual Hampton Inn-Clean rooms-Parking garage right outside-Right next door to Coast Bar & Grill.  Great restaurant.-(For Hilton Honors members) We were able to stay here for free by using Hilton points.Cons:- A/C is noisy and runs constantly.  Typical for most hotels and an area for improvement in my opinion.  At least it was the "central air" type and not the console types that go under the window.- Rooms are pretty standard.  No mini-fridge.- (not really a con) While it's situated down town, there are other more centrally located hotels (however, I can't vouch for their quality).  Expect a brisk walk to get to "hot spots" in town.  It's still right off King street so there's plenty of stuff around.  - Breakfast is rather cheap/usual.  Faux eggs and juices, yogurts, cereal, fruit.  Hey, it's free.  No complaints really.  -Parking deck is $12 per day.  Seems steep but it is convenient and still probably cheaper overall.  Getting out of it is a little bit of nuisance since they have to check your ticket, have you pay, and reissue a new ticket each day.  If there are a couple cars in front of you expect to wait about 15 minutes.The staff took great care of us, after an amusing start finding the room they had assigned was already occupied (not their fault - a guest had stayed past his booking and not advised anyone.) Comfortable room, good choices for breakfast and staff that were right on top of any request.  Being across from the main stop for the free shuttles meant we didn't miss a car and didn't need many taxis. The restaurants close by were terrific, and when we wanted to reserve for dinner the hotel took care of us.  At the end, we had a taxi driver try to over-charge us - Brandon, the manager was all over that, making calls and generally raising hell.  I would recommend this to anyone wanting to see Charleston without a car.updating my rating to a little better because it has a great free breakfast--very impressed.  Internet slooooow, room smells like paint, overall it LOOKS ok-to-nice...it's clean, my room is yellowed white with pleasant, typical decore--has a pool, nice people working here.  But the bed duvets have this seriously strange lumpyness to them (under covers the beds are comfy, but on top of duvet it feels like a little like finding a comfortable spot on a camels back).  There is no free parking.  Did I mention it smells like fresh paint in my room?  I'm going to stay here and pay the expense because i'm like "whatever" about it, but it's not impressive in a good way...You know, the hotel is OK - big, clean rooms, free wifi, and has a great location. But what's wonderful about this hotel is the staff.  The staff went above and beyond helping us with directions, taxis, and what to do about our lost luggage. What a great staff...Best Hampton Inn I've stayed in. It's in a beautiful historic building and has the beautiful, original hardwood floors. Rooms looked recently renovated and were very clean. Bigger bathrooms than most Hamptons. Great pool in a nice courtyard and fitness center is nice too. The staff is very friendly and they went above and beyond to make our stay more enjoyable. The hotel is also Very conveniently located in downtown, It backs up to King Street.I usually always stay at Hampton Inn's because of the clean rooms, free breakfast and free WiFi. This hotel had all those amenities plus extremely friendly staff, & a door bell hop who was very helpful. Was very close to lots of shops & restaurants AND the Charleston visitor center was right across the street so anything you need to know about the city was there. It has a parking deck attached to it which was great but it costs $14 per day(can come & go as you please) and some of the staff at the garage entrance are extremely rude. I reported the rudeness to hotel staff & was told that the garage is owned by the city & they would report the incident...so I'm not holding the rudeness against the hotel. The garage is safe, well lit and once parked you can pretty much walk to anything. The only thing I would complain about is the elevators...EXTREMELY HOT & SLOW. If you can..take the stairs.

review_content: 'Ello chaps!Holiday Inn Charleston - Riverview is well situated along the Ashley River on the edge of downtown Charleston. It's location makes it easy to get to downtown or wherever in the area you may need to get to. The hotel, iconic and well known in the area, is in good shape overall. It seemed to be well maintained and modern. You have got to also love the views offered by this hotel of downtown.In town for a conference and it had potential being a water view hotel. Overall the footprint and thus floors are small. The entire building is columnar, including the lobby. The rooms are wedges and are appointed consistent with the star rating and price point. Everything worked and there were no glaring areas of repair needed.Room service was timely, decently priced and made as ordered. Interestingly the next day housekeeping left the old tray and plates. Had to put them outside before they were collected. The view will vary on where you are on the circle. I was looking to the north over the city and river. Not a bad view, but he balcony door is permanently bolted shut so points lost there. The in and out getting to the parking lot from the main road is a little like a NASCAR pit stop and you need to be careful getting out onto the main road as traffic is approaching at a good clip and there's limited visibility around the corners.Overall 3/5, would probably try somewhere different next time but no overt reason Not to chose this locale of the price is right that night.We stayed at the Holiday Inn Charleston-Riverview for a friend's wedding. They were offering her a group rate of $159 a night. I had booked it before the deadline for the group. When I was finalizing plans and looking up the address, I just did a quick search for the nights we were staying. I realized that it was $70 cheaper than what they were charging me with the group rate. I called and they had to cancel my reservation and not guarantee I would be with the group - but I said I didn't care. I feel like it's bad business to give a wedding group that's bringing A LARGE GROUP OF MULTIPLE rooms to your business a rate that's higher than what they could book outside the group. The weekend we stayed we never had a room key. They said that the Waffle House next door had fried their key machine. All weekend long we had to be let into our rooms. However, they had no system in place. I was staying on the 12th floor. On more than one occasion I was waiting 5 minutes or more for someone to let me into my room. Meanwhile, more guest would arrive and need to be let in as well. We would all pile into the elevator and rather than being let into my room first because I was waiting the longest - we would stop at the lowest floor. At one point I had to wait for 3 or 4 other guest to be let into their rooms who arrived AFTER me. They also were not checking IDs with any kind of guest list. I overheard one more than one occasion someone calling the front desk because they had opened the wrong room. I can be understanding of circumstances out of their control with the key machine but you need to have a system in place for that situation. The bathroom consisted of a toilet and tub/shower in one room and the sink out connected to the rest of the room. The toilet/shower room had no ventilation which made it awful inside the bathroom after anyone showered. Overall, I wasn't impressed with my stay at this Holiday Inn location. I am sure my friend who was getting married would have chosen a different location if she had known all of this. Others who are considering blocking off this hotel for guest if you're getting married - I would suggest finding another hotel!I stayed here for a cross country trip and would usually never stay at a place like this. Here's what went wrong:- my room smelled like urine- bed bugs (I cried)- the pool gate was literally held together by zip ties- the vending machine didn't work after I put money in it- you can't even open the door to the balcony because it's nailed shut and has danger signs posted all over it. So if you were considering this place because of the view DONT- the rooms are tiny and triangular- dirtyI stayed here 3 nights a week for 15 weeks while working in Charleston.  Very clean hotel and the staff is very friendly and helpful.  There are a few negatives of this hotel. They do not serve a continental breakfast and the pool is about the size of a hot tub.  All said and done this hotel was just a place for me to lay my head at night and the fact that it was clean with good service was all I needed.Very nice stay. Was there between 30-May & 05-June 2015The staff were friendly and informative. The very top 14th floor is where the restaurant is located, good food , on the expensive side, but the buffet was comped. Will be back.I have stayed here twice before and decided I would have my guests stay here. I spoke with Tammy the manager and she was extremely rude. She didn't find a reason to give a discount to 20 people. Must of had a bad day but she lost a huge amount of customers. Keep the quality of hospitality going in Charleston and find a different hotel. Hopefully they will find a better staff.Best view in charleston! We love this place. You can't find a better view of downtown. We like sitting in the bar area. One of the best burgers in town. Salad is great as well it is a nice spring mix and isn't loaded down with cheap iceberg lettuce. Happy hour from 4-7pm Monday - Saturday. Bartender & server were fantastic.Horrifying!!! Generally old, rundown hotel. Great views but that won't make up for the state of disrepair that this hotel is in. I would best describe it as a project in a ghetto. We didn't even dare sleep under the covers. Just awful. Spend a few extra dollars and go anywhere else!!!!! Btw - had to give it a star to post this. Otherwise there would not be a star on this review.We stayed at the Holiday Inn Riverview for the weekend and we had a fantastic time! Check in was easy, the room was clean and the employees were so nice. On Friday night we came into the restaurant looking for desert five minutes before it was time to close. The manager was very kind and let us order desert. Our waitress Josephine was so polite and on point with getting us served and even worked 30 minutes over to serve us and did not seemed bothered by it at all. The view from the restaurant is amazing! We would stay here again and again...also, the drive to the beach is so easy and to Charleston was about a 10 minute drive! Great location!I'm a very experienced Road Warrior and I spent a week here.  I know my hotels and after a week I know this one quite well.* This property is over 40 years old and therefore somewhat dated but it is well maintained.* The views from the rooftop bar/restaurant are absolutely stunning and probably the biggest asset here.  The bar drinks are reasonably priced and the staff is friendly.  The happy hour food specials are way above average.  The restaurant menu is typical basic American but the quality is a notch better than most.* Most properties of this caliber have an indoor pool and/or Jacuzzi or hot tub.  This property has and outdoor pool only and it's closed for the winter months.  This could be a deal breaker for some folks.* The $10 breakfast buffet is solid and one again the views are take-your-breath-away amazing!* It's a very easy drive into town and they also have a free very convenient shuttle.The pool is not a big deal for me so I'm going to go 4 stars for my experience.  If you are a pool aficionado I can understand how you might say 3.It was very difficult finding a reasonable priced hotel in the Charleston area. We chose this hotel specifically for the free shuttle and the pretty view of the water. However, the shuttle was pretty annoying due to the fact that the bus ran every couple hours, and by the time you showed up for the bus (which holds about 12 people) there was a crowd already waiting. There is no formal line so people would just crowd in to get on the bus. I really think they need to have a formal line or give numbers to people waiting for the bus. I was disappointed that this hotel didn't provide continental breakfast either. Most Holiday Inn's do provide Continental Breakfast. The beds were really soft, too soft. And I am usually not a complainer....so this bed was so soft I had to sleep on top of pillows to give me that lift! We spent 4 nights in Charleston, I definetly would have cut it down to 2 nights. I was expecting the city to be much more larger and charm.Great convenient location to Downtown Charleston without downtown pricing...free parking...outdoor pool.  Complimentary shuttle services available to downtown.Very cordial staff here,  I've stayed here before in one of the renovated king rooms facing the Charleston harbor and downtown.  Have dined in the rooftop restaurant many times over the years for breakfast, lunch, and dinner including holidays and have never had a bad meal.  I like sitting by the window and enjoying the great view of the water.  Only downside was room windows not as soundproof as up in the restaurant ?Enjoyed an appetizer and drinks there this past weekend.  I chose  the crabmeat and crackers.  There was plenty for two people with crabmeat left over.  Took a few bites of my boyfriend's cheeseburger which was excellent.   The crabmeat was mixed in shredded cheese and not sure what dressing mixture was holding the two together.I liked it and the two kinds of ample amount of crackers served with it, but it was not quite over the top . Found myself desiring a bit of dillweed or perhaps paprika and maybe a few drops of lemon to mix it with.   Guess I could have asked, but decided to just add salt/pepper and was almost totally satisfied.  Pleasant evening without a noisy crowd, will definitely keep coming back.Clean, great view, got a cheaper rate by calling hotel directly, upgraded us as we checked in - maybe because it was a 1 night weeknight stay.Brought back memories.  I used to bring my daughters there at night for virgin daiquiris.  They loved it and it had a great view. I was there for a luncheon with a buffet.  I was amazed that it really hadn't changed in the 10 years I have not been there.  The buffet was pretty darn good.  Fried Chicken and Carved Roast Beast.  Good selection of salad fixins as well.  And still a fantastic view.  It always seems strange to me the lack of business it does and that is why I am sure that the luncheon was able to go there.  I still love the view, location, and heck, decent food.  Glad they are still around.  Might bring my daughters soon for non-virgin daiquiris soon!This hotel is good for saving you some money vs. the hotels downtown.  We stayed here our first night, because our hotel in the city was booked.The staff here are actually really friendly and helpful.  They are the main reason I would think about coming back here.  As far as the facilities, the rooms are in decent condition, but the walls felt pretty thin. The ice machine in the hallway kept us up all night, as well as anyone who walked past the room.If you want to save a few bucks, this place isn't bad, but if you are staying for a vacation, kick in the extra money to stay at a cool place downtown.The hotel is well located. Of the multiple Holiday Inn/Expresses in the Charleston area, this is the one on Savannah Highway just over the bridge from the Historic District. It's not walkable to downtown Charleston but as a result is significantly cheaper. While I think you need a car to best explore this city as many things to see/do are outside the CBD, you don't need a car to get to the Historic District as the hotel runs a regular free shuttle. The last run, however, is 9:30 PM so it may not be late enough for some evening activities.Ridiculously good value, no reason to pay center city premium as the HI Express isn't much more walkable.Small fitness center and outdoor pool on the 3rd floor. Wasn't warm enough to use the outdoor pool but fitness center was in good condition. Only a few machines but even with hotel nearly full, was non issue. ATM in the lobby and basic brochures. Free WiFi throughout hotel and guest rooms.Top floor restaurant/bar for all meals + evening lounge and an amazing views. Breakfast was a well priced buffet at $9.99/person. Didn't take advantage of other meals. Free coffee / tea in the lobby in the mornings.ROOMS: good amount of space for two people and love that sink is outside the bathroom for ease of getting ready. Bizarre lights in that one switch controlled both spaces and no fan, led to very humid bathroom after showers. Rooms have balconies but doors are sealed so you can't access. Plenty of outlets.This hotel is not the normal Holiday Inn the rooms are tight and not as clean as normally expected for Holiday Inn but what a great view at their restaurant upstairs do not get the breakfast bar 995 spend your money elsewhere and go out for breakfast the staff are nice if you used a coupon that you get from the travel books it is only good for one nightLet's just call the hotel "retro"...at least from the exterior! I stayed here for the 2014 Cooper River Bridge Run and was pleased. Yes, it was more expensive this weekend than it's worth...but all hotels are! The room was clean, the front desk staff and housekeeping staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the bed was comfortable & soft.  Nice bar at the top, great views of the river, free shuttle downtown and free parking! Free internet. May not have all the "bells and whistles" but a good location and affordable. Recommended.So, I had the worst travel day ever. Hours of flight delays, then a cancellation, lost luggage, and having to drive three and a half hours to Charleston.That being said, this was a great hotel to have this sort of crisis in, I arrived at midnight, and the front desk staff was very kind. They collected as many toiletries as they could for me since my luggage was lost and offered to work with the airport to have it delivered.The room was clean, large, and incredibly comfortable. The bed seemed heavenly, though that could have just been how tired I was.One detractor: the showers were not made for someone of my height (5'10), so if you are taller, forget having a comfortable shower. Also, at 5:30 in the morning the water wouldn't heat and was only lukewarm.Otherwise, great stay!
review_content_20: While the hotel has a beautiful view of the river, the hotel itself is JANKY!  There was only one working elevator that was full every time we tried to get on it. In the end, we used the stairs even with all our luggage.  The rooms were very small and out dated. The bathroom shower didn't drain and left you attending in foot water. The toilet didn't flush well. Just run down and we could have spent our money someplace else.Got a decent deal on priceline for this place. I realized that I've stayed there before.  The only issue I had was the double bed that I was given for me and two kids.  the front desk offered a rollaway, so I cant be angry, its just not what I was supposed to get. Also the doors to the room don't close easily. We returned from dinner to realize the door was still actually open.  I should have double checked but it felt closed whne we left.The hotel is older, but its nice.  I had an issue getting where I needed to go as it is situated between the N and S of US 17 but you can only leave going North. Again, another quirk, but it was okay.The restaurant was nice.  The front desk provided Kids Free coupons that helped me tremendously w dinner and breakfast.  The view was fantastic and held my kids attention for both meals. Although dinner was nice, the $10 breakfast buffet was GREAT.  We ate well.My overall experience was good.  I've downtown before  and I wasnt paying what the folks at Folly wanted for one night.  This place was a good go-between. Solid.For what we paid for this hotel on orbitz, I am so pleased! I've seen this hotel countless times on my way to folly but normally we go for the day. I was extremely nervous to stay several nights as the hotel is a little old looking from the road. The rooms are clean and updated. The TV and fridge are really nice. We didn't pay for a harbor view but can see the boats coming in from our bed. I have no issue letting my 2 year old play on the floor and there's plenty of room for the packandplay in the sink/dressing area- a huge bonus since we can watch TV without disturbing the sleeping toddler. The staff is great, the location can't be beat (we want proximity to Folly, Sullivan's and all downtown), and there is free parking. For $110/night, this way exceeds my expectations.For what they charge, this place is a little too run down and dirty for that.  The staff was all very nice and polite, so they didn't lose any points there.  The carpet reeks in both of the elevators of mildew.  My room had the added amenities of a gnarly yellow fingernail clipping on one nightstand and a spot of Astroglide with a pube in it on the other nightstand, so they obviously didn't clean it well at all.  My room also did not have a mini-fridge or a microwave, pretty much standard fare these days.  Each room has a balcony, but they sealed all the patio doors to them shut "for your safety" which is fucking retarded, so if you plan on coming here despite my review bring a #2 phillips screwdriver with you so you can go on the balcony anyhow.  Not that BBJ would ever disobey a sign...The restaurant was a 2 star affair as well.  Were it not for the coupons they gave (essentially making my meals free) I wouldn't have ate there more than once.  Frozen vegetables?  I don't stoop that low when I'm cooking at home.  If you do eat here, they seem to be able to deep fry seafood well at least.  Feel like whoever owns this place is slumlording it.  Collect all the money they can when they should be spending part of the cash renovating things.Great location to downtown and a great view.  I would stay there again!!!Hotel is what you would hope to expect. Although everything is overpriced in Charleston this time of year that's not their fault. The staff has been friendly and efficient and the room is clean. No refrigerator in our room and an armoire serves as a closet.This place was a big disappointment. The value definitely was not there and was not worth the rate I paid. The hotel is run down, the wait staff upstairs in the restaurant acted like they didn't really care to be there, bad overall experience.A/C works great, free parking, good water pressure, hot water can be so so when everyone hits it. Front desk was staffed with nice friendly people. Good recommendations for dinner with directions (Marybeth).  Hotel is old as we have been coming here for over 20 years. They updated carpet, showers, sink. Not sure decided on the sink height, but unless you 6'4" it's way too high. Flat screen Samsung, HDMI so we could watch stuff off the Laptop . The king bed was one of best I've sleep on. Hotel is a circle, 360 degree view from top floor restaurant. Ice machine was down on our floor for cleaning. Nice to know that do that, but not on one of their busy weekend (really people).  It was down at least 2 days.  Restaurant for breakfast was the worse of all the places we stayed.  Almost no one in the place and the service was SO slow.  Buffet had tons of food made up ahead of time just getting cold. I have never seen eggs cooked in pile before. Like someone can't see the amount of people staying there and cook the food in smaller amounts.  While standing there to decide if I wanted any of this, the staff decided it was the short cut running everything past people trying to get there food (HINT - Walk around and stop running over your customers). Parking lot fills up and getting in and out can be a little tough and traffic can be heavy in each directions.  I don't have a problem with that and the location is easy from either direction.  For the guy who was concerned they closed the slider off so you can't stepon the little balcony.  There a reason for that, it requires major work to rip all the old balconys off and replace them.  With age they will no longer hold your weight, otherwise you could have an express ride to the ground.  Highly recommended the hotel, just eat somewhere else!Good place, friendly staff and great food/room serviceI spent one night here; approximately 8pm-9am. It was clean and well maintained and had beautiful views from every window. The staff was very friendly and helpful both at check-in and check-out. There was free wi-fi (awesome!) and there was a bar/ restaurant on the top floor that was hopping at 9pm on a weeknight. The food was decent and our waitress was super sweet- like seriously the sweetest person I've ever met. I wish there had been the typical free Holiday Inn breakfast, but they did have a buffet for $10 that had a LOT of options. We had no problems while we were there and I find myself flummoxed by some of the negative reviews. I was tempted to give it 4-5 stars purely to even out some of them. This is a great place to stay in Charleston if you have a car and can drive into the city to get closer to the action b/c it is out of the way a little. Overall this was a good place to stay, certainly more comfortable than some and I appreciated the friendly staff and the clean room.If you're not spending the bucks to stay in the cute part of Charleston, this place is fine. It's a quick drive into town. It's an old hotel, somewhat maintained. Think of it as a place to shower and sleep.TIP/COMPLAINT: Don't stay on the floor under the restaurant. The staff drags furniture across the floor after closing (2:00 am in our case) and the noise is unbearable. A call to the front desk was met with indifference and attitude. Unfortunately we had to be up at 4:00 am for the Kiawah Island Marathon. Needless to say, the lack of sleep and the stress of dealing with the front desk made for a poor experience. I won't stay here again, and will pay alot more to stay on Kiawah Island for the marathon next year. You'll be fine however if you end up here.The view is great but the hotel is old. We paid $150 a night for two double beds. The double beds were very uncomfortable for two people. The location is near downtown but too expensive for what they offer.Two stars for the staff, who were extremely friendly and attentive.  Everything else about this place left me underwhelmed, but it's a decent option if you just need a place to sleep, and don't want to stay at the more expensive hotels in town.The hotel is located in between two highways.  It's a quick (5-minute), easy drive into Charleston - but the drive back to the hotel is easily 20-30 minutes at rush hour.  The "exit ramps" are very short, so when traffic is moving, getting out of the parking lot is nerve-racking.The room itself was neat and clean, but I was kept awake at night by the sound of traffic and wind (the building is round!).  Although the window/balcony is permanently sealed shut, it was very drafty - and therefore impossible to regulate the temperature inside the room.  Sitting at the desk, I was freezing.  Sitting in bed, sweltering.  The heater kept cycling on and off, which only added to the noise - so I finally just bundled up, and switched the heater to "fan only" to create some white noise.On a more positive note, breakfast at the restaurant was good, the view was ok, and the (ridiculously slow) wifi was, mercifully, free.This is just a review for the view from this place! Going to the top floor and having a wonderful lookout over the bay is well worth it. It's a great excuse to get a drink or a bite to eat, just to look at the view. Parking is easy and the crowd is... interesting.This hotel has a great location, off a major highway connected to downtown. The view is beautiful, and the hotel is gorgeous from the outside. With that said, the experience was poor for the amount of money you pay. I usually leave the room after maid service arrives because it takes a while to get my children ready for the day. If you are present when they arrive, maid service is supposed to return later to service your room. They didn't come, and we were left with a pile of garbage and wet towels.Our bedsheets were damp. The bath tub stopped didn't work. I purchased some bath salts from a local store but was disappointed we couldn't use them. The exercise room is tiny, and the pool meager. The wi-fi sucked, and the speeds were slower than the Sleep Inn in Beaufort. Overall, the amenities were reflective of a two star hotel.The management was incompetent, and they didn't have enough carts to load luggage when we checked out. I told them my complaints when I left, and at least they gave my family a complementary breakfast, which was decent but nothing special.You can get so much better for the money.  I received better at a Sleep Inn for half the price.First of all, the only good thing about this hotel is it's staff. They were extremely helpful and pleasant. Now for the rest of it. The tv guide didn't work. The channel selection is awful. You can't go out onto the balcony (even though that's part of the reason we booked the hotel). We bought the king bed with skyline view and got put on the 4th floor, so we had a great view of our parking lot. Unbelievable. Next, the rooftop bar that we were excited to see closed at midnight on a Friday! What bar closes at midnight on a Friday night? We had a rehearsal dinner that night and by the time we got back to the hotel, the bar and lounge was closed. I was woken up numerous times throughout the night by people slamming their doors shut, although even I couldn't close it without it slamming like that. Also, I wrote this review on the actual website and it doesn't show up, despite it being approved. How convenient. I'm telling you, for the price you pay for this hotel, stay somewhere else.Decided to take a break from work and plan a nice weekend getaway to Charleston. Upon Arrival it was clean and pleasant, Up the elevator and to the room. The room was nice, pretty spacious and had a great view ( had to pay extra for this ). First night was nice, went up to the restaurant up on the top level and it had amazing views, the Bartender Derek was quite nice and helpful, We ordered some food to take back to the room with us, and it took about 50-60 minutes for 2 meals and an appetizer. Was not impressed nor surprised that when we got to the room to eat, the food was cold. The next day the bathroom toilet over-flowed and flooded the bathroom floor and part of the carpeted area in front of the bathroom. They sent up maintenance and they seemed to had fixed it. since we were to be out for the entire day, they had a chance to get up the water, and leave a blower in the room to dry out the carpet. That evening, we were having more issues with the toilet, they sent the guy back up and he replaced all the inner workings of the tank. By morning, the water was still at the top of the toilet, close to overflow, so they brought us another set of room keys and had to move us to another room which thankfully had no issues for the remainder of the stay. The elevators were constantly having issues the whole time we were there, there were points where your only options were to wait your turn on the service elevator or take the stairs, considering our new room was on the 10th floor, it made the stairs not really an option. The free shuttle was an amenity that we did not take advantage of, but would have liked to. Trying to horde a bunch of people in a Van on a first come, first served basis every 2 hours was a bit much... people pushing their way to the front to get a spot. We ended up just driving ourselves.Other than that, the room was nice, the bed was comfortable, the cleaning staff came to our door the first morning and threw our towels and items on the bed, as the bathroom disaster was in the process of being cleaned up. She got frustrated when I could not give her the old towels, but considering they were in a wet pile on the bathroom floor, I was not going to grab them. Then she would not leave until I gave her a signature ( for what i'll never know as she did not tell me when I asked her why I had to sign ). We did have the breakfast buffet at the restaurant, and it was pretty good for the price. They did have a corporate manager on duty the evening when they were having all of the elevator issues and we were both given 1 free drink coupon for the bar upstairs. I also noticed at the end of the stay, on the bill, they had comped us $150 for all of the issues and problems. so, of a 4 night say, we got one night free. All in all, it was a decent place to stay, if you stayed out of the elevators and didn't flush the toilets.It was ok...kinda dated.  The lounge upstairs was nice.  Hung out there after a weddingIn comparison to the hotel which was very clean with a pleasant staff. The restaurant had terrible service and my seat was dirty with a sticky arm rest. I was extremely disappointed with the breakfast buffet. When the waitress brought the coffee the pot it was dirty and rusted with old dried coffee and food splatters. While we waited in line at the buffet the bus boy kept walking in front of us with his pan of dirty dishes instead of using the doors on either side to go the the kitchen. As for the food, the taste was fine but everything was cold. That included the congealed sausage gravy. In my opinion you'd do better with a stale donut from a vending machine.   My daughter tried to get breakfast at 6:30 which is the the time the buffet is supposed to be open. She was turned away and told to come back 15 minutes later. She had an important interview that morning so she was left to hunt for a snack someplace else.Although the weather was awful for the time of year, the Holiday Inn-Riverview shines on downtown Charleston from just over the river. I made my reservation directly with the property, hoping to insure a room with a nice view. I asked for a higher floor and was satisfied with being 8 stories up, Aside from the prime location, the cylinder shaped hi-rise is most impressive indoors as well as out. In a city where the number of hotels is not very high, it's most important to make a great impression at a competitive price. (I paid just under $150.00 per night). Having spent just three nights, we did not have time to take advantage of all the amenities. I base my review on the following: location, location , location, easy parking, cleanliness, noise level, friendly and helpful staff, and the overall appearance of this hotel are all 5-star! One could tell that the operators of the property are very image conscious and make everything as pleasing as possible for their guests. Stay there again? I definitely hope so.
review_content_40: The two stars are for the front desk staff and the view. They are both awesome! Otherwise, this hotel pretty much sucks big time. The air-con is loud and has an weird high pitched noise, pulling in and out of the hotel fells like a runner trying to cross the track at a nascar race, the walls are so thin that when someone enters their next-door room I jump because I think that someone is coming into my room, the first night the hot water was not hot, the second and third is was scalding, If you want a room with a view of the city then you will be right next to elevators that give a loud "beep" at every floor, the balconies are sealed permanently in all rooms, the pool is closed for the season, and the restaurant smells of BO. This is just off of the top of my head...On a side note however, they do have happy hour from 5-7 with really good food specials, but sadly the service in the BAR is AWEFUL so go at 5 and expect to leave around 7.Not sure why you would want to stay here, unless you got it on a great deal on Hotwire, which thank goodness, has eased the pain just slightly. Splurge and spend a bit more to stay somewhere else. You will not be sorry.This Holiday Inn delivers exactly the quality of service I've come to expect from this chain.  We found it to be clean, well-kept, and perfectly located for our purposes.  The view from the restaurant is very nice.  (Please note, I'm not rating the breakfast buffet here, which was okay, but I am focusing on the hotel on the whole.)  The only thing missing was an in-room refrigerator.  Service was friendly and fast.  And a fellow named Snyder even left us a note that he was able to perform some requested maintenance to the room.  (Which wasn't even a big deal, but we found the note to be very professional and courteous.)This is a standard 3-star hotel with some 4-star views. If you have the option to stay here for a low price, I say go for it. It truly is a-ok. The hotel is clean, service is good, rooms are fairly nice. It seemed to be very busy the weekend that I was in Charleston. The lobby is small - it is the type of hotel you would just go in and out of and not spend time in (but why would you want to anyway, with so much to do in Charleston?). There is a rooftop restaurant that overlooks the river and much of Charleston. The views are amazing! There are SOME hotel rooms with nice views too..although many do not. The good location of the hotel (off of the highway, a 5-7 minute drive to downtown with a complimentary hotel shuttle) and decent rates would lure me to stay here if it was an option on Priceline, Hotwire, or the likes. I probably would not coming running back on my own, though.We stayed here when the PGA was in Kiawah and it was good enough being one of the cheapest hotels still available, but I likely will not stay again unless under dire circumstances. Friendly staff, but small and dated rooms. Lounge bar on top floor does offer great views, but overall hotel is a little overpriced. Short drive or cab ride to downtown nightlife but I would just prefer to stay downtown instead if not much difference in price.Do you like feeling like you're sleeping in a 40-year old ashtray? Do you want to risk your life as you take a guess as to whether any traffic is coming when you try to pull out of the parking lot? Do you wish to sleep on a bed with linens that feel almost threadbare? If so, you're in luck and this Holiday Inn is the place for you!We had the "fortune" of Priceline booking us here for two nights for a recent weekend trip. Upon arrival in the early evening, the gentleman checking us in said Priceline had booked my husband and I in a two double bed smoking room. He was able to change us into a non-smoking room on the 10th floor with a lovely view...of the highway. Upon entering, it was clear the room had either once been a smoking room or the ventilation was pumping in a smoke scent for us to enjoy.Fine, whatever, we weren't planning on being in the room much anyway.That evening upon turning in, we discovered 1) the heating/cooling system in the room was one of the noisiest I have ever heard and 2) the sheets weren't going to do anything to keep us warm.The next morning, I decided to go for a jog towards the historic areas, which is across the bridge from the hotel. Be aware that the folks at the desk will tell you there is pedestrian access on one side of the bridge, but also be aware that the sidewalk ends on the more southern side of the bridge without a way for one to cross without taking a risk across the sidewalk.Leaving the parking area in one's car also puts one at risk, as there are plants that obscure the view of the coming traffic which is moving at approximately 50 mph, and I can only imagine how many accidents have occurred as a result of this.All in all, it was a room that was semi-convenient for our purposes for the weekend at a somewhat reasonable rate, but I think you can do far, far better when you are in Charleston with many other options.We stayed here for four nights in August 2009.  It's a circle-shaped hotel with a bar/restaurant on the top floor and a pool on a lower floor on the roof of an adjoining structure.  We picked this place because it was the highest Expedia star rating for the budget we were trying to stay in, and we liked that it seemed close to the historical area and some of the attractions we planned to see.  Overall, I was pleased with the stay in the hotel.  It's off of major thoroughfares but in our room on the sixth floor the street noise was negligible.  It was a nice dark room at night, and had killer a/c for when we'd come in from the humidity.  We kept it off most of the time because it had the ability to make the room overpoweringly cold, so I guess I should add that the rooms seemed cool and well ventilated as they were.Circle-shaped hotels have some inconveniences, and one is that your door is going to be right next to a neighbor's door.  For a few nights we could hear them come and go all day and night.  You could also sometimes hear the elevator ping as it passed floors, but I guess that says something for the general silence of the hallways, right?  I used the fitness room one night to run, and although the equipment was nice and there was a big plasma TV to stare at, one thing I hated was that the layout seemed to put everyone's backs to the entryway.  As a woman exercising alone it made me feel somewhat creeped out/vulnerable, but I also watch a lot of trashy crime/cop shows, so it puts that in my head.The funniest problem we ran into was that one night our door stopped locking, and we had to have maintenance come out and reprogram the electronic lock.  As it happened, our room was apparently unlocked for several hours while we were at a rehearsal dinner for our friends' wedding.  Our room contents were secure and untouched when we returned, so I guess you could say the place is safe at least!  Regardless, when they were alerted to the problem they were able to fix it quickly.  Props for that on a Saturday night!All in all it wasn't a bad place.  We'd consider staying there if we went to Charleston again, but wouldn't necessarily seek it out as THE place to stay.We drove to Charleston for a New Year's Eve change of scenery.  There was to be a party in the upstairs lounge for the festivities, and their concierge did his best to sell it, but we opted not.  The steps outside were littered with wannabe southern belles in short LBDs and 5-inch silver heels.The elevators have seen better days and have huge advertisement stickers on the doors that read, "What's your sign?" The shower was like something out of _Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas._  See, it has a regular tub, but the curtain rod curves outward so that when you're done and you reach for the shower  curtain, it's still a foot away.  I think it's supposed to create the illusion of spaciousness, but instead left me with a minor twinge of vertigo-like discomfort.Other than that, it's pretty much what you'd expect--and they have HBO.For $89 on NYE, I'm not complaining.This hotel left much to be desired.  One of the elevators was already broken when we got there and the second one sounded like it was going to break down at any minute in our 4 day stay.  The rooms do not come with a standard small fridge or other basic amenities that other comparable hotels come with.  Don't let the small exterior balconies fool you, the doors to them are bolted shut in your room.  Also, no complementary standard Holiday Inn breakfast, and the coffee in the lobby stops at 9:30am sharp (what hotel does that?  Most have our all day).  This hotel left us underwhelmed in every way.  The restaurant in the hotel was terrible as well, overpriced and poor food quality.  We will not return to this hotel.Clean rooms, good location, quiet. No more than 20 min from anything and 5-10 min from any part of the downtown historic ditrict. The view from the rooftop bar is amazing.One of the best Holiday Inn's I have stayed at. Got upgraded to a suite and the room is great. Large room with a big sofa and 2 chase lounge chairs. The restraunt is great with a nice view. Will definately stay here again on my next visit to Charleston.

review_content: This was really a nice bed and breakfast in downtown Charleston. Very good location. Across the street from the Mill House. Personally, I'm not a Bed and Breakfast girl, but this one was really nice. Such a great location. Close to all the cool downtown places..... Also Privacy!!!Our room was a little small but very cozy and clean. I wish I had brought my bathing suit to sit in the jacuzzi. The room had a small TV but we weren't watching TV anyway. We got to pick when they'd serve breakfast and it was Yummo. Id recommend the place for a night or two. Rooms were small but nice and clean. Friendly staff! Also even though it's old,.... It's very pretty'. And so close to some of the most amazing restaurants in Charleston!!!Stayed here while on a trip to Charleston and couldn't have been more pleased. Elliott House is perfect if you need the basics while traveling: Clean room, comfy bed, clean bathroom, central location and excellent service. The location is one of the greatest things about Elliott House. Located right in the middle of town and close to all restaurants, tourist attractions, bars and shopping. If you're looking for convenience, this is an excellent choice. The rooms are a bit small, but aside from that, it provides a very cozy and relaxed place to stay. They also host a wine and cheese happy hour for all guests every day which is very laid back and relaxing.
