Rooms are clean and comfortable with a lot of character, including antiques and paintings but with all the modern comforts.In need of a last minute hotel room after a bad experience our first night at Embassy Suites up the road, we stumbled upon Ansonborough Inn and I'm so glad we did!  Nearly every hotel was booked for the weekend, but we were able to get the last vacant room here.  I was a little uncertain of what to expect, as hotels like this can really be hit or miss.The atmosphere of the hotel was unique, warm, and inviting.  Our suite was huge, well laid out, and clean with a comfy leather couch and flat screen TV that truly made you feel as though you were in your own little one bedroom condo in downtown Charleston.  Not to mention the fact that their room rates were significantly lower than just about every other hotel in downtown Charleston, including the Days Inn. The staff was great and they had a complimentary wine and cheese hour in the social room that was a really nice touch.Definitely recommend staying here!This is a very comfortable and interesting place to stay.  We were able to walk everywhere,  and the bed was very comfortable.  One word of caution.  We took a taxi from the airport and it was about $30.  It was a metered taxi as you would expect.  When we left I asked the front desk to arrange a taxi to the airport. Not a driver, or limo...a taxi.   What we got was a ginormous black SUV that charged us $45 for the 20 minute drive to the airport.  Do yourself a favor and arrange your own transportation.Stunning. Immaculate. Key Location. These words are exactly representative of this place. Highly recommended to stay. We stayed in the Scarborough Suite and from the bed to the soaking tub, our room will be unforgettable.
review_content_20: A Best Western at best. Our room was two twin beds pushed together to make it look like a king sized bed. It felt like we slept on plywood as opposed to a mattress as well. Seems like they are cutting costs as much as possible, at the expense of the guest. Location is the only good thing here. Continental breakfast was scarce. Don't be fooled by the attempt to look like a fancy hotel with picture frames & chandeliers. They are made of glass, not crystal.Great place, near the City Market and everything really. Staff was really nice, the rooms very comfortable (2 adults 3 kids in a double room with a sofa bed and we were not cramped) , hot breakfast with assorted variety; and to top it off, free wine and cheese at 5 pm.I traveled to Charleston for the first time ever to photograph my friend proposing to his girlfriend during the Cooper River Bridge Run. My friend booked a room at this hotel, gave them his credit card number and got a confirmation from the hotel. During my stay, I was asked for my card for incidentals (I assumed). Upon me leaving, I realized the hotel charged me for the room to the tune of $1000 for the stay. When I called and asked them to reverse the charges, they asked for my friend to call and verify his card to finalize the transaction... which he did. When I checked my account 2 hours later, there were 2 more charges for $840 ($1680 total) for the same room that was not supposed to be charged to me. So in total, I was charged $2700! I was told the person that made the mistake was gone for the day (it was Sunday) and would take care of the issue the following day. On top of all this, the cab company they trusted so much was called to take me to the airport for my travels. Flight was at 6:40, so the cab was reserved for 5:30. Cab did not show which caused me to miss my flight and essentially turn my 1 way trip to Houston (2 hour flight) into a 20 hour standby fiasco that ended with me renting a car from San Antonio and driving back home. The level of incompetence is absolutely unbelievable and I will let everyone I know to avoid this very beautiful hotel due to the lack of customer service they have on the back side.I've stayed here a bunch-- for work and for fun, because it is usually reasonably priced in comparison to other downtown Charleston hotels.  Out of season, more reasonably than in-season of course, and a recent long weekend averaged a little over $300/night which included taxes and the $12 parking surcharge.The people who work here are great.  The rooms are a bit of a mix of old-timey but classic furniture, mid-century pieces, and desks that do not fit in and look like they came from a flea market.The wireless internet is free.  Some of the carpets are really dirty.  Finally, be careful-- if you get stuck on the ground floor, whether on the Hasell Street side (which is a bit more quiet) or the East Bay Side (louder than my NYC apartment above freaking Houston Street!), you are in for a bit of a wild ride (lookout Room 115!).  These rooms should not be let except for a very deep discount with full disclosure.  Shame on the hotel for not taking that tack.The complimentary breakfast and wine/cheese cocktail hour are perfectly adequate.  The "workout room" is a bit of a joke-- it has a treadmill and one piece of equipment I have never seen before; however, in nice weather, you can jog to the new bridge -- the base of which is approximately a mile from the door.So, overall an adequate property and despite some quirks, I will definitely stay here again.Wow! What a gem!  A converted warehouse with exposed brick walls and wood beams in an intimate setting.  Conveniently located near everything.  Across the street from a 24 hr supermarket.  Our room, # 333, was huge! King sized comfortable bed, large bathroom, couch, large window facing east, and very high ceilings. Very quiet.  Front desk was very helpful. The included breakfast was fine.  We'll stay there again!I had reserved a room for my client to stay at the Ansonbourough during the Cooper River Bridge Run weekend. Now this weekend is probably the biggest weekend for Charleston, so I understand the inflated prices ($800 for 2 nights).My client had a nice stay, but when it came time to leave his appointed early morning cab wasn't there, which made him miss his flight, and turns out they charged HIS credit card instead of mine which was originally placed with the reservation. Not only that, he was charged THREE TIMES! Make that $2,600!!!!!!!!!But wait there is more. I check my account, and I've been charged TWICE! $1600!!The dominoes keep falling.Surely I can speak with the manager and make some sense of this this missed cab ride and quadruple $800 charge...I call the manager and she was very unhelpful and pulled the "I'm just as upset as you" card. Considering how much the rooms were overpriced, there wasn't even a hint of a refund or incentive to return to the Ansonborough.This makes me look VERY bad to my client. I love Charleston and will be back for my wedding next year... but staying FAR away from this place.This is such a great place to stay.  It was my second visit (the first time I stayed at Planter's Inn.  I like Ansonborough better).  Not only is the location prime (we walked everywhere) but the staff is also extremely nice (from the housekeepers to the ladies working the kitchen/continental breakfast/wine hour to the (after hours) lady at the front desk).  The front desk (Daniel?) was helpful recommending places to eat, etc.  The only negative was the street noise early in the morning.  I'll stay here again next visit for sure!Absolutely delightful. We booked a loft room for my bachelorette party, which allowed all five of us to be in one space. We had more than enough room and the extra half bath was essential with five women! The website does not do the hotel justice, it is gorgeous inside! Very unique and worth skipping the chain hotels for the charm of the Ansonborough Inn. Staff was helpful and friendly, recommending restaurants and arranging for early morning cab service. Evening wine and cheese reception and breakfast pastries are nice touches.My husband and I  loved our stay here at AI! We did some research and many of the B&B in Charleston are well over $200, but AI was at a reasonable price. We got an upgrade from the King Studio to a Luxury Room since we mentioned we were celebrating out anniversary.  The room was very spacious!  There was a bar area and living room area with comfy couches and chairs.  The bathroom had marble and granite and Bath and Body Works toiletries.  It was very clean and comfortable! AI isn't in the heart of Charleston, but a couple of blocks away from the shops and restaurants.  There is also a Harris Teeter across from the Inn and Parking is $12 across the street too. We didn't drive anywhere all weekend. The continental breakfast included cereal, bagels, muffins, fruit, oatmeal, along with boiled eggs and mini sausage biscuits. The staff was friendly and the Inn was just lovely.  The only negative is that we could hear everything in the room above us.  At one point we heard part of someone conversation. Besides that, I would def stay here again!My husband and I stayed at Ansonborough Inn on June 1st 2012. Our flight got in late, so we didn't show up until 9:30 PM. We had to wait a couple minutes for someone to come to the front desk, which didn't bother us at all. They upgraded us to a larger room, which was room #109. This room was on the main floor right by one of the main streets. I had read another review about this particular room and they mentioned that it was noisy. Yes you could hear some of the outside noise, but it wasn't to the point where it prevented you from sleeping. It would be just like at home. Other things we enjoyed:~Convenience to all the downtown restaurants, bars and activities (walking distance)~Decent breakfast with hot and cold foods~Comfortable bed~Room was big with a sitting area (not that you spend much time in your room anyway)~Very helpful & friendly staff, provided ideas for places to eat and gave directions~We were able to keep our luggage at the hotel after we checked out while we were walking around down town and at the pier. We picked it up later when our ride showed up.Overall we enjoyed the architecture and the fell of the hotel and the staff was wonderful. Would definitely stay again if we return to the area!We've stayed at a different hotel every time we've visited Charleston, and this will be a one and done, too. I wanted to try a new place that was within walking distance to most of historic Charleston, and this place fit the bill. We didn't rent a car this time and it was no problem! In fact, when we wanted to get closer to the Medical University, we went to a bike shop around the corner and rode our bikes over there. The rooms were fine. Very high ceilings and a decent sized room given the historic age of this hotel. I was disappointed that our bathroom wasn't updated as advertised. There was a lot of external noise... we were very close to the docks and it made sleeping in on vacation.The breakfast left a lot to be desired. There was nothing fresh and the grits were instant! Blasphemy! We didn't make the breakfast mistake more than once... every other morning we ate out. The happy hour was fine. The pimento cheese was very good and very Southern. Really, the best thing about this restaurant is it's location.I booked this hotel based on proximity to the cruise terminal for a one-night stay prior to sailing.  While the cruise was abysmal, the stay in Charleston at the Ansonborough was impeccable.  We kind of wished that the cruise had been canceled so we could just stay there.  We had a king room with vaulted ceilings.  The space was impressively renovated, with attention paid to the original beam and woodwork.  The bathroom was clean with nice hot water (not always the case in even some of the finest hotels).We had exceptional service with a great restaurant recommendation.  Check-in and check-out were seamless.  Parking was easy, which I gather isn't true for all Charleston hotels.  The location was great as well.The only less-than-exceptional points were the continental breakfast (nothing special) and the fitness center.  There is no ventilation in the fitness center and only one treadmill and some weights.  It was stifling and steamy after only a mile and a half on the treadmill.  But then again, I don't think many people go to Charleston to work out in an enclosed space.  Use the location to your advantage and run or walk outside, if it's not too warm.Not only would I stay there again, but I'm booking my parents a stay there for their anniversary.The rooms in the Ansonborough Inn are spacious and nice.  The vaulted ceilings have to be at least 18 foot ceilings, but I do not really know how high they are.  The rooms come equipped with a ceiling fan and their own AC/Heat unit, not that one would ever need heat in South Carolina.  The architecture of the rooms, the ceilings, the moldings, and the bed are all very quaint and nice.  The bed was comfortable and provided a great place to sleep.In terms of location, the Ansonborough Inn is on the outskirts of the market but fortunately right across the street from a Harris Teeter grocery store - which helps with the purchase of cheap bottled water by the case for your time in the heat in South Carolina.  The downsides of the hotel:1.  It's proximity to the port.  We could hear the port workers in the early hours of the morning - probably around 6ish - and the persistent beeping of the dock equipment when put in reverse as they transferred goods. 2.  It's proximity to Market street outside of the actual market means people can drive faster and do.  Plus, because it is on the outskirts, there seemed to be a lot of motorcycles who liked the bar almost directly across the street.3.  The maid service in the hotel did a pretty half-ass job of cleaning our room every single day.  We weren't exactly "green" so we always left our towels on the floor - the new universal sign for replace my towels - but they did not.  Additionally, they did not clean the bathroom as a whole all that well each day - which makes me question whether my whole room was cleaned.Funky space and easy walking made this a great, less expensive, respite for our one night Charleston stay.PROS:AMAZING decorFriendly staffPrivate parking lotRooftop terraceLarge roomsGreat locationLow rates ($189 for Junior Suite)CONS:Woke up at 2am to a lot of drunk people in the parking lot next to building. We actually called the cops because they were 'hanging out' in the parking lot until almost 3am and we couldn't go to sleep.Shower was not cleaned. There was long black hair and globs of conditioner in the shower.The people in the room above us kept us up late because we could hear everywhere they stepped...and for some strange reason they were walking around a lot! (Old building = very noisy)We lucked out during a frantic search for a hotel in the historic district of Charleston the night before our trip and booked a room at this warehouse-turned historic inn.  The location is centrally-located and right off of East Bay.  It is an easy two blocks to where all stores and restaurants on East Bay.The furnishings can be best described as British-hunting-centric.  There are countless ornately-framed paintings of dogs: small dogs, big dogs, dogs in fields, dogs hunting with pheasants in the background...you get the picture.  Each room is different, and ours had a small sitting area as well as tall ceilings, as all rooms do.  There were only two windows in the huge room, and both of these had shutters on them to keep the light out, so it was rather dim the entire stay.  There were plenty of paintings of animals to look at.  :)The Inn serves water, iced tea, lemonade, and cookies during the day, and has a wine and cheese hour at 5pm.  This serve-yourself-spread is a nice touch, and held us over before dinner and after a day of walking around.  Breakfast, however, was disappointing as they had no hot foods, just your typical cereal, pieces of limp fruit, and some juice. The coffee is kept hot at all hours, and there is a free business center with Internet.  Parking is $12.Overall, I had a great visit and enjoyed the stay at the Ansonborough.  This was a spacious and unique inn in the heart of Charleston with plenty of character.Stayed over the following dates: Aug 12-Aug14th (A/C worked great). Stayed in the Petite King. Pros: Got a great rate - internet special $159. Compared to others on kayak and the cheapest 4 star + came in at $209. The room, and Inn, was extremely nice and very cozy. Downtown location and great for walking to sites etc...This is not the first time we have stayed here, and we will continue to book this place for our trips to Charleston.Cons: Pillows - I like big fluffy pillows, our room had thin stiff pillows. I know this is a very weak con.This place was amazing!  We didn't expect much from the picture on the website but we needed something for one night in an emergency.  WOW! The room was HUGE, and absolutely beautiful! The nightly wine and cheese was yummy and the breakfast was wonderful and plentiful!  Staff were helpful too. We wish we could have stayed longer!  One of the best kept secrets in Charleston! We will be back!!!Incredibly friendly staff, beautiful rooms, very centrally located...so why only 4 stars? The price of the room. Good lawd is it expensive. And the awesome, old-timey bar was unattended...even though it said it was open during the hours I stopped by. That said, they have a nice breakfast and you can use their computers. The decor is wonderful in the lobby and in the rooms. I really liked that they had a refrigerator in my room as well. I probably shouldn't give only 4 stars as the rates are comparable to most other hotels in that area near Liberty Square. But I think it fits.Great hotel!  Room was large enough for 2 couples with seperate bedroom and pull out couch.  Very friendly staff, good location off E. Bay Street.  Moderately priced compared to most hotels located downtown.  One of the coolest looking lobby's with all the wood beams; high ceiling and sky lights.
review_content_40: Far better than expected. Great wine & cheese in the evening & an excellent array of breakfast choices in the AM. Location is the best. Our room was on ground floor... not a lot of street noise but it was stormy so not a lot of walkers. I highly recommend this placeStayed one night for a business trip and was very impressed by the charm and conveniences of this small downtown hotel.  The rooms were spacious, with ~very~ high ceilings, and the decor certainly matched the "feel" of Charleston, SC.  My room was impeccably clean, and the maids were friendly and attentive, asking me as I was checking in to let them know if I needed anything.  The front desk staff were just as friendly and obliging.Beyond the rooms, the layout was cozy, yet spacious, with areas for relaxing and dining and the meeting room that we used was quite adequate for our presentation, with a drop down projection screen, and plenty of outlets for use for projectors and laptops (which can be a problem for the business traveler.)The location was perfect, within walking distance of many great restaurants and the University of Charleston, and had the convenience of having a grocery store quite nearby.If you're looking for a "full service hotel", this may not be quite what you're looking for, as there's no pool, spa, gift shop, a relatively small fitness center, etc. but I highly recommend it, and would enjoy staying again when I visit Charleston again.spent two nights here to celebrate my girl's bday.  we loved it!  comfy room, lots of character, easy to walk everywhere in town.  good place to stay in charleston if you don't want to spend a fortune!Beautiful inn, huge gorgeous room, clean, clean, clean!  Can't say enough good things about this place.  Located on the edge of the historic arean, just 2 blocks from the city marke, the location is perfect.  Dozens of the city's best restaurants within a few blocks.  Prices are comparable to other hotels in the area, but why get a generic chain hotel room when you can get exposed bricks and beams, hundreds of old oil paintings, a gorgous paneled pub...charm galore.  Oh, and free parking!  Highly recommended.

review_content: Just what I expected. Some have complained, but I don't understand how you could ask more of this place. Everything wasn't perfect but it was all acceptable. I also think a lot of the bad reviews are from before the remodel. And only a fool would waste time complaining about people walking past their window in a MOTEL... The good:The location couldn't be better. The famous Historic Charleston Market is a block away. Great shops like the Savanah Bee Company and River Street Sweets are around the corner. And one of the best breakfast spots in town, Toast of Charleston is attached to the motel. Get up early to avoid the lines, and check them out on Sunday for "crazy hat day". The parking is free, and if you get to town early like we did, they'll put you on a waiting list to check-in early when a room is available AND they go ahead and give you a parking pass so you can explore without paying to park elsewhere. The room had no signs of bugs (I always check for bed bugs), it was recently remodeled and very clean, with a couple of exceptions which I'll cover in "the bad". There is a safe in the room, so there's no excuse for complaining that your stuff came up missing like some people on here have. The front desk staff was very pleasant and helpful. The bad:The ice machines didn't work (at least not the two I found). The maid staff was being loud and cussing when we got there at 8:30am. Check-in is at 4pm... I should have paid more attention when booking, but I was a little disappointed. After doing a little research I found that the standard for the area is 3-4.  We were able to check-in early at 3pm, but knowing we were first on the list for early check-in made us think a room should have been available sooner. My wife and I have both held jobs working as maid staff in the past, and I know what it takes to clean a room and it shouldn't take more than 45 minutes for an experienced person who isn't wasting time with boisterous, vulgar conversations across the parking lot. Finally, for as long as it takes to get the rooms cleaned they really should be perfect, and they nearly were. The three things I found were 1) what looked like a coffee spill on the head corner of the box springs 2) a small amount of hair in the bath tub and 3) a few drops of urine on the toilet seat. The toilet issue should have been obvious, I'm not sure how it got overlooked. Overall we had a good experience, and I would probably stay here again if I were trying to stay on a budget.Pros: good location, parking, friendly front desk.Cons:  horrible comforter plagued with cigarette burns and blood, a broken lamp shade, a badly patched ceiling, holes in the shower curtain, and a small double bed that was elevated beyond belief. This room was a handicap room and it was not that handicap friendly due to stacked appliances on a fridge and no towel bars.Days Inn should upgrade their bedding first and foremost!  Stay other places if you can until management makes a change.It's a Days Inn. It's definitely not anything fancy, but it is in a fabulous location one block from Market Street or King Street.The beds are comfy. Temperature is controllable. Refrigerator and microwave in room.You might see a bug or two. Exterior corridors, and you can hear all of the noise from the street (any seasoned traveler comes equipped with earplugs anyway).No frills. You get what you pay for.Good, clean hotel in the middle of everything. It is older, but clean! Staff was so niceWHAT A GREAT LOCATION AND VALUE! This hotel could not be in a more convenient location. Walking distance to the Battery, King Street, Market Street, Bay Street, restaurants, museums, shops, coffeeshops, bars - basically EVERYTHING. And it's a great value. And the staff in the office were great, and the room was completely fine! I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Charleston and would recommend it to other pennypinchers, too!The night manager was not pleasant at all. Forget about southern hospitality. The only reason why we stayed because it was pet friendly,Very poor area to walk a dog.I was able to get a $70/night rate for a three day stay in late December on Priceline.The good:Staff were super niceEverything was reasonably cleanLocation was awesome, right off King StreetThe Ugly:Over three days, my room was only turned down onceTwo different times when I tried to shower, there was no hot water; several other times the water was borderline too hot. I never actually managed to get the tap adjusted to a comfortable temperatureMy shower drained slowly so by the end of each shower I was standing in ankle-deep water; I asked to have this addressed twice but didn't get much responseThe AC unit sounded like a very loud, static-y TV, to the point where I had trouble sleepingHalf the channels on the TV were actually static-yIf I had a slightly larger budget I would definitely stay somewhere else.Ignore most of the ratings of three stars or less.  I think these people don't understand that you get what you pay for.The Days Inn is all about location.  Yes, I too, was put in a smoker's room...and I wasn't a fan of how it smelled.  You know what else I'm not a fan of?  Spending $400 a night to stay in a nicer hotel that is close to all the action in Charleston.You'll get two beds, tv with cable, the regular amenities and a small pool to cool off in.  If you were looking for luxury around the $100 mark, you didn't do your homework on Charleston, and I'm guessing you're also a lousy tipper.Try:  Digging deeper and going elsewhere if you want luxury and comfort (this is a place to sleep)Avoid:  The smoking rooms if you canOk fellow Yelpers, here's what's up. If you're looking for a swanky southern style hotel that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time, this isn't it.  But let's be honest, would you really expect that for a Day's Inn?! This place is really good for what it is. Reasonably priced in a central location.  Staff could not be friendlier, and our room was clean, and parking is included. They're pet friendly (for a fee) but be sure to specify if you want a smoking or non smoking room. (I currently feel like I just walked in to my grandma's house while she's sitting on the couch watching the price is right going through her pack of cigs like they're going out of style)   Regardless, the hubby was a bit nervous about me being ok with staying here given my preference for places like Hotel Belleclaire in NYC and The Adolphus in Dallas but the location and price cannot be beat. Make yourself feel better by spending the money you saved by splurging at Poogan's Porch or the Gin Joint. You won't be disappointed.Thank God we only spent 90$ on priceline. The best part was the free parking, otherwise this place was a bust. Got there at 2:30pm, met by a rude front desk lady, said we couldn't ck in till 4 even though all the rooms were cleaned and this place was dead on a weekday and no holiday. Front desk said pool view room when in fact it was a view  of parking lot with semi and dumpster  parked in it. Beds had huge side rips and were on slants , with head higher than body which made for a horrible nights sleep. Huge black mold strips in tub, with ripped carpet and huge holes in walls. See pics. Spend the extra few bucks and stay elsewhere. But did enjoy Eli's table walking distance, great breakfast.Super helpful and friendly front desk. Great location. Good price.It's 2015, and this place still has smoking rooms. It's not clear when you book, what type of room you'll be getting. They run out of non-smoking rooms fast and the staff has to deal with tons of angry people that do not want to be in a gross room. All the staff will offer is a quick chemical spray to cover the smoke. Yuck. They like to give smoking rooms to people that reserve through Priceline and other sites, so be careful and call ahead to see what you can reserve. We had a dead roach in our room and mold in the bathroom. Check out is at 11am, we were hoping the front desk could be flexible and allow us to check out at noon so we could finish a tour. They said "no" and we had to check out at 11am. The location is great and the parking is free.Great service and room was very clean ! Pool was warm but dirty needs to be cleaned a bit more!If you stay here you are out of your mind.  Listen to the other reviews, I ignored them... Don't make my mistake!   This place is gross!   No parking!  Dirty!  Falling apart, stinky nasty rooms.   Worst hotel ever!  It should be a pay by the hour sex motel..that's how this place feels.  Don't be fooled by the looks of the place outside, seems like a nice enough hotel.. The inside is scary!Our motto this weekend became "It could be worse." Pros: friendly staffworking appliancesfree parking downtown locationfridge and microwave in the roomCons:Our room was a smoking one, no one asked us if we had a preference. And being that is was Labor Day weekend, it was too booked to switch. A constant water puddle next to our shower. Toilet didn't work so well. Hasn't been renovated for a few decades. Overall upkeep just wasn't good. I won't return if I can help it.First room we were put in had a floor that was soaking wet and overall reeked of mildew. My husband went and talked to the man at the desk and got our room switched. The new rooms blankets were stiff like cardboard and while my daughter was showering the water temperature suddenly changed, burned her and wouldn't cool down.. The only good thing is the location!As they say ..... you get what you pay for. Yes free parking but not enough parking spaces!!  Had to pay to park across street then they refund you when you check out. We paid for two nights but they checked us as being out the first night. Had to go to office and recheck in. Location was good but thats about all.You pay for what you get here, the location.  This hotel is steps away from everything in the historic district.  The room overall is fine, and has the standards of any cheap hotel room including a mini fridge, microwave, desk, TV, etc.  The bathroom light blew out which was a pain, but these things happen.  The things I did not like were the cracked and missing tiles in the bathroom, overly perfumed smell in the room, and the staff hanging around smoking in front of the office and near the stairwells every time we were outside, blocking the door and walkways and stinking up the place.  Also, at the time of this review, there was construction next door, so if you want to sleep in, you might be better off in another neighborhood.For us, it was fine for a night, but I would not book an entire week here.Awful place.  Smells like mold. Unfriendly service.  Holes in the sheets and comforter. The manager rude and could've cared less about our concerns. We moved hotels in five  minutesPerfection!! Inexpensive and awesomely located!!! I'm giving this spot 5 stars based on it being a motel, clean, perfect location, friendly staff and inexpensive!!!! Not really much else to say. I think they have a pool but can't really be sure. I can tell you that they are within walking walking distance of anything you might want to do in downtown historic Charleston!!
review_content_20: If you follow my reviews, you will note that I have just come back from an east coast road trip, that started in Florida (my Hometown) and ended in New York. My first stop, in Charleston, lead me to my stay at the Days Inn. The reason my friends and I booked this hotel was for the fairly low rates and location. The Days Inn was by far the largest hotel room on my trip. Although, it was perhaps the oldest and most outdated. But hey, that's just aesthetics, right? The rooms were clean. There was room enough for a Queen size bed and a desk with 2 chairs. The way the bathroom was situated, there was a sink outside of the toilet and shower area, allowing someone to shower and another to use the vanity area. This is a great feature, to prevent infringing on each other's privacy or fogging up the mirror. The towels were a little rough... Although, I am a bit of a linen snob (I design and sell custom yacht linens for a living).The location of this hotel is epic! I felt safe in the hotel.  And it was definitely within walking distance to King St. And all the local hot spots.All in all I think the Days Inn delivered exactly what you'd expect a Days Inn to deliver.If you want to be in a prime location for a reasonable price, then you really can't go wrong with this hotel.  If you're touring the downtown area, then most of your time will be outside instead of in your room, so it makes sense to save your money and stay at the Days Inn.Beware Room 122 the hellish stench in here goes so far beyond stench it's more like stank. The fetid aroma will haunt your dreams, forever. The location of the Hotel is in the heart of downtown making it an excellent base camp for exploring. Parking is tight so don't move your car or you'll lose your spot.Place is nice enough.  Our room was very quiet.  Came with a mini-frig, microwave, hairdrier, iron and board.  Beds were comfy. I would go back.  Location on Meeting Street is in the central hospitality area which is north of Broad Street.  The historical area south of Broad Street is residential only - no hotels, no retail.This place is a HUGE mistake. I'm not exaggerating. We stayed last year and got stuck in a smoking room-- filthy, stinking, disgusting. It didn't seem that they even cleaned it--blood was on the wall!!  We decided to try one more time because of the price and the location. I would rather sleep in my car. We got stuck with a handicap room this year complete with a gross, dirty handicap shower chair.  It is musty, dead bugs, hair in the sheets. I swear they don't clean these rooms.  And don't bother complaining to the staff. They are the worst, most unfriendly people I've ever met. I really don't know how anyone could rate this place well at all.  If I could give this a negative review I would. This place is just taking advantage of tourists.The only thing good about this hotel is the location. The bathroom had tiles missing off of the floor, the stairs up to the second floor were loose, and the door had a quarter inch gap under it. Every closing door nearby could be heard. The air conditioner had a rattle in it. Lifting up a magazine off of the desk revealed some kind of bug living under it.Traveling with pets? Non-smoker? This is not the place to go. I booked this hotel through their website, which listed the hotel as pet friendly. Getting there, it turns out that the only rooms they allow pets in are smoking rooms, which I cannot stay in due to health reasons. A $100 fee is charged if pets stay in a non-smoking room.Great access to historic downtown Charleston is not worth sleepless nights and extra fees.Very old hotel, the staff is not the greatest, but is great for the price. The location is nearly unbeatable.The place was actually a little nicer than I was expecting based on reviews. The rooms open to the outside (instead of an interior hallway) but the neighborhood seems safe so I guess it could be worse. The pool looks okay, though I didn't use it. The place didn't have complimentary breakfast and didn't have a fitness center, but the free wifi and parking were more important to me. The wifi was reliable and fast enough- something that's often an issue in budget hotels. Like everyone else says, the location can't really be beat. It's in the heart of tourist areas and the best restaurants/bars. I stayed here for three nights and never needed a car.The room itself was hit or miss. The pillows and sheets were very clean and new, but the blanket/comforter had burns and stains on it. The shower and toilet were very clean but the bathroom door frame and baseboards by the sink were dirty/damaged and needed to be replaced. Bottom line is that the place was clean enough, has a great location and the best price in the historic district.Location!  Location!  Location!  That is the best thing about this hotel.  It's a short walk to The Market area.  They are dog friendly, but you must make that clear when you reserve the room because only certain rooms are for dogs.  The rooms were.... old and basic.  They were pretty clean though, which I appreciate.  If proximity and price is a high priority, I'd recommend it, if not go somewhere else.We stayed in May, the place is old but clean and a great location. It had free parking, a good air conditioner and we could walk everywhere down town. If you want to save some money and don't have to be in a big name property then this is the place.Oh yuck. Since when did Days Inn get so crappy? The place was clean. The overwhelming smell of bleach doesn't let you forget! The bathroom needs some serious repairs. The shower head was low and there were rust stains in the tub and some of the knobs didn't work. It's been 3 months and no beg bugs have surfaced in my home from my trip - always a good sign - although I did spray my bedbug spray around the beds. I do that everywhere nowadays.The housekeeping and front desk staff get 5 stars but the room gets 2. The location cant be beat. It's right in the middle of all the best places to see and it's probably the cheapest place but the worst value.Excellent customer service.  The people at the front desk were so friendly and helpful and the maids too. The rooms were a bit outdated and there was no storage under the sink,  just a fake cabinet door to make it look like there was.  Wallpaper coming off on the bathroom.  But great location and one of the cheaper hotels on the historic districtAlright folks. When reviewing this hotel, I'm going to keep in mind it's obvioulsy not in the same caliber as a BnB, a Hilton, or Marriot. This is a DAYS INN. With that said, it's the best hotel deal in the city. When you arrive, you get a parking pass, you can actually find a parking spot, and you won't need to move your car 'til you go back home because the location is amazing! The bed is fine, the bathroom is clean, you get a medium size fridge, microwave, ice bucket/cups, and coffee pot. NO WI-FI, that I found anyways. If you plan to stay in your room the entire trip, then yes, book at the Four Seasons. But I'd rather save that extra $150/ night to use on the amazing FOOD and TOURS Charleston has to offer! Who cares about where I lay my head for 8 hours! We were able to walk to the City Market, Cru Cafe (make RSVPs!), Husk (make RSVPs well in advance), Poogan's Porch. We walked to the Battery, the bars on Bay (Gin Joint, Social Wine, The Squeeze Bar).OLD!  Uncomfortable small beds.  Missing tiles and hole in bathroom wall.  Outside noise will keep you from sleep.  Carpet looks original therefore SCARY!  Location is great.Stay here if you go to Charleston.  The hotel is in the middle of historic area and close by everything.  It helps when you plan to walk around a lot and want to crash at the hotel after you're done.  The room was nice and clean.  It was affordable as well.  It's not cheap to stay in the area, but we saved staying here when we did our research.If you are looking to visit Charleston and experience a great city and are on a budget...this is the place to stay. I wouldn't typically stay at a Days Inn but you can't beat this location at this price. My wife and I came here for a long weekend and originally booked and stayed about 15 miles away in a nicer and less expensive hotel. However, we were never in our room and each day found ourselves driving to downtown and having to go through the struggle of where to park and how much and how far away and ugh! We walked by the Days Inn and thought why aren't we staying there? It's not  the 4 Star Wyndham we were at but it's right where we want to be. No parking/travel/traffic battle. We checked out of the 4 star ($100) Wyndham that was 15 miles away and checked into the 2 star ($149) Days Inn the next day. The room is fine. It's a little smaller and not as nice, the air-conditioner makes a little noise, the bathroom is smaller, etc.. We can live with all these things. The room doesn't stink, I can't stand the smell of smoke and I don't smell any. The bed is comfortable. The people in the office are nice. But here is the thing...the parking is free and available!!! The hotel is right off of Market Street in downtown!!! One block from King Street. Easily walking distance to Waterfront Park and The Battery/White Point Gardens. Walking distance to all kinds of great restaurants, shops, bars, crazy cool houses, and just a really cool city. This hotel provides everything we are looking for during our stay and very little of it involves the inside of a hotel room. If it was dirty, if there were bugs, if it was loud, or unsafe...I wouldn't recommend. But I can't say any of that. What I can say is unless you're rich and can afford the 5 star hotels in downtown...stay at Days Inn off Meeting Street.No one smiles here at all.  The bathroom had mold and stuff in the bathtub.  Around caulking.  Out of date.   Still have bed spreads on beds.   Threw on floor pronto.  The females at front desk seemed as though we were a bother to them.   They say have a nice day to end the conversation for you.   No smile.I wouldn't stay here again, even though it is much, much less expensive than any other hotel in the historic area, and even though it has one of the most convenient locations in the city.The room was dated and had lots of stains; you had to hold down on the flusher to make the water in the toilet go down; and there were lots of bugs in the room. I didn't find the staff to be particularly helpful.A cockroach crawled out of my travel companion's suitcase when he got back home, and I think I got bed bugs from this place. I travel often and it's the grossest room I've been in. I don't understand how a hotel could be this bad.A quality no frills hotel to lay your head when visiting this awesome city.  It's cheap and has a stellar location and free parking.  The rooms may be a little small for a family of 4, but that's the only downside I can see.  They also appeared to be renovating bathrooms when I was there.  When you're in Charleston you should be spending as little time in your hotel room as possible, so why spend a fortune on it?Avoid this places at all costs. Our room was like a dungeon, the sun never reached our windows, the whole place smelled of mildew, and everything was damp. The wallpaper was peeling off the wall and sheets had seen better days. The staff were helpful once you can get past the fact that they are rude by nature for having to work at such a bad hotel. Needless to say, we will not be returning.
review_content_40: Awful. I booked a stay here two months early and received a confirmation email. When I called the week before my trip, apparently there was something wrong with my card number and it was cancelled. I didn't receive any notification as such and they were all booked up by this time.We got bed bugs here. The hotel, as well as The Days Inn corporate office refuse to refund our money even though we ruined hundreds of dollars in clothes and luggage. This place is a great location with free parking, but it's FILTHY. It's just not worth itThis is a great option for visiting Charleston.  Its clean, cheap, and very close to all of the historic sites.  There is a nice pool and you can park very close to your room.This hotel, conveniently located in the center of historic Charleston (and with a free parking lot), has suffered the slings and arrows of many customers who were repelled by its shabbiness. I have good news. The motel has been cleaned and upgraded and is a true bargain. It you think of it, not as a low end hotel, but rather as a high end hostel, you will enjoy your stay. Rooms are small and efficient but clean and comfortable. In fact, after three weeks of travel, sleeping in many different rooms, I found the Days Inn pillow to be the only one that fit perfectly between my cheek and shoulder. Everywhere else I traveled, I had to choose between  using one pillow (too thin) or two (too thick) with the resulting neck pain. The desk attendant here, when we arrived around midnight, was courteous and helpful (the lot being full, she allowed us to park in a "handicapped" space no one else would have used). Rooms have refrigerator and microwave, adequate lighting, and room for luggage. The TV has HBO and msnbc included in a long list of regular and cable channels. Ask for a non-smoking room, as some rooms do allow for smoking. And if you want art on your hotel walls, bring your own.I wish I could give this place a zero.  This is probably one of the worst hotel I have stayed in.  The room are dark and dingy, and some even still have the dorrs between rooms that make it so you can hear every move made by the people in the next room.  The staff in the office is aloof and not freindly, lackadaisical comes to mind.  To add insult to injury, I had a death in the family the day we arrived and I am from RIchmond, VA.  We needed to leave the next morning in order to be back for the funeral.  I made the front desk aware of this at check in and was told I needed to contact the third party site I booked through in order to gain a refund for the second night I have already booked.  Fine.  No problem.  I did.By the time I contacted the third party site, they had alredy made payment to Days Inn and the refund process would be completely up to them.  So I called them back.  Each time I called I got a non chalant individual on the other end of the line stating that it wasnt' their responsibility and they couldn't help me.  No "let me see if I can call someone", no "let me see what I can do", and not even an "I am sorry I am unable to refund your night's stay and I am very sorry for your loss."  I will never stay in this hotel again, and I am going back this summer.  In addition, I will probably never stay at a Days Inn again.  I just can't get past the total lack of interest in customer service or the satisfaction of their guests.

hotel_name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Charleston Riverview
review_content: I have to agree with the other Yelpers here; do not stay in this hotel. The hotel was not that nice to begin with when I arrived, but before I left it was even worst. I was in town on business and decided to stay here because I get a discount at La Quinta hotels. I could have paid a little more and stayed some place nicer; I did love the location on the marina with California Dreaming in walking distance from the hotel. The first night was ok; check-in when smoothly, got to my room and it seemed clean until I let down the spread and there was makeup on the sheets, and the bed was very uncomfortable. Anyway I get up the next morning and they do have a meager breakfast buffet with waffles, coffee, cereal, boiled eggs, and bread; nothing really extravagant. So I go to work and come back really tired from not getting much sleep the night before to find that the hotel is flooded. I go up to my room and it is actually raining in my room from a busted boiler they have on the roof; luckily none of my belongings were destroyed. The hotel did move me to a new room which was in their other building this a building with the rooms on the outside of the hotel, no big deal; except you can hear everyone walking by and every car and boat driving by. The next morning I was very happy checking out. I've got to come back to Charleston this week and I think I'll stick to the Hampton Inn instead; it's only $20 more a night without a discount.Two letters. N-O. Please do yourself a huge favor and stay at a different hotel, even if it costs an additional $5-$10. (I wish I could give zero stars on this) First, this hotel has two buildings, the one the show on their website and the one they don't. The other one is outside, and believe me, you know it. You hear cars, marina crew, intoxicated guests at the same hotel, everything. It does not make for a plesant slumber. As for the room, it's small, damp and looks (and smells) in desperate need of a cleaning. The room we stayed in, did not even have a telephone! It also didn't have a trash can, and only one set of towels, with the washcloth already looking rather used. I used my phone to call the front desk to explain and the lady just laughed and said "you ain't got no phone?! That's crazy" (still, they never brought one). In addition, the bath tub bottom was stained black, the mirror had stains/marks all over it and our lampshade looked like it lost a few battles. The desk chair, if you want to call it that, looked like a beach chair with wheels and it was too wide so you couldn't walk past it, you had to move it completely out of the way. It is a poorly planned hotel with completely outdated items. Also, you can't access their wi-fi and when I called about that, they couldn't tell me what to do. Positives: free breakfast and a shuttle to downtown every 2 hours - but make sure you call because sometimes they forget. Overall: please do yourself a favor and choose a different hotel. There are many others and ones that are pet friendly as well.Made a reservation not knowing the hotel, they offered a river view, what a joke not worth the additional cost could barely see the river. Checked into room the bath tub was filthy and hairs from the previous occupants all over the tub and floor, called front desk they said they would send someone to clean it there was also only one towel in the room, we waited 20 minutes nobody came to clean the bathroom we asked to change rooms we had to go back to the desk they had such a care less attitude it was insulting. In the second room, the phone did not work and the ice machine on the first floor (where the room was) also did not work, had to go to the third floor for ice. The pillows were no at all comfortable. The hotel overall is filthy, elevators, floors, walls.We checked in late, otherwise I would not have stayed here, but for sure never will again.If I could give a lower score I would. Hair in the bed, leaky faucet, horrific beds, slow elevators, sorry maintenance staff, rude breakfast staff, etc. I will never go to another La Quinta again after this experience.Pro: close to charleston, good view on harbor, free shuttle every 2 hours to charlestonCons: old sock under bed sheets, dirty shower, not enough towels, weird smell, mediocre service, construction going during stay, crappy roomI will look for something different the next time (i have no idea how that place could have gotten 3 stars on hotels.com)This place needs to get rid of every human working there and start with a clean slate. The worst staff ever. My bathroom didn't have a shower curtain up, so I ask the cleaning lady to get me one, she never came back......2 hours later I went down to tell the front desk that I didn't have one. They finally got me one and I put it up myself. Oh - and the lady that runs the breakfast area is the RUDDIEST person that I have ever encounter. She lacks a lot in the friendly department. She should be the first one to go.THIS PLACE IS A DUMP. I spent four days here and in the most squalid conditons. I arrived late and was given a room in a separate building of the hotel to the back. I got there and the room door was propped open, the curtains closed, and the room was dark. Decided I did not want to subject myself to risk by going in with all my stuff. The desk agent at 1a.m. was very rude(first name starts with T). She transferred me to another room. I had to grab all my stuff and carry it up stairs to the main landing where the elevator is. When I got to my room on the opposite side of the building and a different floor I saw the room did not have curtains on the 6 fot by 5 foot windows. I called desk and when I asked T to please do something about this she hung up.I travel a lot on business and have been to other La Quintas. Nothing prepared me for this place. Socks, broken furniture, and soda cans littered the walkways from my room. The pain was chipped and peeling. My room looked like it hadn't been renovated in 10 years. It had a weird chemical smell. I could go on but you get the idea. NEVER AGAIN!To start things off, the first morning we jump in the shower and get out to realize we don't have any towels in the room. It then took the hotel staff an additional 20 minutes to bring them.That night we come back, we find out someone apparently checked us out of our hotel room a day early so when we can't back to our room the room keys didn't work.The room clearly wasn't cleaned properly- there was hair still in the shower and coffee stirs on the floor.To top it all off, when we went to check out we realized we were way overcharged for our second nights stay. In our confirmation email (and what they quoted us) stated $95 and they charged us $188. They did refund us the difference but it was a total inconveince. That has NEVER happened to us at any other La Quinta.Oh, and the yogurt at breakfast had expired two days before and I'm pretty sure my milk in my cereal was bad. Our next trip to Charleston, we will definitely be finding somewhere else to say. That says a lot considering we're members of La Quinta.Arrived at 10:30pm on a Thursday night with 9 people, and 3 dogs. Reserved 3 rooms 30 minutes prior after a catastrophe at the hotel we booked months ago that was absolutely disgusting. Everything seemed great, lobby was pretty, staff is nice, pets allowed with no fees. Then my husband and I get to our room and the floor is soaking wet as well as both beds, the phone doesn't work to call downstairs so we decide to take the elevator down. The elevator got stuck and they didn't even attempt to help us get out. My husband pried the door open and we stepped up about 2 feet and out of the elevator (sweating). Got to the lobby then didn't seem to bat an eye when we told them we were the ones that were stuck. We told them about the wet floors and they switched our room. Stepped into the new room, light didn't work right off the bat. Fast forward 1 hour, we get into one of the beds and the sheets are stained with brown/red splattered spots (barf). We slept in the other double (all the beds are full size) bed. All in all, this is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed at and its the 2nd one I've tried in Charleston in one night. I'm so annoyed I want to stop my vacation and circle back home to my clean, dry, splatter free bed. Rant over.There are two sections to the hotel, an older part and a newer part. My review covers the older section.I have a tendency to stay at La Quintas when traveling with one of my four footed friends. This one was by the far the worst I have seen. The furniture looked like it had been around since the 70's..scratched and torn. The carpet was so worn it was bare in spots. The room smelt of dust and I had to go out and by air freshener to make it tolerable. I had to ask for amenities like a waste basket. There are no trash cans outside the older section and access to the rooms is from the outdoors. There is an elevator but it was broken the whole 3 days I was there. Contrary to what another review I never heard any barking dogs but there was the flashing light from the marina that was on all night. They didn't change out the dirty towels... the towel for the bath mat was torn. The bed had a huge indentation in it ... the tub was dirty and the hairdryer was covered in dirt. I could keep going on... There was dust an inch thick on the night table. If I could have changed hotels I would have. I did have to use the facilities in the main hotel lobby -- there were paper towels all over the floor and I had to ask for toilet paper. Disgusting ...RUN.... GET OUT OF THERE...You're not leaving... Fine... But remember, YOU'VE BEEN WARNED ! ! ! After my ONE STAR experience with a La Quinta in Savannah GA, you'd think I'd abandon the idea of returning to another La Quinta location. You thought wrong... I didn't have that much of a choice but yeah, here we are back at another La Quinta.A few hours before arriving in Charleston SC, we were using the mobile phone to find hotel; not as easy as I thought it would be, plus we didn't really know the area (first time visiting). Our goal was to locate a hotel in or near the historic district. Most were filled to capacity and those that had vacancy were insanely expensive. I found a La Quinta just over the Ashley River (still very close to everything). SUCK IT UP GLENN, HOW BAD CAN IT BE?Well, I sucked it up, bite the bullet and reserved a room (a room with one king bed)The hotel looked like any other on the outside; a lovely marina view for the rooms on the front side of the building and highway for those facing the back of building. Entering the building was ehh; kinda dated and in need of modernization but not bad enough for us to run (yet). We check in and naturally we request a marina view. She apologized she couldn't accommodate that request because they are full. No problem since we were last minute. We head to the room and turns out we DO have a marina view, but what we don't have is a king sized bed... nope, we have two separate small beds. I head back to the front desk and request a room change to a king bed. She says they have no vacancies and certainly no more king beds. Ridiculous.Things aren't ONE STAR levels yet but after our night out in town we returned to our room with two little beds. I stay up quite late and it wasn't until 3 in the morning that I decided to finally climb into bed. The room was dimly lit from the television and I barely notice something on the pillow next to me... WHAT IS THAT? I don't really want to know but human nature go the best of me and I turn on a light.. OMG it's blood spots (or at least that's what it looked like). Oh NASEAU... I didn't complain to the front desk because I was furious and it was 3 am but I should have known better to stay away from La Quinta. Just like my Savannah GA visit, I checked out early and called that 800 number. They offered the same resolve as in GA (a voucher for a free night). NO WAY, NEVER, AIN'T GONNA HAPPEN... GIVE ME MY MONEY... THIS PLACE WAS DISGUSTING.You can read about my Savannah GA experience here: yelp.com/biz/la-quinta-i...The biggest issue that we had with the hotel....only 3 towels and 1 washcloth for 4 people is ridiculous. We asked housekeeping numerous times and her only answer was that washcloths were a hot commodity. I'm not cool with sharing linens. Oh, only got one bar of soap...not enough with 2 adults and a teenage that loves to take showers. Other issue, every evening we would come back to the room, our ac was switched to heat. In Charleston in July..... Location was just fine.Great location but one can do a lot better. On the plus side, The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were just right. On the negative side, moldy bathtub and bathroom. Inattentive front desk and maintenance service. Small, dingy room with a tiny window whose view of the river was forever blocked by the fog from the air conditioner and the dirty windows. Breakfast was mediocre. Best bet is to stay at the Holiday Inn Express directly across from this hotel. One last item, did I say no hot water? Took showers early in the afternoon and in the evening and the water was tepid at best.This place is dirty. I don't dare touch anything. Hoping the interior sheets are safe.I should have known better after staying one night in a LaQuinta in Columbus, GA years ago. Staff acted like I was a bother to them when I checked in. Our room was acceptable but could have used more soap and wash cloths. Beds were comfortable and the view of the harbor was nice through a sweaty and dirty window. Go elsewhere.In retrospect, I would pay a bit more so that I could be closer to the downtown area. This place is across the bridge from the city. It isn't too long of a drive, but my time in Charleston would have been twice as nice had I been down where everything is.Speaking of location, upon check-in, make sure that you are not down at the west end, near the boat storage place. The walls are thin, and the doors have gaps, so they let in a lot of sound. A LOT! That boat place opens up very early and they start running their machinery. It will make tons of noise, and sometimes vibrate your room. You've been warned. This hotel has certainly seen better days. It is a bit rundown. The ice machines are giant, gurgling antiques and the washers and dryers are boxy, white scratch & dent specials from god knows where. On a pleasant note, the staff seems to be very friendly, and while the place is worn down, it does appear to be clean and looked after. No complaints about what's inside the room. Nice tv, strong wi-fi, comfy beds, and good water pressure.Jessica the lady at the front desk was very nice. That's why this place is getting an additional star. From her alone. She deserves a raise. From outside, the hotel looks nice. Inside is a different story. It is a bit outdated. Once we walked into our room, it felt dirty. And sure enough it kinda was. For four people there was one trash can, three shower towels, and no refrigerator. The bathroom needs to be redone. It too was dirty. But what did I expect? I did get a room for $84 per night with only an 8 minute drive to Charleston.The gm of the hotel ultimately refunded my night's stay (didn't ask for that) and did his best to address my concerns. While my stay was still not pleasant, I still appreciate him taking the time to listen and respond.This hotel is ok. The rooms are a good size and ours was clean and did not smell. They did not clean it the next day, but cleaned it the day after that. We had to get towels at one point as we did not have enough. The pool was closed for 2 days for some reason. There is plenty of parking in the back and on the side.Like all La Quinta this hotel is dog friendly. That's the only perk. I have been Working in hotel consumer service for almost ten years in the napa valley and I cannot even fathom how unprofessional and rude the staff is here. And if you're looking for a clean room and quiet nights sleep and that doesn't smell of pee, then forget about it. Every time I pass the front desk they are arguing with a guest. Did I mention an employee tried coming into my room when I wearing nothing but a towel? luckily I had the flip latch on the door because the "do not disturb" sign and the pad lock weren't enough. Oh it gets worse. After calling the front desk and trying to explain what had happen she starting talking on her radio while I was mid sentence. And it gets better..She had the decency to tell me that it was my fault. If that wasn't the icing on the cake, they scheduled us to check out a day early.. They again told us that it was our fault. My family are members of la Quinta and Marriott... However, while in Charleston we will no longer waste a dime here and I encourage everyone to bring their business elsewhere.
review_content_20: I originally chose the La Quinta as we hoped to bring our dogs along with us on our trip. After reading reviews we saw several that said the hotel will call you immediately if your dog barks in the room. We got spooked as our dog barks during storms and it was supposed to storm all weekend. We stayed at La Quinta Pup-less...and the moment you walk in it sounds like a kennel. Doesn't bother us at all but seriously one dog didn't stop barking for two days and I didn't see or hear about any consequences.We were pleasantly surprised at the look of our room and bathroom. For the cost it was very nice and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and stocked with all the necessary toiletries. The next day our room was "serviced" but the bed was left unmade and the bathroom was not restocked or cleaned. It's as if someone started to clean it, left to get something and forgot to come back. Not a problem, but would've been nice to have a clean room.The complimentary breakfast was fine. If you like waffles you will be pleased, you could also choose bagels, donuts or cereal.I would stay at this La Quinta again if I was on a budget or wanted to bring my dogs.I have stayed at this hotel a few times because it is what I was awarded through a name your own price. For that price, I cannot truly complain; however, for that same price, I have stayed in many other places in the Charleston area for a much better experience. This LaQuinta Inn is dirty and could stand a deep clean. i feel it stands behind a 'don't ask, don't tell' policy. The one thing it has going for it is that it is just around the corner from down town and the service is friendly....just don't ask for much.Staying here to board a cruise the following day in Charleston and this hotel is very convenient. They offer free parking for cruisers while they cruise which is key. Hotel staff was very accommodating at arrival and answered any questions I had during my stay. Hotel overall is in decent shape, it's not the Ritz but overall I would stay here or recommend it to others. Rooms are clean along with free breakfast and wifi is nice. Just could use some updating.I don't think this La Quinta is as bad as some people have said.  It's maybe not as modern as some of the other ones, but I felt fortunate to get a room so last minute and a few minutes cab ride from downtown Charleston.  And our room was not dirty, so maybe that was a past housekeeping issue that has since been resolved.   I thought the harbor view was really nice, both in the day and at night.  So if you can, you will probably want to ask for the harbor view room facing the marina. The beds are nice too, soft and comfy.  The room we were in was roomy as well.  The only thing I didn't get was that the sink was in the bathroom along with the coffee pot and I wondered if poopy germs would get in my coffee in the morning.  But I made coffee in there and I survived so I guess it wasn't a big deal.  The room also had a nice bureau in it too so we could hang up all our clothes and coats, and that was nice.  It's also very convenient that they have a washer/dryer in the hotel and are reasonably priced.Perhaps some expect the ritziness of Charleston at economy level prices and that's just not going to happen at a budget hotel.  But like almost everyone we met in Charleston, folks were very nice and polite here and like every La Quinta they were very cool with our dog.  They didn't care about the breed, or weight limits or anything.  Overall it was a nice stay and I'd stay here again.Room small and very dirty.  Booked for a family of 5.  Got a room with two double beds and not enough room for a roll away.Half a used condom wrapper in the bathroom.  Pubes on the toilet.  Comforter filthy with stains.  Fire ants outside.Generally the whole place looks run down and dirty.Very bland and dated hotel. Great location next to the marina. A lot of water damage in the bathroom. Breakfast shut down completely at 1030am. Not even coffee Overall not bad but could use some updating and more pleasant decor very "dorm" like and cold in lobby.Checked into a king non-smoking room and immediately noticed that it smelled musty. The wardrobe that was provided smelled so bad that I would not hang my clothes up in it, or iron my clothes with the iron stored in there, for fear that it would cause them to smell. The carpet felt damp, the bed felt damp, and the bathroom did not have an exhaust fan to help with the moisture. Even papers that we left out on the nightstand overnight felt damp in the morning. I have no idea what the problem could have been, but I'm not sure how housekeeping did not notice it. We even sprayed the air freshener from the car multiple times to try to hide the smell. For the money, I could easily find somewhere else that does not have a moisture and smell problem. I have always had good experiences with La Quinta in the past, not sure what is going on with this location.Great location, rooms clean, great parking area, staff very helpfulI would give zero stars if I could. My 'executive king' room stank heavily (as in, overwhelmingly) of stale cigarettes and cheap chemical to (attempt to) mask it. Stains on the floor. Dog barking incessantly in the room next door. Noisy traffic from the adjacent interstate. A pubic hair (not mine) on the toilet upon my arrival. This place should be an hourly rental and nothing more. Disgusting.In the past, I worked for more than a decade in the service industry (waiting tables, customer service, etc.), so I'm loathe to complain.  Never have I asked to switch rooms and I've never sent back food in a restaurant.  But I did insist on leaving this hotel at 9pm after checking in, and it took some effort to find a vacancy in town seeing as how it's spring break.  But it was entirely worth the effort.  I was not going to stay there.  No way.  No how.The only redeeming quality of this hotel is that they allowed me to check out without penalty (I think).  Regardless, this was my first and last time staying at a La Quinta.This is not representative of La Quinta or Choice Hotels. My wife and I love to take our dog to Ka Quintas wherever we go, always knowing that our time there will be flawless, and the rooms clean. Here, there were bugs, my room keys never worked, the TV was broke, the a/c made loud sporadic noises, there was no room fridge or bathroom trash can (something I've seen at every La Quinta). The hotel staff was very pleasant and helpful, however they were waaaay overworked for the amount of people this hotel services at once. The hotel has potential to straighten up and shine, but that would require all new management.Pool is small but it is pet friendly and you can walk by the marina and look at the gorgeous boats.  Free breakfast is surprisingly nice!!! Only 2 complaints:  room service did not get to our room until almost dinner and our room had a smoking smell to it- like someone had been smoking in there :( Other than that all was fine.I'm gonna warn those who use Travelocity, don't expect to get what you pay for.  However, when we arrived on August 29th, Mary at the front desk of La Quinta worked out the errors that Travelocity made with our booking and made me very happy.  And she didn't have to.  I really appreciate her!  Thank you Mary!  The weekend was my birthday and our anniversary and I for one, like La Quinta and enjoyed staying in this one in Charleston.  It was nice, a clean room and quiet.  Only heard dogs if and when I walked down the hall and it was only briefly.  But I'm a dog person and that's okay.  I would recommend you stay here.  Easy to get anywhere in Charleston and reasonable.Ok booked this online, I am a loyal LQ customer as we stayed in them all of the way from Seattle during our relocation. we have 2 small dogs and I hate being charged for them. PRO: Convenience, price (gov rate, AAA), location to area, breakfast is decent, but they need to have some biscuits and gravy to change it up, we were here 5 days every day is waffles. Parking is huge we had 3 vehicles one of which had an RV attached no issues. California Dreaming is just down the street (recommend). Linens are very clean and smell like bleach.CON: This is an old property (former Hampton) and they are slooooowly bringing it up to LQ standards. We had numerous issues, all resolved but it took 3 days, the sense of urgency by staff to correct any issues is greatly lacking ( I had to threaten to take my business else where) The night manager feels her only job is to stand there and eat popcorn while you are explaining the issue at hand. And then it is a shrug or "I came on at 3 so I do not know" attitude. Our shower did not drain for 2 days the card reader to get in the room was not unlocking ( still and on day 3). We asked for a fridge and microwave which was brought up the next day thanks to the day manager. Rooms are dingy with old furniture.All in all I think if LQ put $$$ into this property it would be a great place to stay.This was the dirtiest, ugliest place I've been to in a very long time.  I couldn't wait to get out of there.Worst hotel experience of my life. Our room was next to the checkin with no door separating the hallway. When I tried to close it they gave me some bs about fire doors. The lerk shouted all night on the speaker phone and made sitting in the room miserable. The clerk could care less. We were greeted by a loud Machine outside our door very noisy drying out some kind of water spill on the carpet. Shower musty and moldy. Constant screaming from breakfast area. Great view of a parked car. Whoever designs these places must be a Cretan. This place is not fit for human habitation and should be demolished.If you are a light sleeper avoid this place, was not impressed at all. Should have read the reviews on Yelp before I bookedI've stayed here for years because it is affordable, convienently located and pet friendly. The accomodations are fine for a trip where you spend little time in the room, but they are nothing to write home about. I stay here at least two to three times a year when visiting Charleston. It is usually a good value for what you receive; the breakfast is nice and the TVs in the room are as well. My biggest issue with this hotel is the staff. They are rude and not helpful. Most recently, we booked a room with two beds and a sofa through a third party. Upon arrival our room did not have a sofa bed and the staff at the front desk, who is responsible for providing room information to third parties, did nothing, despite the fact that we had one person, with no where to sleep. They also complained about noise in our room. For a hotel with so many reviews about volume, they are sure quick to come knock on your door with a noise complaint, for really no reason at all. Additionally, I had my dog with me on my last trip and we stayed on the first floor. I went outside to get a bag from the car in the middle of the day, and before I was even to the vehicle the front desk was calling my cell phone to tell me that my dog was barking. I had been gone for approximately 2 minutes before they called and rudely demanded that I come back from wherever I was.Only stay here if you are planning to spend very little time actually in the room. It isn't worth the hassle.This place is F-ing disgusting and the manager is incompetent. You get what you pay for, but its not worth more than $60/night.Rooms are just okay as the bathrooms are outdated and the beds are somewhat old and worn. While we were there I saw a new set of mattresses delivered so maybe they are updating everything. The bellhop was a really nice man and helped us bring in our luggage and saw that we had food so he brought a mini fridge in. Staff was friendly and the continental breakfast was standard. The best thing about this place is the close proximity to downtown and the fact that its in a very quiet road which has little traffic. I would come back down here for the location if for nothing elseThis hotel was okay.  It was clean and convenient to area attractions.  The staff is friendly and accomodating.  It had all the amenities that we needed to make our stay comfortable.  There were a few things that bothered me about this hotel.  It's very dog friendly, which I don't mind, but we ended up with a room next to an constant barker.  We also found the internet to be extremely unreliable.  The continental breakfast is good but gets very crowded.  For such a basic room, I found it to be expensive.
review_content_40: Gross. I really wish I had read the Yelp reviews before my boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel. The room was very outdated, which isn't very appealing, but that wouldn't have bothered me that much if it wasn't dirty! The bed skirt was stained along with the ottoman, and the couch. No microwave and no fridge. Which was a complete inconvenient. The bathroom looked moldy and dirty. The wallpaper looked grimy. But, what threw me off the edge was the GIANT water-bug in our room. The thing was the size of a golf ball, and I swear there were more than one. I understand that the hotel is near a marina, but I don't think that's an excuse. I'm pretty sure other hotels exterminate so bugs like that won't get in, but apparently not La Quinta. My boyfriend spent almost 10 minutes hunting the thing down to kill it as I shirked of disgust in the corner. I could barely sleep thinking another one would crawl into our bed in the middle of the night. I would NEVER stay at this hotel again in my life. It's not even THAT close to Folly Beach. Worst of all, this hotel is NOT cheap. For that one night we whipped out $155 dollars. Urgh.We originally booked to stay here for three nights and the first morning couldn't have come soon enough. We took our things and headed to another hotel. One of my worst hotel experiences ever! Room was VERY worn and not clean at all and for some reason when we showered water spilled out all over the floor making it dangerous to get out for fear of falling. The linens were faded and shabby and the bed was horribly uncomfortable. The room was not very clean at all either. I found hair everywhere. We were renting two rooms next to each other for our family.We were put outside at the adjoining building of the hotel.  Our boys had a drunk man banging on their window in the middle of the night and then all night long someone in one of the rooms had a yapping dog. Also at different intervals all night long people would go out on the terrace and yell for people down in the parking lot. My entire family could not wait to get out of this place. I spent the evening there searching online for other places to stay. When I called the desk at La Quinta to complain they acted like they could care less and offered nothing to help make my stay more comfortable. Never again!This La Quinta is in a nice location on a dead-end road, by a marina  across from Charleston. Easy to get into town and within walking distance of California Dreaming, a nice restaurant located in an old fort (hint: try the Bloody Marys). Some of the rooms in the hotel have nice water views and the staff is welcoming and helpful.Great hotel, nice staff, good breakfast.  What more do you need?  Clean rooms, nice views... This La Quinta has it all.  Very happy.Not bad.  Somewhat overpriced because of its location. Staff were all extremely courteous and professional.  Room was very clean.  The only complaints were that the bathroom lighting was inadequate and the  continental breakfast was, at best, so so.  The only protein was in the improperly over-boiled eggs.Walls are paper thin, you can hear someone cough or someones tv/radio on low! Rooms are mostly clean, the bathroom shower/tub was dirty/stained. I stood on a towel in the tub so I didn't get any foot fungi or anything. Parking is kinda limited as well. I'd try to find a better place to stay.Never have I seen so many dogs in a hotel. Easily a dozen. Bedspread stained. Desk clerk friendly.Checked in to a room on the 4th floor with a nice view of the Marina but the room was worn and musky.  The loud AC had to work all night to keep the room cool and the bed was old and scratchy.  The worst of the La Qunita's we've stayed in this past week.  The best benefit was the close proximity to downtown.

hotel_name: Crowne Plaza Charleston Airport - Conv Ctr
review_content: Great stay. Beautiful and spacious rooms. Close to Tanger Outlet and and fairly close to the interstate. About 10 minutes from US 17 and 20 minutes from Folly Beach.  Great sleeping bed, ample free parking. No complaints.the rooms aren't awful but the shower takes forever to get hot and has one of them 2 turn diverters from the 1960s.
