Pain in the ...... to set.The shower curtain bar was updated to the bow variety, but they used the old curtain from a straight bar, so it comes up a foot short on either side.Nice and helpful staff.  OK, pricy restaurant, for what it is.Atrium set up with an active late nite bar full of loud mouth drunken twerps, whom you will hear bouncing of the walls til 1 AM, even though the bar closes at midnite.There are many other hotels in the immediate area.  I have to think one must be better.I had, what I can only image to be, one of the worst hotel experiences here last weekend. We booked this hotel with some hotel points that were expiring at the end of the year and were pretty excited before we got there. My mother called the night before check in to CONFIRM our reservation and the front desk attendant decided to CANCEL the reservation. My mother was very clear that she wanted to confirm and explained this multiple times but the front desk attendant was VERY rude about this. So rude that when the reservation was restored my mom asked what the attendant's name was and he said "have a nice day" and HUNG UP. We thought maybe there was ANOTHER misunderstanding so we just called again and asked his name and he hung up on us another 2 times!!! Finally we called from another number (it became very clear he was screening our calls) and got a different attendant who assured us our reservations were restored. We kept asking about if our points carried over and were still used to book the room and nobody at the desk was sure what to say or do. The morning of our check in we called to ask if we could have an early check in and the desk attendant said no. We called 20 minutes later to ask what time check in was and the attendant said the hotel was not busy and we could check in any time we wanted. (WOW with the miscommunication). While it is located in a nice area, the outside of the hotel looks like an abandoned hospital. Upon check in we made sure the rooms would be booked under the points we used when we first reserved the room and we were assured it would all be taken care of. The inside lobby is beautiful and the layout of the rooms were perfect but unfortunately they were the only pleasurable experience about the hotel. Towels were out in the fitness room both times I visited, there were no cups in the lobby by the water, in the rooms the blankets on the bed were itchy, HDMI port on the TV was broken, the sliding door to the bathroom did not close all the way. I could go on and on but I won't because I think you get my point. The morning we checked out we received our bill and by no surprise we were charged for the rooms and they were not booked under the points we used to first reserve the room. We did try to take care of this three times before and were told it would be taken care of on check in. This was all taken care of by the time we left but if we were in a hurry to check out or if our points did not roll in to the new year this would have been a nightmare to take care of. Frankly I wouldn't be surprised if this was not still cleared up and we were actually charged for the rooms. I would NEVER stay here again. I would not recommend staying here at all. We were HUNG UP ON by the front desk attendant multiple times after he cancelled our reservation. I have never had that happen to me by anyone in the HOSPITALITY industry. I feel so ashamed for whomever did this to us. Be aware if you are thinking about staying here.We were there 2 nights. very nice staff.The bath room is kind of weird, the door can not be locked. And it is not quite, I can hear the noise from the bar in the central of the lobby till mid-night.I booked two rooms from their web sight for one night to celebrate my dad's 75th birthday.  When we arrived at the hotel at about 3:15, one room was ready and one was still being cleaned.  I inquired how long it would take and the lady at the front desk pointed at the sign behind her and said "check in is not guaranteed until 4:00pm.  So, I said that's fine, but she could have  said it a little nicer.  Anyway, as She was checking me in, she said they did have another room with two beds that was ready now.  So, I said Great.  My parents went to their room and I went to mine.  The rooms were nice and clean with mini friges.  My parents room was on the bottom floor and it was very dark because you had to keep the blind pulled so no one could see into your room.   I had also read that they had been renovating and had new mattresses, but it was very apparent that neither of our rooms had new mattresses yet.  They sounded like a haunted house when you got in or out of bed.   So we were taking a rest before going to dinner and when I came down to my parents room they said about an hour after we arrived, someone was using a key card to get into their room.  My dad opened the door and two men had a key card to their room and said they had just been given that room!I have travelled quite a lot in my life and have NEVER had something like that happen.  My parents are in their 70's and I shutter to think about this happening in the middle of the night or when we were out to dinner....only to return and all of their things missing.   So, went to the front desk to ask why this happened and was told "that's already been taken care of".  No apology, explanation or anything.Next morning I received my bill under the door and low and behold it was $25.00 more then what my booking email had given me.   After having another girl at the front desk point at another sign that said "quotes are estimates". I got to speak with a manager and I asked what the difference in price was for and he then proceeded to tell me that when I checked in, that they did not put both reservations on one account, but separate accounts and that he would fix it.  Then he told me the amount....which was the exact same amount as before!  After telling me this same amount several times, each time acting like he gave me the correct quoted price.  He then asked me what I wanted him to do.  I said "I want to pay the amount on my reservation that was emailed to me".  He said "they quoted you the wrong prices."  To which I said "who is THEY?"  I showed him the email confirmation again that said "Crown Plaza" and asked "is this not you?".  He said it was the reservations office in another place not his specific hotel.SERIOUSLY!In the end, he did charge me for the rooms at the price given to me when I made the reservation plus another $25 for my problems.  I told him about the men trying to get into my parents rooms and he said he would look into why that happened.  For that issue, he gave us free breakfast vouchers.While I appreciate the final result from that day, I don't think I should've had to go thru that.  I have never made a reservation just to be told later that the "quote" was wrong.At the same time an addition charge of $275 was placed as a hold on my credit card.  I mentioned this to the manager because they put a hold of $451 PLUS $275 on my card.  He said the $275 would fall off.  So, now almost a week later and it is still on there even after the real charge went thru.  I called the number that was included in the email confirmation and couldn't get in touch with anyone and when you press 0 for the operator you get "this number has been disconnected".Long story, finally got reservation desk, they transferred me to guest relations who wondered why I was sent there!! But took a message and said they would fax the hotel about my issue.Finally, a very nice man named Chris called me and said he would take care of it for me.So, would I stay there again?   Are you kidding?I don't know who is running that place, but they seriously need to get their shit together.  There are way too many other hotels that are less expensive to stay at for a lot less headaches.Super experience here! Some of the highlights:1. This place is SWANK! From the front lobby to that awesome "open-air" bar area to the rooms, this place is a jewel. 2.  Very friendly staff. Both the dude at check-in and the room service lady were very welcoming -- and it was at the end of the day for both contacts. 3. The shower. Modern, large -- and it gets BLAZING hot, quick! (MUCH appreciated after a long day of travel.)4. The gym. It's actually one of the largest hotel gyms I've seen. Jam-packed with gear, it also has a separate sub-room for the treadmill folk. About the "bad" things:1.  Other people have mentioned the noise coming from that "open-air" bar area. It's totally true: even with just the TV on and no people around, that sound is TRAVELING. It seems like a non-issue to ask the front desk to room you away from that noise epicenter, though. Finally, the small things that totally make my day:-- They leave an aromatherapy kit on your bed that is the BOMB DIGGITY! In particular, the "leg rejuvenation" thing was glorious: that, with the super-hot shower, left me feeling pampered afterwards. -- They've got lots o' electrical electrical outlets right at waist level, including in front of the TV. I know, I know: "First World problems" -- but can I help getting excited that I can iron AND watch Law & Order: SVU at the same time?-- The wallpaper: it's a stunner.  Check it out -- tell me I'm wrong. I would TOTALLY stay here again. (Guard your pennies, though! Don't pay the first price you see online. I Pricelined that little baby and ended up saving $45/night.)I travel for work and I was in Charleston for the week. My flight was cancelled and Delta put me up at the Crowne Plaza overnight. I was skeptical, I usually don't veer far from Marriotts and Hiltons, but I have to say the CP was very nice. They are located across the street from the Tangiers Outlets-great outlet shopping if you need anything or just want to shop. The check in process was quick and easy. The lobby has a restaurant to the right and a lobby bar to the left. I would avoid the restaurant, it took forever for someone to seat me--party of one and after 20 minutes of sitting at a table without service I got up and left. There are quite a few restaurant options nearby so it wasn't really an issue. I did have a drink at the bar, the staff were great, seemed on top of things. The rooms were all new and I really liked the decor. They were very clean and the bed was comfortable. I called for some additional pillows and they arrived quickly. Overall a great stay after an annoyingly cancelled flight.I thought this was such a nice hotel it was new and clean.  No issues at all it had the cutest curved chair in the room as well.Loved the shuttle and how fast and courteous is was to my husband and I! The Tanger Outlets are within walking distance with tons of 5star dining as well! The hotel has a small dining lounge one the premises as well. The pool was awesome and just the right temperature!Utilized the Crowne Plaza Hotel for a family reunion, and it was great!These were definitely some of the nicer/more modern hotel rooms that I've ever seen. Very spacious and stylish and wasn't even a suite. Tons of accommodations here from 24 hour fitness, to pool with outdoor fireplace lounge area, to varying sized meeting rooms to do reunion activities in. We had a very large group and actually there were multiple reunions staying here at the same time. We were always accommodated very well and treated well by the hotel staff when interactions regarding reserved areas of the facilities were required.Though there were other families doing their thing as well, no group was ever made to feel less important than any other group (which I've encountered before).Great hotel (across the street from a Tanger Outlet) that I'd recommend!This was our second stayed at the Crowne Plaza for the MUSC Evidence-Based Drug Therapy Update in the last 2 years. I will not be staying again. There was a cockroach in the bathroom that I did not see and stepped on with my bare feet. There were also ants in our room. We brought this up to the front desk who immediately switched us to another room. Unfortunately, that room did not have the same amenities that our original room did. We declined switching to the inferior room and asked what other options there were. The front desk said they would call us back with other options, but they never did. I have never experience such poor customer service before and will not be staying at this location again. I would encourage MUSC to find another location for future conferences.I'm writing this review as I'm laying in bed at the Crowne Plaza, unable to sleep due to the noise level of the patrons at the lobby bar.  As other reviews stated, the hotel has an open design, so from the lobby bar you can see up to all five floors of rooms and noise travels terribly.The hotel is very nice and modern, with a great outdoor pool area.  The beds are great and bathrooms are incredible, there is no bathtub..only a stand alone shower, which is awesome.All of that being said, I would never stay at this hotel again if I needed any type of decent rest.  A lot of aircrew stays at this hotel, and now it is just after midnight and I am unable to sleep due to the noise of the bar, 6 hours before our scheduled takeoff time..for a flight that I am the pilot of.I would have given one star, but I couldn't bring myself to do that because of the great beds and the shower.Came here for a work event and absolutely fell in love with the color schemes and decor in the lobby.  I've been to plenty of Marriotts and high class hotels, but the blues and Southern charm of this one really stood out to me.  Their conference rooms were named after the plantations in Charleston, and there was a large mural of the Charleston harbor hanging near the entrance.  The front desk staff were extremely helpful to me when I needed photocopies made for a meeting and also helped me get the event room set up with materials in a short amount of time.  Would love to come back here to stay sometime.Lovely hotel, amazing southern food, great location if not downtown, very comfortable and nicely decorated rooms.The rooms are so nouveau Classic. Spacious. Couches. Mini fridge and microwave. Beautiful and serene colors in the rooms. I loved my stay here. The design is more consistent with an urban apartment moreso a hotel room. I was immediately reminded of why I love Crown Plaza properties so much.Good gym.Pleasant staff.Airport shuttle.Very comfortable to say the least.I can't find a single thing to complain about this hotel. I loved this place. The rooms were modern, clean, and crisp. (Every hotel should have pocket doors on the bathroom - major space saver!)The lobby bar was good and the food was good. Terrific location with lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance.The chicken spinach ravioli is totally awesome. What great flavor as well a large portion. I forgot to take a picture of my meal because as soon as I took a small bite, it was all over. I must say this meal was a grand slam!"New, Nice, but very uncomfortable, stuffy (poor ventilation) and overpriced!We chose to stay at this location because it is the closest to Tanger Outlets and we primarily came here to shop there. The location is not that bad it's a close drive to downtown Charleston and nearby attractions such as Folly Beach. It's the price for this location that doesn't add up. They do have a Super Walmart within 0.1 miles as well as a Qdoba, iHop, McAlisters Deli, FIve Guys Burgers, Buffalo Wild Wings, and JimNnicks BBQ (great!).The hotel is very new and has a very modern design. It seems relatively safe and well lit especially since it's directly across from the outlets. The staff is very friendly and the place is very inviting. Their gym is average but nice and all the equipment is new. They have a good set of free-weights and some elipicticals and treadmills. The pool is closed until the appropriate season. The other amnemities are a bar centrally located on the first floor with a large screen tv (for watching sports) and a restaurant inside. The bar scene is a turn off as I'm traveling with my family including small kids. The room is very narrow and very stuffy. It looks very nice and everything is very new! Funny because with it being new it really raised my expectations but the bed was uncomfortable as well as the pillows. We didn't sleep well here because of the lack of comfort, there is poor ventilation and the heat/ac unit wasn't working properly, and also due to all the loud inconsiderate group of airforce personnel coming back drunk at 0300 hrs in the morning making noise and hanging out in he hallways. There wasn't a bathtub in our room. You'd figure theyd have enough sense to get us a room with a tub since we are traveling with a 1, 3, and 7 year old. The sink faucet and tv remote werent working, they couldn't fix the sink.If you stay here DO NOT stay on the first floor because the windows face the front entrance and the front entrance invites people to lounge/loiter out there... which they DID all day and night. We had no privacy and couldn't have our windows open because of their modern style blinds only options were open or shut. The tv was very nice flat screen HDTV. There was no eating area in the room itself. They do not offer a continental breakfast so you either have to go to the restaurant or order room service. We ordered room service and it came to $51 dollars and we only ordered two meals and some juices (which we split with the kids).They cleaned our room but forgot to replenish the towel sets.I felt like I had to keep calling guest services for things that should already have been taken care of i.e. the faucet, television remote, and towels.Overall it was not family friendly at all. Maybe it wast the herd of airmen. And not offense, I'm in the military myself, but when you have 150 of single military 21 year old kids staying at these hotels during their training...it pretty much rules out the "family friendly" of where-ever they stay. So I am assuming because this is a IHG partnership hotel (and that the military has a contract with IHG) and they have a huge airforce base here... that they get military personnel here all the time! Anyways, for the price I paid ($131, $150) I could've stayed at much nicer areas actually downtown! That's my mistake though. The only positive is that I got 2,000 bonus points for staying here.Upon our arrival, we were greeted by a handsome duck...and realized there are quite a few in the parking lot.  Be careful, they like to lounge under the cars.  They've clearly been fed by humans, so they'll see what they can get from you, too.At check in, we were told that our room wasn't ready. While this was ok, I really wanted to get a run in before our dinner plans.  The concierge was helpful: stored our luggage, offered us complimentary waters because of our wait, and provided me a key to the fitness center.  While I changed and ran, David read his book in the lobby.  This is a beautiful, modern hotel.  The lobby is very trendy and the appearance of facility is very chic!  We were very impressed at our arrival.  Our room is a spacious size and with a different floor plan from most hotels we've stayed at.  It seems like a great idea having the bathroom located at the far end of the room, but not so great when someone gets locked out and the other person is in the shower and can't hear the knocking on the door.  It is a beautiful room with a beautiful bathroom.  Very fancy.My sleep is far more important and that did not prove to be good.  First, I didn't realize how thin the walls were.  We could hear toilets being flushed a lot and it mustn't said that this isn't something I've noted too frequently at hotel stays.  But this wasn't the worst---it was just loud way too late.  I don't even know what time it was, but clearly the design on the lobby was not created for peace.  The bar patrons were a raucous crowd and woke us a number of times.  We are on the third floor, and down one of the halls, but we learned that the loud talking and laughter travels easily.  I'm disappointed as we both want to sleep well.  Perhaps we will request earplugs tonight.  I do think that at some hour, the at should request the patrons pipe down---but it was Saturday night and I'm sure far more important to the bartender to beta good tip and drunk visitors.  I'm hoping Sunday will be better.I guess alot of people want to stay here because it is close to the airport and out. It is more modern but the walls are thin. When we arrived, there was an event going on so it was packed, so much so that we could barely get to the elevator to get to the room. They should have had a walk way blocked off or something. We had a room facing the lobby area... They had no more rooms, we heard everything all nigt...
review_content_20: 1) noisy hard slamming room doors (poor design)2) air conditioner quit -had to change rooms3) hammerdrill floor below while trying to sleep?!?4) lousy AT&T reception indoors while excellent outside hotel.5) Showers mis-labelled hot=cold.For the room rate charged not acceptableI was really impressed with the decor-- it is a classy modern feel. Checking in at 1PM was convenient, quick and easy-- even though the sign said check in is at 4. The rooms are great -- having the bathroom in the back made the room seem more spacious. The only thing the room lacked was a full body mirror or really any accessible mirror (besides the one at the bathroom sink and a decorative one above the dresser). Great for business travelers bc it has free wifi and a nice desk set up. Great for leisurely travelers because it is right by the Tanger Outlets and the rooms each have a nice sitting area with a small table that can slide under the couch and attractive pillows and ottoman. My only complaint is that there are no vending machines so if you want a Coke, water, snack, etc you have to go to the store by the front desk where everything is $2. Don't buy any food products in there bc the ones we tried were all stale. Definitely a great option for the Charleston area.The room was a home away from home and better.  It couldn't have been cleaner, quieter and more accomodating for a personal or business trip.  Beautifully decorated.Stephanie, the bartender, was great.  I enjoyed her friendly personality.Room was very modern but extremely damp. I live and travel in the South and have never been in a hotel where my clothes were this wet.  They advertised a premium coffee bean for their brew; however, I had better coffee brewed in a 25 gallon vat in the Marines.  Staff was good. Pricey for the location.

review_content: Stayed here for a couple of nights at Christmas. Location was perfect, service and room were great. Big unexpected bonus: free bike rental with lock provided - we used them the entire day to tour Charleston, this was a perfect way to get around and really made a difference for us.Decent location, convenient distance to mostly everything downtown. The staff is friendly and inviting. Hotel has a modern feel. The rooms are comfortable enough, but the hallway noise pours into the room like a freight train. The doors are not privacy doors in the least. The gym is something to be desired. The equipment is some off brand called "Technogym" you can tell that someone who doesn't workout was put to task for buying this equipment. No upright bike, only a recumbent bike. The pool isn't a lap pool, but isn't quite a pool either. The pool and fitness center feel like someone was just trying to check the box rather than putting any real thought into.I booked two rooms for four persons.  At check-in the clerk have me two little milk chocolate squares as part of a points promotion.  One little square per room.  Not one per guest. Didn't make us feel very special. Upon entering one room there was a pronounced burning smell, like a clothes iron left hot on ironing board.  I dialed '0' and waited two minutes for the front desk to answer.  The staff promptly offered to change our room, but didn't seem very concerned that their might be combustion occurring somewhere. There is no apparent ventilation in the bathroom. Excellent if you like saunas after a hot shower, but not otherwise.  The bath towels were all hard and scratchy; the worst hotel towels I've experienced on six continents. Maybe they were supposed to be bathmats.This Marriott Category 8 Renaissance property doesn't have room service!  But the front desk staff will deliver take-out from the in-house restaurant/bar. Thus we got our $23 cheese plate in a plastic take-out clam-shell. Unbelievable. But true. Marriott leaves little envelopes on the bed asking their "guests" to tip the housekeeper.  Marriott charges $200-$500 per standard room but chooses not to pay its housekeeping staff a living wage and then asks their customers to make-up for their corporate parsimony.  Unbelievable again. Bottom line: Lodging in Charleston is expensive.  If you're lucky enough to get a cheap rate, the Renaissance is a comfortable property in an excellent location.  But if you pay top dollar, you will be disappointed at the average service.Location is GREAT for visiting downtown Charleston. Rooms are COMFY and relaxing. That's where the niceties stop. This is the first Renaissance I've ever been to that has neither room service NOR a concierge lounge. The restaurant on property, Barony Tavern, has decent enough food (albeit pricey), but there's no room service. I can get it to go, but they wont bring it up?? Ok, so I got an order to go, I get upstairs and I have plastic flatware and the food is served in plastic containers; disappointing. Marriott.. you need to resolve this, I won't be back at this property until one of the two above are resolved; either get a lounge, or get an agreement with the restaurant for room service, but this is ridiculous. If my wife and daughters weren't coming down this weekend to explore the city, I would move to a different property.Dirty, but expensive. Paid for the privilege of internet access to leave an angry review. No food or drink after 11 on FRIDAY NIGHT in central Charleston. No service - no one working here. Nothing but a motel room, in a "hotel".Great location and a nice, new lobby. The rooms are standard Marriott / Renaissance style, but that is not a bad thing. The staff and concierge were super helpful and gave us some great tips for our short stay in the city. Wish they had given me a later checkout given my status as a platinum Marriott Loyalist, but that's understood as they were sold out the following night.Location of this hotel is incredible, right off king street shopping and within 10 minutes walking distance to just about anything. The rooms are pretty standard Marriott, clean decent amenities and a little on the small side. The staff are courteous and helpful with a navigation desk that can help you book local tours etc. there are also bikes available, it may even be free, didn't get a chance to try it. It really is a perfect choice for being a tourist in town.Just stay here this past weekend. Rooms were very nice, soft beds and big comfy pillows. Enjoyed the room very much. Very large for a place where buildings are close together. Hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating on food locations and things to see in Charleston. The valets were very friend. Hotel gym was small but effective. Nothing to exaggerate.Always fresh towels there to wipe you off. They all so had a small pool to cool down if needed. The hotel is centrally located to every restaurant in the historic district. Really liked this location. My favorite was the hotel bar. Jim was a great bartender and turned out to be a good friend. I can not wait to take my next 3/4 day leave from the military and see Charleston again.Great location to do most all of the historic holy city by foot.  Very comfy beds.  Good buffett for breakfast.  Charming interior.  Very friendly staff, able to give good suggestions on where to eat, etc. Nice fitness facility.  If you own a Tesla, they have a charging station.Stayed here for a night coming from a Marine Graduation on Paris Island. Hotel staff was awesome, room was clean and neat. We were going to rent bikes to ride around Charleston but the hotel had them for us to use for Free! Location is awesome and we walked to a ton of places. Overall sweet stay, self parking was a little high but demand is high in the downtown area. Would definitely stay here again.Their breakfast is really good, especially the bacon and sausage.  The front desk is super friendly.  And the hotel is really pretty.  I enjoyed my stay here. Its centrally located.  You can walk to a lot of attractions and don't even need the car.  We walked to Poogan's Porch for dinner and it was a pleasant surprise.  If you do need a car to go to further away attractions, valet is super fast and they're really nice too.  Definitely happy we saw Boone Hall Plantation.  Thats a must.  And we enjoyed our she crab bisque, thats also something to do.  This was a super fun stay.You are paying for location at this hotel. A bit pricey for what you get. Walking distance to almost everything, free trolley stop right around the corner.My husband and I stayed at the Renaissance from Thursday-Sunday of Halloween weekend. Upon arrival the staff were all very nice and they had a cute Halloween candy display for guests to enjoy. They did not have the room that we requested (are hotels becoming more like rental car companies in that you reserve something specific only to show up and have it be unavailable?), so we had to sleep in what appeared to be a room meant for bridal parties getting ready, which only had a full-size Murphy bed that folded out of the wall. Odd. The staff were very accommodating though and moved our luggage the next day to a room with our requested King bed. They even left us a cheese plate and a bottle of wine for our troubles.My husband paid a little bit extra for two free drink tickets (he thought it was two per day but it was two tickets in total) and breakfast each morning. If you see this package, I would skip it. The breakfast was your typical boring hotel breakfast, and your money is better spent on breakfast and drinks at a local Charleston establishment. The bar was a happening place though and convenient if you want one drink before dinner. The location was nice as well, as you were pretty much in the middle of the city and could walk to Upper King or the water in about the same time. We would definitely stay here again but would cut out the frills like the drink tickets and breakfast.Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly and courteous valet staff right up to check in. Our room was clean, accommodating but our sensor for our smoke detector chirped. One call and they fixed this immediately after we had left for dinner. Our room included a continental breakfast that was anything but! It was awesome and the server, an older gentleman, was superb!!! Also, we asked if we could bring towels to the beach as I left mine at home and next thing I know, they're knocking on my door with the towels. As a Marriott member for YEARS, I knew this would be s great property, I just didn't know it was going to be one of their OUTSTANDING properties. All of the staff we encountered was friendly, professional and even funny, Tamika. The bar staff is knowledgeable and it has a nice ambience. The hotel itself is in the heart of Charleston's downtown district and walking distance to just about everything. I loved my stay and we will book here again!!Great hotel! Amazing location, loved the pool and ambiance...Friendly service.A little weird on the decor but none the less...we had a great experience.Decent enough hotel - front lobby staff are certainly friendly, as they should be for the rates at this hotel. Bummer there's no concierge lounge and the continental breakfast buffet is pretty lame. They work hard to keep it replenished, but it's nothing noteworthy. The rooms are fine, it's definitely a dated hotel with some obvious attempted facelifts (fresh color paint/decor), revised chandeliers downstairs and the bar area is clean, but don't look toooooo closely. The occasional "snack station" in the main lobby is a nice attempt, but the drunk poolside guests clear it of its contents, ultimately ruining it for the rest of the "residents". The evening festivities of Charleston certainly make their way into this hotel too - so don't think you're going to catch up on beauty sleep. Prepare to be awoken in the wee night hours..... Location is truly incredible and nearby food is excellent - so it's all in the trade off.This hotel is a joke!  For the prices they charge the amenities and the service is subpar! Only stayed here two night and I could not leave fast enough. Our room was never cleaned. When we asked for towels, May answer the phone and had attitude. Like it was our fault her staff didn't do their job. The front desk was not helpful at all most of them  just didn't want to get involved. It is a real shame this is a Marriott property. We travel often and we have never experienced the lack of customer service and lack of respect! STAY AWAY!Very nice stay with the family this weekend. Great location on King st. Access and walking distance to lots of great shops and restaurants. We really enjoyed our stay. Shelby at the front desk and Clayton managing our service in conference room were great, very friendly and professional.This is my "go to" hotel when staying in Charleston.  The location is terrific for the walking vacation that I always enjoy while in the historic distric.  The conceirge staff is incredibly helpful and full of brilliant suggestions.It is worth the few extra dollars to stay in such a top-notch accomodation.Very good located, just in walking distance of many of Charlestons's attractions. Good breakfast for the States with fresh fruits but staff could have been more attentive - we asked three times for coffee. We arrived after one of the regular daily thunder storms/rains and found the room wet around windows - no wonder given that one can look outside just UNDER the door to the balcony, it does not close. In addition, the door to the balcony is rotting away. Ouch. Also when we got back after a day out we found our room not serviced. The street where it is located also is currently experiencing quite some construction work. All in all not worth the money they charge at the moment until they invest some of it.
review_content_20: While the Location is Great and the employees are very friendly the place needs more than just TLC it needs major overhaul and renovation in basically all areasThe appearance in the details is not acceptable for a hotel in that category and that price level.Not to recommend for now...sorryGreat location and wonderful service! The staff was friendly and very helpful. The restaurant was closed during our stay, but the hotel compensated by offering a complimentary breakfast and cocktail hour! The gym was really impressive. Our room was spacious and had all of the necessary amenities. We were so central to everything downtown and walked everywhere. We will definitely stay here again.When I arrived it was pretty early (10am or so) and my room wasn't ready yet. I sat in the lobby and answered some emails for about half an hour and they called me to get my room. The lobby staff were very friendly and courteous. One lady even remembered me and would greet me by name every time she saw me.The lobby area has a very grand feeling but isn't terribly comfortable. My room was very spacious, clean and comfortable.As a Marriott rewards member, I did get vouchers for a free breakfast at the cafe in the hotel. This was also excellent and the staff there were very friendly and attentive.In the last two years I have stayed in 75 hotels and 45ish Marriotts.  This Marriott is nicely kept, but the reason it is the single best Marriott experience I have ever had is because of the service.  Abbey Griffiths (manager) and Suzie Cohen (concierge) are by far and away the two best Marriott employees I have ever had the pleasure of interacting with.  Personally I am very loyal to Marriot brands when I can be so this may seem like a skewed opinion, but if I have stayed at 75 hotels in two years think of how fantastic the service must have been from these two to write this kind of review.The hotel was in a great location as well.  I would highly recommend staying here and introducing yourself to Abbey and Suzie.Really like this hotel. Clean, large rooms. Great staff from the doorman, front desk and bartender. Had margaritas in the bar served in a mason jar, a great glass of wine and finished the night with two awesome desserts. Bartender was engaging and friendly. Easy check out good location.My wife and I were expecting this to be similar to the Renaissance in Providence (modern take on a historical property) given their 4 year streak of 4 Diamond awards, photos and other reviews. Instead I would characterize it to be a well renovated Marriott with great bathroom products (Aveda) and a well designed lobby area. Baffling that it's Cat7. Cat 5 is more appropriate. Wireless internet didn't really work - used Wifi card instead.Great for a business stay but I would stay elsewhere for pleasure.Located in the heart of the historic district with great service and comfortable rooms.  Definitely planning a return.I will definitely return to this location. Turn down service and round the clock attentive service is with the cost. Location of hotel is right on, you.This review is for the spa..... I scheduled a spa (basic) manicure and pedicure. First, Van who did my nails was very good and friendly, you can tell she wants her clients happy.The spa itself is not great I was in small room to get my nails done and it was hot!! The manicure chair and even pedicure chair is uncomfortable. The spa mani/pedi is not worth $94.00 as there are no extra services with it and chairs are so uncomfortable making it hard to relax. Just not worth money based on solely on environment....Favorite hotel in Charleston... Close to restaurants and sights.  Plus good workout options in the hotel and next door (gym, yoga studio and spinning facility all three competing for your drop in).  I always enjoy their breakfast in the morning (the smoothie shot is a nice touch) and the bar for a after dinner drink is a fun option too.However, I've had my worst hotel experience at this property.  During my most recent trip I had to request a room change after being awoke at 1:00am by my neighbors.  It was a room connected by interior doors, and I could hear their every word. Not comforting for privacy and relaxation.  I'm in a hotel 100+ nights a year and this was far worse than the standard talking in the hall and somebody letting a door slam when they stumble in at midnight.If I could give ten stars, I would do it without hesitation. Once we arrived, we were courteously greeted, and the bellman took all the bags with us to our room. The entire hotel was stylish and the room itself enhanced that feeling. The rooms are very spacious with a nice view. The people were very helpful and the beds are very comfortable. The hotel offers free wifi, some people were just not connecting to the right network. I highly recommend this exceptional hotel and I would gladly stay in this lovely hotel on my next visit to Charleston.We were in Charleston for a bachelorette party and the Renaissance was the perfect hotel for the occasion. The location was great -- within walking distance to King St, Meeting St and E Bay St. We didn't have to get in the car once all weekend! The staff is very accommodating and the rooms were large enough and comfortable. We also had a mini-balcony, so it was great to be able to open the door and get some fresh air. Definitely recommend this hotel for a weekend away in Charleston!Fruity water, quiet rooms, location,and awesome food best describes the Renaissance. It is the center of action and ambiance no matter the age group. Need I say more? If I ever come back to Charleston this is the chosen establishment I need to frequent. The service unprecedented, The food is awesome too and that includes room service. I regret to inform my desire to run on the treadmill after eating so much was thwarted by some folks not realizing the 30 minute time limit in the hotel gym, Be forewarned! My only real complaint is the 12.95 fee I had to pay to use internet access at the hotel. I believe this should be included in the price as the price per night for a room is quite high.I was also expecting this hotel to be in line with other Renaissance hotels. The lobby is elegant and nice but the rooms are on the small side and outdated. Staff has been super helpful so far and provided us with early check-in which we greatly appreciated.Clean hotel.  Great staff.  Bt the Marriott corporate policy of not offering free wi-fi is a disservice to their higher end properties like this one.  To pay $450/night and then be told at check-in that Internet is an extra $12 is a joke, and diminishes everything else from that point on.  Wake up Marriott!  It is 2012... not 2003.Oh...but at least it is free in the lobby!  Woo hoo!  I suppose they won't mind if the wife and I hangout down there in our pajamas at night, so we can use our iPads and answer business emails??This hotel was very nice. The rooms were average size, average decor and clean. The staff was very friendly and even offered a "navigator" service (we didn't use so cant vouch for how helpful it is). The hotel is walking distance from lots of shops and restaurants and there is convenient parking right across the street in a nice, clean garage. Breakfast and wifi was not included in the room rate - which was definitely on the high end. If i I could, I would probably drop the rating .5 stars for those oversights.  Overall, I would probably recommend this hotel to others.Four star. I am not much of a chain hotel diner but the food was top flight. Grits and scallops rank as my best ever. I doubt one can go wrong with anything on the menu. The place has pride in its food and the servers show it well.Nice rooms and great locationThe ONLY place to stay for the annual Charleston 10K Bridge run. Parked the car across the street and never touched it for 3 days & nights. Small fee for parking - fabulous. The staff is incredible: valet, bellmen, front desk, bartender ( Henry is sooo great at cocktails especially concocting a great drink with Firefly sweet tea Vodka). rooms: wonderfully appointed, great bed. The hotel is on the last 1/2 mile of the bridge run: we run by it and then after the race...walked right back to the hotel. What a super experience: Renaissance has hit a home run here. Look forward to returning for another visit.We have stayed at many of the historic district hotels over the years and this place is one of the best.  Great location. Clean, well-equipped rooms.  The staff are great...helpful and courteous.  Give it a try...you wont be disappointed.
review_content_40: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel.  This hotel was recently renovatated and it shows.  Our room was very clean and beautifully decorated.  The bedding and furnishings were awesome.  Also, the room had a 32" flat screen.  Not that we spent much time watching TV.  wink winkThe hotel is centrally located.  Their employees were very friendly.  I would definately stay here again.The interior shows its age, but is charmingly decorated, staff were top notch (we made lots of requests and they were all graciously attended to) and it's in a great locale (short walk to anywhere you want to be).Perfect location, clean, great service. The best Valet guy I have ever seen/known/experienced in my life. Every Valet guy should take notes from him. Aveda products?!! love it! The gym is perfect with new equipment, televisions, and balls. Great lounge chairs by the pool, although the pool is atrocious. You can fit maybe 3 people swimming. Ha!Overall, happy with out stay. All the great little details that you want out of a hotel.Not what one expects for $470.00 a night...  even at a $40.00 Super 8, I get free internet!!!  small room, no fridge, no view, no mini-bar, no complementary water, no parking ($17 a day to have it driven across the street), NO comp Wireless internet, no continental breakfast, I returned @ 2pm and my room still was not serviced...00.00 of the amenities a professional traveler expects. Staff were very, very nice but in no way made up for the downfalls... I am NOT coming back to the Renaissance and do not recommend you do either.  Cheers and Safe travels to all.A great hotel.  The staff goes out of their way to be helpful and us very attentive to your needs.  Quiet and comfortable rooms.If I could put 0 stars I would. We've stayed at Renaissance in several countries and states and this is by far the worst. Room size and style is a joke, very outdated and cramped for a hotel of this "quality". We tried calling down for more pillows twice and no one answered or assisted. At most hotels they assist you w your bags but they didn't seem to care (or notice) that my 6 month pregnant wife was lugging her bag around. Don't get me started on the fact that they nickle and dime you for everything. Sometimes when you pay $350+ for a room you expect free wifi and some "extras".....but not here at this Renaissance. You must pay for it all. Pool is the size of a large hot tub with the view of a brick building. Not sure what all these people are saying about location. It's decent but not great. It's still a nice walk to anything you want to see, I was expecting everything much closer based on other reviews and price. I know Charleston is a little pricey, but their are other hotels much more convenient and appreciative of your business. I will never stay here again!The staff at this property is great and always willing to work with you. I'd say some of the room decors maybe a little outdated.You'll need to walk a little bit (not far) to get to the heart of Charleston so the location is great and the service is great...not sure what else I can ask for.They don't have a fitness center (at least I don't remember one) at this property. I think you have to go across the street to a local fitness center.I never get excited by hotels.  The ones in my price range are pretty much always the same.  Same boring rooms, same hotel smell, same cheap soap, same crappy coffee maker, same tired staff.  Renaissance shook me out of that boring old cycle.  Their desk staff were really friendly, quick, and professional.  The room was very nicely appointed  It actually looked like the photo above (we even had one of those crazy tube pillows).  The soap and other various toiletries were top-notch.  I don't even go for that stuff so much, but I thought they all smelled great (in a natural way, not like synthy-sweet mega brand soaps).Not that we were there to watch tv, but there was a nice big HD LCD in the room.  The view from the third floor was of a jumble of nearby rooftops.  But everything in Charleston is so low I think you could hardly expect a sweeping view.The fitness center was totally adequate.The hotel's location was very convenient to everything.  We saw the City on foot, mostly, leaving from the hotel each day.Parking is located in the garage right across the street.  $13/day, unlimited access.Nice work, Renaissance.I expect a Renaissance to be a cut above some other hotel chains. We did not find this to be the case. The hotel was well-kept but furnishings and carpetting were old. We had requested a king bed but received two double beds - something that might be due to a travel agent problem.  To compensate, the front desk (very nice) gave us "the nicest view" - a 6th floor room that overlooked a bunch of small buildings...go figure.The fitness center was limited but there was a gym across the street that worked well for the $10 fee.I always choose hotels based on the criteria of clean, comfortable, good location and price.  It doesn't take a lot to please me. this hotel always delivers.  I'm not a big fan of the "southern touches" in the room but hey, do as the locals do. Location and the price I got won me over.After a bit of a rocky check-in from a not-so-happy employee, I don't really have any complaints. The room was very clean and comfortable. All of the other staff I dealt with was very friendly. If any issues did come up, they were quickly resolved. I don't think the pool was heated when I went as it was pretty chilly. The breakfast buffet was really good. Location was GREAT!Stayed here last week for 3 wonderful days in Charleston. This hotel is tucked away downtown. Very convenient. Not over the top fancy, but quite nice.  Starbucks on site. Valet parking. Had a large corner room. No bathrobes. The staff was excellent. Everyone was friendly and knowledgable.  I would look forward to staying here again.I have very few criticisms of this place.  It was one of the best hotel experiences I've had in a while.Our hotel room was exactly as described and was in a quiet location as we requested.  However, you could hear noise from the hallway.  My partner even woke up at 2am because the noise from someone showering next door was too loud.  We would also hear people slamming their doors or kids running down the hallway.There is no place to hang a hand towel by the sink.  You have to fold it up and lay it on the counter.  I would really prefer a nice, simple hook like I find at most hotels.  The only place to hang a full size towel is on a hook on the back of the door.The beds are nice, but they turned out to be too soft for me.  By the end of my three day trip my back was a little sore from sleeping on the bed.The best feature is the heated swimming pool.  No, you won't think you're in Hawaii, but it is warm enough to swim outside even when the weather is 60F and below.  I used that pool twice. The staff were all consistently professional.  I never got the attitude from anyone that "I can't help you, it's not my department".  The front desk people didn't hesitate to pitch in and get me my car when the valet was busy.  The hotel operator was very helpful in giving advice about where to eat.I would definitely consider staying here again the next time I am in Charleston.Great staff. Good location. Soft bed. Nice tv. Concierge was outstanding.The hotel is very nice, clean and located in the heart of Charleston, convenient to historic downtown, the marketplace, restaurants, bars and shopping.  We use Frommers as a travel guide and it has always been very helpful.  It is important to note that of all the hotels in the "expensive" category in Charleston, this hotel was the only one which charged for Wi-Fi, to the tune of $13 per day.  Also, we self parked at the parking garage across the street, for which we paid the hotel $13 per day.  As we departed the parking lot the last morning  at 6 a.m.,  (there was no attendant because of the early hour) the machine which regulates the gate for exit was malfunctioning. Were it not for the man behind us on his way to work, we would have had to pay additional fees just to exit.  It was a fairly tense moment.The location is probably the best part of this hotel- it is conveniently located in downtown Charleston and within walking distance of great restaurants and shops! We stayed here using Marriott points (30,000 points for 1 night), not sure I would be as impressed if we paid the regular rate. The king bed was very comfortable and the room, lobby and hallways were clean. The front desk staff was very friendly, although I was unimpressed with the concierge who was very blase about giving us a dinner recommendation. In the end we got a good recommendation out of him....  after being told it was the busy season and reservations were nearly impossible.

review_content: We finished our stay here. It was a discounted price so we thought great! But you get what you pay for I suppose. We arrived and noticed a bunch of construction.Here is the short list:1. Hotel is under complete renovation (even workmen and orkin on the floor we were staying)2. No pool (that's right it's closed for the time being)3. Moldy mildew smell in room4. Bathroom configuration is completely off. (You have to walk in close door then sit on toilet not vice versa)5. Trolley and water taxi start late in my opinion to take you downtown at 10am (which doesn't allow you much time to beat the crowds - which forces you rent or use your own transportation. 6. Resort fee $12/day (gym, trolley, paper, refreshments i.e. Water n popcorn) plus state tax and tourism tax. So approximately add on 25-30$ per rate to get a better figure of you are budget conscious. Positives 1. Great location just outside the city2. Water taxi and trolley although the schedule did not fit ours.3. The beach and the views spectacular - my toddler loved playing in the sand 4. They will make you a fire pit. All in all I may go back once everything is all finished and updated for a discounted special.The hotel is in an excellent location. The hotel itself is going through renovations. The staff went above and beyond for us! They built a fire in the fire pit on the beach just for my family. We were the only ones out there. That made our stay so special and we will have those fond memories forever!I understand that hotels have overheads, profit margins and other expenses. They need to make money. I get it, but...If I'm going to be charged over $250 per night with an additional $12 per night "resort fee" I have some expectations. I expect my room to be in near perfect condition (this isn't a $34.99 per night place). Please see the pictures of my room, RM 321. At first glance the room was bright and festive. After only a few moments in the room many of the flaws were obvious (dust, rust, disrepair, unsightly outlets). Again see the pictures.Here's the short version. This was last stay here. It's just way too expensive for the convenience of being close to attractions and for what you get. If their weekend rates ($270) were the same as their weekday rates ($125) I would give them 4 stars. But I've been left with the feeling that I've been overcharged. As an added disappointment, I was told that I could not park my motorcycle under the awning on the first day only to find that another motorcycle has been there for the past two days! Thanks guys!Unless you get a rate under $188 ($200 - $12 resort fee) you might suffer from feelings of disappointment.Had high hopes for the trip and while some things fell short others surpassed expectations.Best surprise on the trip was the shuttle into downtown that was included in the daily resort fee and the quick access to the water taxi (not included but right at the resort. One of the concerns I had coming was driving into downtown so having these options and being able to leave the car parked the whole visit was huge.Staff was friendly especially the concierge -Jeffery (I think) who went above and beyond with some recommendations and drawing them out on a map for us which was needed because there was no amenities/attractions book in the room. several times had to call the front desk and couldn't get an answer and room was not fully serviced the first day.The bar has a cool water front vibe though prices are high which I guess you expect at a resort.The room itself was very small and had a feint fish smell. Couldn't tell if that was from the restaurant, the outside or something else. Biggest complaint was the only visible outlet was in the bathroom which had no fan. Had to pull the bed out to access an outlet for the typical cell phone chargers.Pool was nice and chairs comfy, though there were a small family of crabs in the pool so not sure if that is normal or not but was definitely entertaining to see.Overall full price here is way too high, we used a groupon for our rate which is what gets it an okay value rating from usLike an old grand dame who's lost her family fortune, this dump looks like it was once nice. However, since it's no longer nice, the price is an outrage. The basic cost isn't that awful but by the time you add-on a "resort" fee (that's a joke in and of itself) and all the taxes, it was $170/night. I've stayed in Hampton Inns, and Marriotts, and Hilton Garden Inns which are more elegant and far less expensive. The room was small, the bathroom even smaller, and everything was just tired. The room smelled musky (or like onions or cat pee?), the towels were small and worn out. We had breakfast in the little restaurant off the lobby and the cook couldn't make over easy eggs! Soon after I turned mine back because they were hard, the table next to us returned theirs with the same complaint. All in all, find another spot. You'll be happy you did.Absolutely HORRIBLE service. Left the dock master several voicemails, called every phone number on the automated directory and never received a call back after 2 days. We were traveling by boat from Philadelphia and still never heard back once we were within an hour away. Thank god for Charleston city marina! They were great. If I were you I would go to the city marina and not this hell hole!!Poolside drinks are pricey but it's hot out and I don't care!Other than that, this is a decent resort. I'd say a solid three stars. No more though, the pool has been consistently filthy on many of my visits and it's pretty unsatisfactory. Good location, plenty of parking, and fun activities to keep everyone entertained.I hate to pop the nay-sayers bubble, but I also booked through Hotwire and I am totally happy with the hotel, my room, the drinks, the food, the view (did any of the negative Yelpers catch either a sunrise or sunset--awesome), the staff, the parking, and the free bicycles. The hotel is going through a renovation (hence a 1-star deduction), but this is a quality place. I spent around $120 out the door via Hotwire and local taxes/fees. Would return in a heartbeat!I've been here 5 minutes and it's going to get 2 stars already. We booked through club corp which in turn uses a travel agency. We got the best price u could get. With that I don't expect the best views from the room. But really? We r on the second floor, and not only do we have the parking lot view, which I would not care, but we have to largest dumpster site right out out window! I have stayed at cheap hotels that didn't have this kind of view from their worst rooms... Pretty sad. I would never stay here again! It's the middle of March, I'm pretty certain they r not booked up and could have given us a better room!! I DO not recommend, they don't take care of the customer to the utmost!! $300 a night and I'm starring at garbage!!*****UPDATE! Called front desk and complained. At 1st they said that side of building is all booked up!? What? Anyway, it would cost more to move to other side with a view. We told them how unhappy and we would let our travel agent know. 5 minutes later they called back and gave us a room with a view. Thanks! U went from 2 star to 4*****UPDATE UPDATE**** after spending a night in this place, I would NEVER come here again! It's hot as heck in this room and it's 1 am. I'm pretty sure the front desk was aware of this when they moved our room! The fan is so freaking loud it's ridiculous!!! It is outdated! The bathrooms are icky. Do yourself a favor, go elsewhere!We love to visit Charleston as often as we can. Every time we do we stay at Charleston Harbor Resort and Marina. We do this because we know we will have great rooms for the price with extras. I enjoy all of the authentic artwork on the walls. We can depend on the extremely helpful, respectful, caring staff that go out of their way to make sure our needs are met. The breakfast is very good. The pool is ok, nothing exciting but with so much else to do it doesn't matter. It is right next to museums, restaurants, and a golf course. There are activities planned if you want to participate or you can check out a bike an go for a nice ride on the bike path. It is always a great experience.Really loved this hotel and the ambiance. Friendly front desk and staff. Everyone said hello, even the guy pushing trash from the marina. Good ol' southern hospitality. Our room was upgraded to a balcony room with great harbor views. They have laundry facilities, a great bar, and several restaurants onsite plus a free shuttle. Really liked the decor in the room with the bright harbor and beach motif. They also have bikes you can use. Would definitely recommend!I would never stay here again. First, my room had not been throughly cleaned when I checked in - there was a used bar of soap in the shower and no shampoo. This morning as I was getting ready I realized there was no hairdryer. It took 15 minutes and more than 5 calls to get someone to bring me a hairdryer. This place is in need of new management that understands the business travelers or really any traveler and cares about meeting expectations. Finally I ordered room service last night and it was not only the worst shrimp and grits I've ever had, they delivered it in a styrofoam container in a bag. That's take out not room service!Average at best. Poor value for the price. Room was small, bed moved with every breath. View very nice. The pool was nice and clean, no pool service while we were there. The restaurant is good with very nice views of the battle ship. There is construction going on during the day.I would give this place negative stars if I could. It's hands down the worst hotel I've ever stayed at. Don't stay here, motel6 is better. Had bloody sheets 3 nights in a row and terrible service. When we stripped back the bed because we had to change our own sheets, the bed cover was also bloody. Told the staff and nothing happened. And when we checked out and showed the manager pictures, didn't get any compensation or anything. This is the first time I've written a review for a hotel because no one should go through what we went through.We stayed here because of a discounted price we received through Hotwire.com. We ended up spending about what we would have spent to stay at a mid-level hotel. After staying there, I almost felt a mid-level hotel might have been nicer. The room that we stayed in was very outdated. Our view from the patio door with no balcony was of a parking lot visible through two palm trees growing right up in front of the door.There was no place to set up your luggage to unpack because there was very little room between/around the furniture in the room. Nice TV, but no good channels. Staying with a 2 year old and a 4 year old, it's always nice when there's a nick jr or disney jr, but no dice. We turned the tv on the first night and realized there were no good channels, so we watched tv on our own iPads the rest of the stay. Which could have been better if the internet connection wasn't so slow. The mattresses and pillows were very uncomfortable because the mattresses were very dated (I know this because my husband sells mattresses for a living). The pillows were all down pillows, which provides no neck support and leave you a little stiff in the morning. Most hotels provide a couple of different options in pillows, but the Marina did not. The bathroom wasn't necessarily dirty, but seemed very dirty, probably due to wear and tear and the fact that it needs to be updated. Also, they provide a blow dryer in the bathroom; however, the one in my bathroom didn't work (even after hitting the reset button and trying it in several outlets). All in all, I wouldn't recommend this hotel (resort, ha!) to any of my friends. I'm sure there are better places to stay in the area, when we go back this summer, we'll let you know! :)I can't speak for the hotel or the restaurant, but the pool area and the bar are great places to hang out during the warm weather months. The Marina is pretty standard, but no complaints about the slips or the staff. Definitely worth a visit!I stay here 3-4 times per year I don't understand individuals complaining about the cost as this hotel is the most reasonable in the area with the best amendies. They offer great amendies such as a free shuttle to downtown Charleston, free bikes to ride around town, free internet, a board walk, free concerts for guest in the summer, a swimming pool, free coffee/tea, and a very polite staff. I love the fact they remember who I am... It's one of the reasons I keep coming back.Spent the past two nights at this wonderful resort. Was a bit apprehensive due to some reviews mentioning construction noise, but we didn't hear a thing. Got a great rate online, nice view of the harbor, and near the USA Yorktown. Breakfast buffet was expensive ($14.95) and the food was nothing special. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable.Stay there this past weekend, and it was a dismal stay. The room itself seemed nice and clean, and the staff was good, but so many issues, most small, but a couple were large.1. Poor lighting. With every light on in the room, it was still "dark".2. Slow internet. In fact, it would even freeze all together and lock up.3. Curtain wouldn't open. The wand wouldn't pull the curtain open, so I had to pull the curtain from the top to open it, and it cut my hand.4. Shower dispensers not locked. The soap/shampoo/ conditioner vessels had locks, but weren't locked. Anybody could have put anything in them.5. Insufficient fan. The bathroom fan would not clear the room after a shower. I had to use the room mirror to get ready.And these last three, were major to me...6. Nice 42"(?) flat screen TVs, but poor standard def programming. Why have a 16:9 TV when you broadcast those black bars on every channel?7. The ice machine was broke on my floor. I had to go up or down a floor everytime I needed ice.8. And this one made me mad...I had 2 hours to kill, and found a decent movie to watch (even tho it was a poor picture). About half way into it, the picture went away. When I called the desk, they said it was common to lose programming when it rains. Really? I would not go back to this resort based on the above issues.We loved this place. Nice and quiet and not far from downtown. Fort Sumter is incredibly close by.Our room was big with a nice TV and a soft, comfy king sized bed. It was an amazing value because we booked last minute on Hotwire for $60! Of course we upgraded to get a better view and with that fee, the resort fee, and all the fees Hotwire added on it was more like $100, but that was still a great deal considering all the amenities and the level of comfort/how much we loved the room!FYI though, I did not make use of the internet so no comment on that. Also, we only stayed 1 night so we didn't get a chance to check out the restaurant, the pool, etc (plus it was 50 degrees and rainy, and it's an outdoor pool)!I was also very indecisive on whether to upgrade, and we actually used the restroom in the first room before I changed my mind. When I asked for the room change they were incredibly courteous and got me switched over right away.Also, room service was quick and the food was good.
review_content_20: We found this place online and decided to take a chance.  Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised to find a clean, nicely decorated property with easy parking, great access to local venues, and a super-friendly and capable staff.  When we experienced car problems, the staff went out of their way to find us alternate ways to get around including "Ollie the Trolley", their own vehicle.  Restaurant recommendations were great and we actually spent more time on Point Pleasant than in Charleston.  We had a great view of the harbor and marina and my only issues were that the beds are VERY soft - we prefer a firmer mattress - and a bathroom door that wouldn't really shut all the way.  We'll come back again.My husband and I spent our 18 wedding anniversary there. We have paid less for more! The room wasn't up to par nor was the dinning! In fact in the dinning area table clothes were stained, I found a bug floating in my coffee mug! I could go on, however it's really not worth it! The desk staff and bellhops were pleasant. What made our anniversary wasn't where we stayed, it was being together! We won't be staying a second time!!!!We had stayed at this Marriott Hotel at Patriots Point on a previous trip to SC but opted for another hotel on this visit. Big mistake. : /  We did manage to make reservations for Easter brunch at the hotels restaurant though. Good decision. : )) It was wonderful. The tables were set up outdoors and the water view was fabulous. The food was very good. They had an Easter egg hunt for the little ones which was so fun to watch! Excellent job! See you again soon.I was a tad bit wary about staying here after reading the reviews, but in the end I am glad I went to experience a stay for myself. My group arrived on New Years Day and discovered that our rooms were facing the construction site (the resort is building a new hotel next to their current hotel). As we were there for relaxtion, we were worried about the noise (and we wanted a better view). We spoke with the manager and he was able to change our rooms (but not until the next morning). Our new room provided a beautiful view of the water and beach area. Every staff member we encountered were very polite, friendly, & helpful. The resort provided bikes to ride, a van that provided transportation to & from downtown, and a full breakfast buffet (which was free with our package). The best part of the stay was the fire pit. The hotel provides the wood and fires it up. We throughly enjoyed our stay and will return again. The only reason I didn't give them 5 stars was because the beds weren't as comfortable as I would like.Not at all what we were expecting.  Attractive hotel, but rooms are kind of small and outdated.  Our particular room had a view of what appears to be a storage area.  We went out from about 9-2:30 and the room wasn't clean when we got back, so I guess we're not getting a clean room today.  Additionally, there is NOT a beach here.  There is sand that ends at very large rocks.  About 2 feet below the rock line is water.  So our beach resort resulted in a 20 minute drive to Folley Beach everyday.  Oh, and there is ZERO water pressure in the shower.  This place isn't bad, but it's not the fancy resort it's advertised to be.Nice place to stay at a reasonable price. It seems like an older "resort," but it was still a good stay (not the current types of resorts that I typically think of though). I got this stay through Priceline, however, they add an additional $12 resort fee. I think that is something that Priceline needs to work out because it was discouraging to have to pay more when I thought it was already taken care of. I guess part of the resort fee goes to a free 4-hour bike rental and a trolley to downtown Charleston.The front desk asked if I'd like to upgrade with a better view, but for $35-$45 more and the only time I'm in my room is to sleep or get ready, I didn't think it was worth it because I don't stare out my window. You also have to pay for WiFi.It has a great location between the downtown Charleston area (5-8 minute drive) or Sullivan's Island (10 minute drive) or Isle of Palms (10-15 minute drive). It does not have it's own beach, so you'll need transportation to get you to one. But it has a pool.The grounds were clean and quiet. The room was brightly decorated, clean, and did the job! However, the shower curtain smelled moldly/sour and the A/C fan was going all night. Some may like that to reduce any outside noise. I didn't hear any other hotel guest, but not sure if that had to do with the A/C or if the walls are thick. Overall a good place to stay, saved me hotel money, and I was able to have some Charleston fun without breaking the bank. I'd stay there again if that is where Priceline gets for me.Beware, our trip on the 4th of July week was not good...This is what was promised and confirmed with our online reservation:*Beautiful Room with Harbor View, quiet and undisturbed surroundings for the 4th of July week for our Wedding Anniversary, and my Birthday...What happened?*Room was above a loud noisy bar.*Room stay was interrupted and changed to a higher requested floor.*Loud Rock Concert barraging the guests to run and hide!*All access roads were blocked off during times of activities...Huh?*Strangers and Visitors running all over the grounds to hotel, not approved.*For staying 4 nights, we were 'promised' by a temporary hotel front desk person (they did not have a regular staff, overworked by the Holiday) one full nights credit - it never was posted to my account.   A very frustrating experience, and just read the other reviews...what a shame.Stayed here while scoping out places for room blocks for our wedding next year at pavilion@patriots point. We got a rate comparable to Hampton inn nearby, but figured this would be nicer, being a "resort"and all. WRONG. The room is filthy, the bed has a huge sag in the center, and the refrigerator can't even hold one take out box. The bathroom was like something you'd find in a 1986 apartment; tiny, dirty, shower curtain covered in mildew. Just not worth it for the price, and in the summer, it's closer to $400/night. Save your money and stay in Charleston or somewhere else.Just finished a two week stay involving ten other people and nine rooms.Spent a bit of money to say the least.Stopped by the 'Reel Bar" tonight (9:45pm) to grab a bite seeing how we were exhausted a after a long week with limited wifi, dirty carpets, despondent employees and excessive noise.The bar was empty but for four other patrons, yet the bartender told me to "Hurry up and order, because it was late".Really?Wow, what ever happened to customer service?I ordered a plate of hummus and pita wedges and told the bartender I hoped it wasn't too much trouble.He told me "The kitchen staff wants to go at the end of the day".Wow, so do I, but not if I'm on the clock.Perhaps they should all quit and let somebody else fill their positions.I hear there are a bunch of people who would appreciate a job right about now.........Booked a stay here through Priceline- $800 for 5 nights- not a bad deal. You get what you pay for.We asked for early check-in (because check-in is at 4pm, which is REALLY late) and got in around 1. Without paying for the upgrade, we were also given a balcony with a view, which was nice.There really isn't a beach here, it's a marina, so there is sand, but you can't wade out into the water. There is a pool, which is refreshing. One down-side is that if you are looking for some time away, you won't find it at the pool. I was completely surprised by the amount of families and children at the pool each day when there are multiple beaches within a 20 minutes drive! We would return to the pool after the beach and I'd have kids splashing all over the book that I was reading or into my drink- however this is not the hotel's fault, but the parents.One hidden fee that we were charged is an extra $12 a day for Internet, TV, the trolley, and a few other things. Overall, this was NOT worth the expense. While we stayed at the Harbor Resort and Marina, we could get no Internet connection in our room and when we moved into the lobby we still had difficulty getting a connection and quickly gave up. Additionally, the TV's cable stinks. One night we decided to rent a movie on the TV to quickly learnt that they did not have that option, nor did they have very many channels to choose from. It is worth it for the trolley if you have a big group of people and use the trolley daily. It's about a $15 cab ride to and from Charleston, so if you use the trolley, you are getting your money's worth.We did not eat at the hotel, so I cannot comment on the food, however we did order margarita's one day and they were $10 for each. I expect high prices for drinks at a hotel, but this was too much to handle. Needless to say we went out and bought our own tequila and mix to make them in our room and save money.On another note, everyone that we interacted with at the hotel were courteous and nice. I'd recommend staying there because the location was great and the price was right.One thing I was suggest doing while you are at the hotel is to run or walk over the bridge. It has a beautiful view and is worth the effort.I was here in October, 2013. Frankly, the service here sucked. The room was just OK.   The location would have been fine if they actually had a shuttle service that was worth something. For the price, I'll look elsewhere next time.I stayed here recently and loved the place. The hotel room was very uniquely decorated, very beach inspired, nothing like I have seen before. The pool and beach area were great, also cold poolside water! The views are amazing. The best perk is the free trolley service to downtown Charleston and Sullivan's Island. The place is a little pricey but it is worth the splurge. I would stay here again.I agree with Erika B. Customer service was CRAP. Reception staff were apathetic, unfriendly, bordering on rude. (What is up with Charleston's poor hospitality?!)  Concierge is absent Monday-Thursday and when reception told me that information they acted like it was normal.  The bicycles that you can rent are also CRAP - they don't have hand brakes and the seat was so low (and not adjustable) that my knees were above my belly button!On the upside, the room was decorated with fun patterns and colors. The pool was lovely (except for all the kids running around) and the sandy hangout area was relaxing. Very convenient location to the marine museum and the water taxi. Not a bad walk to Nature Adventures (for kayaking) and to some great restaurants on Coleman blvd (Coleman Public House and ZuZu's among them!). Also a nice bike ride away from Sullivan's Island. Room service was expedient and polite and the green salad, fish tacos and sweet potato fries were all delicious (from the Reel Bar). In summary - rude reception staff, but good location and decent food.This stay was somewhere between Meh and A-OK, but I think my expectations may have been too high based on this being called a "resort", and other stays at resorts in Myrtle Beach and hotels in Charleston.We were in town to attend a concert and I was staying on a Groupon.  And while the price was discounted, it was still up there in price.  I believe we could have stayed downtown for what I paid, and since it's the off-season, most of the "amenities" weren't in play here.   The resort fee is $12/per day (per room).  The day we checked in, the gentleman and young woman working the front desk were VERY friendly and helpful, as was the gentleman that I handed the card keys to the day we checked out.  Those I spoke with in between were meh, and the one who got an attitude with my mother after she asked if there was a phone book almost got the wrath.  My moms room was decorated very well - built in cabinets with a cabinet-mounted TV, nice finishes and furniture, with a remodeled bathroom.  My room, directly next door to hers, looked like it was at another hotel except for the wall color and the coverlet across the foot of the bed that matched hers.  Bathroom toiletries are in wall-mounted dispensers which kind of felt cheesy (again, keeping in mind this is touted as a "resort").  Both rooms included small dorm fridges, single serve coffee makers, several glasses and an ice bucket.  While her fridge was hidden in the wall cabinets, mine was sitting on the floor (seriously - the rooms were night and day).
