My TV was on some kind of energy saving crap that made it too dark to see (I finally figured out how to correct this on the TV itself, not the remote, after giving up the night we checked in and just watching Big Bang Theory on my Kindle).It was very quiet both nights we were there - no hall noise, slamming doors or stomping feet.  The bed was comfy, though I wasn't a fan of the small, mushy pillows.  I did like that the A/C could be turned way down, as I am always hot.  No vending machines, you'll have to pay $3 per bottled drink (there were snacks too) downstairs in the general store (closet).  I didn't have any trouble with the Wi-Fi, I was able to check email and surf.The biggest disappointment was the breakfast that was served.  It was part of the Groupon deal, so we had vouchers.  Had I been forced to pay for that, I would have been livid.  Served buffet style with good choices, but they were all cold.  And I don't mean on the other side of warm, I mean cold.  Eating at 9:00 on a Sunday morning, bleh.  Cold eggs, cold hash browns, cold grits, cold coffee.  The bacon and sausage were delicious, so I made a bacon sandwich (which got me the stink eye from the cranky Yankee broad at the next table, mind ya business!).  The 4-year old at the table next to us, after drinking some of the "orange juice" said, "this tastes like water, this doesn't taste like oranges at all".  Out of the mouths of babes - the OJ is so watered down that Tang would be an improvement.  And both mornings we went (the second day was stale bagels to go), the young women working there definitely put off a vibe that we were all inconveniencing them by being there.I read another review about the Yorktown view, which was correct - the Yorktown view is a dirt/mud parking lot, a dumpster, a port-a-john, and in the distance is the bridge and the Yorktown.  Depressing.Nothing was horribly offensive, but nothing was so awesome as to justify the rates.  I think my mom was a little disappointed, though she said nothing since I paid $600+ for 2 rooms/2 nights.  This was probably once a grand dame, and now it just seems a little aged, even with the facelift.The room is a little outdated but the view and staff make up for it.  Would prefer the room to be a little bit bigger.  My room had room for the bed and that was about it.Our room was awesome! It was beautiful and we had a ceiling fan, with is a super rare find in hotel rooms! They have beautiful built-ins cabinets and plenty of room/storage for unpacking! Room comes with a nice size mini fridge and a giant TV! The beds were so comfy, sheets were so crisp and soft and the pillows! Wow! The pillows were like little heaven clouds and they load the bed up with them (which is great for a pillow hog like myself!). The bathroom was beautiful, tub was a deep jacuzzi tub, had rain shower heads, plenty of counter space for all of my hair tools and products too! Plus the staff was awesome - especially the guy who drives the trolly; he rocked!!! Unfortunately, I didn't catch he's name but He gave us a list of awesome late night spots to hit up and every time we ran into him walking around the resort, he was so friendly and always made an appoint to say hi! Great guy! We will definitely stay here the next time we find ourselves in Charlestown for random weekend trip!  Oh and forgot to mention our rate was beyond fair for our stay! Actually, I would say we got this place @ a steal for how nice of a place it is! Great job guys! We will see you all the next time we are in town!Sometimes hotwire hits the nail on the head and sometimes it misses completely.  We had stayed in a 3 star hotel the day before in Asheville and were very pleased then we got here.  Outdated does not begin to describe the room or hotel.  Went to check in at 330 and was told the room wasn't ready. At 430 we finally had a room. Our view was of a storage/trash area and parking lot. Not a single ice machine was working in the hotel. Our door lock died and it took 45 minutes to get into our room causing us to miss the trolly. Room was never cleaned. Every night it sounded like we were above a garage band trying to learn their instruments. The beach was sand on rocks no access to the water.  ( not great for my 1 y/o)The pier was so rotten and splintered I was afraid to let my 1 yo walk on it. And the big one ( I'm a Firefighter) I went down the stairs to avoid waiting for the elevator and found the fire door blocked by construction debris. You give me bad service oh well you risk my family's life you're going to know about it.  I told the front desk and the answer was a unconvincing oh we will take care of it.  The next morning when it wasn't fixed I payed a visit to the local fire station.  This hotel doesn't deserve 1 star let alone the 4 it supposedly received.The location is 4 stars. The rooms are 2 stars at best - average 3 stars. It is a glorified hotel. If you have to be on the Mt Pleasant side, it is a good choice. Check out the aircraft carrier also.Excellent hotel, with a great staff.I stayed at the Harbor Resort and Marina during the offseason (around Christmas) and may not be getting the full picture. I understand that there's a 9 month window under which this place gets fully rocking and rolling, with a beautiful beach bar (respite with fireplaces and tiki huts) and a nice pier overlooking the whole Charleston harbor area.Anyway, the place was very clean, with dutiful housekeeping cleaning the tornado we left them every day. The bartender gave me a beer for free on my birthday. (.....And it was Fat Tire.....what?! NICE!) Wouldn't hestitate to give them another try if I came to the area again. Thoroughly enjoyable experience. I'm docking them a star because they accidentally charged us for an extra day (which has since been removed) and because the prices for the incidentals and food are pretty insanely high. I'll pass on the 4$ "shots" of water, thanks. They also failed to share our outrage over finding a "Palmetto bug" skittering across our floor. (It's a Charleston cockroach.....that doesn't gross us out any less, people)I found this place online, and has become a habit of mine, I called for reservations and found out that this hotel also has a significant discount for law enforcement and government workers, so do not pass this up by booking online.Situated at the end of patriots point the hotel is out of the way from all the traffic and noise of any near by roads, BUT is extremely accessible from Charleston and Mt. Pleasant.  There is free parking in a expansive lot, and I felt my car was safe the entire time.When I checked in the desk upgraded my room without request or price increase to a bay view, which was quite a treat as I could see all the ocean going ships coming and going from the harbor, and I also had a stellar view of Charleston from the window.  I did not have a balcony suite, but beggars can't be choosers.  The room itself was pretty, and I choose that word with care, it was actually pretty.  Brightly painted, bright curtains, white cabinets, flowers placed about.  It felt comfortable and a bit like a freeze frame of what a tourist would think a southern hotel would look like.The bathroom was large and clean, with great water pressure. There was also a mammoth pile of clean towels, so there was zero worry about running low.Outside was cold during my stay, thus no use of the pool, which was nicely situated with a view of the ocean and a tiki bar right next to it.  The hot tub was a different story.  That was fair game even in the 50 degree weather.  I liked the size of the tub, easily fitting 10 or more people, but the water temperature did not get hot.  Warm, yes.  Hot, no.  that was disappointing.Everything taken into consideration, I would choose to come back here for another stay while visiting Charleston in the future.  The staff was giving, and went out of their way with upgrades and suggestions of ghost tours and things to do around the area.  Also, I later found out one of my very good friends spent her wedding night here and could not say enough about how well she was treated.
review_content_40: This was a wonderful hotel located at a pleasing distance from the heart of the downtown historic district. The location offered water taxies to the popular Market St. markets. It offered standard amenities that you would expect to find at a resort but the waterside location with the sail boats docked at the marina could not be beat. We even used the resort bikes to pedal our way to dinner. The rooms were charming and I would definitely recommend other to stay here and I would stay here again.Don't be fooled by the Resort Name - Over priced, poor service, dirty rooms, poor management- I booked through Travelocity with a special rate (if you call $118 a inexpensive rate). It was a resort with a good location so I did not mind paying for a luxury experience- WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT! It started from the second I arrived.First, let me set the stage. Midweek stay, the place was deserted, the parking lot was almost empty and the bar/restaurants had no one in them, the pool/beach area had 1-2 people sitting around. As I stood there waiting to check in, the front desk woman to answer the phone several times. When she finally finished, I presented her with the Travelocity confirmation page at which point she informed me that "THAT' room is not ready. She did however inform me that with a upgrade payment, a room may be ready immediately. I had just driven 9.5 hours from Washington DC. I was further informed in no uncertain terms that it was a non-smoking facility and and I would be CHARGED if I break the rule. Since I am a non-smoker it really is not an issue for me, but, I really did not like the implied threat. I was so taken back by her comments that I seriously considered dragging the manager up to the room both prior to accepting the room and and pre-checkout to ensure we were all on the same page. I informed the young lady that I was going to use the gym while I waited for the room and of course paid the resort fee, which I have no problem with. She prepared me the guest card and directions. l asked if there were lockers, locks showers and towels at the gym for which she replied, maybe, I'm not sure, yes. The fitness center is located 3.5 miles away at a development called I'ON - it is not on site and has a lot to be desired especially when there are top of the line facilities in the area. The I'ON fitness center does not have towels. It would seem to me that the front desk would know this or would make the effort to find out for a guest. They weree pretty quick to collect a resort fee but don't seem to want to provide resort service. Upon leaving, I asked when she thought the room would be ready and was told check in is not till 4 and it may be ready after I get back from the gym but they will call me and let me know for sure. They did call me - at 4:21PM as captured on my cell phone logs.After returning from the gym I was given room 323. For the prices, even under the Travelocity deal of $118 a night, this room was atrocious. It was beat-up, dirty and I was appalled at what I was given for the price. The ancient TV slides out out of the cabinet when the doors were opened (not level) and it had a terrible picture quality. The bathroom has dirt, mold and mildew imbedded in the tile around the tub. No soap in the dispenser at the sink (for 2 days - staff did not even fill it when they made the room up after the first day). It would be one thing to put up with this while looking at a beautiful beach but I was looking at the parking lot. This is not a resort quality room by any standard. Day 2, I went to the lobby around 10:15 for coffee at the coffee station by the front desk to find both empty. What really got me was the same young lady who had checked me in stood there looking directly at me and seeing that there was no coffee. She made no effort what so ever to assist. The most basic budget hotels do better then this.Nice location but absolutely not worth staying at. I was visiting other people who had stayed at The Charleston Marriott which is located at 170 Lockwood Blvd for a lot less. Good location, nice room, nice staff. I was very disappointed that I had made the wrong choice. Don't be fooled about this place - stay elsewhere.The hotel was OK at best. Do not kid yourself....this is not a 'resort'. There are no resort amenities other than a slightly dirty pool and a lukewarm hot tub. The previous comment about the exercise facility was spot on - they really don't have one if you have to go 3.5 miles to get there.We also had an ant infestation where the night hotel staff told us they didn't have anything to deal with it and we would have to wait. And no discount. Yuck. If you stay here rent a car. There are no taxis and the (oft broken) shuttle doesn't run with great frequency or is full many times. If you stay for multiple days it will be just as expensive to rent a car as it will be to pay for all the car service trips. The onsite restaurant is not worth mentioning from any perspective. Same goes for the bar and general service. We got a 'wedding rate' that was over $200 a night. Absurd for what they offer and provide. Save yourself some serious dough and stay at the Quality and/or Holiday Inn Express nearby.The bed WAS really comfy - just make sure there aren't ants in it first....A late addition.....the rate they quote you for a one way airport shuttle is $35. We just got charged $65 because their contract guy was late picking us up and we would have missed our plane if they hadn't called a different service. Why did this become my problem???? DO NOT EVER STAY HERE!!!Be careful with this resort. First problem was they doubled their rate and their reservation person didn't inform is. The trolley service into down was very sporadic and not convenient. Also I got a lot of bites on my ankles. They may have a bed bug problem. I'd avoid staying there.Overall a disappointing experience. This place calls itself a resort and I'm still wondering why. There is nothing about this place that Justifies the price or resort label. Let's start with the room. We were given a room with a nice view overlooking the pool and the harbor, but the Windows were crusted over in what looked like a mix of salt and soap scum. The room itself had no dresser, no drawers to put away clothes. There were some cabinets built into the wall but one had a mini fridge in it, the other had the electronics for the television in it. Speaking of the tv, this one was not formatted to fit the screen and for some reason the volume needed to be turned up to 100% to even be heard, also the remote barely worked and there was no channel guide to be found. Not a huge deal, not going on vacation to watch tv. But it's the little things. Just shows how little they care for the state of their rooms. The iron was broken also, missing a whole plastic panel, with open wiring. ice machine was broken. The bathroom door was a heavy sliding door with no handle and no lock. Meaning to close the door from the inside you had to pull the edge of the door hard and pull your hand in hopefully quick enough so you don't smash your fingers. Again no lock, and even if there was, privacy is compromised due to the 2 inch gap between the door and the wall because of how the sliding door in mounted. The "Resort" has no gym or spa on the site. They suggest you go run over the bridge for exercise. Seriously. Also we were excited about using the water taxi and trolley to get to Charleston. Unfortunately the water taxi was not running when we were there and the trolley only runs every 2 hours. Meaning for a 8 pm dinner we needed to take the 4pm trolley back to get ready to take the 6 pm trolley to town to get our 8 pm dinner. It really cut into the time we had to do things in town. Made use of the Reel Bar for drinks, which was totally fine but not special. As a rule we do not allow housekeeping to come in our rooms so I can't comment on those services. All in all its an adequate place, you get a room and a bed, but for the price and name you expect so much more. Unless you're staying for free there is no way I could recommend it, there's just way too many better options in the area.THIS PLACE SUCKS NOTHING LIKE IT IS ONLINE AT ALL. The area its in it Great but the Hotel SUCKS!! There is black mold in the Air vents if you have allergies BEWARE!! They had to switch rooms for me because I found two yes... TWO cockroaches in my room. There is rust all over the bathrooms. The rooms are disgusting. PLEASE DONT STAY HERE!!I bought a groupon for 2 nights this week...said kids under 17 stay free but beware that does NOT include their breakfast at $17.95 each...what hotel gives adult a voucher for breakfast but not kids? I actually called before we left to make sure breakfast was included for kids...was told it was...that was not the case. The guy @ the front desk told me he "wrote" the groupon & I should read the fine print...I did & it said nothing about children having to pay for breakfast. He argued with me out front and it embarrassed me. Seriously my granddaughters ate 1 piece of bacon & didn't want more because it was raw....the breakfast at hampton inn is a lot better...also 3 towels for 4 people is not enough...only 2 rockers & 3 tables outside...that is not a resort...its' rundown, needs updating...no umbrellas @ pool..tha a/c fan does not shut off & very loud..that is really not a beach...just some sand brought in...this is definitely not the place to stay if you are looking to go to the ocean...or anywhere...I have never in my life had someone at a hotel call me a liar.I stayed there recently. I made a reservation and was quoted on the phone a government rate of $141, the maximum government rate for Charlestown (and for my employer). There was no mention of taxes (assumed there would be) and no mention of additional fees (assumed there would not be). After trying to check in three times over 90 minutes (the room's not ready, and the room's still not ready), they charged a 'resort fee', for WiFi, a shuttle, and the pool. It was $12 a day ("less than we charge most guests!"). I had the choice of either paying them, or leaving. I paid. I put it to the clerk that the charge was unethical, and she would not disagree. (she agreed, actually). She was nice and helpful.I just checked their web site, and attempted to make a reservation. I'm through to the paying part, and no mention of resort fees. Ahh, but if you check the credit card terms and conditions, it is there if you scroll down a popup window: (booking.ihotelier.com/is...). Others describe this type of charge as arising out of either greed or mismanagement (elliott.org/the-troubles...). In this case, I'm left thinking it is both as the hotel was both. I enjoyed part of my stay there, and I could comment on what was good at this hotel, but I found their behavior totally reprehensible, slimey, sleazy, fraudulent, scummy, shameful, scam, and/or unethical (take your pick!). Next time, if it was for work, I would consider going to the Comfort inn or the Holiday Inn (250 Johnnie Dodds Blvd., Mount Pleasant, SC (843) 884-6000) or the Holiday Inn Express ( 350 Johnnie Dodds Boulevard, Mt Pleasant, SC - (843) 375-2600) down the street. If it was for pleasure, I would stay downtown, as it is a happening scene. I'll review Blossom later.This review is based on my experience with the hotel on Friday nights when they put on Party at the Point which runs from mid May to Mid June. As you approach the hotel at the end of Patriots Point in Mount Pleasant you notice all the natural beauty surrounding the property...beautiful fountains in two small lagoons on either side of the road leading to the entrance, Charleston Harbor straight ahead and to your right, a beautiful marina filled with gorgeous boats also to your right, and if you take a minute to turn around you get an exceptional view of the USS Yorktown. The hotel lobby itself is always in nice condition but the few times we have had to speak with staff they do not seem very willing to answer questions or have much friendliness. As far as everything else you encounter when at Patriots Point...you cannot find a much more beautiful location. There is a beautiful pool outside, with a man made beach (with the best sand in Charleston) leading up to the rocks, tiki huts, and lots of great views while taking in the music. The price for admission this year was upped from $5 to $7 and beer prices also were upped to $5/beer. When the weather is right, there's no better place to start your weekend off. Hours only run from 530-930 for the event.I would not stay at this hotel again. The rooms are really small and the bathrooms are cramped. The patterned comforter had some old stains on it and I doubt it was washed. The front desk did not seem very accommodating when it came to requests. We asked where we could get bowls, spoons and milk for the cereal we had brought. The front desk girl has no idea where to get milk. She thought maybe the kitchen. Well, at three in the afternoon the kitchen was not open at the indigo restaurant. When indigo was open, I stopped by asking for bowls and spoons and the girl gave me a hard time saying "you can call room service". I asked her what the problem would be if she gave us a couple of bowls and she just heaved and went to get a couple. Definitely not very accommodating. Sorry grabbing bowls is such a pain in the A for you. Front desk people should have answers. Oh, and we came back to our room in the evening to an uncleared room. Housekeeping working till 5-5:30 pm my ass. Find a better place to stay unless you don't have any needs.Beautiful, clean, big place! We booked a few nights here through Priceline's name your own price and were shocked that they accepted $70. We thought there would be a catch but once we got there, we realized we just got lucky!The resort is quiet and very clean - it's about 10-15 minutes from downtown Charleston and a $15 cab. It was nice to come "home" here and feel like we got away a bit. The pool looked great, though we never actually swam, and there were daily activities (hot chocolate, cook outs, etc.). There is a $12 resort fee for wifi and the trolley, but we took a the trolley a few times and it saved us the $15 cab ride, so it was worth it.The water taxi departs right from the resort, which makes it convenient if you decide to venture into the city that way. We arrived a bit late (after informing them) and they said our room was taken so they upgraded us to a nicer one. So for $70, we had a room with a balcony, view of the harbor and city, and a ton of space. It was just the perfect place to vacation. The bar downstairs was busy but not so loud that you could hear it upstairs. Would go back here in a heartbeat.So far so good! My first time in Charleston and I couldn't be happier with this place. My room is fabulous....I guess this is what they call 'southern charm'. The rooms are adorable - hard wood floors, upgraded furniture, bathrooms re-modeled...so cute! Enjoyed dinner at the hotel bar called Reel Bar - awesome food and great service. I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. Best part is....I pricelined it for cheap!We spent 2 nights here after having spent 2 in downtown Charleston. I have to say we really liked staying on the island. It was so close that it was no big deal to drive over the bridge if you wanted to go downtown and the views of the harbor were really beautiful. This hotel experience totally goes to show that it's all about who you get at the front desk. We booked our room with Am Ex points, so we didn't pay for it directly. When we arrived, we were put into a "standard" room that overlooked the dumpsters (really). The room smelled horribly of cigarette smoke, but was supposed to be non-smoking, so I called and asked to be moved. When I went back to the front desk, a new girl was there and she was so sweet and "upgraded" us to a harbor view room that overlooked the pool and the harbor. Anyway, if you are going to stay here, I think the harbor upgrade is a must."Insects, blood stains, and moist carpet the entire stay!" When I called the hotel directly to book, they stated I needed up "upgrade" and pay more money for 2 queens. I ended up going to Quikbook.com and it had an option for 2 queens at the advertised cheapest rate. I went with my friend as a girls vacation before school started. The room reminds is very Vera Bradley-esque. It ended there. When I opened the closet, there were insects. I saw blood stains on my comforter on the bed. The carpets were moist and damp the entire trip. I believe it was never properly dry, and the air conditioning kept it moist. It was hard to walk around bare feet. The staff was nice enough, but after seeing insects and blood within 5 minutes, I was ready to leave. The location is right off the main bridge, so it's about 5 miles from downtown Charleston, and about 3 miles from Sullivan's Island beach. Great location. Hotel looks nice outside, but inside was another story!One of the most expensive places in/around Charleston. Too much to complain about. Did not live up to expectations at all. We booked the Sumter Suite, big mistake. Had to move to a new room due to noise from air condition units and due to the fact that we could not see out the windows that were corroded over from weather. The real kicker for me was the roaches, which they say cannot be helped in South Carolina, no matter where you stay. I don't live there, so I don't know. Second room was a deluxe King suite, and we were very happy with the room and location of the room, but then the roach's brother showed up, needless to say that last night was a bit restless because every time I heard a scratch I thought I was being carried away. We did discuss with the manager and we were refunded part of our money and he seemed genuinely concerned. The resort itself is absolutely beautiful, but prices need to be slashed much more for fall and winter since many of the ammenities are not available: tiki bar not open; fire pits not burning, etc...if they fix these things, they will do ok.Came here in the offseason (Mid-Oct). Origonally we were booked into a room overlooking the dumpster. After speaking to friendly staff at the front desk, they graciously offered to let us move to a different room immediately. I opted to pay an extra $20 a night for a room with a balcony. They gave us a beautiful room middle unit overlooking the pool with an ocean view. It was totally worth the extra money. We spent a lot of time when we were at the hotel sitting on the balcony reading and enjoying the weather. The hotel is very nice, staff is very friendly. We had a few minor issues setting up the dvd player and had a dead battery in a remote control. Staff came up within minutes to address our problems. Complimentary root beer floats in the lobby every day from 4-5pm also. The pool is very clean, they have a nice jacuzzi by the pool to relax. We scored a great deal (50% off regular rates) to top it off through hotels.com. We stayed here for 5 nights, and hate to move on to our next destination. They also have a free trolley from the hotel into Charleston if you need it. If not, it is a short drive over the bridge (5 minutes into the city). You are right at patriots point, minutes to USS Yorktown and Fort Sumter tours. Plenty of places in the area if you want to go for a long walk. Just ask for a room not to overlook the dumpsters. That would have been a big negative! Other than that, this place is fantastic!Extremely pleasant place (fun-colored furnitures) for a very good price. 10 minutes drive from Downtown.

hotel_name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel & Suites Historic District
review_content: Stayed here 2 years ago for Memorial Weekend. This place was a zoo but nonetheless it was because it was centrally located to all the fun stuff and its historic value that it had.Good ole Southern hospitality was felt. First, my boyf called ahead of time to let them know we were celebrating a special weekend and if they can accommodate us with anything special.At check-in we learned we were upgraded to a suite. What a huge suite!! Not only that but the hotel offered complimentary champagne and chocolate strawberries. I loved that the boyf thought that ahead of time, but it was nice that hotel management honored his request on such a busy weekend.The decor was rather old but then again if you are staying at a place called Historic, what do you expect. You have to valet because of the location of the hotel. However, the valet was fast and we had no problem. Room service were always available and when I come back would have the boyf book this place again.So disappointing!I travel for work and stay at Hiltons whenever I can. This is not by any means the worst hotel I've been to, but it is not up to Doubletree standards. Let me start with things the hotel can do nothing about. The location is awesome! Right next to the market and walkable to pretty much anything in town. Now the rest. The lobby is beautifully decorated and the staff is very friendly. The breakfast is meager, however. Also, the bar in the evening was in the same area as the morning breakfast. Like they literally moved all the stuff off the table and pulled up some stools. It was bizarre. The room was nice enough and clean. I ended up in a suite which was two levels, kind of cool. But the shower was unacceptable. The water basically dribbled out of the showerhead, no pressure at all. Until they do some renovations, specifically regarding the shower, I will not be back. There are so many other options.Dissatisfied. As a Hilton honors elite, I expect a clean room and a room with a view. My room had a view of a roof and balcony extended to the large air conditioning unit, overcoming all sounds in my room. When I ask for a different room due to the view and noise of the AC unit, the huffy staffer snappishly states "sir what would you like me to do about it." First you can move me to a quiet room, second you can take your attitude and stuff it. What a wonderful way to be greeted on a quiet getaway. Will not returnGreat building, great location (next to the market) however the hotel itself is nothing special. here for the night with wife and kids before heading out on a cruise. 5-10 minute walk to the cruise pier. 2 minute walk to Toast for breakfast - highly recommended. The suites have a 2nd floor yet the HVAC control is on the main level. Thus a significant difference in temp was experienced between the two floors. The rooms themselves were average, small cramped shower area. 2 stars. UPDATE: post cruise, our entire gang walked back with bags in tow, left them with the bell hop/valet before walking to breakfast. For this, they get 5 stars! Overall - meh. It will do for a night but anything more, I would reconsider....Wonderful hotel! The location was amazing - super convenient!Our room was more like a suite - it was two floors and had a great sitting area, mini kitchen, and huge bedroom. The bed was comfy, TVs were nice and had a bunch of channels, the showers/bathroom were clean and water pressure was good. The staff were very friendly; the front desk was beyond accommodating. The lobby was really nice and was a great place to take a load off. The only downside was the price but I would expect that for the location and the size of the rooms.Location gets 5 stars. However I'll NEVER stay at this hotel again. Please read on if you care about your accommodations, your money and how you are treated.Layout of room and design off lower interior are. Ok, yeah, you get a cookie at check in. Big deal. That's with every double tree. The big thing is location...you can't beat it. The dining area is ok, and servers are very nice.Issues:-they act like scammers regarding their rates and other fees. They tell you at the reservation stage a rate, what's included , then suddenly during your stay that story changes and they claim it's a AAA rate though you never actually provided or were asked for AAA proof??? When you argue that they charged you crazy lodging fees and dining fees for what WAS free aka comped breakfast, they are rude at the front desk. VERY rude. Especially the guy Jason. He hung up on our party and become very defensive when the bill was questioned. They say that a person greatly defensive when posed a question is already admitting guilt. this hotel staff is shady. -in room there is an ac unit in each room. It's temperamental at best. One night woke up to 72 another 76 another 64. Had maintenance here twice and one time was told. It was because they don't change filters or clean vents enough.-No water in rooms. They don't offer at check in but when you realize this you call then they say you need to ask the desk for water when there. They don't offer to bring to you. They tell you to come down to get it. I find that funny not because I feel entitled or am lazy but in hospitality services typically they'd offer giving you the options to come yourself!-leaking faucets. Omg, how can they not fix this little random stuff?? A new washer is all they need. I've had to listen to leaking faucets for days.-I was on fifth floor, an honors member suite. It looked clean and tidy but I saw 3 bugs in 3 days in the hotel too close for my comfort. Two in my room and one in hotel hallway on another floor. They looked like roaches. It was enough to cause me to not sleep well. I did check bed but I still felt gross. I also had volleyed say they saw them in elevator and on 3rd and fourth floor.-$40 hotel tax per night?? In addition to all the typical hotel taxes you would pay for lodging state etc? Strangely high. -No shuttle service, no room service after like 7pm. No store on site for guests but when you go out to find store everything closes at Sun down.do you are stuck until the next day. You'd think they offer a cookie, ha ha!-scent of water mildew as you enter rooms.what's the deal? If they had water damage they've hidden it well.but the smell is coming from SOMEWHERE and I'm on fifth floor!-alarm clock cubes...No led display that's lit. We all had same issue. So it wasn't just mine. So odd. Can't see any info on the screen and you needed to unplug or that alarm hours off all hours. Also one of our room telephones had zero service. They said it was MY NOT HAVING THE LIGHT SWITCH ON. I'm like, no, it's you not having working telephones. Never had a stay like this in twenty years with a Hilton hotel. This place...Never again!Ah, room 373. Inconveniently located behind the gym on the 3rd floor, & certainly not between room 371 and 375, where any normal person would expect it. That way you can wander around looking for it until you go back down to the front desk and ask where it is.Once inside, after realizing it is not a coat closet, you can focus on taking the coat hangers out of your actual closet to get the roaches off the top of the window box that holds the curtains, which is seemingly designed to have just a tiny enough crack on all sides to give roaches a nice roach sanctuary. But really, this room is smaller than my bedroom in a NYC apartment.In the morning, you will be awoken as your room literally shakes over and over again over the course of the hours from 6-9am. Is there a fight happening next door? Should you call the cops? Seems to irregular and non-vocal to be a fight...no, that's just the gym weights being slammed against the wall shared by your headboard as they are re-racked! Why the hotel would arrange the gym in a fashion to disturb a room every morning and night, is beyond me.Bonus complaint: when the sheets were changed the duvet had a brown sticky spot on it. What even was it? How wouldn't you notice it since it's in the middle of the duvet?Perhaps the other rooms in this hotel are nice. But it makes no sense to have this terrible, cramped corner of this building be made into this excuse of a room.This hotel doesn't even deserve 1 star. As a frequent traveler I've stayed in many hotels and this was one of the most disgusting establishments I've ever had to stay in. First off, as other reviewers have mentioned, this hotel has a HUGE COCKROACH problem and infestation. This building needs to be cleared out, cleaned and bombed by an exterminator. Hello board of health, this needs to be addressed! And they are charging over $330 per night! Ha! Let me begin by saying my stay in Charelston was for work and the company booked our hotel rooms so therefore I was not paying for this stay out of my own pocket, thankfully. Although, what is important is that the work days were extremely early and long and included client dinners afterwards each night, therefore getting a good nights sleep was imperative.When I came across the first batch of roaches they were babies, which I found very disconcerting and proceeded to go down to the front desk to complain. The guy at the front desk seemed unsurprised and bored with the complaint. He offered to spray my room the next am when I was out at work and I gave permission to do so. When I came back to the hotel the next night I confirmed with the front desk that my room had in fact been sprayed. When I got to my room and started to get ready for bed, low and behold there are bigger mid-size cockroaches just chilling in the bathroom, on the sink counter where my toiletries were located, hanging out in the trash, racing around the carpet, ya know just a good old roach party going down in my room. I took photos (of course, although my phone camera just doesn't do it justice) and immediately rushed downstairs to the front desk where I demanded to switch rooms. Once again, I was greeted with an almost bored and unaffected, not surprised employee who informed me that there were in fact no rooms available and that they were completely booked. Unbelievably, I exclaimed to him that he was basically telling me I would have to "sleep" with the roaches for tonight. He confirmed this and told me they could switch my room the following day. I was disgusted, angry, exhausted and freaked out all at the same time. I obviously didn't get much sleep that night and was completely exhausted the next day at work which was a 14hr work day. When I returned the following night after the long day, they did in fact switch my room to another one on the same floor located right around the corner from the roach room! So laughable it was, they said that was what they had available after I shared my obvious displeasure in the turn of events. They didn't really care. Obviously. And guess what?! The new room had cockroaches too! Wow, what a surprise! Beware of staying in this hotel, especially on the third floor. Also worth mentioning: there were several black hairs I saw in both rooms, one on the pillow, several in the bathroom and shower. I have dark blond hair in case you're wondering. Such a terrible experience, and I will never stay in a double tree ever again.A mixed bag. Definitely a 5 for location. You can use their valet (you pretty much have to use their valet to get parking) and walk everywhere in the French Quarter. The service is marginal - not great, not bad (maybe a 3). We had a one bedroom suite. It was nice to have the extra space with a little kitchenette area. I recommend staying off the first floor. There is a lot of activity outside at night. It can be noisy.The fitness center was OK. Nothing fancy, but adequate.One thing that really bugged me was the lack of attention to the amenities in the room. The iron was missing, someone had left a toy in one of the drawers, and the safe was locked. A quality check of the rooms would be a key to improving the experience.Stayed at this location in July of 2014 for a bachelor party. Hotel is in a nice location and pretty central to downtown. The front desk people were very nice. The highlight of our stay here was the delicious warm cookies that we received upon arrival. These where damn good cookies! We actually ended up buying a tin late one night after getting back. The room was nice enough and clean. Whenever I travel I take a flashlight and do a thorough inspection of the mattress, headboard, etc. Until you do this you have no idea how dirty most hotels are. This place was definitely clean and I felt very comfortable sleeping on the mattress after finding absolutely nothing (zero sign of bed bugs).The crowd at this hotel seemed to be the young/party type. For a bachelor party, this place was great, but not sure this would be my top choice for a family. Can't hold this against the hotel, but loud drunk people were disturbing some of the rooms.Fantastic hotel, great location, extremely clean establishment, and the best of the best southern hospitality. If anything is not right, the staff steps up to fix it promptly. Highly recommend for business, family, romantic, etc. Best stay I have had in a very very long time. Kudos to a well run hotel. A little bit more money than courtyard and WELL worth every extra penny.I used some of my Hilton points and I've now stayed in this property twice. As parking in downtown Charleston can be a challenge, I've also taken advantage of their rather spendy Fantastic location that is right next to the City Market and with great access to the downtown area.The first time, I had a bi-level suite with a sitting room and wet bar downstairs and the bedroom area with bathroom upstairs. Very cozy, very quaint, and unexpected. If you're not a stairs person, this might be a challenge. The second time, a standard suite with a sitting area with a separate bedroom area with closeable/lockable doors.In both cases, the rooms were relatively quiet from noise due to neighbors though at one point some inconsiderate folks were shouting in the hallway.Valet parking is recommended. It's $25/day but you have unlimited in and out privileges and they also don't seem to have an issue if you keep your car there for a few hours after the usual check-out time.The free breakfast was nothing special. You'll be better off heading to one of the nearby restaurants for shrimp and grits, or biscuits and eggs.Summary: Great location, good property, great staff.We were in a King Bed Suite and thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. It was quiet and very large. The couch in the sitting room showed wear and tear but that didn't bother us. We were surprisingly happy. Breakfast was solid- eggs any style, sausages, bacon, yogurt, granola, bread pudding /pastries. Front door bellman could have been friendlier but that's a small gripe. Otherwise front desk staff /wait staff at breakfast were excellent.Stayed here while attending the Renaissance Weekend speaker series a few blocks away. It is a very convenient location immediately next to the Market in historic downtown. Valet parking in the underground garage, helpful concierge, small but clean rooms. Fridge in room, microwave at vending areas on each floor. Choose a courtyard room to avoid street noise, which includes restaurant traffic on Market St, a panhandler who plays the melodies of 1980s hits on a xylophone (which projects wide and far) until about 11pm, and masses of tourists on foot. Also be prepared for horse urine smells at the lobby entrance, as the carriage tours hang out across the street.Fantastic location. Nice rooms. Overpriced. Parking rip off.It is next door to the slave market, where there are plenty of restaurants and bars. You can walk to King street where there are more restaurants and bars (and shopping if your girlfriend wants to do that). The hotel is nice, but it usually costs over $250/night on weekends during the spring and summer. It's not worth that much, but it's a good $150/night kind of place. Beware the room service is expensive. It is not like regular room service. They have a partnership with Hank's restaurant next door, so the food will come from there. You will spend at least $40 on dinner, no matter what you end up getting unless it's a burger or an appetizer. Internet access is super slow. If you are not a gold or diamond HH member you have to pay for it. Don't unless you have no other choice. Think of slow dial up. It's that bad.Parking is valet only and it costs $22/night. The valets park in the city garage around the corner. You can park there yourself for 15 bucks (or so I'm told).Ask for room 305. It is larger than the regular ones and costs the same price. It has a huge window overlooking the courtyard.Reservations made by a group we were with that had a full day meeting in one of their conference rooms. We were in room 475... and despite the smaller than normal entrance door... it was a nice suite, with sitting area and working desk, wet bar and a separate sleeping area with king sized bed and it's own TV.Front staff were very pleasant and hepful. Breadkast and lunch and snack served during the full conference day was better than most. conference room was comfortable, with very comfortable seating, chairs and thermostatic temperature control.Overall a very nice experience aside from ONE complaint.. the PARKING... while I don't like valet parking, that is apparently the way to go, but I did park at the deck Friday after 4PM until 4:30 PM the following day for only $20. It was the Bank of Am. bank parking deck asjacent to the hotel. Valet parking was $27/day.They are central to the downtown area and only a stones throw from the "Market"... so if you plan on parking it, and hoofing it around d/town, this may be a desirable location.My girlfriend and me stayed here over the past Fourth of July weekend. We had a very positive experience here. It was located right in the heart of downtown and we could walk anywhere we needed to go. The staff was friendly and courteous. The only problems a that the front desk didn't seem knowledgable about the restaurants in the area but it didn't influence our overall impression of the hotel.Fantastic hotel and stay! They are extremely attentive and kind. The room was huge and very clean. Amazing location! Would definitely recommend this hotel for a visit to historic CHS.Great location but our room was unbearably small and cramped. My hubby and I typically prefer an updated and modern hotel and this was painfully traditional. Not our style. Also, the room was a little dingy.Great service, good staff and the lobby is nice but our room just wasn't that great and it was considered a "suite." We wouldn't stay here again for that reason alone.This hotel has a killer location if you're looking to be in the heart of historic Charleston. Sure, it sucks paying for valet, but i enjoyed not having the headache of searching for parking and just walking out of the hotel to start our day. It was even nicer ending our day not having to drive back to the hotel after exploring the bars of Charleston. i did use Hilton points to book the room, so the room price didn't factor into my equation. It's a little trek through the courtyard to some of the rooms. We were in 303 and it was great, had a nice view overlooking the courtyard. Our bathroom was one of the biggest bathrooms i've ever seen in a hotel, so based on other reviews, that must vary by room?No complaints with my stay here.
review_content_20: Octavia in the breakfast restaurant is a real sweetheart. You can tell God has blessed her to serve others. How refreshing. The hotel is fine and a great location. People are great. Not over the moon property but not bad.I love this hotel for its location.  I can overlook some of the faults, and I still like it, but this particular trip wasn't great...The good stuff:  The hotel is right on the market, in the middle of the best part of downtown.  The hotel is quaint, with a nice courtyard and a lot of roomy suite-style rooms.  The service is good, and very friendly.  The rooms are clean and comfortable.The bad stuff:  Our room overlooked a roof and windows into the next door restaurant.  No view, and not great for privacy.  The front room of the suite has no natural light, which makes it very dingy.  The bathroom is tiny.On top of that, we had a couple bad things.  Our A/C unit was leaking water, which soaked the carpet (and luckily not our stuff).  We had to put up with some repairs and a blower running in our room to dry the carpet.  That was a pain.  We also had a bad room service experience on check-out day.  We ordered breakfast in the room to save time so we could get to the airport.  We were told 25-30 minutes.  I called to check after nearly an hour and was told the order was "on the way."  They called back 5 minutes later to clarify our order--showing it hadn't yet been started.  When it finally arrived the food was good -- but about an hour later than it should have been, which cramped our schedule.I still like the DoubleTree and will go back, but this particular time (maybe my fourth visit?) was not the best.This is the perfect location to stay when you visit Charleston! You can walk to anything and everything. Plus, the valet service (required, $25/day) includes as many pick-ups and drop-offs as you'd like. So, it's easy to go do things a little ways out of town. The staff is more friendly than most hotel staff I've encountered in the States. And, as you may know from other Doubletree Hotels- you get warm delicious chocolate chip walnut cookies upon arrival! :)Have fun!AWFUL!!Awkward room, stained sheets, broken equipment, worst housekeeping and terrible customer service are some of the qualities of this hotel!We had a bad stay at this hotel but what happened after our stay was over the top. We forgot a book which had sentimental value to me. We noticed it 2 hours after we checked out and immediately called the hotel. I remembered exactly where I forgot and gave specific instructions to the hotel. They said they'd call back later in the day. Next day we called to check status and had supervisor tell us housekeeping manager was off yesterday so they'll talk today and get back to me. Next day "I" called and still no progress... After 1 week my husband demanded to talk to the hotel GM. He was responsive. He "investigated" but told us that they took all the right steps and we were wrong implying that we were lying in order to get points and offered a lousy 1000 points to make up for it. After we got offended and furious he said he can do 3000 points (1 night = 50000 points). Totally insulting!! We got mad, told the GM to call if he was going to be seriously trying to work things out and never heard back. Every level of leadership in this hotel is disrespectful and Charleston must be a desperate city for this awful hotel to remain in business and still charge over $200 a night. *For further information continue to read below.The Renaissance hotel was over sold so they sent us here to stay. The price is not cheaper although the quality is definitely lower. We were really tired and in need of a decent place which is downtown to crash, so we didnt really have a choice. We stayed at one of the town houses. That was the most ridiculous room I have ever stayed. The room was tiny and the layout was more than weird. Where should I start..There were old stains on the sheets. We had to tweak the tv's antenna cable to be able to watch it. The phone located in the upstairs was broken. When you missed the housekeeping service , all they do is to leave two towels and toilet paper in a trash bag in front of your door. The housekeeping is so inattentive that they didn't even picked out the filled feedback form that is left on the table before us.The only good thing about this hotel is the cookies that they serve when you check in.This is definitely a great choice if you're looking to be close to all the happenings!I stayed here with a bachelorette party and we were able to walk to meals, bars, shops, and a  farmers market. I'm not super familiar with Charleston (read: not at all), but this seemed to be a pretty central location and it met our needs for the weekend.We stayed in two suites, each with two double beds and a pull out couch, which was comfortable for our group of 9.  We did five in one, four in the other, and I was in the room with five and it never once felt too crowded. Granted, we didn't spend a ton of time in the hotel, but for the time we did spend at the Doubletree, it suited our group perfectly.It's nothing fancy, but it was clean (super important) and in a great location. Also, the staff was really on top of it when called for a cart to bring our bags down prior to departure. Seriously, they were at our room no more than five minutes after we called down. If you're looking for a home base for a fun weekend, this is a great option.I stayed here with my mother, my wife and my 7-month old son from 11/24/14 - 11/26/14.  We read reviews that suggested we stay in the bi-level suite, so that's what we went with.  If you're traveling with one other person, this may be a suitable option.  However, the upstairs is simply a loft with 2 double beds, so there isn't a door to separate the upstairs from the downstairs.  Also, the downstairs area was extremely cramped and the ceilings were very low.  On top of all of this, we had problems with our AC.  I called maintenance and reported the issue, only to have them replace the air filter and tell me the problem was resolved.  Needless to say, the next morning our AC was still not working.  I reported the problem and guest services "upgraded" us to another suite that wasn't bi-level and did have a separate room.  This room was much better and I wish we had stayed in this room to begin with.  On top of switching our room, I was able to get the hotel to comp us on our breakfast at their restaurant and also comp our $25/day parking fee.  To summarize - this wasn't a terrible hotel as it was conveniently located to the Market and King Street, as well as providing adequate comps to cover the issues we had staying here.  However, I probably would choose to stay somewhere else next time.Perfect location with warm and friendly staff. I stayed here with my family and had a wonderful rest. Room is large enough and very comfortable.You can reach all the best restaurants by walk.Strongly recommended.Wow! Got upgraded to a suite after booking an incredible deal on Priceline. Valet parking is reasonable, especially with the attendants willing to get your car at any moment. The central location is spectacular: 2 blocks to the water and adjacent to the street markets.Terrific, friendly service and ambience from the time you valet your car at check in until the moment you check out of the hotel. Suites are small, but beds are extremely comfortable. Breakfast is satisfying. Order eggs any style from the waiter. In and out privileges with car parked by valet.This is in the best location. I had a great room and the staff is very friendly and helpful. Although I was here for work I unfortuently was not able to enjoy the ourdoor market right out the door. I hear it is amazing. Tons of restaurants/bars/shops in walking distance.I want to give this property a 3.5. Great location, friendly staff (minus breakfast personnel), good room, disappointing bathroom, disappointing breakfast experience. I used partial points for this leisure stay and we were welcomed with typical friendly staff, warm cookies, and an upgrade to a slightly larger room (I think we went from a room with 2 beds and a sofa to a jr. sweet, which gave us an extra TV and  separate bed/living rooms. We found the beds comfortable and were pleasantly surprised that our street-facing rooms didn't mean there was unwanted noise (yay not facing Meeting or Market St.). The furniture in the sitting room wasn't exciting or especially nice, but it was clean & comfortable enough. I'm not a fan of housekeeping stopping by in the evening to leave hard candy, but if you are you are in luck.The bathroom set-up featured the separate toilet and shower/tub with the sink out in the open. I appreciated that the sink was not one of those ridiculously high models that I find in lots of remodeled properties (ugh) and it had plenty of space for two people to unpack. The shower/toilet room was small and as is often the case with this sort of setup there was nowhere to put your stuff while showering by which I men my glasses and clean clothing. I hate resting those things on the tank of the commode. The breakfast buffet was flat out poorly managed. M-F it ends at 10am and on day 1 we arrived around 9-9:30. Ours was included, so the hostess had to check her list(s) for our name & room number. There seemed to be at least two if not three different lists of guests she was checking for our name as the printouts appeared to be formatted differently on the different piles of papers she had. Doubletree: this is not working. A line of people built up behind us. Can we get this staff member a tablet OR just a single list?? Then, we had to wait a few minutes to be assigned a table because although there were empty tables, they had not been cleared or set-up. Doubletree: you need to invest in a busboy for your breakfast service. The waitstaff were obviously overwhelmed by getting people coffee and the very few items they might have requested that were not on the buffet. On day two I wised up and grabbed my own coffee from the service in the lobby as we waited for a table to be cleared. The food on the buffet was unevenly restocked. On day one there was almost nothing on the buffet because it hadn't been replenished (don't worry, I was able to get 3 of the final 6 pieces of bacon). There was some food - cereal, baked goods - but not much else and what was there was minimal and obviously in need of refilling since there were still guests coming in behind us waiting to be seated. Forget requesting a refill on your coffee or water. Just get it yourself from the beverage service in the lobby. I'm not a huge breakfast person, so I rarely go out for it and do not think of myself as overly picky about breakfast service. If you won't hire enough staff to ensure there are clean tables AND coffee and other things are delivered you should almost just downgrade to a serve & bus yourself breakfast room like a lower level property would have. The set-up here could not handle busy late weekday mornings. Bellhops were available when we needed them (to store our luggage) and the taxi they ordered for later in the day was waiting for us as promised. They make use of a nicer grade of taxi service too, which is nice (I don't take that for granted). Thank you for making our departure smooth and providing great service to restore our faith in the property's service.Overall, I'm really glad I had enough points to cover the cost of half of our stay because it is a more expensive part of Charleston to stay and because of the segments that were a disappointment.You know how you always receive a survey after staying at a property? Yeah, I didn't get one of those, which leads me to believe that the management is less concerned with folks' feedback on this property because it is newer and in a great location. Yes, we have come to the day when not receiving a survey makes people suspicious.I just stayed here this past weekend and was blown away by the excellent service and clean rooms, as well as the location.As soon as I walked in, the curteous, welcoming staff welcomed me at the door with smiles and were very accomodating. I asked last minute if I would be able to use my Hilton points, and they helped me work with Hilton Honors to make this last minute change. They also upgraded me for the weekend- woo hoo!My room had a pretty good view of Downtown Charleston from the top floor with lots of natural light. Everything was really comfortable and the room was extremely clean. The hotel is valet parking only, but at $22 (compared to the $20+ for self parking anywhere around the area) it was extremely worth it. The valet were extremely friendly and curteous, always offered to help with bag (if we had any), and it was so nice to be able to just walk out the door to our car instead of trekking to it (it was pretty rainy the weekend we visited).Breakfast here was so-so. There are so many wonderful restaurants in Charleston that I'd really recommend going somewhere else. The staff was friendly, but the food was only okay. We tried it on the first morning as it was complimentary with our stay that weekend, but opted for other breakfast places on the other days.Location of this hotel, as everyone else has stated, is PRIME. It's right next to City Market and only a short walk away from everything else downtown. We only used our car to go to Mt. Pleasant, across the bridge. Seriously, everything is so close- the waterfront, tons of restaurants/bars, shops, art galleries, churches.....the list goes on.The location and service of this hotel is what really make it. I felt so welcome and comfortable- I'd return in a heartbeat. Fantastic.This a great location if you want to walk around and enjoy downtown Charleston.  The fact that they offer valet parking in their private garage which saves you from driving around looking for parking is benefit enough to stay here!!It is expensive, especially during the holiday weekend we stayed here, but in my mind it was worth it to be close to everything.  And, it was in line with the price of all the nearby hotels.The room we had with a king bed felt small, as the bed took up most of the room but it was nice overall.Our party of 4 adults and 3 kids booked this through Priceline.  We got a fabulous price and were in a terrific location.  The employees were helpful in helping the Hubs & Brother find a parking space for our ginormous SUV.  Still, the cleanliness of the suite left something to be desired.  It could've been cleaned a little better.As for as location and price...TERRIFIC!!  Just make sure the room is cleaned better.I have been a long time Hilton Honors member, as well as an owner with Hilton Grand Vacation Club.  My family and I have stayed at many Hilton brand hotels over the years and have never had an issue like the one we just experienced at the Doubletree Hotel on Church Street in Charleston, SC. My husband and I stayed one night on Friday, July 26th, 2013. When we received the bill, there was a $1 charge for a "Charleston Police Fund Donation." When I inquired at the front desk about this forced donation, I was informed that the franchise owner of the hotel was on the board of this organization, and he advised the front desk personnel that they were to charge every customer this fee. Furthermore, I was told that they were not required to ask permission or even inform the customer about the charge. Of course, if a customer complained, the charge would be removed. It is my understanding that posting an unauthorized charge to someone's credit card is against the law. However, that is what just occurred at this hotel.  I'm not questioning the value of this organization, and I'm not going to go broke over a dollar. However, using your position as a hotel owner to "steal" money from your customers is not legal, ethical, or justifiable. As a Hilton franchisee, this reflects on the Hilton name. I am appalled that Hilton would allow this type of illegal activity. Forcing every patron to donate to your choice of charitable organization by way of an unauthorized credit card charge is not ok!Very pleasant fabulous location. Breakfast staff very polite and welcomingWent here for a weekend get away. The hotel is situated just next to market street and on the beautiful church street in Charleston. The hotel has a great front desk service that are very friendly and helpful organizing dinners, ... The rooms are roomy and we had a split room with living-room and bedroom.  The living room is small but convenient. We had a good bed that is comfortable to sleep in. The cleaning of the bathroom was questionable. The bathrooms are also a bit dated. One get s the sense that this was once a great hotel, but management is really not on top of operations. The hotel has happy hours 5-7 everyday, but it is not much of a bar. There is no pool, ....  so be prepared. This is a place to sleep!They have a breakfast buffet, that is OK but the selection is limited. For anything extra you have to order from the kitchen and the service is SLOW. Like waiting 15 minutes for a plain omelet. Could be a good experience if they tried  a little harder.So still continuing with the Charleston weekend, we had to have some place to crash, but I was surprised by the Doubletree on a few fronts.  First, it was expensive....like NYC prices?!?!?! I realize this place is smack dab in the middle of everything but this is Charleston.....So let's talk about what they don't have..........they doesn't have a pool????  They don't have a rooftop deck area?????  But do give you a warm cookie if you ask nicely? And the cookies are actually good.The rooms...at least the ones we stayed in were like little townhomes.  Two stories with only 1 bathroom, 2 beds and a pull out bed from the couch downstairs.Valet service is available which in a town with very little available street parking I'd recommend you take advantage of it.From the hotel you are steps away from the Market and close to everything.  I found out later there are plenty of nicer hotels and B&B (which includes breakfast and afternoon cocktails) that are in this hotels price range, so if you are going to stay in Charleston/Battery proper just upgrade as you'll get nicer accommodations and more perks at or around the same price.-Perfect location for tourists-Excellent concierge, valet, and front-desk staff service-Terrible housekeeping service (rude, aggressive, unorganized, inefficient)-Did I mention the location?-Rooms are OK - we had a suite in the courtyard (first time my hotel room has had an upstairs bedroom)-Water pressure was weakI'm a Hilton hotel fan, so I try to stay in Hilton-brand hotels as much as possible, hence this particular stay.  If this hotel was in another location, I probably wouldn't be back.Eh....great location, but that's about it....Stayed here last month for a work function.  The rooms were average - could use some updating as I've stayed in newer, much nicer Doubletree's before.  Rooms are also VERY small - at least mine was.  The bathroom vanity was outside of the bathroom, near the bed...strange.  Beds were comfy, stay was quite which I always appreciate.  The biggest challenge of this place is the layout.  It's quite a walk from the room to the valet section to get your car - valet space is also very small and only 1-2 guys working, so expect to wait for your car.  The doors from the outside going in are VERY narrow....made it quite difficult to get in with your suicases.  I appreciate that it's an older building thus narrow doors, possibly odd layout, but found it annoying for me stay.  Overall not bad for the price and location.
review_content_40: This hotel has an amazing location in the historical district of Charleston.  5 stars for the location.  I found the service here to also be great.  I stayed here for a week, and by the end of the week, the staff working in the restaurant made a point to know my name!There are tons of great restaurants in walking distance around the hotel. There are also plenty of cool things to see around the area, and these are all within walking distance of this hotel.The only negatives here are the high price. You pay a pretty high price for a small room, but in my opinion, the location is worth putting up with the  smaller room. I also found that the wifi was very slow, but that still wasn't enough to upset me. If you have never been to Charleston before, I highly recommend staying here!We took a quick trip to Charleston and with only about a week's notice and a lot of things were booked. I looked at a lot of hotels like French Quarter Inn, Charleston Place and some B&Bs and they are were 250 and up a night. Some of the other hotels (Holiday Inn etc) were booked. So, we stayed here even though the reviews on Yelp are horrible (trip advisor was a little better).  The price here was $80 less a night. Here was my experience on the things I dealt with. We had a true suite. There was a room with a couch, chair desk, table, mini bar, fridge etc with lots of room. The bedroom was spacious. The bathroom was really small, but I can live with that. I was a little nervous because we were on the ground floor and I hoped that people going to the bars and walking around, but I never heard anything. The room was clean. Parking was bit pricey but whatever. It's 17-20 at lots of hotels in places with limited parking. The valets were really quick and I didn't have to wait long for them to bring my car around. The lack of a pool kind of sucks, but knew that going in (can still wish though right?). Basically, you're paying for location. The location is close to everything in the historic district. I didn't watch TV at all, but thought it was odd that the living room had a tube TV and the bedroom had a flat panel. Would have expected some continuity. There was an odd noise (somewhat mechanical) coming from below. I have no idea what it was but it wasn't loud enough for me to complain, but if you're a light sleeper, make sure you aren't on the first floor. Overall, it was fine but I will probably stay at one of the super nice hotels next time.Other than the location the hotel is very non-descript. The price of almost 300 bucks a night is extremely high for the quality and cleanliness of the room.  Please get some mildew remover for the bathroom. I had a bi-level suite that opened onto the courtyard. The bathroom and vanity were too small for much of anything. There is no room for luggage in the upstairs bedroom. The noise from adjoining rooms was extremely loud.  I appreciate historic hotels--but they can and should be in immaculate condition. With all of that said--the location of the hotel was amazing. The staff was polite.  However, even though I am a die-hard Hilton guy, I will likely not stay again at this tired and dated Hilton property when I go back to Charleston unless the price is more in line with its quality.Clean comfortable rooms get them 3 stars.  Abysmal service deducts two.  No one offers to carry bags.  No help finding room (in ancillary building).  Building very difficult to find, and person on phone provided no help.  Whoever runs this place needs to be fired, stat.Wifi didn't work.  Person at front desk said they would call back.  Never did.  Eventually figured it out.  Of course, they jam you $10 for access.  (Whatever, it's an excise tax on those who work.)I may have had higher expectations than this place deserved.  With the word "suites" in the name, I would have thought the rooms would have a fridge at least.  Not mine.  Even though I got an upgrade, it seems to only have given me a balcony in which the door would not open fully on due to how shallow it was.  Could barely fit, and it overlooked an alley.  Thanks for the upgrade.The people were nice, the room average, the air/heat loud, the TV changed channels slowly, the hot water could boil peanuts,  and the coffee maker was on a tiny stand that would make you laugh.  I promise to upload a photo some day.  For the money, stay elsewhere.   I will next time.Although a bit on the pricey side for event weekends (like the Cooper River Bridge Run), this hotel is located right in the heart of the historic district and within walking distance to the market, fantastic shopping and great restaurants. And with a free warm cookie upon arrival, how could we possibly complain?Our room was plenty big for two people, very clean, and had a small balcony. Obviously with this being the historic district, the buildings are on top of each other so not a great view, but come on - why would you book a room in the historic district and expect one? Get outside and walk around; so much to see/eat/buy, so little time!There are a ton of restaurants within a one block walk and a tiny bar area within the hotel that serves breakfast in the morning and drinks the rest of the day (we couldn't get into any of the rooftop bars due to the CRBR crowd, so went back to the hotel and sat in the courtyard where Chris, the bartender, served us drinks in the afternoon - bonus - no crowds and spectacular service!). Free coffee/hot tea in the morning and a Dunkin Donuts right around the corner if you want to grab a cheap breakfast before embarking on your day of activities. Only (minor) complaint was that the temperature in our room kept getting hot and cold without touching the thermostat; guessing because it's an old building and not enough to deter us from staying there again. Be sure to take advantage of the valet parking. Might seem steep at $20 a day, but they are quick to get your car and parking is at a minimum in this area.Room was clean, the front desk was friendly immediately offering directions for our dinner reservations and bringing out a map for us. Our car was unpacked for us and our bags brought to our room by an extremely polite and helpful young man.Could the couch in our room be upgraded, yes but that's my only negative comment.  The Bed is very comfortable and the location is amazing. We are already discussing adding another night to our stay we are so happy.Charleston is my favorite southern city. The hotel's location in historic Charleston is amazing. We had a problem with our suite being on 2 floors and with the way the front desk initially responded. But I was very happy when a manager contacted me and then compensated me for the problem. I certainly will stay at this hotel again.Very close to the Market.  Excellent base to walk and see downtown.  There are various rooms here,  Some two room, some single rooms.  Mostly remodeled now.  With nice TV's.  Can not beat the freee cookies.Parking is expensive is really the only downside.Loved this hotel...and it was because of the customer service we received. A group of my friends stayed here for the bridge run and the hotel is nice and in a good location. Unfortunately there was an issue with the hot water. While this was inconvenient, the hotel went above and beyond to fix the issue and covered our room rate for the entire weekend. You don't get that type of service these days. I will definitely go back in the future.Under construction. Loud banging and construction workers as my view during the day. Also a strong paint remover smell permeating the lobby and halls all day. My other complaint is noise! I can hear every word my neighbors say in the living room part of my suite. Planned on putting my toddler in that room at night and it isn't working out.Location is great though and the staff is friendly. Room is clean but a bit worn and the bathroom is tiny and really like the bathroom of a 1 star hotel....cracks everywhere, a hospital quality shower curtain that leaks and floods the bathroom....Okay if you are just concerned about location. I don't think I'll be back.Stayed for 3 nights.  3 stars for the room, 1 star for the service.Room:-Clean-Comfortable bed-Small bathroom, poor water pressure-Suite with pull out couch was perfect for our family of four.-Paper thin walls = one of the noisiest rooms I have ever stayed in.  I could literally follow conversations from the room next to me.Service-Really, $10/day for internet access??  Ridiculous.  -Despite the hotel knowing that we had 4 people in our room, every day we got 3 bath towels and every day I had to call to request more.-Every day had to call to receive the paper that was part of my room rate.  Was not delivered once.-Took 25 minutes to get help with luggage and our car ($22/day to park) when we checked out.  Was told they lost our request.-Did not get the promised turn down service for the entire stay.Basically, the location of this hotel is superb.  But despite that, I would not stay here again.  There are other options and the Doubletree was a disappointment.This ended up being a great place to stay!  It was smack down in the middle of it all in Charleston, SC!  We were able to valet the car and walk to everything.  I really liked the rooms since they were suites.  Perfect if you were staying with another couple or a group of friends and wanted to separate the rooms and have some sort of privacy.  We ended up with a fantastic king suite facing the front of the hotel and had a beautiful view of the city.  The sunlight filled the bedroom and living room and it was very clean.  It was nice to have access to two TVs as well as a mini fridge to store perishable food.If I had to complain about anything it would be the small bathroom and the 8:00 bang on the door from housekeeping.  Besides that, everything was perfect and I enjoyed the free warm Chocolate Chip Cookies at check-in!The Doubletree was a bit pricey, especially considering I've stayed in luxurious boutique hotels in Chicago and Atlanta for LESS.  They even make you pay an unreasonable amount for internet access!!  I notice many upper echelon hotels are making people PAY for something that SHOULD be included with the room (especially at the price point).  WiFi is a way of life these days, not a luxury.  That said, we always got clean towels, a thorough housekeeping job on the room and very nice valets/bellmen.  It's close to many different attractions and the location is pretty primo.  The venue still needs some updating and improving, and definitely a good polishing.  Upon observation the environment,  objects, walls, railings, even the steel in the elevators appeared, dirty, worn and dingy.  I also would like to see if they could inject some air conditioning in the elevators, it's only a few second ride, nonetheless you're workin' up a sweat until those doors open (especially in that Charleston heat).  I didn't really spend too much time in the facility, since I was busy with all my Spoleto itinerary.  I would say the Doubletree is definitely a nice place to stay when visiting the area, but I have a feeling there are nicer and friendlier accommodations for the money spent here.  I'll be looking for a B & B or something a bit more charming and personal when I return.  However, that said, I will point out that when I was checking out, I got to see a certain celebrity chef checking in, so it's gotta be pretty good.Yep, it's expensive. What'd you expect? It's a Doubletree. It's in a premium down town location. No, parking ain't cheap -- $20 plus tip valet; $14 self park around the corner on Hayne Street (not owned by the hotel). Again what'd you expect? Of course like many nicer hotels there's a $10 per day charge for wi-fi (although I suspect Hilton Honors members might be able to get that fee waved with a "Hilton HHonors Guest Pass" I received a pass because I was there on a negotiated group rate, and our negotiator got free access for all of us, and the above phrase was on the log-in information card. If you belong to HHonors I think you should ask.) Does that cover the typical complaints?  NOw to the good stuff.The staff could not have been nicer and more friendly, whether I approached them at their work stations or passed them in the hall. From the person who met our car and offered to carry our bags to the cleaning crew, all seemed glad we were there. I had a wonderful room in the newer added-on building. You get there by walking across a large interior courtyard. I think you'd get damp crossing it in the rain, because there is no completely covered path from the main building to this one.Room had a hi-def TV attached to a Comcast box (I understand from someone else at the meeting that is not the TV option in the main building). Initially it did not work. A call to the front desk and a gentleman from engineering arrived to check it out in less than 5 minutes.
