Turned out problem was just some loose wires between the cable box and the TV. Quickly repaired. Football game on!The hotel location was supreme. We could easily walk to anything in the downtown tourist area--which of course was part of the high room cost. Would I stay again? yes. Would I think it was darned expensive? you bet. But I got what I paid for.Outrageous price for what you get.  It is advertised as "suites" but I had an ordinary, small hotel room...no fridge, no room for a sofa, absolutely not a suite.  No pool.  No restaurant.  No bar.  For that kind of money I would have at least expected that.  No airport shuttle.  But great location.  The staff, friendly and accomodating.I would not stay here again.  Outrageous price for the low level of what you receive.I have loved doubletree for their roomy suites- meaning two rooms- breakfast included and a nice pool. This hotel featured none of those. A small but comfortable room but in this heat a pool would have been a welcomed relief. Also what is the deal with having to pay for wireless?! For nearly $200 per night, why isn't it included?I was doing a southern road trip with my best friend. Charleston was next on our agenda. We had been so happy with the trip so far. We arrived at the hotel at about 2pm. Valet was confusing as there was no sign and valets were not around. At front desk our room wasn't ready until 4. I understand check-in wasn't until 4 anyway, but staff was rude and somewhat cold. When we did get in the room it was beautiful but the hotel layout was very confusing. They had redone an old building in the back and this is were the room was located. The old building had a terrible smell and seemed dirty. When we went to the concierge to purchase a tour he seemed more concerned with his dinner plans over his cell phone rather than helping us. When retrieving our car to drive to the beach the valet was rude and short. When handing me my keys he held out his other hand waiting for the tip. To top all of this off, when we did check out I noticed $2 on my bill for the Charleston police department fund. Now this is only $2 and I have no problem giving to the police department but to not even ask and to add this to my bill... Once I brought this to front desk she responded with a ,"yeah yeah," and removed it. Makes me think how many people don't check there receipts. I'm sure there are good workers but the staff that we encountered was rude and seemed to be annoyed to be bothered with customers. I will never stay at this hotel again and would suggest to everyone to choose another place to stay.Decent location downtown, but considering how expensive it is, you get a lot more for your money at other locations that are within blocks of this hotel.  For instances, Embassy Suites is only a few blocks away, is generally about $10 cheaper, has more room, has a fridge in the room, has a pool, free breakfast and happy hour.  The last time time I stayed here, the light switch in the bathroom did not work.  i let them know the first night, but five days later, still not fixed.  The parking is completey unsatisfactory.  If often took at least ten minutes to get my car in the morning -- this would be ok if they were busy, but in the a.m.s, I was often the only one in 'line', but apparently they need a line to get moving?  Do not get why this hotel is so expensive for what little if offers.  in addition to the Embassy Suites, Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn, and several local hotels are withing blocks of this place so location does not justify the price.

review_content: Thanks to Marriott Rewards program for 2 free nights at this location. It's not walking distance from the downtown restaurant/fashion/antique districts, but it met our requirements just fine. So, know that there is very little nearby, but you can walk to the river area and view that from the rooms. Since it was a weekend, they gave us breakfast each day for free. Whew!While the hotel itself needs some updating and care on the outside (I saw rusted out areas and some needing paint from the window). Also, the bathroom is incredibly small. I'm surprised they didn't redo the shower. Not what I would have expected from a Marriott, but our stay was free, so I won't complain. Otherwise, it's well decorated.We had dessert and breakfast in the restaurant. My biggest suggestion is they need to do something about acoustics in there. It was insanely loud, especially when kids were running around or busy. Lastly, we got left by the shuttle driver downtown (long story), but I'd encourage you to get there very early or they may take off before the designated pick up time. Thankfully, the hotel manager took care of that situation for us, which was very kind.We booked this hotel for a wedding over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel wasn't located downtown, but there was a free shuttle that ran every hour for guest would wanted to venture out. Unfortunately, we arrived in the afternoon so we did not get to take advantage of this service.The hotel nice and the rooms were clean and spacious! We had a 2 year old and needed a pak and play and the staff accommodated us quickly. The bed was really comfortable and I really liked that the thermostat was really quiet. Nothing worse than coming into a hotel with a separate air conditioning unit!We ordered room service for dinner and breakfast the following morning- the prices were very reasonable and delivery was very quick! The food was surprisingly really good. I dared to get the crab cake and it did not disappoint! I like that the standard egg order came with orange juice and coffee!The pool was great, it was clean and not over crowded.All in all, it was a nice overnight stay and I would recommend it to anyone. I wish it was downtown as it was a little hassle that I couldn't take my son to walk around, getting him in the shuttle and down there would have been tough especially if he had a meltdown and I was stranded without a way to get back to the hotel- in hindsight, I guess I could have gotten Uber to get me back...I stayed here with a group of friends for the weekend of July 4th. The hotel is not located in downtown Charleston but about 2 miles away near MUSC. The hotel was super busy since it was the holiday weekend and they had a cookout on the 4th but everything was well overpriced such as $7 for a burger or a sandwich. I expected decent pricing if not reduced prices for hotel guests at a nicer hotel for a special occasion. When I originally booked my reservation, I requested a rollaway bed since there were 4 of us and some people wanted their own bed. At the time of check-in, the front desk was unaware of this request and did not have any confirmation which has never been issue before since I am elite member that has had countless stays. Anyways, I requested it again and they replied that it would be up there shortly. A few hours later, there was still no rollaway bed so I went down and asked again getting the same response. Later that day after we explored Charleston, we came back and there was still no rollaway. I went down and explained the issue once again and was very frustrated at this point but all I received was an apology. It was a terrible experience but I finally received my rollaway bed after asking in person 3 times which is completely unacceptable.On a positive note, the hotel had a free shuttle that ran every 30 minutes to downtown which drops off right in from of Waterfront Park. The previous reviews stated that it cost money but it was free of charge so I am not sure if the policy changed or it was a special for the holiday weekend. That was convenient so we didn't have to try to find parking and drive ourselves downtown at all. As for the breakfast, they had the standard hot foods and pastries along with an omelet bar, waffle station, and made to order eggs. They also had a nice variety of fruit but nothing special as they didn't have smoked salmon nor juice shots as I have had at other Marriotts. Overall, it was a below average stay because it took forever to get my room set up but luckily we weren't in the room much except for sleeping. Expected better service from a Marriott but unfortunately it just wasn't there this time.Convenient location to MUSC and the Children's hospital. They have a special rate as well for ppl doing business or with family in the hospital, ask about it. The staff is very friendly. The hotel is clean and what you would expect from a Marriott. They have a sundry shop, concierge lounge, bar, restaurant and coffee/pastry counter. It appears they just renovated. There is a great outdoor area by the bar with fire pits and comfortable seating.I was not there for a meeting, but they had a good amount of meeting space.They have free parking as well. They are not far from the hustle bustle, restaurants, history of downtown Charleston. If you are a Marriott Reward member you can get free wi-fi in the guest room and you can sign up at arrival if you are not a member.this marriott was not within walking distance to downtown, but we were unable to move closer. there must have been a convention or something going on.but we did find perks to this place. if you are a gold member...free wi-fi and there is a concierge lounge that we took advantage of. the lounge had nibbles, coffee and a free breakfast. you can order drinks, which get charged to your room. during my stay, there was a super friendly hostess, who was able to point out some places to hit during our stay. she gets the 4th star for this hotel. the rooms were clean and spacious. my view wasn't much to rave over and the windows fogged up with condensation. still, it was a pretty good value.This is a beautiful hotel with lots of potential. Roof top bar is excellent. Unfortunately, they are understaffed and that can be annoying. The front desk supervisor, Danny, does all he can to be professional and accommodating. He is a asset to the hotel but he can only do so much. The cleaning staff do a nice job but are loud and unaware that their boisterous conversations in the hall disturb people who are not leaving or want peace and quiet in the morning. The room service food is outstanding. We noticed they are understaffed also, the manager brought our food one morning. This hotel is NOT downtown. I still think that it is a very nice property with mad potential. If management focused on these key factors, I would stay here every time I visit Charleston which is monthly.Fantastic stay for the weekend, it does require a quick car ride to the historic district. There is a shuttle service provided by the hotel or taxis which stay outside. Love entertainment on the rooftop bar on the weekends, pool is clean but does get crowded. We spent our time there mostly in downtown, the breakfast is great (ours was included in our stay, I do not know how much it is individually). There is a Starbucks, a patio area that is ground level with shaded areas, parking later on the evening can be tight. Safe parking lot and well lit.Great conference hotel. Easy check in, good service! Bars and restaurants have good food. Very accommodating!We booked this hotel as it offered the most reasonable rate over a major holiday.The level of service was excellent - from the registration desk, bellman, shuttle driver to the bartenders. The decor in the lobby area was very attractive. There is a spacious patio with comfortable furniture to enjoy also. Our room was nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathroom decor had been updated but the tub area appeared to be original. Seems they should have updated that too when upgrading the rest of the room. Also, condensation appeared in the windows but neither of these interfered with the comfort of our stay.A little out of the way in terms of the historic district but they have a complimentary shuttle that runs every 1/2 or so and the drivers were great about accommodating you.After reading the reviews on several sites I decided to call it home for a week while working in Charleston. The rooms are clean but was just never able to feel relaxed. The restaurant is mediocre at best and be prepared to finance your bar tab if you have a few drinks and a meal. Servers are inattentive and didn't bring salads or appetizers. They did offer to remove them from the bill after we asked about them several times. Drink prices are outrageous so buyer bewareNicely updated hotel. Love the rooftop bar. The staff is very helpful and pleasant. They have a shuttle downtown thst is s plus. You don't have to take your car for the entire stay, which is a plus. There is a fee for the shuttle, which i wasn't informed of when i checked in, i think they should do a one time fee for your stay, but the charge is $7 per day per person which is a lot. I think overall I would stsy again.This hotel was terrific. All the staff were so friendly and smiley. The coffee shop lady went above and beyond. The restaurant had great choices and the rooftop bar was a great bonus. There's a shuttle that will take you downtown and the pool area looked pretty chic itself. Those pillows I wanted to take with me. I'd always stay here if I were visiting back.Dinner was deliscious, crab cakes. Friends had she crab soup and ribeye with Mac and cheese. Waiters were attentive. No wait.Beautiful hotel, fabulous staff, comfy room, great view. We booked thru booking.com. Perhaps we could have grabbed that rate directly with the hotel;they were so accommodating. They upgraded us to a corner room with windows facing two directions and great views. Manager (Mr Till), clerk (Richard), and bellman (Dan) all great service.This is the worst Marriott I have ever stayed in. Checked in, received 2 rooms, and both smelled like cigarette smoke. One of the two rooms had a mold smell that just hit you in the face as soon as you walk in through the door. The receptionist put us in two different rooms 3 floors below our original rooms, and those ALSO smelled like pure smoke. I thought Marriott was a smoke-free hotel in the US! It isn't here. Even the hallways wreak of smoke.The view is also quite awful. Don't be fooled by the "courtyard view". If you are above the 2nd floor all you will see is an ugly rooftop with fans. Everything outside your window is all concrete. This hotel is supposed to be waterfront. It's not. Don't come here. Not worth the $339 I was paying a night per room.Does Marriott know that they have this place? It is like corporate forgot about it. I would agree with the reviewer that said it was the worst Marriott they have stayed at. The lobby, bar, and outdoor areas were very nice. My room was on the 6th floor and it looked a little tired. That didn't bother me. The horrible mustiness was a bigger issue for me. It was awful. I realize that it is humid in the south and that things get musty but this was unbearable. Thankfully, I only stayed one night. In the morning the hallway smelled of sewage. The rooms also don't seem to have a door closer on them so you hear slamming all night. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The parking, while free, was a problem because the valet had all of the spots near the doors blocked off. You can pay $10 to valet or drag your belongings all the way around the building. The location is not great. Whenever I travel I like to explore the local neighborhood on foot. Not here. I drove around the block to get my bearings and decided that I was just a couple of blocks from an unsafe area. It is also too far to walk to the historic district.Way overpriced for what you get and where it is.Our room was clean and comfortable and had a gorgeous view of the harbor. The drinks at the bar were tasty, strong, and priced well. There are rocking chairs and sofas on the back deck (again with the amazing view) and complimentary coffee in the morning. All of this was wonderful, and we would stay here again. My only complaint is the shuttle to downtown, as the hotel is not in walking distance. My mom paid the $6 for each of us to ride, and the driver never checked our tickets. (Not once, the entire weekend, and we only paid once and rode many times...) We kept getting told different times about pick-ups and drop offs, but no matter when we showed up to catch the shuttle we almost always had a thirty minute wait. In one instance, the shuttle driver was late because he said the hotel made him sweep up outside the lobby. Another time, he almost made us late for our walking tour because he was planning to head back to the hotel to drop his buddy off first (not a hotel guest!) until we complained! Another one of our shuttle drivers gave the double-bird at a fellow motorist who cut us off in traffic. Overall, the shuttle was not an enjoyable experience...I give it only one star! Crappy room Ac didn't work! Not friendly. But it is in a good area!That's all I can sayThe customer service is amazing at this location. From the housekeeping staff to the front desk when Matt greets you by name and remembers your face from before! The staff here go the extra mile to make you feel right at home when staying in Charleston.Great decor in the lobby. Newly redone rooms. Very clean. Walls were a little thin. Only stayed one night but would stay again in the summer to take advantage of the pool and outdoor area.
review_content_20: The decor at the Charleston Marriott is perfect! Bright and cheery southern decor touches make it so charming! My room was comfortable and clean. The staff were all pleasant and helpful. I loved having coffee on the large patio each morning. The only negative is this hotels location, not within walking distance to any restaurants or sites.The last review from "Alison" is not the Marriott....... It is the Courtyard Charleston Waterfront hotel.Ugh! We had a group event here for 5 days and absolutely hated the hotel. I am super easy about accomodations and am always happy with a solid Hampton Inn.  This place is just the worst.  The room had so much mildew that I sneezed non-stop. Others in our group complained of the same thing. I am still recovering from staying here and think I have a sinus infection as a result.The place is so tired and worn out - it looks like a cheap Las Vegas hotel circa 1995. The room was in disrepair and I couldn't believe the ironing board when we pulled it out of the closet - it had a destroyed cover that looked 20 years old.It is horribly located - not near anything you would want to see or do in Charleston.  We spent a fortune on taxis everyday. The rooms are tiny (and so are the bathrooms and showers). There are so many other places to stay in Charleston that there is absolutely no point in staying at this Marriott.This is by far the worst Marriott Hotel that we have ever stayed in.  We were in 2 different rooms that both smelled of mold covered up by Febreze.  The room was in need of a face lift.  It needed painting and freshening up.  We spent one night there and checked out the next morning.  We were suppose to stay 3 nights.  I couldn't stand the smell.  We checked into the Hampton Inn in Charleston and really enjoyed out stay.We just got back from staying a few days at this Marriott.   Though it was not really set up for family fun.......   Everyone at this Marriott was very pleasant.  From the drivers to the maids.   Very Clean and The Pool area was very nice and catered to everyone.  I would recommend this to everyone.We were scammed and manipulated by the sales team at Marriot! We will never do business with this particular location ever again! EVER. Also when you stay there look closely at detail and you will see that its not as nice as they claim it is.I only stayed in this hotel for one night while waiting for our rental house to be available on Isle of Palms. It was fine - clean, quiet rooms, convenient Starbucks counter right off the lobby, nice sitting area outdoors. My issue with this hotel started after checkout. I realized an hour or so after we left that I didn't have one of my bags with me. I remembered that I had shoved it into the closet upon check-in the night before and failed to grab it on the way out. I called the hotel to explain what happened, left my name, room #, and my phone number. I expected to receive a call that they had found my game later that day, but no dice. I called again the next day and spoke to another person who had no idea what I was talking about, and I was told that no bags had been reported found in any rooms. Well, I'm positive that I had left the bag in the room, so what could have happened to it? It was a new bag, with a brand new set of sheets and two beach towels in it. It cost me well over $100 to replace everything that was "lost". Very disappointed in their customer service and I won't be recommending this particular hotel to any travelers.We held a four-day event here in their Opal and Topaz ballrooms and were very very pleased. The banquet staff was all wonderful, the servers and bellmen were some of the friendliest people I've met, and everyone we encountered did whatever they could to help us with what we needed. I even met a very kind bellman who, when I couldn't find a bicycle rental shop who'd accommodate me, asked his friend's girlfriend to lend me hers so I'd have a chance to explore the city on my break from work. Talk about going above and beyond the call of duty!I'd give it 5 stars if the box lunches we were provided daily weren't so grody. Almost all of our participants mentioned how bad they were and it reflected poorly on us. Also the whole "pay $9.95 per day for your internet" thing, but we got around that with the help of a very obliging salesperson.This is a nice place and the staff were very friendly and helpful.  I was overcharged on check out but they quickly corrected the error with a smile.  The room was fine although a bit small.  The breakfast was truly amazing!  The fresh fruit on the buffet were the best!The rooms are small. But the smell of my room is not appealing.I am 100% sure this was a smoking room in the past and they just couldn't cover the smell.The parking is terrible. However, the Concierge lounge it pretty nice... Well if you are a rewards member.very clean, location is not in the heart of downtown or on the beach but not a far cab ride at all. friendlyish staff but need to be a tad more knowledgeable on the area but cabs and shuttles offered at the hotel right away.Disclaimer: I wanted to experience the downtown, historic Charleston area. That's why this hotel gets 2 stars. (Yes, I'm another Hotwire sucker.)Pros: This is a very nice hotel. The lobby and restaurants downstairs are very tastefully decorated and remind me of much nicer hotels I've stayed at in Las Vegas. Saffire's bar is quiet and reasonably-priced, and makes a nice place for a nightcap. The staff was all very friendly. The Daily Grind is open early and closes late, so you can always grab some coffee. The room was decently sized. The hotel was hosting some sort of conference or workshop, and all of those people seemed to be having a good time. Parking in the hotel lots is free and there were always open spaces.Cons: My room (the Hotwire special) turned out to be a wheelchair-accessible room, which only actually mattered in the bathroom. Everything was low, which wasn't that big of a deal for me, but there was no bathtub. It was a shower stall...with no stall. There was a half-inch lip of tile between the shower floor and the bathroom floor...which meant I had to spend time mopping up the floor after each shower. We ended up using the extra towels as additional bathmats. The bathroom also took forever to dehumidify - I'm talking 45-60 minutes with the fan on. So that was strange. The rooftop bar was closed; the desk clerk said that no one goes up there when it's cold. (Temperatures were in the 70s-50s the entire weekend I was there; they lost some money on that decision, I'll bet.) The hot tub, pool, and courtyard were closed for renovations - which seems odd to me, because other reviews I've found suggest that those areas were renovated in 2009? So...too many things were closed. This hotel is NOT downtown. It's a solid two miles from the hotel to King Street. There IS a free trolley (CARTA DASH) with a stop on either side of the hotel, but it only runs until 9  at night (7 on Sundays), so if you want to experience Charleston's nightlife, you'll need to call a cab or hike it. The hotel offers a shuttle ($), but I didn't bother with that. ETA: Oh! They want $10 per day for wifi! That is nuts. And if you've forgotten any of the basics - toothbrush, toothpaste - don't worry, they'll be happy to direct you to the store just off of the lobby, where you can pay $3 for any one of these items. In summation: if you want to walk around Charleston, this is NOT the place for you. If you don't care about cabs or shuttles, this is a really nice place to stay. If they stick you in a room with a wheelchair shower, try to switch.We were duped by Hotwire!  I chose a 4-star hotel in "downtown" Charleston and wound up with the Marriott which is located nowhere near downtown.  At the very least, the downtown area should be walkable from the hotel.  Unless 2.5 miles each way is your idea of a convenient walk, you will likely be disappointed.  The hotel is convenient to absolutely nothing except a VA hospital.  Every time we wanted to go into town, we had to drive and waste a bit of time searching for parking.  I know they offer a shuttle from the hotel at $6/person, but it is fairly infrequent and doesn't make sense to take considering there is a free city trolley that they fail to mention, and if we really were downtown, we wouldn't need a trolley in the first place.   The hotel itself was fairly charming in its lobby and common spaces, and doubles as a small convention center.  The rooms were a different matter.  Walking the hallway of our floor, it smelled of shampoo.  There is no circulation at all, so the smell of cleaning fluids lingers about.  In our room, because there was no circulation, our window was beaded with water drops.  It always looked like it was raining outside.  The only time we could get the water drops to clear up was if we kept the room at a very low temperature.  It was all rather inconvenient.  The tiny bathroom that required a maintenance call didn't help matters much.  The downstairs coffee shop had some rather delicious coffee and sold sports drinks which was great, until I saw that the price for 1 coffee and 1 sports drink cost over $6.  Ouch!  The parking and internet were free, so that was cost effective at least.  Breakdown:(room rate) $125/night + (fees) $27.30/night = too much money for the hotel. We actual stayed at the Mill's House via Hotwire for less money than this and had a much, much grander time in the heart of downtown.Great room - great service. You can tell this is the nice hotel in the area. I do wish that it was closer to the downtown area. Not sure if they provide a shuttle but if they do that would be awesome.I was on a business trip - 5 hotels in 5 days and while I think the overall ambiance of the hotel was great there was something lacking in the room but I can't place it right now. Maybe the rooms were a bit dated in comparison to the rest of the hotel. The conference center area is nice but could use some more labeling as people seemed a bit lost of where to go for their events.I think the staff make this a 4 star review. Also Marriott needs to do something about not providing free wireless - it really is a crime at this point.Good place to stay.  Restaurant is ok.  It is a Marriott, so rooms are sort of good size.  Bed is comfortable.  People are nice.  Valet service is enthusiastic,Charleston Marriott, you suck.  You were oversold and couldn't offer me another room when I wanted to switch.  You gave me a musty room without a bathtub.  Your desks are too high to sit at comfortably and I never got that desk insert you promised me.  Your bathwater takes too long to heat up.  The entrance to your terrace bar is ghetto - it looks like an emergency exit with a sticker on it.  Your stairs layout doesn't make any sense and you elevators are slow.  And lastly, you charge a fee for a shuttle downtown when there is a free trolley that stops right by the hotel that you don't tell anyone about.But you have lovely outdoor seating areas with firepits and a nice view of the water.Peace out Marriott.  We had enough and checked out early.Great hotel, quiet, clean.  Staff is friendly not fake friendly, and so helpful.  Great shuttle downtown every half hour for six dollars for the day.  Good location right next to Charleston PD but you would never know they are right next door.  Neighborhood seems safe and quiet.  Downtown is about 2 miles, not really walkable but close.  One of the best places I have stayed in a long time.  Vast amount of parking and well lit, plus free garage parking if desired.  Very well appointed interior of hotel and rooms.Nothing spectacular about this place other than the restaurant and lobby and even that wasn't anything exciting.  Extremely overpriced in my opinion but I think that's pretty par for the Charleston area.  Rooms were clean, yet small and the outdoor patio area was actually a nice little surprise.  My girlfriend and I were here for a wedding reception and the staff running the open bars seemed to be doing a great job filtering the people their drinks and the restaurant did a good job setting up the food, etc.  My suggestion though is that if you have to stay in Charleston, try and stay right down the road in Mt. Pleasant or at least across the bridge and save yourself a good amount of money!I recently stayed here and was quite impressed.  This is a category V Marriott and it felt like it.  The staff were extremely friendly and the building itself was very clean and well maintained.There is a nice outdoor pool area with several fire pits and outdoor seating.  This restaurant has a concierge level and has both a cafe and restaurant onsite.The parking is free and is all around the location.  The hotel is conveniently located on the west side of town so the traffic is nice and light.The next time I visit Charleston I'll certainly be stating here again --a very pleasant stay.Having stayed at many hotels across the country for both business and leisure, I wasn't really sure what to expect out of the Charleston Marriott.  I'd read other reviews that said it was great, and others despised it.  For me, this was a pretty solid hotel for the money, although the location made it less-than-perfect.Let's start with the good - The hotel entrance, lobby and common areas are all very nice places to sit, relax and enjoy a cup of coffee.  Actually, the lobby is one of the nicest Marriott lobbies I think I've come across.  Service was also generally solid, and between the restaurant and coffee shop (which was open late), there are plenty of dining options.The mediocre?  The rooms.  They were fine, but just didn't have the updated feel of the lobby and were generally small.  The biggest drawback, as I mentioned, was the location.  The Marriott is just over 2 miles from the heart of downtown Charleston and a quick bike ride away, but I wouldn't want to walk it.  Alternatively, guests can take a hotel shuttle or a cab for $5/person.  Or, for similar money, you could just stay downtown.  (Not at a high-end B&B, of course.)Despite this Marriott being generally appealing and a decent value, if you're going to stay in Charleston, stay in Charleston.
review_content_40: I wish you had a no star option yelp. The bathroom was all mildew, dim lightbulbs so you don't see all the dirt.....sofa just filty, bed linens torn, stained rug, dirty wet windows. This hotel needs management because the front desk staff and restaurant employees were very hard working. The public areas are comfortable and the outdoor seating is plentiful, nice pool. However one does like a clean room at these rates.Wow, what horrible deal we got through hotwire.com this time around. We also got misled on the location. We asked for a Downtown hotel and ended up here. This is NOT DOWNTOWN! You need a car to get downtown or will need to take the FREE TROLLEY down the street. Do not take their shuttle that they charge for. Anyway, the hotel is sort of bait and switch by the fact that they have a lovely reception/lobby area complete with to types of spa water that they keep fresh all day long. I LOVE SPA WATER! lol I make it at home so I thought this was a treat! Anyway, we get up to our room and the misery began.The hallway on the 7th floor was so stuffy and muggy, it was odd. No air circulation was going through there. As we opened the door, I almost passed out. Now, it was cold outside, I should welcome warmth inside my room, but instead, I was greeted with a very muggy almost moldy smelling room and the windows were all fogged up! I had to keep the air conditioning on during our entire stay just so we could breath comfortably in there. Sure it got cold, but it was the only way. It was very uncomfortable to be in that room. Also, the bathroom was very tiny. For the price we paid even at a discount via Hotwire, this was such a disappointment. I could barely move around in there. It was outdated and rough. The toilet broke within a half hour of us even being in the room. Already had to call down for maintenance. Also had to call for toilet paper at an inopportune time. Housekeeper missed the mark there. Makes me wonder what else she missed making up the room. Parking was free, but the spaces closest to the elevator banks were tight and almost never available. For the most part, we ended up parking all the way in the back just to make sure the car wouldn't get hit and that we had room. We had to walk through the conference room area to get to the lobby and then the elevator banks. The one other good thing about this place is the coffee. It was supposed to be Starbucks but it sure did taste A LOT better than Starbucks at the store. I don't know what they are using down there, but it was pretty decent. They open early and close late so that was nice. Also, the rooms offer free wifi which is nice, but it's slow and you get knocked offline a lot, but either way, it's free so I can't complain I guess.I would never stay here again. Also, thanks to this stay at this hotel, I won't be using hotwire again. They tricked me! The last time we were in Charleston we got the Mill House Hotel! Now, that's what I'm talking about. Ughh..never again.Very nice room, excellent service, varied options for brunch. If I ever return to Charleston, I'll be staying here!For service. Ok, I get it if the hotel was really busy the night prior. I get it that you advertise check-in at 4pm. But unless its Vegas, who ever has to wait til 4 to check in? Apparently this Marriott doesn't care about the time regardless. I showed up at 2:55pm to check in, as a Platinum member. No rooms were available. Gave them my cell and went and sat in the lobby. One hour and 45 mins later I went up to the front desk. Told him how long it has been. He put me in a room immediately. I asked why no one called. He said the room they had for me still wasn't ready. Are you kidding me?! Why wouldn't you ask me if I wanted a room or the one they held off for me. So mad. And to boot --- no apology whatsoever, or even acknowledgement that I am upset about all of this.Stayed here 4 nights for a mix of business and vacation. The best thing about this hotel is the people. The front desk staff and attendants are all excellent - very helpful, friendly, and full of ideas to explore their city. The rooms are on the small side but big enough. We had a beautiful view looking over the marsh lands and Ashley river. The hotel is near the Citadel and the minor league baseball stadium ("River Dogs"). Downside to the hotel is that it is not within walking distance to the historic district. But the on demand hotel shuttle is super convenient, and the shuttle drivers are all GREAT. The morning breakfast buffet is fantastic! The daily fresh fruit selection is wonderful. Nice to have a "we proudly brew" Starbucks in the lobby too. The common grounds of the hotel are all nice with great outdoor seating, a nice (small) pool and great rooftop bar. Overall, would certainly recommend staying here.Clean, nice and convienent location. Staff was very helpful. The outside patio by the pool is relaxing and beautiful. While some reviews say it eas dated, I would say minimumally, and that care and maintinence were superior and are far more important as was the case. Would stay there again if venturing to Charleston.The hotel is undergoing construction in it's conference area and parking garage area. Parking is a little bit of a challenge, but not enough to hinder a rating.This is a Marriott? This is a Mariott BY NAME ONLY. The lobby is nice enough but I couldnt get over how small the rooms were. I paid $220 for a tiny room with a king-size bed, PAPER THIN walls, dim bathroom (I had to do my makeup in the bedroom). The towels are tinted green - did someone wash them with some green accidentally??? The staff was nice enough but give me a break. I will never be back here - pay a little extra and stay at a nicer place in town.K and I stayed at the Charleston Marriott, and it was a mixed experience. As the original reviewer noted, the building color is a 1980s kind of daffodil yellow. Ugh.The remodel being done, however, is taking it in the right direction. The pool area is nicely done, and the lobbies on the first floor are tastefully done and inviting.The view from our room on the 8th floor gave a nice panorama of the river from the left (southeast) to the Citadel on the right. Unfortunately a couple of municipal buildings mar the immediate foreground, but the view is otherwise pleasant.The bellhop, Crosby was pleasant and very helpful in wheeling our many bags upstairs. If you stay here, ask for him by name. The room was pleasant and unremarkable. The mini-fridge was helpful, and the blast of the dual-head shower was a welcome relief after a 5-hour drive from Atlanta. The $10 charge for internet---even in the lobby---was no relief at all. For a $160/night room, they are charging for wireless? In 2009? Really? When I called the front desk and ask if wireless is comped for Marriott Rewards customers, he explained that it is for Gold and Platinum (I'm only silver at the moment). He then asked if I had received my coupon for a free flatbread appetizer.....ummm, yes, but what has that to do with my internet question? *sigh*The front desk's recommendation for dinner was *meh*, but there is an excellent book of restaurant profiles and menus. Rather than ask the desk, I'd suggest flipping through that...or coming to Yelp!Checkout this morning was a Charlie Foxtrot. I called at 10:15 to arrange a bellhop and cart at 10:45. Despite two subsequent visits to the front desk and 30 minutes of waiting, no help came. As we carried our bags to the car, three bellhops stood talking outside. Nice.We might stay here again (convenient location, safe, reasonable cost), but the service was on-again, off-again.Great room and great service...no free wifi which is sad.Have never had a bad experience at this hotel. Check-in to check-out is wonderful.The restaurant's menu is limited, but what they have is prepared wonderfully!This hotel was absolutely beautiful. I was a little concerned about it, when we first arrived. Maybe it was the cheesy yellow exterior paint color. But I had nothing to be concerned about. The hotel is beautifully decorated, the colors are bright and warm. The staff is very friendly. The beds was firm and the linens were fresh and crisp. I also love the lamp style that Marriott is using in their hotels now. The lamps actually have electrical outlets in the base, for plugging in your cell phone charger or i-pod. It's very nice not having to stand on your head looking for an outlet! Nice hotel, I would definitely stay here again.EXCELLENT front desk service. Very nice room. Nice hotel. Nice, friendly bar. Mislead on the location by hotwire. Shuttle OVERPRICED...and doesn't run late enough. They don't tell you a taxi downtown..where we THOUGHT we were staying...is less than the shuttle if you are more than one person.Would not stay again...only because of the LOCATION.Nice feature of this hotel is the shuttle to downtown Charleston. Runs every 1/2 hour. We came here for a short vacation which happened to New Years Eve. We took the shuttle downtown on New Years Eve and caught it back to the hotel after dinner. The rooms are nice and clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is vey safe. The lobby and common areas were nicely decorated. On the downside housekeeping didn't leave us fresh glasses (we left a good tip). They should really offer a self serve coffee service in the morning. The line at the cafe was long as they only had one person covering the bar and To-Go counter. If you are planning to spend a lot of time downtown Charleston you may want to go to the Marriott Courtyard which is located right on Marion Square which is in the middle of downtown with many shopping and dining options within walking distance. The only other downside was that we could not change the input on the TV in the room and the TV was pretty small. I find the input issue strange because we stayed at the Marriott in Myrtle beach on the same trip and one of the features they touted was the entertainment system where you could customize the inputs etc. Overall we had a nice stay. Next time we would probably try the Courtyard just based on location.Friendly staff! I got a great deal. This hotel looks very elegant and my room is comfortable and clean. The historical district is probably less than five minutes of driving distance. The only thing that stinks is the wireless fee. I used my phone as a hotspot and it's obvious a few other rooms around me did the same. Otherwise, I think this hotel was fantastic.Just stopped in for a cold beer on a big night quest. Nice bar.Stayed at the Charleston Marriott for a week on business. The hotel was nicer than the JW I stayed at in New Orleans. It's a clean, averaged priced hotel in a safe area with incredible staff and it features a good restaurant, a good bar and some incredible meeting and event space. The rates were average for the star/location, the room was clean and of average size and the staff was incredibly friendly. The bar was very reasonably priced, especially for a hotel bar, at $10 for a double Jack and $12 for a double Johnnie Walker (black). Surprisingly, they offered Blue label for $24 but I stayed with my usual drinks. The coffee was better than the Starbucks by my office, Their rib-eye was excellent, the braised pork chop was also really good. The waitstaff were very attentive. Their convention and meeting space was incredible (on par with nice hotels in Vegas just on a smaller scale). The Internet was a little hit or miss. The hotel said they are in the process of upgrading their system so that might explain things. Anyway, I would definitely stay here again...next time, I'm upgrading to one of the rooms with the little balcony's.This is a 2 star hotel W's star price. My experience has been awful. I checked in last night at 2:00 am after a long drive. The parking lot had no spaces. There is no valet!! I was directed to an overflow lot next door. Ugh. I was traveling solo and didn't relish the thought of grappling with my luggage for a long walk. This lack of service for a $215 a night hotel is absolutely unacceptable. I requested security and got an unarmed ununiformed female who would have been no help had I encountered a problem. When I complained about the lack of parking I was told they were having some parties along with a few Other weak excuses. I would think the part goers would have been required to use the overflow parking, not the" paying dearly for very little guests". I called for room service to deliver coffee the next morning. An hour later it still had not arrived. I called again. It took another 25 minutes, and even then my simple order was not right. The decor is fine. The pillows are terrible. The mattress could be a lot better. The view of the river is nice. No bathtub, no bathrobe. There is nothing to make this hotel worth the price. It is rated $$. The Renaissance where I stayed last week was $$$. I paid about the same or a little less there, and had a better location, experience, service, and a nicer hotel. Don't get sucked in here. I stayed here because I couldn't find a room elsewhere. I would have been better off in a $60 room on the interstate. I was told this am that they are building a parking garage. And, to be fair, they comped my rm. Service coffee that I waited 90 minutes for. Still, I wouldn't stay here again.This place was top notch all around. I have never stayed in a hotel that every person on the staff was so friendly and always said hi, how are you, have a good day, etc. Seriously - every single person in the halls, outside, everywhere were sooo nice. And it did not seem creepy or phony, just nice people. The lobby and entry area were really, really classy and nice. And the pool was phenomenal, with beautiful tiles, and music going. Nice view of the river from many rooms, if you took a walk, or from the roof bar. The room was clean, nice and as expected for a Marriott and I do not have one word to say negative about the whole stay. We ate lunch in the restaurant which was very nicely decorated, and the food was great too. Reasonable prices too. The one downside is the overflow parking lot could be repaved. But it is 100 feet from the front door so not that difficult of a situation really. One downside is you can not really walk ( 2+miles) to the historic district.......but cabs were there in less than 10 minutes when we called and $6. So save your money and stay here......and get a great pool!TIP: I used priceline in the Ashley River Area selection - and we won the room at an $85 bid for a 3 and a 1/2 star. So try this and use the savings for more great food at dinners....!Thought I'd add my views here to balance things out some in case the negative review was just one persons bad day.

review_content: Nice hotel and staff. For a year end stay everyone was very cheerful and attentive. The place is very clean and comfortable. The buffet breakfast was great as well as the accommodations. Although it's located next to 17, it's very quiet and private. Highly recommended.I had reservations here to stay for a Bachelorette weekend,  and the hotel was very cute and a little fancy,  but what you would also see typically in a hotel. The associates we very generous and greeted us very nicely. The front of the hotel looks very small, yet it expands to the back a bit farther than you would think, so it's very spacious. Shared a room that holds 2 queen beds and a bathroom with a tub and Walk in shower. The hotel has entrance and exit access from the sides of the hotel for convenience.  They also have a in-ground pool which is centered in the middle of the hotel,  but located outside like a courtyard. They have a restaurant inside the hotel caked Trotters, they have a All-you-can-eat breakfast for $12.99. Had a great experience here, just wished I could of stayed in Charleston, South Carolina a bit longer, the weekend went by too fast. Until next time!!!One of the best hotels I've stayed at during all of my travels! Convenient to the airport and to the historic district, as well as to other sights, it is also close to many restaurants (three good BBQ places are nearby!) and stores (there is a grocery store right next door!), the room was large, clean and very comfortable, the staff were all friendly and accommodating.The rooms have recently been renovated; ours was spacious, immaculately clean, the bed and linens were incredibly comfortable. The bathroom and particularly shower were largest I've ever seen in a hotel.Although the hotel is strictly non-smoking, we had an issue of cigarette smoke wafting into our room the first night. It seems to have come from outside, or maybe a staff break room? Either way, the front desk person was very apologetic, gave us an extra restaurant voucher and luckily the issue did not re-appear.If you make a reservation through the hotel's website, you'll receive one $15 voucher per night's stay (not per person), which can only be used during a specified time frame (i.e. 3 nights, 3 vouchers, each of which can ONLY be used for dinner/drinks one night or breakfast the next morning). The Sunday breakfast buffet is a great deal at $13, and the weekday breakfast buffets are pretty good deals at $11 a person, although one can also order off the menu, as well.We had an excellent weekend stay here! The staff is very friendly and helpful! The hotel is welcoming and nicely done. The rooms are clean and very homey! We had a junior king suite with an air bath tub. It was so relaxing!  We did enjoy breakfast at the restaurant in the hotel but if you enjoy room service they provide that option and the prices are very resonable! I am so glad we chose this as our place to stay!Will recommend to anyone and everyone headed to Charleston. The rooms are clean, beautiful and luxurious, leaving nothing to be desired for the price range. We were delighted to find a minifridge, microwave and Keurig, a spacious shower stall and separate bath, as well as a NICE hair dryer similar to what I have at home. They are also generous with the toiletry items.The beds were very comfortable. My boyfriend and I take our memory foam pillows on every trip, but could have fallen asleep here without them. :)))Housekeeping was cheerful and friendly to our kids. The fitness center is small but well equipped with the basics in new & immaculate condition. Beautiful pool area and courtyard, too! We will definitely be back!!!Hold the phone, I just went to a CVB event that was hosted at this hotel. We got a tour of the rooms and whoah this place is amazing! I'm definitely going to recommend to people looking to visit and stay near me in West Ashley. The event catering was delish; spanakopita, pimento cheese sandwiches, prime rib, goat cheese stuffed cherry tomatoes and in small but generous appetizer portions. Yum!!!!What a posh place in west Ashley!Wonderful hotel! We Picked it because of the price and the pool but it was better than we hoped for. Pretty close drive to Folly beach. Near a lot of great restaurants. We had BBQ dinner 5 min away and it was amazing. Great staff, very friendly attitude. You can drive around hotel and park closer to your room.This place is amazing. Amazing service, amazing rooms, just plain awesome. When we arrived back from our cruise early (like 7 a.m. early), they allowed us to check in to our room at 8 a.m., even though check-in wasn't until 3 p.m. They also gave us a $15 breakfast voucher at their delicious in-house restaurant. The rooms are very, very clean. It comes complete with a fitness center and pool and is within walking distance of a few restaurants and a grocery store.This is an overdue review for my visit to Charleston this past June. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. Staff was kind, accommodating, helpful, and professional. The amenities are luxurious and clean. This hotel is affordable, beautiful, and very close to Charleston and Folly Beach. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and can't wait to return!My wife and I stayed here this week and the service here is outstanding. From check in ( Tracy and Pavi ) to the bar and dinning staff they made us feel at home. Breakfast and dinner were also above average. Look forward to coming back to these comfortable and clean rooms.Took our first trip to Charleston and since we are frequent travelers, I can say this is probably where we will stay when we come back... I'm like the other people (stayed there the same weekend as Natalie B's review) - I'm recommending this place to anyone & everyone that comes to Charleston. I'm also writing this review as a retired flight attendant, so I've spent a very good portion of my life in hotels. After traveling across the country (literally West Coast to East Coast) just 4 wks ago and staying in some shocking substandard hotels, I was SO HAPPY to pull up to Town & Country and see how cute & maintained it is. VERY accessible from the Hwy too for out of town travelers, and if you just keep going down Savannah Hwy, you'll end up right downtown Charleston/by the Aquarium etc in less than 6 miles - it's a straight shot, so that was nice too. Plus Folly Beach is easily accessible from here as well.  From the beginning of our stay I was impressed, the desk staff was FANTASTIC, truly some of the best I've encountered checking in (& as I said, I've stayed THOUSANDS of nights in hotels across the country), even more impressive than more 'swankier' hotels. Truly. Parking near our room was surprisingly a breeze & when we stepped into the room we were actually shocked at how really nice it was. The rooms are very spacious, the furniture layout was so comfortable, there was a fridge/microwave & Keurig & the bathroom as FANTASTIC with a great shower & separate bath. I even loved the "my earth" soap they had and usually I'm all about my own Aveda products that I bring lol. We got there & we were tired, so we went with room service, food was great & reasonably priced & again, the service itself was FANTASTIC. The gentleman who delivered it was a doll and we saw him several more times thru our stay. Housekeeping did a GREAT job, they even went out of their way to "de-shed" my bed the next morning (I have crazy thick long hair that just loves to shed everywhere in the summer - whomever cleaned our room/made up the bed, literally cleared the bed of the mess of hair I shed lol - whomever she was, she's my hero!!).  So in summary, the staff is FANTASTIC all around, the facilities were BEAUTIFUL & the location is really great for non-locals. We'll definitely be back! Thank you Town & Country!If you don't want to pay the big bucks for staying in the historic district, this property is an excellent alternative.  Since it was recently renovated this place is like a shiny penny amongst dull tarnished coins.  The public areas are super clean and attractive.  The choice of colors and wood stains help to elevate the decor.Had we stayed more than one night we may have looked into booking a suite.  But being in town for such a short stay, their standard King was very comfortable.  The bed was definitely slumber inducing, and the room surprisingly quiet considering the hotel was almost full.  It was a blissful night sleep.We loved the separate tub and shower, and the fixtures and counter gleamed.  It was nice to have a small microwave, fridge and a Keurig in the room.  Ice was just down the hall.  In the courtyard area there was a small but attractive pool area and looked like a decent place to chill out after a day of sight seeing.The $15 voucher we received upon check-in was used toward the $10.99/per person, weekend breakfast buffet.  It was a very nice spread, not like the ones found at competing properties.  You really had to be careful as there was so much to choose from....praline french toast, thick bacon, grits, sausage, pancakes, sausage gravy & biscuits, hash browns, oatmeal, muffins, fresh fruit, granola, cereal, yogurt, scrambled eggs,  etc.  The made to order station (only available on weekends) offered omelets and crepes.  Both had a nice selection of toppings and fillings, and both were skillfully prepared and very much enjoyed.  Nice having some jalapenos in your eggs to kick start the day.All in all a big thumbs up.This is a nice hotel for this price range.  Very clean and updated, with a Keurig, microwave, and fridge in the room.  The hotel is made up of several smaller buildings, so don't expect to go to the check in desk with all your stuff and head straight to your room.  I had no problem driving around toward the back of the hotel to park near the building where my room was located, there was plenty of parking available near each of the buildings.  Staff was very nice and professional.Lovely place to stay, rooms were fully equipped and very comfortable, terrific outdoor pool tucked away within an interior courtyard, super friendly staff and fantastic breakfast. Direct book to get a $15 voucher. Great price too! Highly recommend.Very often I have encountered less than impressive hotel accommodations, but the Town & Country far exceeded my expectations! I arrived for a fast-paced wedding weekend and was promptly greeted by a kind and cheerful staff member at the front desk. My room was clean, spacious and fully stocked with things I usually forget to pack (toiletries, mostly). The king bed was a comfortable, welcome sight! The housekeeping staff made a point to say 'hello' in the hallways, and on the day I checked out the front desk graciously held my bags for four hours while I explored downtown Charleston. The breakfast buffet had a large variety of options as well. I will certainly stay here again.Like this place... less in price than some of the downtown places, but MORE bang for the buck.  Nicer rooms, bathrooms, amenities, etc.  Rates are very good and Dtown is only  a few miles away.  Plus guaranteed parking too.  We WILL be back.Visited Charleston for spring break and stayed at town and country. We chose them because of the good reviews and was not disappointed.  This hotel looks very nice. We asked for a double queen.  The room was roomy and one of the nicest we have stayed in.  All the staff were extremely polite and helpful. At first we thought the location was not going to be convenient but it was just fine.  About 5 miles from downtown. No trouble at all. As we visited  downtown we realized parking was a challenge. So we were glad we did not stay in the city. The breakfast buffet is like fine dining. None of that cold  continental stuff other chain hotels offer. Everything was hot and southern. Reserve directly to get the daily $15 voucher which makes the breakfast free.I have stayed here twice in the past year when in Charleston for business and was impressed both times with the quality of the hotel.  The hotel is a lot cheaper than the hotels in historic Charleston and only a 10 minute drive to MUSC.  If you book through the hotel website, you can get a voucher for breakfast or lunch at the hotel.  Breakfast is a buffet and the voucher covers it for one person - the buffet includes yummy fresh made pancakes, bacon, sausage, eggs, grits, potatoes, oatmeal, cereals, yogurt, juice, coffee, etc.  Both rooms are stayed in were incredibly nice and comfortable.  They have microwaves, refrigerators, and Keurig machines.  There's a Bi-Lo practically in walking distance.  The bathrooms in the hotel rooms are also very nice with a separate shower and tub and lots of space.  The first time I stayed back in the summer of 2013 they did not have a full length mirror in the hotel rooms but on this last trip they did - I think that was the only con on the first trip.The front desk was friendly and helpful.  When I decided to end my work trip early due to winter weather issues, they were totally fine with me making the change the morning I was to check out.  I really appreciated this.We just stayed here for 3 nights because our friends who were getting married in West Ashley recommended it. Typically we stay in the downtown, historic area, but we decided to try something different this time.We liked this hotel a lot; clean rooms and common areas, friendly staff and convenient location. There is a grocery store within walking distance and a mall and lots of restaurant options  (including Graucho's)  very close. For what you get, it is reasonably priced. However, it is obviously not the same experience as staying downtown; not too far away though.4.5 stars. Great room--comfortable beds, very clean, nice amenities. We enjoyed staying 10 or so minutes away from downtown, historic Charleston (better priced) and it wasn't a bad drive both days of our two day trip. We came in on a Sunday around 2pm and the parking lot was packed (Sunday brunch buffet) but it cleared out not too long after. The only downside was the indoor gym. The setup was really weird and it was difficult to impossible to watch the TV while running on the treadmill. I'd definitely suggest the hotel rethink the gym setup, but that's a minor detail. There are some good restaurants nearby too that don't require you to go all the way into downtown. I'd definitely stay here if I go to Charleston again.
review_content_20: Granted it is not  in a scenic area of Charleston but  this hotel was fantastic AND a great bargain too. Charleston is an expensive place and that makes this hotel an even better bargain. I second all the positive reviews of the facilities. Really pretty place with nice sized rooms. Can't comment on the food since we didn't eat here. The staff was gracious too.Very clean and pretty. Definitely a place you want to take someone you are trying to impress. Also great if you just like nice hotels. We got the Standard 2 Queen Bed room. The size of the room is good enough for a family of 3 or 4. There is a mini fridge and a microwave as well as a Keurig. There is a small closet and a safe. The bathroom is awesome. Bathtub could fit two skinny people. Separate walk in shower. Beds dont look queen size they look full size.That made me sad and is my only complaint.This is a lovely hotel and when the renovation project is complete, it will be a real stunner!  Located just off the south end of I-528 and about 10 minutes from downtown Charleston, this place is a hidden jewel!  And a a real bargain.Our room was gorgeous, well-organized (a corner wet bar contains all the appliances: a Keurig coffee maker, microwave, and refrigerator), the closet has a sliding door and laptop safe.  The linens are lovely and the beds - dreamy!  A spacious walk-in shower separate from the bathtub compliments the bathroom. There is virtually no traffic noise because the guest rooms are located behind the lobby, restaurant, and conference rooms. There is plenty of convenient parking and the property seems very secure.  Don't pass up the Sunday breakfast buffet.   It' is not included in the price of the room,  but worth the experience! Finally, kudos to the hotel staff.  They are friendly, helpful, and were incredibly responsive.  Can't wait to stay here again!I can only talk about our room because we stopped there just for the night and left right away the next day, but I wished I had more days there. We were in Charleston for the long memorial weekend, mini road trip and just had one day in the area. We had no reservation and when we started looking for a hotel room everything was packed. There were tons of people there that weekend and I don't even know at how many hotels we stopped. This was recommended from another hotel that was full and the lady said they still had a couple of rooms. We drove there as fast as we could and they only had 2 Jr. suites.Not much of an option, and it wasn't really expensive, we needed a bed, so we took it.This room was beautiful, big and clean and spacious and fabulous and everything looked new. And there was marble and a beautiful glass shower, and a jet tub in between the bathroom and the bed. And the bed was huge and comfy and the comforter was about 10,000 lbs heavy so you went to sleep and it would not let you get up haha!!!All in all, it was a fantastic room!!!This hotel looks nice & all, but it's just been remodeled. It'll starting wearing down quick. First off, I called to ask if they provided portable cribs (pack'n'play) and the receptionist seemed to have no clue what I was talking about.( FYI every hotel we've stayed in, even low-end, has them nowadays). When we got there to check in i asked again & different lady, but same response. Said she'd look into it, but never heard back. Signs all over saying we are a"green" hotel and to put towels you want replaced on floor or in tub. We did neither & they replaced all just as any place would. Lastly, the breakfast Buffett, YUCK. We had it on weekday & weekend(more stuff on weekend) and where to begin. Menu says fresh fruit, ummm more like fresh out of a can. The weekend buffet had "fresh" not very good grapes, melon & grapefruit along with the canned crap & it was not much better. As well as cottage cheese & stewed prunes so you can guess who the target crowd is. If you're looking for anything "light" good luck. Bread, potatoes, & meat is all you'll find here. No cold cereal, no yogurt. Asked for hot tea & I get lipton's which is prob what they use to make their iced tea. Can't believe people come for the buffet that aren't staying at the hotel & lots of them. Oh yeah & both mornings the host was busy texting as we walked in. We were given restaurant vouchers for every day we were there since hotel was still under construction. We didn't even use them all. Can't speak for any other meals, all we had was breakfast. Bottom line, new clean reasonably priced place to stay if you don't mind being 5-10 drive from downtown charleston, but skip the breakfast buffet!!!!!This hotel is beautiful.  I would highly recommend it.  It is immaculate inside & out.  Their restaurant serves up a wonderful hot breakfast including made to order omlets, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausage, hash browns, French toast, fresh fruit, fresh creamy yogurt  & I could go on & on.  On top of that, the restaurant couldn't be more lovely.  Book directly through the hotel to get breakfast vouchers.  All employees that we came in contact throughout our stay were warm & helpful & even go out of their way for you.  They also have a lovely pool.   We would definitely stay here again.  Classy place for the reasonable rates!My boyfriend and I stayed here for a week last August and we are planning on returning! It was a fantastic deal and the hotel was very modern, comfortable and clean. It was about 7-8 minutes drive from downtown Charleston, but it was perfect for us, since we liked the slower atmosphere. There were many places to eat and shop within walking distance. I had a problem with my debit card when we first arrived, but the staff was very sweet and worked with me.Was in area for a wedding recently, hotel was clean, friendly staff and good value. If in area and don't want expensive downtown location I would recommend.Just finished a four day stay and loved it. Jr. Suit was large and comfortable with a great bed. Hotel was still under construction but it didn't effect anything. Staff was helpful and nice. The location is easy to get to and very convenient to both downtown and Kiawah island.Just stayed at this hotel. The remodel is beautiful! The price is very reasonable for everything you get. The pictures are accurate in depicting what the remodeled rooms like. It's 10/15 minutes from downtown Charleston where we spent most of our time. You won't be disappointed!Cute place, good location near to Charleston but a fraction of the price. Rooms are clean, updated with spacious bathrooms (we had a king room) comfy bed/ linens, loved the Keurig. Renovations going on but you only notice it out front. One thing they needed was a full length mirror in the room...a must have folks!! Oh and we were under the impression we would get a $15 voucher for their breakfast buffet but we only got a $5...although we ended up finding the best diner down the road so it worked out.

review_content: NOT DOWNTOWNAbout 1.5 miles to downtownRooms are clean and spacious, beds are comfy, breakfast is decent, check in was fine.All in all, average, but if you are looking to be close to town at a lower rate than being right downtown, this is your place.Hotel was easy to locate and has free parking! Such an added bonus. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our room was great! Clean cool and comfortable. Great place to stay in charelston.Not my favorite hotel. Everything was clean, the staff was friendly, and the free breakfast was decent, but the website advertises it as being close to downtown and it really isn't. We have a nice view of parking lots and a Burger King from our tiny window. Since I am in Charleston, I would like to be able to sit outside, but there isn't really any outdoor seating other than by the tiny dirty pool, which is closed at this time of year. And the internet is agonizingly slow.I would say that if you are visiting the VA hospital across the street, or maybe the med school, this would be a prime location, and it really is fairly decent, but if you come expecting a vacation destination like I did, you will be sorely disappointed. Two stars for false advertisingThis is the second time we stayed here.  The first time was better service but the parking was horrendous.  This time the parking was better even though our car got scrapped.  You get what you pay for as my dad would always say!  The elevators are fast and the ice machine worked.  The free breakfast was okay, always packed with people.  My main gripe this time; we never had towels when we wanted them.  Everyday we had to wait on towels.  So bring your own if you plan on staying here.  Now, we were after Christmas, the place was busy, but again, it was hard to get towels when you wanted them!  The staff was nice and courteous.  The mattress was comfortable for the king size bed.  We stayed in room 301 and there way always noise and banging coming from the stairwell.  Don't know if I would stay here again.It's a typical vintage chain property. Not upscale but not a poke-and-go either. Generally clean and everything works ok. We had a great flat panel TV with easy access to accessory ports. If you're coming for vacation and want to visit historic district or the beach then their only advantage is price. It's not really walking distance to anything and in/out parking is a major pita. Except! And it's a huge exception, if you're here for the hospitals then it's super convenient. VAMC is across the street and MUSC is about a block. That's really the ideal guest here - those who need to be close to the hospitals. There's some fast food nearby and plenty of delivery options but no real super eats in walking distance. Bottom line: for vacation you might rather be elsewhere. For hospital visits it's excellent.Maybe two stars is a bit harsh, but as I think back on my stay, it's the bad things that stand out.  I was in for three nights for business, and was moderately satisfied with my stay.  PROS:-free wireless internet-free breakfast with food that people might actually want to eat-The room and furniture/tv were nice and modern.-The staff were friendly and helpful.CONS:-One night my room randomly started smelling like a bathroom that someone just took a dump in.  It went away just as randomly about 2 hours later.-My room was directly across the hall from the housekeeping hub where they keep all the supplies.  This meant that there was a lot of housekeeping staff talking very loudly right outside my door, starting at like 7AM.  I would have been pissed if I was there on vacation, but because I was working, I was up anyway.-The breakfast area had a very bad fruit fly infestation.  We had to throw out food a couple times because one had drowned in the food/drink.I think a 3.5 is probably a more accurate rating but Yelp doesn't allow half stars, yet. I only stayed one night at the Comfort Inn. I should start our with the positives. The rooms were very clean and comfortable.  The air conditioner kept the room cool and the TV had full cable. The decor was modern, fresh, and appealing. They had a nice continental breakfast available in the morning. Now the not-so-good. I felt the location sucked. Yes there's a free trolley outside but it only runs every 30 minutes and can be difficult to navigate. The receptionist told me to take one trolley to the Visitor's Center, then switch to another trolley to get to where I was going. It sounded like a pain and time consuming so we just drove. This hotel is a good 1.5-2 miles from Historic Charleston. This hotel is very large and there's only two, very slow elevators. There's stairs available but only with outside entrances and exits. It's odd. Also, as others have said - the staff isn't exactly friendly or accommodating. They weren't rude but I felt they provided bare minimum service. All in all - for one night it was more than fine. However, if you're planning a visit to Charleston as a vacation then I would look elsewhere.Price was high for what we got. Paid 128 a night as part of a wedding block deal. Room was ok. Iron burns in the carpet. Shower didn't drain. Breakfast was alright (generic continental hot and cold breakfast) stayed in the bridal suite for a nights. Very large with a nice balcony. There was a late dead cockroach in the bridal suite. Pool was pretty lame and parking was very limited. Not that close to bars and restaurants. One elevator was broken the whole stay (4days) which was a pain and the stairs did not connect to the lobby.The hotel is a mix of 3, 4, and a 5.Location to the Historic Downtown Charleston - there is a free trolley (18 min? ride) that takes you into the Historic Downtown - Charleston Visitor Center. From there another free trolley takes you onto King Street (green line), Aquarium (orange line), and City Market (green line). Just take the purple line back to the hotel.Parking situation - we left our car at the hotel the whole time. We just took the shuttle and a cab at night $8 flat via 7-star luxury taxi. My husband and I thought I was a good deal and never had to worry about parking in the downtown area. The best thing was we kept our good parking spot. Extra Parking - was told you can park in the bank area, especially on the weekends since they are closed on sat/sun.Free Continental Breakfast - was alright. You can get full off the biscuit, toast, cereal, egg, sausage patties, yogurt, waffles, banana.. Sounds like a lot. Foodie spots - there were not a lot of foodie spots around the inn. You are pretty much next to the hospitals, VA center, medical university center of it all. Con - if you want to go to the beach (ie Folly Beach) yes, you would have to take your car. Hotel itself - it looked like the hotel had renovated and looked more up to date. Yet.. One thing that irked me was no security box to store your valuables. Thankfully we didn't bring anything valuable. The room was spacious, somewhat modern contemporary. It's not shabby and a lot better than what I have expected.Service - I would have to say the lack of towels that they replenished. We came back to the hotel room to find only 2 bath towels, and no hand towels and only 1 face towel.A real bummer of a hotel. The door to the room I was originally assigned was propped open and smelled like some type of mold/chemical/pesticide, pretty terrible. After a 30 minute wait, I was changed to another room. I know hotel staff are busy and all, but it's a disappointing introduction to Charleston, SC. I don't recommend staying here - not worth the price or location - there are better hotels in the area to check out.Update - there were also bugs in my room, including cockroaches.Run down, tired building. VERY little parking, room was dirty, nail trimmings between beds and nightstand. This is a cash cow due to being adjacent the VA and MU SC hospitals. Obviously corporate is squeezing all they can out out this facility. It is an insult to a staff that tries very hard to provide excellent service. Shame on them!  Read the canned responses from management with the low ratings on the Choice website. It is obvious volume trumps running a decent facility. This was our 5th trip to Charleston and have used the nearby Holiday Inns previously and they are infinitely better. Stay with them. The round HI is older but much cleaner with PLENTY of free parking. DO NOT help their bottom line. Maybe they will get the message.This is a descent, affordable hotel in an otherwise very expensive city for travelers.  I was able to stay two weekend nights for less than half what other hotels were charging in downtown.  Granted, this hotel is a long walk into downtown, but there is a free trolley that picks up in front of the hotel.  I tried that once but it took quite awhile and still puts you off north by the visitor's center (yet another 15 minute walk into the middle of the tourist area.)  We found that driving and paying to park was still much more affordable than paying to stay downtown - a cab ride back at night cost us $12.On to the hotel itself.  I wasn't overly enthused with the cleanliness of the hotel when I arrived.  The pillows looked dingy and the sheets were super wrinkled.  I also immediately tossed one pillow for the duration of my stay as there were two different, long hairs on it.  Aside from that the room was pretty clean.  There bathroom wasn't shining, that's for sure, and the toiletries were all half used.  Definitely a poor housekeeping crew.  Then the traditional issue with a chain hotel - the air condition.  I set it as low as it would go and consistently woke up in the middle of the night sweating.  It never got cool in our room and it was April - I hate to stay in this room in August!The room itself was updated very nicely with a modern color scheme and furniture, which made up for the drab experience otherwise.  There's free parking, coffee in the lobby, a business center, friendly staff, and again, the trolley outside.  So for the price, it will suffice.Staying in Charleston isn't cheap!  Well getting within spitting distance of either a beach or downtown isn't cheap at least.  And even the hotels in the North Charleston area that are from the nicer brands are pretty pricey.  So when I saw that I could get the Comfort Inn on Bee Street for less then $80 a night I decided to roll the dice and see what I could get.  Now don't get me wrong, I'm no stranger to Motel 6, Super  8, and the like but I have come to appreciate the nicer things in life and I do prefer a better brand if I'm going to be staying somewhere for more then a single night.Comfort Inn on Bee street was a solid 3 star experience for me.  No it wasn't as nice as say a Hilton Garden Inn or a Hyatt Place but it wasn't bad either.  I would rate it a solid value and a good alternative to somebody staying in Charleston on a budget.  Let me list for you the highlights, middlelights and lowlights of my experience.First the Hotel was renovated within the last 5 years.   In this case that means a flat screen TV, a working fridge (cleverly hidden in the cabinet that held the TV), unstained carpet, unworn furniture,  and a decent neutral color palate.  In another 5 years I might have a different opinion but for now the decor and upkeep are just fine.  The hotel offered hot free breakfast every morning that included at minimum, scrambled eggs, waffles, biscuits and gravy and various continental offerings.  The waffles were excellent, and they helped me fuel up each morning for a busy day, while saving me dollars.  Housekeeping was friendly and attentive.  Tipping didn't hurt, but it was nice to get fresh towels each day, especially since my  GF and I use a lot of them.  The bed was comfortable, and the AC was strong.  The pool was clean and of decent size, and the ice machines and drink machines all worked.  The room was quiet, there was neither guest noise, nor traffic noise to disturb our sleep.  Fellow guest were very quiet and unobtrusive (we had the pool all to ourselves the afternoon we decided to use it).  A lot of them were apparently staying there for use of the VA hospital that was across the street.  The staff was mostly friendly and helpful.
