The service has become extremely subpar over the years.I will post the DISGUSTING pictures, as soon as I can get them off my Blackberry...I've stayed in a handful of hotels in downtown and I must say that I love staying here. The rooms are huge, as expected because they're all suites, but there really is a lot of space between the private bedroom and separate living space. Every morning they have a full hot breakfast with choices like cereal, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, bagels, toast, bacon, eggs, sausage, pancakes, and yes... even made to order omelets! I made sure to catch breakfast every morning but if you go at the last minute, like everyone else, you might have to wait a bit or won't find a seat anywhere.In the evenings they also include a free happy hour although I was only able to take advantage once. The staff were excellent and helped me with a few things throughout the week including getting a couple packages delivered and making sure I received them in time. I also needed to spend most of my day in the room and then heading out for ours in the evening for an event. Every day when I left, I would call down and let them know I was heading out and that the room was available to be made up. No matter how quickly I came back, they had already sneaked through like ninjas to put everything back in order, make the beds, and replenish the towel supply.The location couldn't be better being that you're in Marion Square Park when you walk out the side door. You can walk to anything you might need in Charleston including all the bars and restaurants of the Upper King St area or all the shopping and dining of the Lower King area. Most of the historical and more tourist based activities are down by the Market which is very walkable but a rickshaw (bike taxi) or cab would do just fine for the true lazy vacationer.Old hotel that's been updated, but furnishing are still pretty dated and bathtub needs caulking and has black gouges in the enamel. Excellent, friendly service. Not the hotel's fault but there's construction right outside our window that starts at 7:30 am each morning and ends at 5. Giant drills, cranes and machinery breaking up concrete parking lot. Non stop noise that shakes the room and the entire end of the hotel. Avoid room 121, 120 , 220 etc for sure. Not sure how to avoid this. Construction we are told will last week or longer. Go somewhere else if you want some quiet or to sleep past 7:30 am.Yup, pricey hotel.  For the cost, the room and bathroom were just ok.  I've stayed in nicer, but I've certainly stayed in worse... and we saw no signs of bugs or anything dirty in our room.  The beds were comfortable, the pull out couch was fine, the pillows were nice... it was certainly sufficient.  The common areas were also nice, the fountain in the middle is classy for sure.But its the location that likely drives up the price- it's next to a beautiful park that has a huge farmers market on Saturday mornings, plus it's behind a bustling part of King Street, so you are literally steps away from some of the best shopping in Charleston.  Besides the location, there are two really delightful things about this hotel that make it stand out for me:1. Happy Hour.  Every night from 5:30pm-7:30pm, there's a free happy hour at the hotel.  They put out light refreshments, usually veggies and ranch dressing, and then a rotating selection of cheese and crackers, freshly made sweet potato chips, etc.  But the stand out is the bar.  It's a real, fully stocked bar.  And the drinks are good, strong drinks.  We made dinner reservations every evening for 8:30pm, so we could enjoy happy hour out on the patio, and then get dressed and head out for the night... it was the ultimate pre-party.2. Breakfast Buffet.  Every morning, they serve a full breakfast buffet for guests.  Made to order omlets, pancakes, sausage and bacon and fruit and cereal and pastries and  yogurt and grits and coffee and juice... everything you could possibly think of for breakfast.  This breakfast was worth paying for, but in fact was free each morning.I would stay here again in a heartbeat.We came to Charleston for a long weekend. Finding a good place close to downtown without being too expensive was important. We thought a historic building remade into a hotel would be cute. When we first entered the hotel, it appeared a little small but open and charming.  While the lobby was nice, the bedroom was small and the carpet really old. And the food was really just this side of bad mediocre. While the staff was nice, I can't give this place more than three stars.Beautiful hotel with an extraordinary entrance including exotic birds in a cage in the lobby. Like all embassy suites there is complimentary breakfast which is quite good with eggs made to order as well as a complimentary happy hour from 5:30-7:30 pm with light snacks. Not mentioned on the hotel website is that there is a hot tub in addition to the pool. I was also interested to learn that the hotel was once the old city citadel and you can see remnants inside the suites if you look closely. If it's to steamy to travel to the market during the day there is usually someone selling baskets in the lobby in the evening or you can always use Charlestons rickshaw service who can usually make it there before an Uber and is also less expensive. It would have been a perfect stay except for the construction that stared at 7am! We were on the top floor and it was incredibly noisy and actual shook our bed.2.5 StarsTo be fair, I have to note that I used points during my stay because rates were ridiculous high during the week of my stay.Pros:+ Location- You are within walking distance of tons of restaurants and shops as well within a block of a stop for the free trolley. + Suites- They did offer separate living/working/sleeping spaces+ Room amenities-  They did have a microwave and small fridge+ Lobby- Nice and comfortable couch and chairs to lounge+ Free cooked-to-order breakfast and a nightly happy hour with snacks (if you can eat the food)Cons:- This place is old and the rooms need a make over. It looks like they did work on the bathroom and counter top with sink and holds the fridge and microwave, but forgot about the rest of the room. - The furniture was dated and stained- A/C - it didn't seem to work correctly. It wouldn't cool the rooms with the beds without having the door that separated it and the living spaceOur first hour in Charleston led us straight here. Thanks yelpers.  The fried chicken biscuit is insane.  Get it. Just do it. And get it the way they serve it, at least the first the. Its assumed that the chicken and the biscuit would be top notch, and they were.  The real surprise is the pairing with the pickle and siracha mayo.  The pickle is wonderfully tangy while the spice of the siracha adds another layer of flavor and the creaminess of the mayo ties everything together. Super good.Not your typical Embassy Suites.  Very historical looking.  They brought us waters and popcorn mid day and later cake.  Really nice & goes to show the southern hospitality I'm always hearing about.The rooms were clean and spacious.  Free wifi and plenty of cable channels.  Had a suite so bedroom was separate.  They serve breakfast every morning and omelette made to order which are tasty -- made with real eggs vs. carton eggs.  In the early evening they serve complimentary wine and snacks.  Had a few nibbles while waiting for our cab before dinner.We went to lunch and walked around to explore the town some upon arrival... it started pouring rain on our way back... when we returned to the hotel there were fresh towels waiting in the lobby for us to use to dry off with.  Another nice well thought out perk!I found people who worked in service were over the top exemplary, but the Southern guests or people in general were rude and obnoxious.  One woman couldn't open the door from the patio to the breakfast area... I watched the whole incident where she walked around and started to yell at one of the staff.  He asked if she tried the other door and she was offended and said "I'm not that ignorant", which she was because she didn't try the other door!  Anyway, the hotel may want to consider putting a sign up on that other door.  I hate seeing innocent working people getting chewed out for issues that are not their fault.We booked our stay here because of the great location. The common space is very pretty. The room we have is very outdated and dirty. The hvac vents are dirty and gross. The walls have dust clinging to them. The carpet has been patched. The rooms look tried and worn out. The web site shows big bathrooms with garden tubs and our ours is very small with a very small tub/shower combo. The desk has no light on the desk or on the wall, so it very dark. The bedroom area is very small. The front desk staff/concierge service has been less than helpful. They did not have much information on events that were going on right next door to the hotel. The breakfast staff and food has been good. I would not recommend this hotel to stay at. Very disappointing.Dead flies and live spider on the window sill?Great location but room was dirty.  I put out our dishes from room service before we went to our 8pm show...and they were still there when we left our room for breakfast at 9am the next morning. Perhaps they didn't see it? Oh wait! We were nextdoor to the staff only facility door, and I actually saw the housekeeping trolley waiting outside my room yet they failed to pick up the tray. Mildew in the bathroom, peeling paint on the walls and insects (live and dead) in the window. No coffee table and no bedside table. Had to request my room to be cleaned twice in 12hours because it was not done.Breakfast was good with healthy and not healthy options.  Nice historic building but could use some tlc.Staff was friendly,  but need more training.Would not stay again.
review_content_20: **1.5 Stars**Booked a room here for Thursday (8/7) and Friday (8/8) of this week - a suite with 2 double beds. The place certainly was NOT inexpensive - $229 for Thursday night, $379 for Friday night, plus another $82 for taxes - adding up to nearly $700 for a two night stay. Spoiler alert: we only ended up staying one of the two nights...As noted by other reviewers, the hotel felt pretty dated. This was somewhat offset by the historical significance of the building, being housed within the "Old Citadel," which was actually pretty neat.The room itself was spacious, but again, felt very dated and was quite dark as the only windows were those looking out to the main interior of the hotel (i.e. no natural light) and having those curtains open meant forgoing any sort of privacy, as anyone walking down the hallway would be able to see directly into your room.The living room area and bathroom were both fine, but the bedroom layout was a bit awkward as the furniture was all off centered, leaving a large open space with nothing to fill it. Bedding left much to be desired and was super uncomfortable. The mattress springs could easily be felt pressing into the side of your body and oddly there were no standard size pillows, only small square ones like those you would find on a couch. Sadly, the pull out couch proved to be more comfortable than the actual beds.Aside from the lackluster room conditions:The hotel was LOUD with kids sprinting around the halls until 10:30PM. With the rooms all situated around one large common area everything going outside of the rooms is amplified.The bedding was also ITCHY! We didn't see any signs of bed bugs, but when we spoke to the person at the front desk they informed us that they had received complaints of bed bugs, ants, roaches, and fleas - so, it was quite possible that something was biting us.Needless to say, we checked out after the first night and found a different hotel!The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful, and the fresh cookies at check-in were delicious - but unfortunately that does not make up for the expensive, uncomfortable, and itchy hotel stay.We won't be back.We got in mid-afternoon and were told our room wasn't ready because we'd requested no air freshener or perfume sprayed in it. Told us to come back in 30 minutes. Got back in an hour, spoke to a new clerk. Room not ready, she wasn't very patient and finally told us to go sit somewhere and not stand there. (!) We waited and waited, there was a coffee setup in the lobby but the coffee was cold. We asked the concierge for some hot and after an hour finally gave up. Even with a big urn it doesn't take an hour to make coffee. We timed it, it was over an hour and a half. They were baking cookies to go with said coffee, but no coffee and nobody had bothered to check. Pitiful. Got to our room eventually, after a two-hour wait from when we first arrived. It was on the far end of the hotel, and it stunk of air freshener so much that we could taste it. We propped the door open with a chair to air it out but that didn't do much, so we called and complained. We did use the coffee maker, there was still no coffee in the lobby and we were tired and out of sorts by then. About a half hour later the night housekeeping supervisor called very apologetic, her boss had gotten the message but instead of dealing with it passed it to her and left for the day. She apologized and said she didn't know how that could happen etc. By then we were so unhappy we insisted on speaking to a manager. Some time later the Guest Services Manager came by and said he had a couple of other rooms we could look at. The first one we were shown was not perfumey in the least, why we couldn't have had it to begin with is anybody's guess. He apollogized but had no answers (and didn't seem to care that we'd gotten such a runaround). The room was older. There was a small window next to the bed, up high, and it leaked icy air all night. The carpet had stains. The tile in the shower could have stood a good scrubbing. Given all these deficiencies, we were highly amused when the guest manager said we would get turndown service, consisiting of two bottles of water and a snack (pretzels or chocolate) at 5:30 because we are Hhonors Silver members. Most hotels, the water is in the room. Some time later closer to 6 there was a knock at the door and the maid handed us to bottles of wter and one fun-size Hershey bar like you give out at Halloween. We declined it. It's like they're trying to be grand and haven't got a clue. Next morning we packed up and had breakfast, it was OK. The grits were excellent but the rest was just so-so. The cheap pastries were tired and had no taste, no donuts (they had bagels) and the bread for toast was airloaf. The orange juice had about twice as much water in it as it should have. I imagine the omelets would have been better than the premade eggs but at that point we just wanted to eat and leave. We won't go back. For what they charged plus $20+ for valet parking) we should have had a much better room, meal, and service. One positive note: The concierge was helpful, he directed us to a soul food restaurant around the corner where we had supper. That was the high spot of this visit.Having stayed in a number of Embassy Suites over the years, including several in the last year, I've come to expect a great hotel experience. This specific hotel is known for the fact that it is the renovated Citadel but the accolades stop there. The decorations are not as grand as the other locations throughout the lobby or in the rooms, the rooms are small and the furniture is old. The first night that I pulled out the sofa bed I nearly thought that I was going to fall through the mattress because of the huge dent in it and the air conditioner only blew cold air. The staff thankfully was quite responsive and our thermostat was promptly repaired.Like all Embassy Suites, they had a hot breakfast and I must say that the egg white omelets that they served up were better than others that I've had. The Krispy Kreme doughnuts were a nice addition to their breakfast selection. We didn't rush back to make it to the happy hour so I can't comment on that experience.As other reviewers have mentioned, the location was excellent. Next door in the park was the farmers market, the visitor's center was down the street, King's street was a block away and a nice selection of restaurants and bars were within walking distance. Hopefully in the near future more can be said of this place beyond the fact that it is the former Citadel because right now, the hotel is just that - historical. I think that overall, the hotel was decent and for the discount that we got, it was well worth it but this location struck me as being one of the neglected hotels in the chain.Everything about this place is amazing! The spacious rooms, the free happy hour with snacks, they even put a complimentary makeup remover wipe in the bathroom. That to me, is genius! It came in handy and I was impressed! The bathroom is huge and super clean! It looked like it was scrubbed down and really is very pristine! The only reason not 4 stars is the parking is expensive and not connected to the hotel, it is charleston so I understand but a perfect hotel would have free parking. Also there was no fan in the bedroom and I have trouble without sleeping with one bc I need the white noise. Other than that. This place is DIVINE!Let me start off by saying the staff at the hotel were great. However, we had to change rooms twice upon arrival because of a water leak and then a room that was much less than the one we booked. Upon moving into our third room we discovered that it too had a water leak that had been very recently repaired because the carpet was still wet! Our first morning there, Sunday, there was a church service being held in the park next door. Unfortunately the band was right outside the wall playing at rock concert volume making it impossible to sleep past 8 am and shaking the walls. Every morning past that we were again awakened at 8 am by the construction outside (hydraulically driving pylons into the ground) which could be heard everywhere in the city and shook the floor throughout the hotel. Thankfully the manager at the front desk comped our parking for the week. We would like to think that for over $200/night parking might be included instead of the $20/day we would have been charged! Upon checkout we didn't receive a bill under the door as you normally would. We checked at the front desk before we left for an itemized bill. Good thing we did because my credit card was about to be charged an extra $325 over what I had booked the room for. The staff was very helpful but there's no way we will be staying there on return visits.From the outside, the silhouette of an old fort/castle (formerly the Citadel) is amazing and inviting....once you walk inside, the hotel itself is not as cozy nor inviting as other Embassy Suites. The atrium is basic and bare....the first day we walked by the atrium on our way to breakfast we saw someone sleeping on one of the couches....this person seemed like a homeless guy, not a patron of the hotel... that was a big turnoff. Location is on the north end of the Historic District, which makes it a bit of a walk to the Battery and the City Market...The breakfast is the basic Embassy suites fare, but the fruit was bland (cantaloupe and melons tasted like nothing)...Breakfast area is very small and even though they let guests sit in other areas, it is not very convenient. Room was again...basic. It felt a bit dated. Overall an OK Embassy Suites, if it wasn't for the exterior, I would have given it 2 stars..."Great location, beautiful building"The hotel is a beautiful Charleston historic landmark and is on the National Register of Historic Buildings. The place used to be Citadel Military College and is right next to Marion Square. The rooms are nicely furnished and some of their walls are the original ones, with exposed bricks and all! Rooms are clean, they offer free wifi, cable TV and nice amenities.A breakfast buffet is included in the nightly rate and there's even a chef making pancakes, omelets and eggs to order. The evening Manager's reception offers complementary mixed drinks (really great margaritas), beer, wine and hors d'oeuvres. Every Embassy Suites has an atrium, but the one in Charleston is bright, spacious and with gorgeous flowers and plants that invite you to sit to relax for a while. The location is perfect: in the heart of historic downtown Charleston and walking distance from nice shops and restaurants on King, Market and Meeting streets.thebilingualtraveler.blo...Just spent 3days at the Hotel and room was spacious, staff was helpful, great breakfast. Location was close to everything and walking distance to shopping food and shopping.This hotel is above and beyond the average downtown hotel. The staff was very good. During the evening turn down service the staff left me wonderful chocolates and a nice note about the next day's weather. I haven't received this kind of customer service in a long time.Sabrina is the best. We would NOT of stayed here if it wasn't for her. She gives exceptional customer service, and should consider working for one of the more customer focused hotels. We were pleasantly surprised, because we didn't have much expectation for an embassy suite hotel. The room was fine, the pool was cool, location was amazing, but the other staff were not up to par. Sadly we will not come back.I stayed here for 2 out of 3 nights for buisness. The hotel was the Citadel at one time from what the front desk told me although they had no pictures to prove the story. The room was large and gave me more than enough room to relax and do my work. The breakfast was free and it filled the tank for my day on the job. Starting at 1730 they had drinks in the lobby and that was a good way to end a long day of work. I really like this hotel after spending a night accross the street at the Hampton Inn. I will stay here again when I return for work or pleasure.Hotel is an epic FAIL!! Very noisy from surrounding bars, and you can hear your neighbors since building construction is old and outdated. Rooms are blah, bathrooms have that dirty feel, and the staff from the bar served wine in lipstick stained glasses. If you can afford better, go to a different hotel.It's all good,,, I've stayed at several embassy suites. This one is cool because it used to be an old armory. The guest rooms are smaller than typical for embassy suites, but what they lack in size is made up for by the uniqueness of the property. It is an old building,,,, like the revolutionary war old!!! But again, it's very unique. I'll definitely stay here again.Our FAVORITE place to stay in Charleston. My fiancee proposed down in the battery while we were staying here. The staff was amazing!! He let them know what he was planning and while we were out, they placed roses, champagne and chocolates in our room. All complimentary! Outstanding customer service!! Also, we really enjoy their breakfast and welcome reception. Everyone we encountered was as pleasant and friendly as they could be. Can't wait to stay again this cStayed here for 2 nights while visiting Charleston for the first time. We thought it was closer to the heart of all the activities so we were a little disappointed with the location. We would recommend self park and not valet just because you probably will not need your car until you leave. Frank the concierge was not very friendly to me and that was disappointing. He had more of a do what I say or you might as well go home kind of philosophy and wasn't that forthcoming about the things I was interested in. The rest of the staff seemed friendly enough, but know that if you're having an omelet made to order it will take some time. They are not as quick as most Embassy Suites. I was impressed with the sweet potato chips and fresh veggies though that we had the first night during happy hour.Really nice place. The rooms are very large with a living room space and a bedroom. My room had two televisions and I really liked the granite counters for the dry bar area and bathroom. Complimentary breakfast in the morning was hot and tasty and they do customizable omelettes which were very good. There is also 2 complimentary beverages offered to guests at the hotel bar every night. Sweet. I forgot my tooth brush, tooth paste, and shaving cream at home and the concierge at the front gave me complimentary replacements, so that's great. I would have given it 5 stars but the fact that I only had one window in the entire suite was a small drawback. I guess that's the price you pay for repurposing a historic citadel buildingThe staff was great. When you valet your car they place three major newspapers in your car for the morning. Overall, I would say that it is the perfect balance between a corporate hotel and a historic building. It is owned by Hilton but there was minimal corporate signage and advertising which is nice when you're staying in the historical district.What's not to like!I am writing this from the hotel room, on our second and last night. My 2 year old son is asleep in a crib (provided by hotel) in the separate living room, and my husband and I can watch tv without disturbing the little one. A 2-room suite is a must when travelling with kids, and this was the only hotel I could find that had this, at that price, with this prime location. We walked everywhere from the hotel, they lent us an umbrella, had our room ready before the regular check-in time, provide a drink reception every night in the lobby, and free hot breakfast. The staff is super nice, the hotel is a historic building and looks amazing, I wouldn't think of going anywhere else if I ever come back, and will recommend this hotel.Stayed the weekend of 10/23 - 10/26.As a Diamond HHonors member, I prefer to stay at Hilton hotels, so as usual I booked this hotel. This was a tremendous stay for me, everyone from the bell-caps to housekeeping were outstanding. I drove my car and used the valet, I was able to call down for my car whenever I needed it. I didn't participate in the breakfast buffet or evening social as we were more interested in dining out at the many top choices in Charleston. We'll be staying here the next time we come to Charleston, its central location to almost everything and the proximity to High Street where many restaurants and clubs makes it an advantage. I have to add something, whenever I walked by the front desk I got a hello from both Rachel and Hanna, I found it odd that these two young ladies were working during each time I walked by the front desk from morning to evening, I found it nice that they were always pleasant regardless of how many hours they actually work.I checked in at 10:30 PM, so I didn't have a chance to enjoy the happy hour. As a Hilton Honors Member, I was greeted with a welcome bag and water bottles. There was no bellman available, so I helped myself to the many luggage carts in the lobby. When the bellman/valet appeared he offered to help. At that point, I figured I was 85% there in loading my luggage. So as a bellman not so great, but he was a helpful concierge. He directed me to the 24 hour Walgreens across the park. The park is a bit dark. He claimed it was safe (that night it was). Lily at the front desk was kind during my check in and gave helpful tips. The rooms could use and update and a really good cleaning. Luckily, I had a double bed room, or I would've enjoyed the DNA and hair of the prior room occupants in one of the beds. The rooms are large, for a centrally located hotel, that is a plus. My room was on the "construction" side of the hotel. They don't start that early thankfully, bit I was greeted at 5:40 AM with the hum of machinery somewhere in very near vicinity. Staff was nice, but for the price and the room cleanliness/DNA issues, I give a solid, "meh".I've been here several times and I've finally heard the poops. Haunted. Yep, ghosts. He even has a name, "Half Head". The corner rooms, on the mezz, have had numerous complaints of a teenage boy with only half a head coming and visiting them in their rooms at night. Apparently he's a friendly bloke, and not out just for mischief. I think the true attraction is how close it is to King Street, where there are lots of restaurants and stores. Walking distance.
review_content_40: Walk through to see the place, but keep on walking... Very cool that it is the old Citadel restored but other than that, stay somewhere else honestly.  The location is great but there are some other kick-butt hotels nearby for $200 a night...I've stayed at this hotel 3 separate times...and there's a reason. Dated. Super dated. If the location wasn't so great (right on Marion Square) and the staff not so nice, we'd be looking at 3 stars.  But honestly, for a few nights, it's a comfortable place, with traditionally spacious suites and a pool/gym downstairs.  Happy hour each evening for free drinks and light apps is a nice touch. Those who like a hotel breakfast will appreciate the nice free buffet downstairs. But again, don't say I didn't warn you.  The fixtures look like they're from the 90's, and the decor is terrible maroon/evergreen and in some places tacky floral.  Get out of the room, enjoy your time in Charleston!The location is great.  Albeit not too healthy, the breakfast in the morning is great and made to order.  And the staff was nice and knowledgeable.  Sorry folks I hate to write a negative review...BUT...I really didn't like the room, we didn't have a single window in our room.  It felt like a prison...I travel a ton for business and I am used to staying in similar hotels and this probably my least favorite ever.   They also had a bird in the lobby that you could hear all the way on the other side of the hotel with the door closed.  I am not sure whose idea it is to have a squawking bird in the lobby.  Also, the pictures i looked really do not represent the experience I had.Always a good stay here. We stay here when family is in town and we want to bar hop for the night. Can't beat the managers special (warm up for the night) and free breakfast in the morning. This hotel is dated but that adds to the historical charm. Definitely not your typical Embassy. Staff are very friendly and helpful.Stay here for 2 main reasons: convenience and space. You will get a spacious room and never need a car because you can walk everywhere. Start your day with a breakfast of omelettes cooked to order, and then you can spend your dining budget on the endless options of wonderful cuisine downtown for lunch and dinner. The hotel hosts a daily happy hour that serves mediocre wine (I'd recommend skipping it) and cheap beer, but it's free so one can't really complain. Visiting Charleston means eating a lot of great food. So when you are looking for the fitness center at this hotel, you could miss it if you blink. It's in the pool house building. I did not sense that it is used frequently judging by the dust and dirt on the otherwise decent cardio equipment and free weights. You're better off going for a run along Meeting street to the battery.Overall, it's a great hotel for the two reasons mentioned above. But for the price point, I'd expect it to be a little bit better.Great rooms with a historic touch. Managers reception, great breakfast. Walking distance to many of Charleston's best attractions and restraunts.Channel 70 crew arrived in the wee hours in a cold, pounding, rain after six hours in a bouncing rental van. The desk clerk had us checked in mere nano-seconds. Yes! A few hours later, we caught the very end of breakfast. The cook asked us if we wanted seconds as he was getting ready to close the line. Nice.The following morning, a garbage truck somewhere below my window substituted for the morning wake up call. Not fun. Also, the desk is sometimes slow to answer calls, but  not enough so to be a game changer.Overall, this ES is at the top of its form. (now, if they could  just get rid of early AM garbage trucks)Aesthetically, it is a beautiful hotel.  Room is really nice with a separate living room and a bedroom with an exposed brick wall.  Bed was comfortable.  However, the walls are PAPER THIN.  The wall in the bedroom...could totally hear conversations going on in the other room and last night...could totally hear the couple making love (headboard creaking and all)...ewwwwww.  And the doors to all rooms face into a noisy courtyard that makes it impossible to not hear kids screaming and running around in the halls early morning.  Impossible to sleep in.  You can also hear doors slamming.   The location is great and you are paying a premium for that location.  This is a renovated building (used to be part of the Citadel)...a recent one at that. Would have expected that they would have put a little more thought in the construction.Great staff! Excellent service and in a very great location. The price was affordable for our suite top notch service. Although check in was at 3pm, the Manager allowed us to check in at 10 am!!! Now that is service :) Highly recommended and while the pool wasn't the best and the food wasn't the best, who stays at their hotel at all when you are in Charleston???? Go explore some of the best restaurants in the nation !!!!!What a disappointing experience. My husband and I attended a wedding in Charleston and this hotel was listed as an option by the wedding party. The exterior and the front area if the hotel lead you to believe that you will have a 'Charlestonian'  experience but once you get past that it is a tired motel experience. Our sleeping room had a king bed crammed into a room that was not big enough for a Queen bed. There was only room for 1 bedside table. It smelled like a 'motel' and all of the accessories from the toiletries to the coffee were low-end. The only that wasn't low end was the $384 bill for 1 night. Charleston hotels are expensive but you should at least enjoy your accommodations--skip this option!Very nice place.  Stayed four nights - just the wife and I - and had an overall good experience.  Always love the suite so we each have a tv and a place for "alone" time.   Breakfast is, of course, included and was very good.  I had a made-to-order omelet 2 of 4 mornings.  Bacon they prepared was especially tasty.It's the old Citadel and the windows in the rooms (at least the one we were in) are not at eye level; not a real problem, still plenty of natural light in the bedroom.Service was generally very good although housekeeping only left us one bath towel one day but a call to the desk rectified this.Great location as long as you like to walk - which we do.  Had no problem walking to Battery etc.  Several nice restaurants a block or two away on Kent (the hotel is on Meeting).Definitely recommend.  Sadly this is the end of our New Orleans/Charleston vacation.4 stars for the staff but 2.5 for the hotel. The free breakfast was great, be sure to have them make you an omelet to order. The room was big but so weird with the windows 6-8 feet above ground. I had to climb up on the ledge to look out. I had small cockroaches in my bathroom each night and when I looked under the sink I understood why. There were big holes into the wall around the pipes. The place had some upgrades but still felt dated. My shower had more water still coming out of the faucet than the shower head but the staff did say they would work to fix it. Just an odd feeling to the place. It was in a great location. Walking distance to everything! So a very mixed review.Stayed here earlier this week for the third time.  The rooms get 1.5 stars - they really did a cheap job when renovating.  And the wireless is slowThe positives are a good location and nice staffPlus, if it's important to you, they have three types of microwavable meatloaf for sale in the pantry off the front desk...We stayed at this hotel because a block of rooms was reserved there for the wedding we were in town to attend. It's a very historic looking building with an inviting lobby and very friendly staff. The breakfast is top notch for this level of hotel. We enjoyed everything about our stay, except for the paper-thin walls between rooms. If our neighbors were having a conversation in the bedroom, we could hear every single word. This wasn't the case in the living room, probably because the sound of the fountain in the courtyard helped drown it out, but it's odd to hear someone next door so clearly it's as if they're in the room with you. The hotel is in a great location to local attractions, and all things considered, we'd likely stay here again.This hotel is really great. It's not fancy, but it's clean, economical & well run. The free (cooked to order) breakfast & free drinks & appetizers at 5:30 is a huge savings for a vacation or business trip. It is located well, especially since North King street is up & coming & really close.  We didn't actually discover it until our last night, but still enjoyed all the hip new clubs.  No disappointments here at all!Very good hotel choice if staying downtown. Big rooms/suites, excellent service, and daily happy hour. Walking to King Street is easy, and close to some good restaurants and bars. This is my choice when possible. Stayed several times, never had bad experience.Although pricey, as even with my corporate discount it was $179/nite, plus $18/day to park, this is a fine hotel. Rooms are very clean and spacious. Hotel has a nice open, airy feel to it. Staff is helpful and friendly. Hotel is located in a great spot to where you can walk to the tourist hot spots. This used to be an old fort, and my room still had a gun port in it. Cool.You do get free breakfast which is pretty robust.They will even cook an omelette to order for you. There's also a happy hour around 5:30 each night where you get free drinks and snacks.The hotel and rooms are very clean. The staff is prompt and friendly. The hotel is walking a short walking distance to King street and a little longer to market street. Perfect place to stay while being a charleston tourist.Refer to Daniel C review on 3/11. Staff A++location AInside/outside seating AAmenities (happy hour,food,breakfast)-AShower BCouches in room (mystery stains) D+Overall wonderful experienceOur family stayed here for 3 nights.  Great location for walking to get food and seeing the sights.  The rooms are nice and clean.  Staff was very nice.  The breakfast in the mornings was good.  Something for everyone.  Make sure to try the made to order omelet bar.  Evening drinks and snacks were good.  The pool is ok, I saw a mouse climb up the wall while I was watching the kids play in the pool.  The gym is small but has 2 treadmills and some other type of machine and plenty of free weights.  All in all I enjoyed this hotel.
review_content_60: Clean, helpful and courteous staff, comfortable, great amenities, good breakfast, free drinks 5-7PM, and they accommodate smokers. Their food isn't bad for hotel food, but wouldn't go out of my way to eat here with so much other excellent dining in the area.so much better in pictures! I love the fact that this is a converted space and wasn't torn down to make room for some generic thing, but I thought the hotel was kind of creepy. The rooms are as said, very basic, not horrible but not all that great either. Not all that big. The beds are very comfortable, and a few other nice things - breakfast included and there is an evening happy hour thing also included. Location is pretty good, you're near upper king and Marion Square.Ok, let me start by saying that in the last three years I have spent more nights in a Hilton property than my own home, not necessarily a reccommended accomplishment, but it does give me a good frame of reference. Great interior.  It is actually the original Citadel. Very friendly and attentive staff. The rooms are older but have been remodeld and nicely updated.  There is a nightly manager's special with complementary drinks and a great free breakfast.  The only issue I had was that the work out facility was sub par to some of the other Embassy's I've visited.  Not bad,but almost as an after thought.  It's kinda of hidden in a room off the pool.  If I could have rated it 4 1/2 stars, I would have.  Nice place to stay!Very solid hotel.  The rooms are basic and dont have attention to detail (i.e. none of the clocks are set right or to each other).  But they are large, have a kitchenette, great TVs, comfortable beds and nice coffee service.  The hotel is in a great spot.  We will stay here again.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The happy hour was a nice bonus. The first room wasn't wonderful. It felt very humid/wet and had an odd smell but we assumed it was because it was hot out and maybe some smells were from the  market. Yes, it was weird that the floor was damp... And then it rained terribly one night... The ceiling started leaking and water dripped onto the carpet and one of the chairs. It started slow then really picked up. We had our answer. This was, obviously, not the first occurrence. They did switch our room for the last night with no issue but never offered anything to make up for the inconvenience. The new room felt better. The style of the building was neat as it is the old Citadel. The breakfast was great and the omlet chef was very nice. Make sure you buy your own bottled soft drinks as they were 2.50 in the hotel concession area. Very close to the main shopping areas of King Street. Short walk to the outdoor market. The Saturday market sets up along the side of the hotel and is full of awesome vendors.This Embassy Suites is one of the best that I have stayed at; friendly employees, clean rooms, a wonderful breakfast, and in walking distance from historic Charleston.  Even the parking attendant talked to us about our trip and how we were doing, as well as the bellboy who did the same, telling us about the time he and a friend hitchhiked to San Francisco and lived in the Haite Ash berry and saw all of the hippie actions and things that happen in that neighborhood.  The building was an old citadel and has hard wood floors in the lobby, plus some of the old architecture throughout the hotel.  Breakfast was pretty good with fresh orange juice, fluffy pancakes, and tender sausage and tender, crispy bacon.  I did not go down for happy hour, but it sounded good.  So, for a clean hotel, particularly one of the cleanest Embassy Suites with a friendly staff to mach, the Embassy Suites Historic Charleston cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.!

review_content: I'm in their bed right now! Ohh... risque!It's a Red Roof Inn... so the rooms face outside. If you can get over that... and realize you're paying less than $100 for a hotel room near Charleston then you'll be okay.The building is older... but that's about it. This hotel is branded as a Red Roof PLUS+ (plus plus!). Nearly everything has been refreshed. The rooms have wood-like floors, modern cabinetry, lots of charging plugs near the bed, and even one of those fancy vessel sinks. The TV is a brand-name HD screen with ALL HD channels... which is nice for a hotel of this quality (2-star). There is free WiFi throughout but don't expect it to be super-duper high speed. At 9:30pm it's only .52 Mbps UP/ .26 Mbps DOWN. Yes.. POINT 52. But hey, free is free. Overall, compared with staying in downtown Charleston... this place is nice, cheap, and less than a 10 minute drive across the big bridge. Bottom line: Give it a shot! It's better than a normal Red Roof!Website says they have free breakfast. They do not even offer grab and go or ANY breakfast.. They advertise this as a "plus" property but it has no better amenities than any of the $49 a night red roof inns across the country. In fact they charge extra for a fridge and microwave in the room here...I am trying figure out exactly what the Plus in Red Roof Inn Plus is for.Is the Plus for the clothes that was left in the drawers from the prior guest that the cleaning staff did not find?  Or is the Plus for the group of Walmart remodelers who start drinking beer at 7 am and grill out in the parking lot just below our room  that the front counter person approves of?  Or could it be for the domestic that was taking place in the room next to ours?  Or maybe it stands for the internet connection that did not work and the hotel staff that seemed unconcerned?Not really sure what the Plus is for?!Over all the rooms we recently remodeled and looked very nice and the hotel is located in a very convenient location. Don't ask for a refund for your bad experience because the counter girl will just tell you it was not their fault.Safe travels!Decent place to lay head for the night for an economy hotel. Clean. Pool small but nice for a dip to cool off. No complaints.We were impressed with the appearance and the upgrades they've done to the rooms. The bathroom was HUGE! however our room didn't have an iron, and they do not provide maid service on day 2. (No fresh towels, bed was not made). It is in a great location to downtown Charleston and all the attractions.It's a basic hotel but it was comfortable.  The bathroom is a tad bit small & there were black marks on the ceiling that probably should be cleaned but overall it was what decent.This is the second Red Roof Inn I have ever visited and I was not disappointed. My wife and I arrived way before check in time (4:30 am) and the guy at front desk said he would help us out and have a room ready in an hour for no extra charge. He gave us some info about local 24 hour places to grab some early breakfast and then gave us a map of Charleston. The room was great and had everything we needed for a quick overnight visit. Everything was very clean and the shower was a good size. We needed a razor and an iron which they had in the lobby for no extra charge. The location was great as we were right off the Mt. Pleasant entrance to the bridge into Charleston (which means we were only like 10-15 min to anything in downtown Charleston). In addition, there are a few restaurants and shopping centers right around the hotel. We would definitely stay here again.1st night: so far so good. Quick check in, friendly staff, and choice of lower level room. The room was really clean, hardwood floors (yay!), and overall very clean. Bathroom is a little small, but not a deal breaker. Plenty of hangers, and a small safe, if you need it. FREE WI-FI, which is a definite plus. Overall, pleasantly surprised.Very dog friendly which was the main reason for booking, a little disappointed they did not have simple breakfast in the morning.  The rooms were clean and the location was great. Very close to the downtown Charleston atmosphere.Not sure what the new PLUS is for. We stayed here a couple of years ago, and were very happy with the location and the convenience of the hotel. So, when we were returning to Charleston for a couple of days, we immediately booked with Red Roof Inn. We were ahead of schedule, so a few hours before arrival, we called to see if we could check in early. We were surprised to be told that the ground floor room we had requested (I have bad knees), SEVERAL WEEKS AGO, MIGHT be available, if the people currently in it checked out. If they decided to stay, our RESERVED room would not be available, but we could have a second floor room...no elevator. Fortunately, we were able to get the ground floor room,,,the one we RESERVED WEEKS ago! The hotel is very convenient to several shops and restaurants, and provides easy access to Charleston. However, the PLUS isn't clear. I could never get my tablet to connect to wifi, although my husband had no trouble connecting his laptop. I assumed it was a glitch with my tablet, but when we checked into the LaQuinta in Savannah, it connected immediately. There is no coffee maker in room, no breakfast, no ironing board or iron, all of which are included in competitors' rooms, often at a lower price.Those things are not a deal breaker, but not being assured of a reserved room in a busy city like Charleston is absolutely unacceptable.Last winter looking for a break from a frigid and snowy northern VA winter last March, I was looking for an affordable and dog friendly hotel in Mount Pleasant, SC near Sullivan's Island. (My favorite vacation spot). This RRI was a perfect match.  No more than a 10 minute drive from the ocean (SI), its location was perfect. It is close to all a vacationer would want: Whole Foods, Starbucks, drug stores, pizzaria, and more. Mt. P is a charming little town.  The RRI staff was efficient and friendly and the room was comfortable with HD flat screen, clean, good shower water pressure, fast wifi.  FYI most of the rooms facing the pond do not have microwaves and mini fridges.  This was a challenge to eat healthy as most of my dinners were take out. Next time I will book early to secure a prime room. Speaking of the pond, it is beautiful with a spacious attractive bench overlooking it. A couple of mornings I had my coffee there and the budding spring weather and tranquil water was a great start to my day.  One negative is the cigarette butts on the ground below the bench.  The staff works to remove them, but can't keep up with the daily influx of lazy inconsiderate smokers. My dog loves the water, but I was advised by the lady who checked us in to beware of the pond due to a recent alligator sighting !!!  When I return to Mount Pleasant my dog and I will eagerly return to this Red Roof Inn.For a Red Roof Inn, I was quite pleased. The front desk clerk (I didn't catch her name) was sweet and very helpful.When we arrived to Charleston after a 6 hour drive, I logged onto Expedia and started looking for hotels. This place came up and I'm glad it did. Certainly the most affordable hotel I could find on the strip. We got the deluxe room for only $10 more from a standard room. Pet allowance was a deal breaker for me because I had my puppy with me and there was no extra charge for pets. The rooms were very clean, comfy beds, and a fridge/microwave which is always nice.Tip: the even numbered rooms are facing the main road in Mt. Pleasant and all of the odd numbered roads are on the other side of the hotel, overlooking a pond. I like the hustle and bustle and lights so I'm glad we were given an even numbered room. Would I return? Absolutely.Recently refurbished! Beautiful, smoke free, comfortable room. Flat screen TV, Wifi, super easy online booking and a really great price. Very satisfied.I paid for a deluxe room and NO coffee maker?!!! Microwave and refrigerator but no coffee maker seems ridiculous and the room with one would cost me $10 more a day. I will never stay here again.I was very iffy about this place at first but after looking around the area for a hotel and prices it was very affordable. This is a newly all renovated place and is really nice. The staff was really friendly and helpful and I would definitely come back! Only down fall is you will hear noise from out side with other people walking past and talking but everything else was great. I would recommend this red roof especially for the price. If you don't want to spend all your vacation money on a hotel I would say stay here. It's the perfect location for everything. Your near all the restaurant's and shopping and your around the corner from the bridge to take you into downtown Charleston. It only takes like 10 minutes from hotel can't beat it at all!!!!!I had no problem with this hotel. However, I should say that it is a Red Roof, not the Waldorf Astoria or Ritz Carlton. If you want a 5 star Pamper the customer to no end hotel, then get one. That said, my room was clean, the front desk clerk (Becky was on duty when I checked in) was fantastic, being friendly, efficient, and helpful.My room was clean, everything worked, etc. In other words, it was a clean place to store my stuff, shower, and sleep. If you have a choice, I'd recommend getting an Odd Numbered room, as they are in the back of the hotel, overlook a pond, and are away from the main road. The location is good, right off Route 17 near Patriots Point, and there are a couple of small shopping centers nearby. It is also about 5 minutes from Downtown Charleston, so the city is accessible without paying city prices...The bed and pillows were quite comfortable to me. The only drawbacks were a small, but functional bathroom, and no continental breakfast, but those aren't dealbreakers for me. I would stay there again if I'm in the area.It's a Red Roof Inn so it can only top out with three stars. However, it's a great bargain in Mt P. Great location.First room covered in dog hair second room had bed bugs. staff super friendly but you can't polish a turd:(Just avoid this hotel, it needs too much work to save the money you would by staying here with bed bugs.What a shit hole! When we reserved our room they told us that there were coffee pots in the rooms, micro waves, refrigerators and no bed bugs.  they were wrong on all counts.  Of course the worst were the bed bugs.  We had to leave and find a different hotel.  They denied that that they had bed bugs and would not refund our money.  Maybe it was my fault, after all what do you expect for $ 100"per night. Any where else but  the Red Rash Inn.I had gone to Priceline to book my hotel, and this was what was chosen for me. I was a little iffy since I had heard Red Roof Inns aren't great, but this place was decent. Maybe I'm used to hotels, and didn't pack a hair dryer because I assumed it would be in the room - nope! But the room was clean, small, I got to check in a couple of hours early and the front desk attendant was very nice and accommodating. Even when I went to check out, I needed to check into my flight, and the woman at the front desk let me use one of the computers. It was in October, so an off-season in SC, and the gate was locked around the pool. I asked if the gate could be unlocked just so I could lay out, and they had no problem doing that! The walls were kind of thin, there was a dog in the room next door and kept whimpering all throughout the night when no one was in the room. I would have liked to stay on the beach or in downtown Charleston, but overall this place was good for someone just using it to put their things down and sleep.

I went to Charleston on a weekend girl's trip and we stayed at Harborview Inn. This hotel is in a great location, the staff is superb and ultra-friendly, the perks are the icing on the cake. The size of the rooms ( and bathrooms) were phenomenal. The futniture, fixtures, and hardware were a breath of fresh air because it added to the charm of the city....felt like someone put thought into the senses of and with the customer in mind.There was enough counter space which was surprising.My room was near the atrium, unlimited coffee, tea, hot chocolate (with marshmallows). They also served wine and cheese on a daily basis. The main lobby felt like home. Great view, wood burning fireplace, and an open business area. We arranged a travelzoo deal which included a daily breakfast. Delivery and variety did not disappoint.The location was great. Next to shops, snacks, restuarants, bars...all walking distance!I'd definitely stay here again...and again.My girlfriend and I were heading to Charleston from Savannah right after all the flooding from hurricane Joaquin, we were debating on if we would make the drive because of all the road closures..We arrived downtown without a place to stay, so we drove around looking for nice parts of town, since neither of us had even been to Charleston.. We were down by the water and came across the harborview inn. The hotel was classy looking and appeared to be super expensive, we were sure it was out of our budget. After googling some amazing reviews we figured we would call, just for the heck of it.. We spoke to a very nice gentleman named MIKE.. We asked if they had a room available, and they said they did. The price was less then expected, but still out of our price range.. After explaining to him our situation and price range he put us on hold and came back with a rate we felt we couldn't refuse.. Wow are we glad we did..After entering the lobby we knew we made a good call. We introduced ourselves to MIKE and gave him all our info for check-in. MIKE said that our room wouldn't be ready for awhile, but maybe he could find a room that was ready. Well he upgraded is to this amazing room that blew is away.. Can't say enough about Mike and Jack.. Jack is the bellhop and valet.. Thanks guys for making our stay amazing !!For being a local, I don't get the opportunity to stay in hotels often, but when downtown flooded and I had a work obligation for the weekend, I found refuge in this lovely little hotel. Small enough to feel boutique, but large enough for some killer amenities. You can't beat the late check out, breakfast, complimentary wifi and great view! I'm well traveled and have stayed in some of the best hotels in larger cities, and this room is up with the top! The bed may be the most comfortable I've ever slept in a hotel, and that shower- heavenly. I'll be recommending this to anyone I know staying in the area, it's well worth the price!5 stars for us! We were spoiled with having a room close to the front desk so we were just steps from the wine & cheese in the evening, the cookies & milk at night, and the cozy fireplace with the pretty view of the harbor. Not to mention our balcony view of the harbor! Very cute! Would definitely recommend this little gem on the harbor :-)Location cannot be beaten. Right in the midst of the French Quarter with all that is Charlestown at your feet. An assortment of continental style breakfasts are include with your accommodations as well as Happy Hour wines and cheeses. The service at these "included" amenities are lack luster. The woman pouring the wine at Happy Hour was pouring as she was looking down at her phone and either texting or reading texts. The room service server was in such a hurry to drop the breakfast tray and run that she missed out on the cash tip we were going to give her. Rooms comfortable and the beds snuggly. We would return to the Inn on our next visit.I had a work emergency arise and had to cancel my reservation 48 hours in advance of my scheduled arrival.  The immediate response was to bill me immediately for (1) night, which I find utterly ridiculous.  Life happens, emergencies happen, and most certainly work emergencies happen.  They should be flexible and instead they choose not.Oh well, regardless of its great location I will continue to visit Charleston and using other properties.Perfect.  Amazing location, great rooftop terrace, extremely comfortable bed, really nice shower and bathroom.The price was a little much for someone who doesn't make a ton of money.  But wow, there is nothing bad to write about this place.  They do wine and cheese from 5-6pm (free) daily.  Cookies and milk from 9pm+ (free), and breakfast delivered to your request (as long as you fill out the paperwork).  Coffee and tea (frees) always out in the atrium, as well as fruit (apples, bananas, oranges).  Not to mention the staff was extremely nice, well, except the girl who delivered the food for breakfast, i don't know what it was, but it stuck out really poorly mostly because all the other staff was so friendly from the front desk, to the bellboys, to the girls who help with the wine and cheese.Don't even consider staying somewhere else, stay here.The perfect spot to stay when you're in Charleston! I was in town recently for a girls weekend and can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel.   From the time I made our reservations by phone to our check out, we had an extremely positive experience.The hotel is in prime location literally across the street from Charleston Waterfront Park and minutes from the Water Taxi. Everything is within walking distance so there is no need to rent a car or drive. We had a room with 2  comfy queen beds which were comparable to what you'd see in a Westin or W. The room was very spacious as well as the bathroom. There was also wait staff that would come to our room every day to do "turn down service" which I am not used to and seemed a little funny to me. The coolest part was the complimentary breakfast that was delivered to our room. We had to fill out a breakfast card of what we would like to eat and hang it on our doorknob the night before with our desired breakfast delivery time. Like clockwork, our meals were delivered to our room. Make sure to tip!They also offer complimentary cookies and milk from 9p-10p every night as well as complimentary fruit, coffee and tea downstairs in the lobby. We were out late a few nights and for security measures, you need your hotel card to even enter the hotel which I liked. Don't think I will stay anywhere else the next time I am in town. This place is one that I would highly recommend. It is a little pricey but is worth the cost when it comes to the perks and location.Stayed here for 6 days in February. Booked the romance package, which came with Valet parking, private carriage tour of Charleston, champagne in the room, breakfast in bed daily, red roses upon arrival, and a $100 gift certificate for the High Cotton restaurant. The location of this hotel is convenient, right by numerous restaurant and bars and close to the King street shopping area. It's in a beautiful neighborhood with plenty to do and plenty historic buildings. The service was good, but they forgot the champagne. The hotel does not have a working kitchen for hot food, so room service is not an option and the breakfast in bed meant continental cold foods only, but they did offer tea and coffee. But it never bothered us, as Charleston offers a wide array of good quality restaurants nearbyGreat bed, breakfast and wine and cheese hour. Super location with views of harbor and great access to restaurants and historic district. First class staff with spacious room and amenities. Would recommend and return.  Valet parking on premise.Really excellent stay.   Great breakfasts and amazing service.  One night we did not get turn down service, but that was literally my only complaint!  They could change up the afternoon snacks a bit (jelly beans, etc). The chocolate got melty in the hot weather when we would walk out with it. Would absolutely stay here again the next time I'm in town. I felt like it compared to a nice ritz carlton.As a result of researching hotels for a Charleston trip for my wife and me, we picked the HarbourView Inn because of its amenities and location in the French Quarter on the Charleston harbor waterfront.We were given a water-view room that was very well appointed, sufficiently spacious, and extremely quiet, comfortable, and clean.  Our amenities included complimentary afternoon wine and cheese in the atrium.  The continental breakfast was inclusive and delivery options included our room, the atrium, or the hotel's rooftop.  We chose the rooftop because of the nice views and the fine weather.  We breakfasted at the hotel three mornings and were wholly satisfied with the quality and variety that included yogurt, parfaits, fruit, cereal, and baked goods plus drinks.Our service was excellent.  All of the members of the staff, including the parking valets, were very courteous and helpful.  In particular, our receptionist/concierge Jessica was a standout.  In addition to being very gracious, she provided us with numerous excellent dinner recommendations and called to make reservations for us. The location of this hotel could not have been better.  It is in close proximity to the historic residential district, topnotch restaurants, the Market area, and other city attractions.  The free DASH city trolley bus stops across the hotel's front door and will take you to many attractions outside of walking distance.The HarbourView Inn is a first-rate hotel in an ideal location and staffed with very accommodating and professional personnel.We stayed at The Habourview Inn for four days/three nights while visiting Charleston.Overall, the experience was definitely nice and pleasant. Here are some of the positives:-Friendly staff for the most part (everyone was helpful and meant well)-Nice rooms with large, remodeled bathrooms -Cool common areas (a large atrium, front desk sitting area, and rooftop patio)-Clean rooms and Free WiFi-Free morning breakfast (not full service by any means (continental style with pastries, fruit, yogurt, coffee)-Free wine and cheese hour in the early evening and warm cookies at night with milk (marginal quality, but nice touchesNow to some of the negatives:-The whole guest experience was not worth the very hefty price tag. While the free food and drinks were nice, it was really annoying not having a full service restaurant in the hotel (although there are plenty of places nearby). We ended up going across the street to The Vendue for some delicious breakfast. The water in the lobby was not refilled often, and the coffee was often cold in the later morning.-For parking, you must pull your car around to a front parking spot on the street. We found the valet guys failed to come out sometimes, and we often had to go inside to find one. We would also call for our car and not see it for a least 15 minutes-Somewhat minor... But there is no onsite gym. The front desk said we could get a "discount" at a local gym. The gym ended up being pretty far away, and the gym attendant said there was no discount for hotel guests and charged us $15.00 each for a quick workout... (Might not matter to you though)This is definitely a great option in Charleston near many great restaurants and shops. With the hefty price tag, I would definitely rate the whole experience as 3.5 stars, but I'll round up to four for the delicious evening cookies.Great hotel with outstanding service! Delicious complimentary breakfast each morning. Very convenient to several excellent restaurants and good shopping. The nightlife in this part of town is also a lot of fun! Spent my 50th birthday here and had a wonderful time!Great location. The rooms were large and very high ceilings. Great atmosphere. The breakfast service to the room was a nice treat. Only wish they had a Resturant for hot food for breakfast. The wine and cheese hour was well attended. Unfortunately there was not a lot of seating so a number of people were sitting on floor. You could take it back to room but we wanted to visit with friends. The cookies and milk at night were a nice treat. Would definitely stay here if when we come back!!!Really enjoyed this place!  The rooms are a nice size and the beds are SUPER comfy.  The lobbies are beautiful as well and serve complimentary coffee and tea.  The location is PRIME as you are walking distance from many great restaurants, shops, White Point Gardens, etc.  It doesn't get much better.  Also, you can get breakfast delivered to your room, the atrium, or the rooftop in the morning at the hour you choose.  The breakfast foods are from a local bakery called Saffron, and they are quite tasty!  Also, the staff is very nice and accommodating.Beautiful and clean hotel that makes you feel right at home. The harbor is a stone throw away but quiet enough to make you think your on your own island. The added bonus of breakfast served to you, wine and cheese in the afternoon and cookies with milk for dinner is just the icing to the cake. I will definitely be back.Stayed here for 3 nights and loved it!The location is perfect as its on the water plus walking distance to any type of restaurant you want to go to downtown.The staff was helpful in suggesting different options for some of the touristy activities in Charleston.Onsite parking is nice and I was able to get items out of my car when needed. But I prefer not to have to valet a car. Although having my car parked securely inside the hotel garage made it secure and a nice benefit.The hotel itself is like an old mansion, and not a hotel. The rooms are very nice and furnished like an old mansion. There's no awful standard hotel furniture here. All the furniture looked more like an expensive antique.The beds and mattresses are great. Hotel was quietIf you want 24/7 room service and the amenities of a huge hotel you won't like it here, but for friendly service, something unique, great location and a comfortable bed you can't go wrong at the Harbour View Inn.A great hotel.  The staff was very polite and helpful, the room was nice and very clean.  But the best little secret is the breakfast, it is free and great.  We also loved the location, quiet but close enough to some of Charleston's best restaurants.  We will be returning when we make it back to Charleston.As Inn's go in Charleston, this is a very good place to stay since it is located in the center of the main part of town.  Close to restaurants, shops, art, and a quick drive to get over to Sullivan's Island for some beach time.The staff is very professional and helpful.  Afternoon snacks and drinks are a nice touch and they valet your car.Pricing is way under $300 per night and a value considering some of the pricing of other places in and around this establishment.
review_content_20: This hotel had it all. The check in was adequate but there are so many amenities that come with the hotel. They were note explained well to us. Our room had a view of a power station but who cares! The room was fabulous. It was huge. Turn down service in the evenings with robes on the bed and chocolates. The hotel uses an aromatherapy throughout the facility so it has a wonderful fragrance. They serve complimentary wine and cheese in the evening, cookies and milk at 9 PM and breakfast is served when you want and you have options of having it in the atrium, your bedroom or on the terrace. The location is fantastic, right by the river and park. There is a free shuttle pick up right outside the hotel. Easy walk to The Battery, Historic District, French Quarter, and City Market. They do encourage valet parking and it is $20 a day. We kept a set of car keys and were able to retrieve items from our car that we didn't want to carry into the hotel.There is no restaurant on site and no bar but the evening wine is free so no complaints. We loved our room and the little perks that came with the reservation. We would come back here in a heartbeat. It is a bit of a splurge for us but it was a very positive experience. The aromatherapy just made me feel happy when I stepped inside the facility. Oh the little things that mean so much!Everything at this establishment is top notch!  In the heart of a downtown convenience is a huge priority and the valet service is absolutely perfect.  Since everywhere in downtown is walkable from here it just makes sense to flip them your keys and head out!  We stayed in a room with french doors opening to a balcony overlooking Waterfront Park and the harbor.  If we could afford it we would stay here every weekend!  Highly recommend.This is a wonderful hotel -from the courteous staff, to the wonderful breakfast in the morning and drinks and cookies in the evening.  The location was perfect - on the water and close to everything downtown.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Charleston for a visit. Located right on the harbor as the name would indicate.The rooms are a good size with a beautiful bath, comfortable, four poster beds, nice linens. There is a large piece of furniture which houses the television, plenty of drawer space, small refrigerator and safe.There are many lovely amenities in the hotel. First of all, a complimentary breakfast, very nice choices, which can be delivered to your room, the atrium, or the rooftop in nice weather. There is always coffee and tea available in the atrium. Wine and cheese in the afternoon and cookies and milk in the evening. The staff is attentive and eager to please. Be advised that not every room has a view, so book early.If I ever have the occasion to visit Charleston again, and I hope I do, this will be where I book my accommodations.This is my 2nd stay at this hotel.  The first time I had a great room (king size bed) and wonderful view from my balcony.  Upon my return to Charleston it was an easy choice to stay here again, but I regret my decision.  Upon my 2nd visit, we were given a room with 2 beds and when asked about a King bed which was requested in reservations, we were told it wasn't available on the one night of our 2 night stay.  In addition, we had no view, but of the power lines from our window.  The weather was bad, so walking around wasn't an option, but staying inside and renting a movie wasn't an option either.  They have about 5 channels on the TV with no Pay for View or Movie Channels available.  In addition, the maids have the worst customer service I have ever experienced.  During my first stay I was packing to leave prior to check out time (a few hours prior) and the maid started banging on my door.  I announced I would be awhile and to come back later.  5 minutes later the maid started banging again...I again told her I wasn't ready...again, she came back within 5 minutes and started her banging again...this happened about 5 times within 30 minutes. I finally came out of the room to discuss with the Housekeeper about her need to bang on the door at 9 am when check out time was 12 noon.  She did apologize, but I wasn't sure if she understood what I was saying.  The second trip the Maid didn't even knock on the door, but walked in without announcement while my Husband was in the bathroom.  And then she seemed "bothered" we were occupying the room during her time to clean.  We left the room briefly, but with the rain decided it might be better to sit in the sitting room while she was cleaning.  When we walked back towards our room the maid from my first visit was pushing her cleaning cart through the hallway.  We were walking by as she pushed her cart in front of us and said "excuse me" as if we were in her way.  I wonder how much training the housekeeping staff has had for their positions...certainity no customer service. While the towels were plush, I am not crazy about shower curtains especially at a 4 Star Hotel. The bathroom had empty boxes that would normally hold shower caps, q-tips, etc.  It was humorous that 2 boxes were displayed as an amenity, but were empty. The positive of the hotel is obviously its excellent location for enjoying downtown Charleston, the Bell Staff is polite and helpful, the beds are comfortable and we enjoy the warm cookies in the evening, but for the price it isn't worth the stay and I'll be staying somewhere else in downtown Charleston.  The late afternoon wine & cheese gathering isn't great either as an employee stands behind the bar with the wine and a pile of dollars she puts out on the bar as to encourage tipping...so tacky.I have to add after I wrote this review the hotel followed up with me from my in-room comment card.  They offered me a complimentary night at the hotel on my next visit to Charleston.  I have taken them up on it and will attempt to stay here again in a few weeks.  I appreciate their efforts and look forward to their improvements.I loved this hotel more the longer I stayed.  The front desk was so helpful for dinner reservations as well as tourist attractions.  They were friendly, helpful and entertaining.  The rooms were comfortable and well appointed.  The parking was convenient and the location was great.  Free breakfast was just and added plus.  It's a great place to stay!Amazing hotel with great service!  Very helpful staff with wine and cheese and milk and cookies as well as turn down service and a room service breakfast.  Great location for walking on King Street, and the market place - would recommend this hotel to everyone traveling to Charleston.Fantastic hotel. The best we have stayed at in Charleston. Clean,well-appointed rooms. Great facilities and delicious breakfast options. Nothing bad to say about the place.I'd consider myself a no-frills lodgings person- give me a coffee maker, give me a fridge, give me a room that doesn't have dirty touch marks on the doors and light fixtures (and properly working climate control) and I'll be happy.So for me, the Harbourview Inn was a bit of a dissappointment.(please note my stay was in July 2007, so things may have changed since.)I do give it a reluctant 4 stars.  I stayed in one of the historic suites.  I liked the cookies, tea and coffee.  Nice touch.  I liked the rooftop deck and view of the harbor and adjacent park.  The valet service was very good- the valets at the time were polite and helpful.  Having a memory foam mattress was a nice plus.  The room safe was bulky and secure.The window shades needed a lock to stay open, and in our case, I had to use a luggage case or magazines, otherwise it hung loose in the middle of the window.  Its in a great location, close to everything with a good rooftop view of the harbor, which is reflected in the price.  For what I paid, I thought I would be getting more for what I paid.  I was a bit underwhelmed.  To that extent, the next time I'm in Charleston, I'll probably end up trying another place.Overall, though, you'll probably be satisfied with your stay.Mister picked this hotel because it was #2 on Travelocity. It's cute, small and the rooms are nice and clean + it's away from the touristy area of Charleston, so it's quiet. The hotel is also just off the tourist center, yet close enough to walk almost everywhere. And the hotel staff were so helpful with suggestions and directions. Our room had a King Tempurpedic bed and though it was right in the Atrium, it was very quiet.  I recommmend the Harbourview Inn- when we come back to Charleston (soon I hope), we'll stay here again.While it's true the staff was very nice and the rooms were clean with comfortable beds, I'm not sure that is all I should get for $350/night.  The wine/cheese was laid out in a dark, crowded area of the hotel.  Why they are not playing up their strengths (the view) is beyond me.  Both mornings we went down for breakfast, there were 2 bran muffins in an otherwise empty plexiglass case.  Again, not what I'd expect for the price.  3 baskets of cookes on a cart by the front desk being picked over by kids isn't exactly appetizing either.There is no fitness center, business center, bar, restaurant, or sundries shop.  Those were all major disappointments.  Also, we had a penthouse room that was MUCH smaller than we expected.  Maybe 200 sq. ft. not counting the bathroom.My husband picked this place because he thought it was the best of the best, but after our trip we realized that there would have been many better options for us for about $150-$200 cheaper/night.  I say save the money and spend it on dining and shopping!This is a very nice hotel in a great area of Charleston. You can very easily walk to restaurants, shops, historic sights, and more. We stayed here for 3 nights without a car and didn't miss having one! Every morning we had free room service breakfast included. Our room was very clean and there was a rooftop shared deck where you could sit outside. No complaints- this is a safe bet if you want a clean, nice hotel in downtown Charleston.I went here recently for a 4 night stay. My first impression is the staff was great and very helpful as this was my first time in Charleston. The rooms were very clean but a little dated in the decorations. The stay was very enjoyable. Free breakfast brought to room and a treat of cookies and milk if you like at 9:00pm. I saw where someone posted that they only had 5 channels on their tv. They said it was raining that day.
