I must say it rained while I was there but I would not let it stop me from getting out. I couldn't see staying in a hotel rain or no rain and watch tv. The hotel is in a ideal location. You are very close to all the nice resturants and scenic sites. There might be more impressive places to stay in the area but you will pay alot more for it. In all I would do it again. I would recommend if you stay try to get a 4th floor room overlooking the harbor. That would be a difference maker alone.Perfect! Staff was great, room was great, evening reception was great. I have already booked another stay.The Harbourview Inn is a lovely place to stay while in Charleston. The Inn location was great and close to riverfront and all the best restaurants in Charleston. The staff was extremely attentive and quick. Our room was beautiful and extremely clean. We particurlarly liked the Tempurpedic Bed, a great little touch. We enjoyed our stay at the Harbourview Inn very much.Great location.  Great views.  Great staff - very friendly.  Included in price: afternoon tea, breakfast in your room, wine and cheese, and cookies and milk.  Rooms are smaller than I would have expected for the price.This is a very nice hotel in a great location. I stayed here for one night with my family and we were very impressed with the service and amenities. We loved all the extras included in our room rate - wine and cheese in the evening, milk and cookies at night, turndown service with chocolates, and breakfast! I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Charleston.My husband and I stayed here for our wedding back in 2008.  It was a fantastic hotel, located right in the center of everything.  We stayed in a historic wing room, and it was great.  The staff was fantastic, and even though it wasn't cheap, we were willing to splurge - it was our wedding weekend after all, and it was totally worth it.  I would stay here again in a heartbeat.I was really pleased with this hotel, and it was a very reasonable price. Absolutely all the appointments were up to date in the rooms and the bathroom was especially well done. Staff were really friendly and the location was excellent - centrally located yet at the end of a nice quiet street. We had a room with beautiful exposed brick and amazingly high ceilings. The breakfast was more than generous and I love that they bring it to your room. Free wi-fi too. I love this hotel!

review_content: I flew into Charleston for a trade show and had to call the hotel for a shuttle.  Once there, my room was not ready so I had to wait in the reception area.  The rooms were clean but not really any views of Charleston.  The best part about this hotel was the free nightly happy hour and breakfast.  Those two amenities made up for the wait for my room.Stayed here Sunday - Tuesday for convenience. The lobby is nice, there is a large atrium and a bar right in the center. The elevators are quick, free breakfast in the morning with a made to order omelet station, fruits, cereal and pastries. Our room (322) was....outdated and not very clean. The carpets were old, the shower had stains and cracks, we found various hairs on the bed sheets and towels that were not ours...I know...it makes me cringe just thinking about it. There were also various strands of hair in the sink, stuck on and dry. We knew the hotel was at capacity so there was no use in trying to switch rooms. The view of this room is an empty parking lot.They offer free happy hour from 5:30-7:30 (beer and wine only) BUT beware, the free drinks are located at another small bar behind the buffet, if you order from the bartender she will charge you, I actually got a little annoyed that she didn't clarify this for us. Other guests we were with are the ones who informed us that the free drinks were located in the back. The light snacks are cheese and crackers and chips and salsa. Mike & Chuck the bellman/shuttle drivers were GREAT! They were so helpful with my bags and happily drove us to two separate destinations on two separate occasions, one was downtown. You can't beat that! When Mike checked me into my room he also asked me if the temperature was ok and then he adjusted it for me...I have never had a bellman ask me that so I was super impressed! There is a convenience store in the lobby with sodas, toiletries, traveling trinkets and clothes! You can charge any items to you room which I found convenient because the credit card machine kept saying "connection error."Unfortunately Mike and Chuck could not make up for the state of our room!Not too happy with the management at this hotel.  Stayed for a convention. On night one we realized our room was a single when it should be a double. Management didn't fix it, their solution was to bring up a comforter for the pull out. Didn't get much sleep that night and my back still hurts. The noise of the lobby kept me awake as well.The happy hour and breakfast almost made up for it.We had Internet access but it was very spotty and only worked in certain areas of the room. Hard to get any work done when the Internet keeps cutting out.On our last day we asked for late checkout since our sessions didn't end until 11:15. They very reluctantly gave us 11:30 when I know others staying here got 12:00 when they asked the previous day. Don't make excuses to your guests, be a problem solver and make it work!We stayed here Saturday night to Monday morning last week for my boyfriend's cousin's wedding. I have to say that I was pleasantly surprised! The layout inside is typical of Embassy suites (see pics). We had a suite - 2 double beds in the room, one roll-out sofa. Nothing bad, nothing spectacular. The things that stood out the very most to me were - 1. The beautiful ballroom (we stayed in the hotel for a wedding. The wedding and reception were in the same venue, where the convention center is.)2. Happy Hour. FREE happy hour in the main lobby from 5:30-7 daily. Have you ever heard of such a thing? Not I. Not til this place. Granted it's not top shelf but who would expect that anyway. Dollar tips and happy sips!3. Breakfast was amazing. (See my pic.) probably the best of Hotel breakfast that I've ever had. It's a breakfast buffet of pancakes, French toast, eggs, home fries, fruits, cereal, juices, milk, coffee, yogurt, pastries, AND an omelet bar where they make customized omelets to order!4. Towels. This may seem like a minute detail but I LOVE hotels with towels that aren't stiff or extra bleached, these were just....clean! Their towels were all newer and I just loved it! Another plus - this place is close to many things, even Walmart. AND right across the street from Tanger Outlets. Yay!I'm a fan of this place and would definitely recommend it to others!Very poorly managed, pretty much sums it up.  Had expected HHonors Diamond treatment only to find out that this place is filled with surly staff who could not give a rip about any requests.  Even though it was not fully booked the night before or after, an early check in (I'm talking 3:40 PM) and late checkout (asked for 12:00 noon) both proved to be impossible.  MyWay treats in the room? -- forget it.If you're staying here (which I will not be, ever again) be warned that weekends are filled with family reunions (you can tell them from the tee shirts) making the breakfast a feeding frenzy and leaving a lot of trash in the hallways.I was (am) pretty disgusted with this place.I want to start by saying that I travel often and I have stayed at a few Embassy Suites in different cities.  This hotel was booked by our Family Reunion committee, so prior to my arrival, I contacted the hotel to inquiry about shuttle service from the airport and to the downtown area. The staff were helpful and friendly. The hospitality increased when I arrived.  My shuttle driver who picked me up at the airport was a wealth of information.  He informed me about the complimentary evening appetizers and breakfast.  I was glad to hear about both. The staff also told me about local public transportation and this came in handy during the weekend.  Check-in was quick and easy and when I saw my room, I was pleased - it was spacious and clean.  I decided once I got settled to check out the managers reception (complimentary drinks and cheese/crackers, hummus, and tortilla chips.  It was a great and a nice way for the family to meet and greet before the official family activities began.  The staff were attentive and so nice with all the chaos going on (During my stay-three family reunions and a large church convention) to maintain good customer service when large groups are involved.  Overall, the experience was Outstanding!!  I would recommend this hotel to everyone if this is a convenient place for you to stay.  If you don't drive - Uber Car Service Is Available and they were provided great service too!!Side Note:  Tanger Outlet Mall is 2 Minutes Away - Hotel Shuttle will drive you there and you can call for a pick-up when done.Bed bugs.  My husband is covered in bites and he was there for 3nights. When he called them to let them know the manager apologized and offered 1night stay.  Uh...I don't think Its worth another night with bugs eating us while we sleep.  GrossHappy hour is so good.  We stay here every time we visit Charleston and we are never disappointed. Clean rooms, courteous staff and wonderful breakfast and happy hour. Good job guys!My wife and I stayed here for a convention paid for by my employer.  Since we didn't have to pay out of pocket for the room our expectations of the experience were initially indifferent.  I have to say I would pay full price to stay here again.Our room was clean and large.  The furniture was very comfortable and there were two flat screen tv's.  All the service we experienced was courteous and polite.  Every question we asked about the building or locations around the area to visit were answered promptly and with enough information to prevent the need to ask a follow up question.  I didn't eat any of the food there using their room service option but I have to say that their complimentary breakfast with their cook to order omelets was amazing!  And their happy hour had good beer options and snacks.  I wouldn't argue with the quality of their complimentary meals and drinks.My wife and I could stay here for an extended time and feel comfortable spending most of our time in the room.  My only issue was the fact that they don't offer free internet to non-members and their pay-per view channel charges nearly the same amount as it would cost to see a film in the theater.I had an accident in route to embassy suites this am. They actually sent an courtesy van to see if I was ok and if I needed a ride. So nice.It's a standard Embassy Suites... Maybe even above average.  It's a good location for the convention center or outlet malls.  Otherwise you better rent a car.  If your stranded car-less at a convention it's a great location!  Close to the airport!  Plenty of 'off campus' food and shopping options within a mile.Harold's Hotel Happy Hour is the best well known secret ever!!Can I say I'm a big fan of this place?Anyone staying here get's to have free Happy Hour!  From like 5:30pm to 7:30 pm.  Yes it's two whole hours and there's snack food included.There's no choice for the beer on tap but they did have Miller Lite on this night in particular.I try to get there as often as I can as they are so good to me.BTW: dont' forget to Tip.  Just because it's free doesn't mean the bartender is working for free as well.  After all it's not like it's self service.The room we are in smells of cat pee. The floor is gross. The beds are small and uncomfortable. They charge $3 for a bottle of water in the room. I paid the $3 because they also have regular glasses instead of individually packaged disposable cups and I will not use a real glass at a hotel (and you shouldn't either). I woke up this morning feeling disgusting. I will never stay here again.And they charge for local calls. Seriously? What hotel does that anymore?!My husband and I chose this hotel because the hotels downtown were insanely expensive. We much rather would have stayed down there but we ended up saving a ton so it was worth it to us. The rooms are quite large and clean, which was nice. The staff are very accommodating and friendly. They offer breakfast included in the rate which is almost inedible but free so there's that. Tip: stick with fruit and cereal, the cooked food might actually make you sick. The walls between the rooms are quite thin so you do tend to hear a lot of what is going on with other people. A lot of families stayed here, probably because it's more affordable and we heard a lot of children. They might have a shuttle that goes down town, but don't hold me to that. My husband and I drove into downtown. The hotel does have a parking lot which is included in your stay. Overall, my husband and I were happy with our choice because we ended up saving over $100 by staying here.I've always liked the attention to detail and nods to luxury of Embassy Suites in which I've stayed over the years. This particular one, however, is an exception. Catering to convention groups, the North Charleston Embassy Suites appears to take its guests for granted. The first check-in clerk we had gave us confusing and erroneous information about amenities as well as transportation. We opted to consult the other clerks after this experience. Our room furnishings displayed signs of becoming threadbare and in need of cleaning. There was no caffeine coffee in our suite. Wi-fi costs $4.95 a day. The maids neglected to clean our room one day, even though we were out of it most of the day. Finally, this was the first hotel of its level I've been in in years that doesn't provide complimentary coffee and tea in the lobby. I had to schlepp over to Starbucks, a 5-minute walk across the boulevard, to purchase hot drinks. This locale does provide the usual Embassy Suites evening cocktail/snacks as well as included breakfast. All in all, however, we found it to be a comparative disappointment.I arrived around 9pm, the front desk staff is a bit novice. Beautiful lobby.the rooms are big, beds small. Maybe full size but definitely not queen size! Not at all plush.heres the kicker, there is NO free wifi in the room! You have to pay 9.95 per day, per device. This is not the dark ages. Even the HOJO has free wifi. Free wifi is available in the lobby... thats like 100 strikes aganist you.The breakfast was what saved this hotel. HOT FOOD. And you can also get it made to order. Eggs are terrible.Nice bar area with good selection of wine.  Good place to get a drink before going to an event next door at the Performing Arts Convention Center or the Coliseum.We booked this room through a hotel booking website for the final night of our vacation & got a stellar rate on the room. The bummer was that they didn't have a king bed left & my husband & I had to sleep "1950's style" in separate double beds. Overall the staff was super friendly, the room & bathroom were super clean, the beds were super comfy, the free cocktail hour was appreciated, & the free hot breakfast was fabulous. They also had little Charleston Chews in the candy dish at the reception desks (cute),Yes, it is a 15-20 minute drive to historic Charleston...but looking at a map prior to booking could have told you that fact (unless you have a teleporter or flying car, then Go You! :-) ). Overall, we would gladly consider staying here again when visiting Charleston.Nice hotel. Checkin was efficient. Rooms are suites and nicely done. Very close to airport. All the action however is downtown which is a 20 minute cab ride.My favorite hotel from my recent cross-country tour. Unusually good breakfast, generous cocktail hour, and clean, up-to-date rooms. It is not close to downtown Charleston, and that's a consideration, but I travel for a living and can honestly say this hotel does everything right.
review_content_20: Great rooms for a romantic weekend getaway. But location is not good for walking around the city it is very far from downtown. $15 per person for city shuttle and the last shuttle comes back at 10:20pm on a Saturday night. We thought it was way too early. The breakfast bar is just ok. Pancakes were rubbery and the potatoes were not good. the fresh omelet bar had a very long line every morning. :-( I would have liked a fresh waffle maker.We will not stay here again. We went down for the complimentary drinks. There was a Labrador, a pet, in the seating area on top of a table barking. Nobody made it stop. Eventually, the owner took the dog to a room on the second floor. I asked the girl at the desk if pets were allowed in the rooms. She said, "Yes".We took our drink to our room. We then found out they charge $10 per device in the room. Really? WiFi charged per device? Can you get any more greedy?Definitely not coming back.The hotel itself provided 5 star service, pleasant staff, free happy hour and breakfast, BUT the food SUCKED.  The breakfast line was long, and the poor breakfast lady overcooked everyone's omelettes  b/c she was doing 5 omelettes at a time.  I ordered room service for 2 consecutive nights, disappointing both nights.  Minus two stars for the bad food.This is a great, clean hotel, with a very friendly staff.  The free breakfast buffet is amazing and  is comparable to a $15 breakfast you'd get at a nicer restaurant.  They also offer a free happy hour which is a bonus.  The only knock (and the reason they lost a star) is the $9.95 they charge if you want free wifi in your room.We have attended a few events at the convention center and they were all wonderful.Getting ready to turn in on night two of a two-night stay at this establishment.  Too early to write a review?  Perhaps, but I will live on the edge and say that this was a fabulous stay.  We were in from VA for an Irish Dance Competition.. our daughter did quite well, thanks for asking.  That competition was at the attached convention center, and of all the events we have been to, this was by far the most well thought-through venue for such an event.  With hundreds of Irish Dancers at these events, all dancing and practicing in corners and hallways, you can imagine how many times I've nearly lost an eye just walking to the BATHROOM... but not at this convention center.  The traffic patterns and general flow of the facility made such accidents nearly impossible.  The room is great, breakfast and happy hour are included, and wonderful.   Only complaint I have is about the in-room refridergator... had to turn it on when we got here... took several hours to cool the sodas we had with us.  Minor complaint. For those Yelpers who complain about downtown Charleston (which we spent all day exploring by the way) being nine miles away, well... try using a little technology and pull up Google maps before you book your next hotel!  Not a surprise that this hotel is located outside of downtown... it is clearly NEAR THE AIRPORT!  Good grief some of you peoplemake me worry about the possibility of an intelligent future of humanity!  Enjoying our stay... and the drive to downtown is not so bad that it can't be managed... unless of course, you can't use a map or GPS device.  Embassy Suites.. nice job!Copy of my letter to the GM: It is not often I can take the time to write about my travel experiences, but my recent stay the the Embassy suites North Charleston SC deserves a moment of my time.From check in to check out the entire experience was a pure delight. My business travel schedule has recently increased to weekly trips from my previous schedule of only 4 - 6 trips annually, and to be able to actually enjoy this experience in North Charleston was a welcome surprise.I wish I could remember name of the front desk supervisor who checked me in (Tues March 22, 2011- m/blond hair, probably late 20's to early 30's) but he took the time to find me a quiet room in a far corner, high floor in a hotel booked to capacity.  Most appreciated after being in loud airports for 20+ hours!Regarding my room service meal Tuesday night for dinner, I can say categorically it was the best hotel room service meal I have ever had- full stop.  My wife and I are admitted 'Foodies' and have eaten at many of the finest restaurants in the world including Alain Ducasse Paris, Eric Ripert (Le Bernardin, NY), and Restaurant Gordon Ramsay in London.And while I cannot in good conscience rank the food in the same league as those meals, I mention them just as a point of reference that I hold the quality of my meal at the Embassy Tuesday night in such high regard, especially for Room Service!  I enjoyed it so much in fact, I took a photo of it on my iPhone to I could attempt to re-create it at home! (Photo attached - Seared Sea Scallops, Mushroom Risotto).The freshness and preparation of the scallops were both perfect! The risotto was amazing, and the sauce brilliant.Further, the server (Hal?) who delivered it presented my meal and beverages to me most happily, professionally and seemed GENUINELY thrilled to be doing so.And finally, BEYOND FURTHER, I happened to mention to him that there was a spot of mold on my ice cubes taken from the 8th floor ice machine (to be expected from time to time, especially in the humid southern climate)  and asked him to please notify management so it could be addressed.  He agreed to do so and with great courtesy and wishes for an enjoyable meal he left my room.About 5 minutes later a knock on the door. It was my waiter, returning with a full metal pitcher of ice he had collected from the kitchen ice machine! Unsolicited! Absolutely refreshing to experience initiative and courtesy above and beyond the call. I have been a loyal Hilton Honors guest for several years, and our entire family have long been Hilton loyalists back to my father and grandfather.Please know that my experience this past week has only increased my loyalty to and appreciation of the Hilton / Embassy brands and I will make you my first choice whenever possible.I've stayed here a few times over the years, and though the lobby is nice, the rooms are outdated and in need of renovation.  The floors and interior of the rooms are of questionable sanitary condition.  Though the staff is friendly enough, this hotel is a bit on the noisy side, and parking is horrid after 6pm, since the coliseum is within the same lot.  If you are in the area, I'd recommend staying elsewhere, homewood suites is definately a better property if they have availability.If you go when they are having reunions or meetings in the area then you will hate it! Other than that, it is okay. The bartenders were a little rude. The housekeeping is slow. The omelet guy was the best out of Every Embassy I visited from any states.The food for our meetings is great. I love the staff and the venue. Im a local and I often stay here for a change of scenery.My mother run a convention for kids and for the last 6 or so year we have chosen this place to hold it. HOWEVER one would think knowing that kids were coming in the would offer a family friendly menu in the dinning room. All I wanted was chicken fingers that didn't cost 22 dollars via room service...but no I had to order this fancy smancy chicken dish. I do not have expensive taste! BUT....The one thing that blew my mind was the shuttle folks. TAMI AND CHUCK. WOW!!!! They were great!! The shuttle was only 5 bucks verses 25 for a cab. And not only that these guys went above and beyond to help us out and make us happy. They even stayed on longer than they had to, so we (A group of 8 people) Could have dinner and see a tour so we didn't have to blow 25 more each on the cab system. So bravo to the shuttle people and poo to the food. Other than than the hotel is a hotel is a hotel....the bed a soft though :)Nice hotel, airport convenient.  But...if your objective is to get downtown and say, have dinner at someplace other than the Wendy's nearby THIS hotel, don't stay here.Was in town for a convention and the facilities are exactly what one needs, but all the FUN is at least 20 minutes by cab.  Work a deal at the front desk here to make sure you can get BACK to the hotel from downtown, or better yet...STAY DOWNTOWN!We stayed here this past week and the front desk was rude on the 2 occassions that we had to deal with them. Definitely not what I expected from an Embassy Suites hotel. Our flight was delayed and we did not get to check in until 1am friday morning. The lady at the front desk didn't say hello, welcome, or anything. Then went on and acted like she was busy and we were interrupting her (even though there is NOBODY ELSE around at that time). I'm giving her the benefit of the doubt that it is 1am but she forgot to give us our ticket/card for the free breakfast and manager's reception. When someone notified us that we need it in order to get free breakfast and drinks, we went up to the front desk and requested it. This time the MANAGER of all people was rather rude to us. When we said we never received the ticket/card, instead of asking for ID, he went on to "quiz" us such as our home address, our work address, etc. I felt like a criminal that needs to prove my existence. When we said a friend booked our room under the "friends and family discount", he went on to quiz us even more about this friend. It's a friend of a friend okay, jeez.. It really affected my experience with Embassy Suites. I used to rate Embassy Suites at the top of my list, but now I know that customer service isn't the same at all locations and will have to consider somewhere else next time.

review_content: Got a great rate for the King Charles Inn on Travelzoo, plus with free parking in the back, we couldn't pass it up. When booking I had no idea how convenient this hotel is to everything you want in downtown charleston! You are a few minutes north of the historic district, and about 10 minutes south by foot from upper King street, apparently the new spot in Charleston for the cools restos and bars! And around the corner is the shopping district of King Street, my first stop after checking in because I forgot my sunglasses! (Thanks Forever 21!)Everyone was super friendly and accommodating, from Malcolm the nicest bell boy, to the check in staff, to the housekeepers! The rooms were well sized, though I accidentally got 2 double beds instead of a King bed for me and my boyfriend! I'm sure I could have asked for another room, but we were just ready to hit the road. The bathrooms were well sized and well stocked. The one complaint, though obviously not the fault of the hotel, is that it is on a busy street, so you hear the traffic at all hours. Particularly Monday morning, which was trash day, as well as the fire trucks coming down from the station just up the block. Perhaps the rooms on the other side of the hotel were quieter, but it was fine. Finally, the pool/deck is under construction, which wouldnt matter because it's the winter, however going through the deck is the easiest way to access half of the rooms, so its a bit of a trek to get to them without this shortcut. Alternatively you can access these from the parking lot, which helps a bit on the long journey lol.The King Charles Inn has everything. It's centrally located, has a phenomenally accommodating staff, elegant rooms, and fantastic foods and little "extras." We were extremely pleased with our stay here! The rooms are a little on the small side, but the bathroom is large and everything is super clean. The hotel staff set up a pack and play crib for our 8-month-old baby prior to our arrival. There are fridges in each room and free water bottles. Everyday, they have a "happy hour" from 4:30-5:30 which includes cheese and olives (and of course wine which you can purchase). From 8-9pm, they put out freshly baked chocolate cookies (mm'mm!!) and tea. They breakfast is also nice and comparably priced to the local breakfast places. The best part of this hotel is its convenient location which is right in the heart of Charleston, within walking distance of multiple restaurants, tours, museums, etc. And as a super bonus, there's free parking which is great!Not impressed with this place at all.  The entire weekend, my friends and I (there were 4 of us total on a girls trip) were treated as if we were an inconvenience.  The staff was not friendly and did not seem eager to help with answering any sort of questions or providing suggestions on where to go or how to get there.  One staff member did recommend the pedi-cab, but there are only so many times you can pay $25.00 to go a mile down the road.The area that it is in was also unimpressive.  There were a few places to choose from to eat, but none that we wanted to visit...so we did have to travel by pedi-cab, taxi, uber the entire weekend.  The rooms itself are quite small, as are the beds.  I kind of wish we would have paid cheaper to go to a larger hotel, even if it was further away it may have been better customer service.Nice hotel in a great place. It's an older hotel, no views really, but the service, the rooms, and the location more than make up for it. You can walk most of downtown from here. Because who wants to drive in this area? My wife and I have been coming here for our anniversary for years and they always leave a small bottle of Lamarca in the room for us. How many hotels remember you and show appreciation like that?Arrived and was pleased w the hotel.  This is our first night and when I pulled the sheets back to get in bed, what did I find, " pubic hair in the sheets!"  Not cool.  One more night left.  Had to get sheets from the front desk and re-make my bed.  Pretty irritated Update:  our second night was much better w free drinks offered, chocolate truffles, and like I mentioned before, a very friendly staff.  By no means would the incident keep us from staying here again, or keep us from recommending the hotel to friends.Not impressed with the hotel. It's not in a part of Charleston that I would have rather stayed in. The hotel is old and the corridors are tight. Our room was a "long"way from the elevator and I have a bad back. The term " boutique" does not apply to this hotel. The pictures are deceiving. I am a hotel designer so I am picky. Probably have to drive to the restaurant I want. Suggestions for dinner were not good. Luckily I look it up on Yelp and wasn't up to par with my taste!The location for this place is ideal. I can only think of the words elegant and essential. I suppose it's okay to refer to this as a boutique hotel and I think that is a compliment. If you are looking for a behemoth, keep searching this one is just so nicely appointed and comfy that I cannot image a better place to stay if you're looking to to be near the heart of downtown. At the core of the success here is the staff. They are dedicated to customer satisfaction and take professionalism to the next level. They remember you and they make you feel welcome at all times. It's difficult not to love a place that also offers free parking as an amenity. If you are coming to Charleston to see the town, then you can basically leave your car where you park it and walk to any place you want to visit. This is great for that historic feel you are probably looking for if you are spending time in Charleston. If you want a cookie cutter with a neon logo on it, you may be disappointed. But when the staff members remember our names, what we like to eat or drink and what we're planning to do with our days, I think it is a huge win. I was NOT just a room number here. I will be back and I would recommend it without ... wait for it ... reservation.Great location, rooms were a little small but we adjoined two to fit 6 (2 smaller kids). Great service, nice staff. Pool was closed for renovation which was a little bit of a bummer given we didn't know it. Parking was free and accommodated our big rooftop box. Overall experience, great! Thanks!I stayed here this past weekend with 7 other gals for a bacherlorette party & it was the perfect spot for us. We had conjoined rooms & enough space to all get ready. You can only imagine right? Our rooms were clean & the beds were comfy. The hotel is super cute inside. The decor is elegant/southern chic. Free parking is a huge plus & it was centrally located to everything we were walking to. I would definitely stay here on another trip to Charleston.Found this inn on yelp and was completely pleased. Quaint, charming, quiet, elegant. Staff was very attentive. Bar is elegant. Breakfast on the terrace. Walking distance to the Historic District. Very pleased. Also must check out Justine's Diner around the corner..We really liked the hotel!  Dave checked us in and was super nice and helpful.  When we walked back thru the lobby later, the hotel clerks greeted us by name!  Our room was very comfortable, clean and nice.  We even had windows that opened! The location of the hotel is right where you want to be.What about parking, you may ask? ... FREE!  Amazing!  And I noticed that the doormen seemed to keep an eye on the parking area.  We found plenty of restaurant choices near, I know we'll be staying here again!I stayed at the King Charles INN over columbus day weekend. I was greatly disappointed. The Inn appears to be a beautiful and charming boutique Charleston hotel on their website, unfortunately the pictures are deceiving. The second we arrived I knew I had made a huge mistake! The "Inn" in reality actually looks like a slightly dressed up Days INN or Best Western and during our stay l found out that our instincts were right, The King Charles Inn is actually a Best Western. The hallways are depressing with low hanging ceiling tiles, the rooms are small and drab with an unpleasant odor, and industrial size air conditioning units.   With that said, all of the above wouldn't have been as huge of an issue if the cost had been appropriate to the room/hotel, ie. if it were say 120.00 dollars a night. Then fine I would have been slightly disappointed that I wasted my romantic getaway with my husband staying at this hotel in Charleston but at least  I could have explained it away to myself by having saved money. The real rub came when I had to pay the exact same and infact more expensive room rate than some of the most beautiful real boutique hotels in the city that night (I made my husband stop in at 3 or 4 hotels on our stroll through the city to cost compare - it was really upsetting as this hotel was of equal or greater cost). I would have to say the lesson to be learned here is do not falsely advertise your facility, it is not a boutique hotel so don't make it appear that way on your website. If you don't give your clients false expectations, you won't have disappointed patrons. This is an average hotel charging boutique rates. If you are looking for a romantic getaway and are couple or family that is used to paying in the mid 3-400s/night then steer clear of King Charles Inn and book at the Vendue or any other number of beautiful boutique hotels in Charleston. The one positive thing I will say regarding this hotel is that the staff were all lovely.So delightful! Great city-center accommodations! Clean and elegant! Superb caring staff! Nicely appointed rooms with soft linens and comfy beds were a super place to sink into after a day of shopping on King Street, which is only a block away. Will stay here again for certain!Great little hotel a half step from the heart of downtown.  From the free parking, to the friendly front desk staff, to the clean and comfortable rooms, this hotel is an easy choice for visiting Charleston.  The location is ideal for walking to any restaurant or shop downtown, which is a huge plus because parking can be a nightmare, and just as easy to hop on the highway and explore surrounding neighborhoods and towns.  The price, while not rock-bottom is fair considering the ammenities and their competitors' pricing in the area.  Overall, had a nice stay, and would absoutely book here again.Great stay here in June for my bachelorette weekend. We got two adjoining rooms which was awesome. Unfortunately even though my maid of honor had requested an early check-in for us weeks in advance because we were all getting there early in the morning, we did not get our rooms until late afternoon. It was okay because we got to hang out by the pool but my maid of honor felt really bad because she had spoken with someone who said an early check-in would be no problem for us and then we didn't get one. The AC and fridge in our room did not work well, but other than that we had no problems. The staff were really great especially the guys at the pool!! We only encountered one rude employee and that was Selena at the front desk who told us to be quiet when we were walking in Saturday night. The location of the hotel can't be beat, definitely recommend!Great location. Since the rooms were booked as a group we did not follow up on what type of room we had. Our room had a standard bed with 3 very small uncomfortable pillows. We have had cruise ships rooms that were larger. We tried to move to another room but it was too late, all the rooms were booked. Still a great place just make sure you know in advance about your room accommodations.The location is central enough, on Meeting Street, and since this was my first time to the city, that was super important as I could walk everywhere I needed to. One thing I noticed quickly about the area in general is parking. Thankfully King Charles Inn has parking down below the hotel, but that fills up quickly and stays that way all afternoon and night, only clearing out a little around checkout. There is some parking across the street which is where I left my rental car for a couple days.The accommodations were pretty nice from my perspective with the classy Southern decor all around. I had a deluxe King for a couple nights which was enough space for all my luggage laid out. Not much of a view from my room, but lets in enough light. The front desk was courteous every time I entered or left. I did not partake of any of the other amenities or their restaurant / bar. Plenty of great restaurants nearby.Staying in downtown Charleston is not cheap, especially when making reservations only a few weeks ahead in late summer... that alone probably increased my nightly charge $50.Easily the best hotel we found in Charleston in terms of price and location. Ok, so the bathrooms are small and the view is not great/non existent but they decor is lovely and they have free wifi and parking. Legit. Not to mention, everyone we came across, whether they were working and staying there, was super friendly and helpful. It's amazing what a quick hello in can do for one's morning outlook. It's also worth mentioning that although there is a pool, it's tres small (inappropriate for laps) and lined with glass sliding doors, on the other side of which is the hotel lounge and restaurant... bit too goldfish in a fish bowl for my liking. Still, would most definitely stay here again and recommend to people looking to stay in the city (town?) centre at an affordable price!It was great until the internet and cable stopped working. Loved the pool, the bed, the bathroom. Bad view, but I was on vacation. Who wants to stay indoors?! The welcome at 4:30pm was okay. Not enough fruits. Just grapes, and not great one's either. But everyone seemed to be having a good time. From 4:30pm to 5:30pm it's happy hour and you get $1 off drinks. I was not in the mood for drinking so it did not matter to me. Overall I would stay here again for sure.Highlights:Check-in is at 4pm but they had my room ready at 2pm. Awesome! In the meantime, since I got there at 11am they let me chill by the pool and they held on to my luggage. Had the pool to myself most of the time. It is a little awkward because the pool is literally next to a very busy street (Meeting Street). But whatever, when you are boiling hot, the focus becomes the cool water. Check-out is at 11am but they let me chill by the pool until I chose to leave at 1pm. I know, I love pools! LOL. :)But I also need internet and cable! Argh. Good thing is that the internet and cable went down in the morning when I was on my way out. If it had happened at night....that would have been a whole other matter!Wow, drove into Charleston on a spur of the moment trip. Found this place on Expedia. Had great reviews and free parking!! I see why the reviews are great. Older hotel but, this place is great! Room is super clean, above average toiletries, comfortable mattresses and the bar/pub on the second floor adjacent the lobby it great. The bartender (Taylor, I think) made a FANTASTIC old fashioned and my wife a terrific martini. He also suggested several local steak houses for us to decide on for dinner. The front desk was also very polite. Every now and then you run across a place to stay that deserves to time to write a review about. Keep up the good work guys.
review_content_20: The room was so nice and well decorated, but really the service at this hotel was the shining star. Our first day I turned on the shower and water was shooting EVERYWHERE, so we decided to just wash up and let the front desk know on our way out to breakfast. They were so gracious and it was fixed before we returned, you wouldn't even know that there was a water feature in our room an hour earlier! I have to say, this is such a wonderful little hotel, located right in the center of everything and I am so happy we decided to stay here. This was our first trip to the south and we stayed in a larger hotel in Savannah and here, at the King Charles Inn. This place was right up our alley, and even though there was construction going on next door we didn't even notice.Also, I must say that Taylor, the bartender, is just awesome! Really, I cannot say enough nice things! He is their secret weapon? Or maybe a hidden nugget of gold? Whatever you want to call him, he is a great conversationalist and can recommend excellent restaurants around town, things to absolutely not miss and things you can live without. We never like to be a tourist, more just travelers and we really enjoy the rare conversations that lead to little gems that are local favorites, or maybe something new and exciting.Thank you, for making our stay so relaxing and pleasant, it was a treat and we can't wait to return!The staff here goes above and beyond your expectations if you have any problems with your stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel for not only their southern hospitality but the cleanliness and also the fact that the rooms are very sound proof. We didn't hear anything from adjoining rooms or any road noise. The breakfast here was really good also. The kitchen staff here are very friendly. Thank you Maureen Sheridan at King Charles for making our honeymoon a time to remember.I really enjoyed my stay here. The rooms are up to date and furnished very nicely. The highlight for me was the shower, closest thing to being in my own. The location is superb, you are in a great place to walk anywhere downtown Charleston. The front desk was more than helpful as I had a morning meeting, they held my luggage for me so I didn't have to lug it with me as I walked to my meeting. The pool is small but the overall feel of the hotel is great.What a great place to stay! Excellent location. You are centrally located to everything. The hotel staff was awesome. Jesse checked us in and gave us great shopping and tour tips. Aaron helped us out with where to go on our dining. Loved the free parking! The rooms were clean and we had lots of towels. We will be back soon. Thanks for a wonderful birthday week!Stayed here recently for a romantic getaway to beautiful Charleston. I ended up booking it with a flight combo through American Express Travel and the hotel rate was significantly less than others in the area. Things we loved:Free parkingFree wifiFree cheese/daily happy hour Free bike storage (we rented bikes and they secured them in the manager's office for us--so nice!) Extremely clean and tasteful decorFree water bottles (2) every dayAmazing bartenders---espresso martini is on point!! Prime location (we don't mind a 10-20 minute stroll, so this was a great spot for us) Friendly serviceWe ended up having a room with an oversized bathroom (king bed on 4th floor)--it was great! I had read reviews about the balcony over the garage so didn't bother asking for one. We didn't use the pool (a bit small for the weekend crowd), but it was nice. Would definitely stay here again on our next trip!In a world where making a quick buck and treating customers with little to no respect has become standard operating procedure for many businesses, this hotel and their excellent staff are a CLASS ACT.On a Friday night at 6pm, after almost 8 hours in the airport, Delta finally canceled our flight to Charleston, and told us there were no flights available for the rest of the night and the first seats they had available for the next day wouldn't even get us in for dinner on Saturday.I immediately called the hotel, knowing it was one of the busiest weekends of the year for them (college graduations and Mother's Day) and told them that our flight was cancelled and that we needed to cancel the room. We were absolutely DREADING the thought of paying for the unused hotel room, but knew we would just have to suck it up and pay.The woman I spoke with at the King Charles Inn was instantly SO compassionate and genuinely sympathetic (a welcome change from dealing with horrendous Delta "customer service" all day); she said they wouldn't charge us for the room for either night. I COULDN'T BELIEVE IT and asked her to repeat it twice just to be sure. After what was the worst day I have ever spent in an airport, the King Charles Inn was so lovely and hospitable, they were the bright point of our day, and we didn't even get to stay there... But we will from now on when we go to Charleston!!NIce place in the heart of Charleston!I loved our stay at the King Charles Inn. Great location, clean rooms, free wifi, restaurant on-site for breakfast, light snacks, drinks, and desserts, friendly staff, and nice lounge area with fireplace. My husband and I would absolutely stay at the King Charles Inn again on our next visit to Charleston. I would recommend it to other travelers, as well. The only downside would be that the rooms are fairly small, so if you are traveling with a family you may want to get a suite, or request a larger room.Excellent location in the midst of the historic district. Most things, except restaurants, close down around 5pm or so when the cruise ships typically leave. This hotel was definitely better than the typical Best Western. They were renovating the lobby and breakfast area so can't say much about that. Price is pretty reasonable for roughly $115 a night. Pros:-Excellent location in Downtown Charleston. Most attractions and restaurants are within walking distance.-FREE parking!!!-Hotel rooms and bathrooms are pretty updated.-Complimentary coffee and tea all day. Complimentary mini donuts, cupcakes, and danishes during breakfast hours and cheese and grapes during the late afternoon.Cons: -The rooms are TINY. The bed took up most of the room and that was it. It was really tight and pretty uncomfortable. Tips: -Book early for better rates. Prices went up as the date approached.This was originally a Best Western hotel that converted to this current incarnation. The location is good as we don't mind walking. Lower King street is a block away and most of the attractions are about 10 minutes away. The worst part of this hotel has to be the air conditioning unit-noisy and located right next to the bed at head level, this is unacceptable at this price point. Reading other yelp reviews, this is not an uncommon complaint. Even after maintenance adjusted it twice, the noise level was too high to get a good night's sleep. I can forgive that some of the staff lacks the skills expected for a hospitality industry professional (smiling and volunteering information is an expectation). I can also overlook that the condition of the hotel is not in top shape (the Best Western does show). What I can't forgive is that both my wife and I lost sleep which impacted the vacation. It may have a more sophisticated name now but it's like putting lipstick on a pig. It essentially is still a Best Western.GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!I requested assistance from the Maureen, the General Manager, on behalf of a client staying at KCI--she did a stellar job. Can't wait to visit when I am in Charleston next time.This was a very lovely hotel. The location just can't be beat. The rooms are quaint and artfully decorated. The staff is very helpful from things like carrying our luggage up the stairs to giving us great recommendations to being good sports about being accosted by our drunk bride to me. The pool side wine and cheese is a wonderful touch. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for ideally located hotel in Charleston.This hotel is excellently located for visitors to Charleston. It is within walking distance of almost everything to do in the historic downtown area. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable, the only minor issue was being able to hear the people next door through the walls. The happy hour complimentary snacks and evening cookies and tea were a nice touch!Just had a great stay at the King Charles Inn. It is in a great location near restaurants and shops. The manager's reception at 430 has a good assortment of cheese, crackers fruit and discounted drinks. The hotel is well kept and the staff was very accommodating!Pretty good rooms for the price! Beds are very comfy, and everything is very modern in the rooms. Parking and wifi are free. Doorman is very friendly and a nice service. Upstairs from the check-in desk is a lounge area that is nicely heated compared to the outside frigid air when I visited. Location is good, just on the edge of the historic district.Downsides: No breakfast included. The gym is not attached to the hotel, and you have to pay $5 every time you want to use it. We had to change our reservation, and they called us at 5 AM pacific time to confirm this change in our reservation. Think about what time you're calling someone on the west coast when you're located on the east coast.Even with that, I would recommend this place to others.Edited - Maureen got back to me and apologized for the issue. We'll be staying there in April and we're looking forward to it.This is a beautiful hotel. The staff is so friendly and helpful! We were upgraded to a king suite from a queen. The only downside we had was the bed was very firm. I have a back problem and my back was actually hurting from sleeping on the bed. I had to take one of those very big yellow pillows and put behind my back to sleep comfortably. The hotel is in a great area. Able to walk to shops and restaurants. One restaurant you have to try if you're going to Charleston is Fleet Landing Restaurant. They have amazing food. It has been the best seafood I've had.This hotel was absolutely wonderful and charming. I stayed here for a romantic weekend getaway, and it was perfect. I was nervous about it being a "chain" hotel, but the Best Western company definitely kept it classy and in touch with historic Charleston. It has a parking garage/lot, with unlimited in-and-out, and it is within walking distance to everything downtown. The rooms are not huge, but they are very clean and well-kept. The bar at night serves great drinks, which you can enjoy while sitting in the rocking chairs on the patio that overlooks the street. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.Overall this is a pretty good hotel when you take into account the price, features, and location. I would stay here again. I have to admit I was skeptical about staying here. Best western is not a chain I usually frequent but the reviews seemed promising. First off and most important, the price is very right. I was able to get a room through Hotwire for just over $100 a night. The exterior and interior hallways are a little shabby but the rooms are nicer. You can tell the rooms were recently remodeled or if not the cleaning staff is doing a hell of a job. It's not your typical remodel/cleanup job that looks like layers and layers of paint on top of dirt. Overall, everything is nice... the showers, bathrooms, decor, crown molding, room size, even the free internet that wasn't horrible. Tangent: why is free hotel internet always so crappy? That wasn't the case here.The location is great for seeing downtown historic Charleston. Everything is just a short walk away and the area feels safe. It's easy go get in and out of and best of all parking is free, free, free. My only real complaint is that the elevator is pretty wonky. The 1st level exit takes you to the back corner of the garage and it is inconvenient to get out. The only exit from there is all the way on the other side of the building. I found it easier to just take the stairs but even then you had to navigate through the pool and lobby. It was rather odd but really just a minor inconvenience."Best" Western is right....best one I"ve ever seen.Let me start by explaining that I'm a self-proclaimed hotel snob. I travel every week for work and stay in many hotels....and have even walked out of a few because they weren't 'good' enough - yes, this is the person that chose to stay at a Best Western. I was headed to Charleston for work and looked on TripAdvisor.com to find other reviews in addition to yelpers. As work doesn't allow me to stay at a $400/night hotel, I needed to find something nice and affordable. When I saw that the Best Western received the #8 rated hotel in all of Charleston, I thought I'd give it a try. It did not disappoint - overall, it is quite nice.Pros:- Great location - walking distance to the market and lots of restaurants- Rooms are nice and updated - great bedding and soft feather pillows. - iHome alarm clocks in room for iPod hook up- Large flat screen TV mounted on wall- Nightly 'manager special' cocktails on the 2nd floor lobbyCons:- Rooms are VERY small, but this isn't atypical of Charleston- Bathrooms are even smaller - at least in my room (317). It was actually difficult to use - the door was almost like a partition between the shower and the vanity. It was okay for my one night stay, but any longer and this would've been an issue. - The walls are quite thin. I could hear the entire conversation going on in the room next to me and they weren't yelling by any means. Thankfully they weren't late night chatterers or that would have been an issue. Not a bad experience overall...I'd recommend it if you're on a budget.
review_content_40: Loved this hotel, I stayed this weekend for the second time and loved every minute. The staff is very friendly and the newly updated bar is great! It is in one of the best locations you could ask for, we walked to everything we did, restaurants, tours, the aquarium, and of course bars and it was never more then a ten minute walk. Pros:The bar! The reception when you check in is great.The staff, very friendly and helpful when giving recommendations.The rooms were extremely well maintained and comfortable.The price for what you get can't be beat.Cons:Only one, if you get a deluxe queen or king room and not a suite then your room will be a little small. For me this is no problem because with so much to do why would you be in there. If a smaller room is a bad thing for you (by small you still have a 5'x8' not used space of open area in the room) then upgrade to the suites, they are huge.Lastly be sure to look on their site for packages. Some of the third party sites don't show them and if you are looking to tour the city you can get some great discounts on there. We did the Poe package and got a copy of Edgar Allen Poe's "The Gold Bug", admission to Fort Moulteir, and a gift card to Poe's tavern for almost the same rate as just the room would have been.the general mgr informed me how much money they are losing on my reservation because I bought my room on priceline. I asked if they would consider refunding me one evening because I had an issue at home. she got very ugly with me and made me feel very unwelcome.This hotel has a $50 early departure fee that they dont have listedThanks Yelp for helping me find this place! After reading the reviews, I booked a room for a one-night stay in downtown Charleston the day off and called Best Western directly for the best rates. The rep on the phone was very helpful and gave me some useful information about the area. I got a room for Thursday night for $129 with the AAA discount. This hotel is located right in the heart of the Charleston...some of the hottest restaurants are just blocks away and of course King street is just a block away with a slew of shopping choices. With your overnight stay you get complimentary parking in the garage behind the hotel or in the lot across meeting street. That helps considerably knowing that it's hard to find parking in downtown Charleston. The rooms and bathrooms are pretty big and comfortable with all the amenities you could ask for. The ceilings are low in the hallway and the hallways themselves are fairly narrow so it's hard to pull luggage carts and large suitcases through.The King Charles Inn is a great value and conveniently located to everything in downtown Charleston. The staff aims to please and has always made me feel at home. I love the free parking, free wifi, and the rooms are nice and clean. There's an outdoor pool for relaxing with a book and the kids love it! We bring our bikes and ride all over town and bike the bridge to Mt. Pleasant and Patriots Point for helicopter tours. King St is just a block away for the best shopping in Charleston. Marion Square is only a couple of blocks away so make sure you go there on Saturday and/or Sunday for the art and jewelry and food etc that they put out during the summer months. The breakfast is reasonable and quick so it's easy to get fed before heading out on your Charleston adventure. I'm a regular at several hotels but this is the only one where I always find a handwritten card and chocolates from the general manager, Maureen, thanking me for my loyalty. Neither the Four Seasons in Westlake Village, the Fairmont in Santa Monica nor the Trump in Soho or the Waldorf Astoria in Chicago have shown so much appreciation for my countless stays with them over the years. For a more budget minded trip and especially when traveling with children I highly recommend the King Charles Inn!This is the second time I have stayed here and both times were outstanding.  It is in the historical section of the city so you can walk to all things historical.  The general manager gave us her take on tours and restaurants during the late afternoon reception.  I especially like the door man at the hotel.........  A nice touch and I like the safety aspect.  Parking is free.We had booked our hotel reservation for our honeymoon on HotWire and had no idea we'd be staying at such a nice Best Western! Located smackdab in the middle of the historic district, this location is ideal and has access close to everything you want to check out and enjoy. We were so pleased the minute we pulled into check-in. First, complimentary parking underneath the hotel or behind is a huge win. Parking in Charleston is either A) difficult as all get out or B) extremely expensive. Having complimentary parking and the option to come and go as you please is a wonderful amenity. This gives you the freedom to adventure and not worry about breaking the bank with parking. We made it to the front desk and the staff was so friendly. Welcomed us and even gave us a map of must try places. Helped us navigate with a small legend of some things close by. They thanked us for choosing them, coming all the way from Charlotte, and upgraded us to a massive king bed! Huge props! There is also a lounge area up the stairs where they have free cookies and cheese/crackers throughout the day. We made it to our room and not but 10 minutes later, we were greeted by a butler with champagne and chocolates! Happy Honeymoon to us!The rooms and spacious and have incredible amenities. Big bathrooms, tons of furniture, nice TV and a fridge. This is great since we almost always had leftovers. This location feels so safe. Having inside entrances to hotel rooms is a big plus. Absolutely love this location. Affordable and the staff does a fantastic job. Can't wait to stay here again upon our next visit to Chucktown.We were just there from August 2nd until August 5th  2014.  The place is spotless.  The service is excellent.  The people that work there are very nice and are very classy. The cafe that is on the grounds is very good for breakfast or to grab a beer before heading out.  It is also located 2 blocks away from the main part of downtown.  What a great place.Awesome  service as soon as we pulled up! Everyone was very nice from the front desk to the bartender. They even made our reservations for dinner at 82nd queen.We checked into the hotel late Thursday night. The check-in agent told us we had 3 reservations (we had actually booked 2) and she was sorry but they were experiencing a lot of problems with the third party companies who book the rooms and it was best we call Expedia to clear up the confusion....she was not helpful at all.However, the night we checked in we did not see that the building next door to the hotel has recently been demolished. Therefore, at 7 am Friday morning we woke up to a construction crew and their mack trucks moving all around the lot. At 8am on the dot our BEDS BEGAN TO SHAKE because the construction site was drilling large holes into the ground. It was completely unacceptable. The first time we called the front desk they said "Oh sorry we didn't know they put you on that side".....didn't know they put us on that side?! Literally the whole side of the hotel was experiencing loud drilling noises. NOT ACCEPTABLE WHEN YOU ARE ON VACATION. Eventually the GM moved our rooms to a different end of the hotel and apologized for the inconvenience. Clearly she has been dealing with this issue for a while now. There were a lot of unhappy guests at this hotel looking for room changes after the drilling began at 8am. I suggest before you ever book a room at this hotel, make sure the construction on the lot next door has been completed.Wife and I stayed here, and this is the BEST we have stayed in with the Best Western Hotels. The Manager and staff are will trained....LOVED THIS PLACE...!!Nice, modern hotel, recently revamped from the look of it, in a great location on the peninsula. Pricey for us, but suspect you can get better rates in advance. Parking is included in the price. Great desk staff - they were really lovely and helpful.Exceeded our expectations! Great service and amenities, perfect location for walking anywhere in the historic district. We will stay here again!Great place to stay, can walk Charleston's historic district, shop on King St and at the Market, and dine casual or fancy.  Room was beautiful, clean and staff friendly.I was very disappointed with our stay here.  I read lots of glowing reviews before booking two months ahead, when I could have booked virtually anywhere in the city, and requested one of the highly recommended rooms with a balcony.   Upon arriving, we discovered that the balcony looked out over the interior parking garage of this hotel.  What a joke - incredibly misleading about the balcony and view.  When I complained about this to the general manager, all I got was an apology saying "I'm sorry it was not described properly on our website."  Buyer beware!We arrived at cocktail hour and it felt like we were staying at a nursing home. Seriously, everyone was over 60. Yes, I realize it's Best Western. But still. The room was small and awkwardly located. It was clean and nice enough. I did NOT appreciate housekeeping calling at 9:49am to see if we wanted our room serviced--not cool, Best Western. I'm on Vacation! And I'm not 60 so don't wake me up to give me towels on YOUR schedule.Very nice hotel, great location. Close to some great bars and restaurants, the Battery and shopping on King St.The staff was friendly and it was in a great location for exploring Charleston on foot. The facilities were well kept and clean but a bit confusing, since there was no easy way to get to the room from the lobby. This may be due to the architectural restrictions in Charleston. Also, the rooms were over decorated to the point that it limited usable space within the room. Maybe due to age, the walls between rooms were not good at isolating neighboring sounds, but this was not a big deal for our stay.We were unable to book a room with a balcony, but worth checking out in the future.Here's an update on the Best Western - King Charles Inn as of May 2010, post renovation. This is still the best Best Western to which we've ever been. Indeed, it doesn't even seem like a standard Best Western but rather like a  three star hotel that is, in addition, very central to all the restaurants and attractions of historic downtown Charleston.Highlights of our experience at the King Charles included: General cleanliness and neutral to nice smells throughout the hotel; excellent shower fixtures and granite surfaces in the bathroom and in the small writing area; an excellent balcony with two rocking chairs; plenty of soft, quality towels; and a Pacific Coast down comforter on the comfortable king-sized bed. The staff at the King Charles was 100% pro: The bell hop had some really good advice regarding restaurants and live music venues; and our maids were really smiley and pleasant.  The King Charles has a small but meticulously kept pool, a lovely breakfast room, and a nice little bar area and, best of all, its own parking lot right under the hotel which comes with the price of your room. The parking is a real plus considering that many of the other snobbier hotels in town charge you $15/night to park your car, parking on the street in Charleston is all but impossible and the "boot" is liberally used. Guests should be aware that if the lot right under the hotel is full, there is an "overflow" lot  right across Meeting Street.We will most definitely stay at the King Charles the next time we are in Charleston, may it be soon! It is a wonderful oasis at a very friendly price.This hotel is conveniently located on Meeting street, just on the north side of all the shops and restaurants.  We got a great rate and decided to give it a shot.The hotel has a very upscale feel, especially for a Best Western - likely the result of their recent renovation.  The front desk staff were very courteous and helpful with suggestions on local restuarants and activities.  We had no problems with parking or check-in.The rooms are well-decorated and comfortable, if on the small side.  I think they have about the smallest bathrooms allowed by OSHA!  But overall we were very pleased with the rooms.Overall, a great location for an overnighter or a two-night stay, but if you're looking for a room to spend more time in these may be a little too cramped.  We totally enjoyed it for what it was, however!Rooms are way small, air conditioner ran all night, walls are paper thin and they charge you for everything (even though their website makes it sound as if breakfast is included).  No thanks.
review_content_60: The company photos here on Yelp are pretty accurate. This is probably the nicest Best Western I have ever been in. The rooms are very upscale and the hotel just looks nice. It fits in with the neighborhood. The location is great. Charleston isn't the kind of city you want to drive around...you should walk it. You could pick almost any street and you'll find something historic and interesting on a walk. The King Charles Inn is situated smack in the middle of some really nice walking streets. Lots of popular restaurants are nearby.  For the negatives, I couldn't find many but these are the ones that stood out: Our bed had nice sheets and pillows but one of the two beds in our room sagged in the middle. We didn't use it much but the TV had only 12 channels, which seemed odd in this modern world.  Parking was tight but there was ample overflow. The parking garage, which is under the hotel, always seemed full and I think that's because everyone did like us and parked one day and didn't move their cars until check out. You don't need to in this location. The pool was small but situated in a cute courtyard that most of the time seemed private.I would stay at this hotel again, though probably not in hot, sticky July.Very nice hotel! Im not a fan of Best Westerns in general but this is definitely a step above any Best Western and super convenient location. Stay here and walk the block to Hyman's Seafood...cant beat either one in downtown Charleston!From the rooms to service the hotel is top notch. You will not find better. The staff is top notch, the rooms are modern and clean, and you are within easy walk to most of Charleston's top sites. You won't regret this choice. We always stay here when in town.Clean, affordable, and excellent location to all the sites we wanted to see.We were not able to check in early, but they took our bags for us and let us park there while we were looking around.  Staff was very friendly.  Free coffee.  The only issue was the parking - if you left after like 7pm good luck finding a spot upon your return.This hotel is in a great location, so close to everything: the shops on King, the open Market st shops, the aquarium, half a block from Jestine's and Fig... The staff was really friendly and the room was spacious. Comfortable King bed and good pillows! Very clean, too, I am paranoid about hotel cleanliness.  Only complaints: loud ( but very cold) a/c, weird low ceiling hallways and balcony overlooked the parking lot. Pool is comically tiny. The room was very nice though and the location really couldn't be better.  The hotel is very difficult to navigate, like 3-4 buildings cobbled together, it was very difficult to get from our room to the front desk, we usually just walked through the parking lot.This is is a nice hotel that has been recently remodeled. The price was very reasonable for the location which is in the heart of the historic district. The rooms have internet and the business area has computers with internet access. They have an in house bar for early evening drinks. Parking is free in a secure lot.Great stay at the King Charles Inn! The location is perfect, placed just steps away from the famous Jestine's kitchen, city Market, Wine bars, Jazz bars, and historic sites galore! We had a perfect vacation and wonderful accommodations with this hotel. The value was incredible, the staff were beyond friendly, the room was so spacious and clean! We wouldn't stay anywhere else upon a return trip!This hotel is near most of the attractions (market, shopping, Restaurants). The pool area is nice and relaxing. The staff is friendly. In the lobby they offer happy hour specials which includes a complimentary fruit and cheeses tray. I will return to this hotel on my next visit. The hotel had ths the best soap, oatmeal. The rooms had granite counter tops. Also, there was complimentary tea and coffee avaible in the lobby.Nice hotel, with clean updated rooms a bit on the small side.  Parking is a bit limited and spaces are a bit tight.  Conveniently located, easy to walk to restaurants from here.  Helpful staff.  I would stay here again.Stayed here with some girlfriends for a bachelorette weekend and was delighted with the hotel!  The rooms were clean, nicely decorated and spacious enough for our needs.  The pool, while small, was sufficient, with a nice lounge area with tables.  They had a daily happy hour with drink specials and a fruit and cheese platter, which was satisfied our mid-afternoon snacking needs.  They also had free coffee and iced water- two staples for late nights and the summer Charleston heat!  The location was great as everything we needed was in walking distance.  The only negative was that our bathtub was slow to drain.  Other than that, the price was great and everyone commented that this was the best Best Western they'd ever stayed in!Had read the reviews and found this inn to be rated very well. I have to agree.  The rooms had poster beds with comfortable mattresses and pillows and stark white bedding that not only lent to a light and airy room, but also to the cleanliness of the room.  The King Charles Inn is conveniently located to everything downtown in the heart of the historic district - the City Market is only a block and a half away and it's centrally located so that you can walk to most anywhere or hop the free bus that runs throughout the downtown area.  We never used the bus as we had rented a car, which is nice to have if you plan on visiting any of the plantations or anything outside of the downtown area.  Free parking at the hotel was a nice bonus that we took advantage of for the duration of our stay,  The staff is very friendly and accommodating and I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Charleston who wants to stay downtown without breaking the bank.I love this hotel. We stayed here back in June for a weekend.  Its within walking distance of the straw markets and the shopping on King street. We just parked the car, which is free and walked around. We did not try the breakfast because there is so much great food in Charleston anyway. We did get in the pool though, which is small but cute and deep.  This is a nice place and the staff are friendly. I would not stay anywhere else in Charleston.The King Charles Inn is under renovation currently, but we just stayed in one of their renovated rooms.  Nicely decorated, comfy beds, wonderful pillows, and the bathroom was particularly nice and well-appointed.  The service was always perfect and friendly, the pool is lovely and there is a nice seating area just above it and outside the bar where weary parents can have a glass of wine after the kids are in bed (thank you long-range baby monitor).  Parking is free and the hotel was generous with guest passes although that may change once all the rooms are available and extra spaces are less plentiful.The breakfast looked and smelled awesome, but we were meeting family and they wanted to eat elsewhere.  Woe is me, we ended up at IHOP.The location is fantastic as well.  I thought the rates were very reasonable for the level of service and the quality of the rooms.  The website had some excellent deals, I would definitely stay here again.When we arrived for a weekend trip, we were pleased with the location of the hotel and what appeared to be a nice room. The check-in staff were friendly and accommodating. I woke up after the first night feeling itchy. My husband read that a sign of bed bugs is tiny blood spots on the sheets, so he inspected the bed and found about 10 tiny spots on my side. When we removed the sheets we found a tiny black bug that appeared to be dead. We called the front desk and a bellman came and picked up the bug and looked at it. We asked to be moved so we could shower. The manager came up and said she couldn't find any bugs and asked to see the bites. I didn't want to pull down my pants to show them. She said she had been trained extensively in bed bugs and the bites don't itch and the bugs are clear. A quick look at WebMD disproves both statements. We were told two people had just checked out and a new room would be available soon. We went to eat breakfast and checked back. No room, but they promised to call as soon as one was ready. We ventured out in 30 degree weather to a coffee shop to wait. After another 90 minutes, we called and were told housekeeping was checking on rooms. After 20 minutes, we walked back and the front desk staff scrambled and eventually found a room -- more than three hours after our initial call. The manager was rude and acted as if we were being deceitful. We stayed the second night without issue. The next morning my husband visited the manager before showed her cell phone pictures of the bites on my legs. She said pest control didn't find any bugs. He got very upset with her and she was exceediny was rude to him. Later, I asked to see her and told her that while I'm certain there are people who scam hotels, we are not those people. We never asked for anything except a different room and it took three hours to get it. I told her I didn't appreciate her questioning my credibility. She said that when she came to our room I had said I didn't have any bites and that I said I was being a "hypochondriac." What I had actually said was that I was itching all over and that after finding the bug and the blood, some of the itching could be "psychosomatic." Big difference. She was inexcusably rude and defensive when all we wanted was a clean room and a sincere apology. I don't blame them for the bugs. That can happen at the nicest hotels. I do blame them for treating us like criminals and liars.Certainly the nicest Best Western I've ever stayed at.  Newly remolded, clean and well appointed decoration.  Ideal location, friendly staff, comfy beds, and reasonably valued for the price during spring season.  The breakfast option is convenient, but nothing to write home about.  Although we didn't use it, the pool was small, but nice with plenty of chaises for sunbathing.  We did enjoy the wireless, room patio, and the full happy hour bar.  Really good choice to meet many needs.i've been known to choose a crappy hotel or three (hey, it was before yelp, alright?), but this centrally located best western actually worked very well for us!the room was spacious and clean, the price was reasonable, there was free wi-fi, and service was very friendly!  i would definitely stay here again if in the area!note: booking through their website lead to best prices!This was our first trip to Charleston. The King Charles is clean, nicely decorated in old world style. It's located right in middle of downtown Charleston & if you're not looking for it you will miss it. We booked here via their online website because my husband's employer gets a discount & because the website description made the Inn sound spacious, but when we arrived it was anything but that. Pictures on website are deceiving making the hotel & rooms look spacious, its not. If you get a room w/ a balcony, you get a view of the parking garage. Pool is about the size of two large hot tubs. The Deluxe Double room was too small for 3 adults on tiny full-sized beds. When I told management the room was too small, they offered to upgrade us to their King Deluxe for no extra charge, but then our 18-year-old son would have to sleep on a cot! We said no thanks & just made do with our room, spending most of our time out of it. Never tried room service or hotel restaurant as they were too expensive. They do have free parking in their garage which was a plus. But if you leave and return in the evening be prepared to park in their overflow lot across the street. If you like small & cramped spaces then this is the place for you. In fact, this describes downtown Charleston. You will need a Mini Cooper to navigate it! For goodness sake (& your vehicles paint job) don't come here in a SUV!! You can walk everywhere to shopping & restaurants, but if you come in summer prepare to sweat profusely on your walk-about in the humidity.nice hotel, not alot of parking under the hotel, but never had a problem since they had extra across the street.
