Pool was a little small, but had great jazz playing, nice flowers and nice loungers. Really pretty sitting area with fountian and ice water next to the pool. Great location, so we could walk to everything. Our refrigerator broke right after we arrived, and they fixed it as soon as we called to report it. We were on the 3rd floor, and it could get really noisy since our room overlooked the street. We had brought a fan which drowned out most of the noise, so had no problems sleeping.Great hotel! The local is ideal for seeing the sites on the Charleston Peninsula. The service was fantastic, including the front desk staff and door men. The property is very cute and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Access to a nice gym around the corner is complimentary, always a bonus. I was overall very happy with King Charles and if I go back to Charleston I will stay there again.

review_content: Old hotel but I read online that they will be undergoing renovations soon. The lobby is very nice and so is the bar/restaurant. Now onto the room: I was on the business floor and the room was decent, at best. The view was terrible but I wasn't there for the views so I didn't really care. The AC worked but I was not able to control it and the AC is ridiculously loud. The bed was comfortable but the shower is terrible!! The water wouldn't drain at all and it was disgusting. They were nice enough to let me do late checkout till 2PM. The hallways smelled like cigarettes. The overall experience can be improved if they work on the little things.My experience once again seems to differ from the main stream. I found this hotel to be most suitable in every way, from the gracious front desk personnel, a very large clean comfortable contemporary room and bathroom to the very courteous airport shuttle divers. If you decide to stay longer than an overnight then you should have a rental car as downtown Charleston and/or MT Pleasant is a 15 to 20 minute drive. There are some interesting things to do in North Charleston but that too would require a car. If I needed to stay near the Charleston Airport in the future, I would not hesitate to stay at the Charleston Plaza as it is only an 8 minute shuttle ride to the airport.Yeah, as another Yelper commented, the lobby area is nice, but the rooms are dirty and outdated. And although every employee I talked to was very friendly, our room was unacceptable. I'm not sure what kind of view I was expecting at an airport hotel, but all we could see from our window was air conditioner equipment.The bathroom sink was running (not dripping) the entire time we were there. At one point, it was filling an 8oz cup in just over 5 seconds. The first night, when I tried to shut the faucet off, the handle came off in my hand. We notified the front desk, and they promised to have it fixed. When we got back to the room, the handle had been screwed back onto the faucet. However, the faucet was still running, and turning the handle wouldn't change the water temperature. Our only choice was hot. It was comfortable enough for hand washing, but way too hot for teeth brushing or drinking, and not hot enough for shaving. And on our last night there, the handle came off in my hand, AGAIN!The shower curtain was moldy, and it stank. After our room had been cleaned, I had to wander the halls looking for someone with a cleaning cart in order to get coffee and toilet paper. And there was exactly one available electric outlet in the room for charging our phones and computers.This is the most pathetic hotel ever and it is a joke to all hotels out of the city of Charleston. Poor hospitality, poor cleanliness, poor stablishment,poor use as a hotel.Do not come here! The hotel has a beautiful lobby and bar area. As for the rooms, they are very outdated and extremely dirty! The lamp doesn't work. The sheets are stained. See the photos!Recently rebranded as the 'Charleston Plaza Hotel', this comfortable property is a short drive from the airport, and just 15 minutes from the historic district. We scored a $75 rate on Priceline when planning a last-minute family getaway on Memorial Day weekend, and the room was worth just about that.The front-desk service was slow but adequate, and our two-room suite was spacious and clean. The property shows some wear and tear, but we couldn't find anything glaringly wrong. Then again, I was a little afraid to look too closely. The biggest negative was that the TV in the living area wouldn't work. This was a real bummer for our two kids, but helped get us out the door a lot more quickly, so I really can't complain. The king-sized bed was a lot more comfortable that I expected, and the shower was hot. While definitely not the sort of place I'd book for a romantic weekend in Charleston, it did the trick for a quick family weekend away.I didn't have high expectations given the rates we paid but the hotel was just fine. Lobby looks good but rooms are out dated and need an upgrade. Beds are not very comfortable either. Didn't get a chance to use the pool but it looked nice. Checkin can be friendlier as well. Overall worth 100$ a night.Where do I begin? When you arrive it looks great! Just wait until you get in your room. When we first got in our room and were checking everything out we found dirty towels hanging over the shower rod. Not to mention the moldiness of the tub. It was so gross. Not acceptable at all. The corners in the bathroom were yellowed and looked like they had been urinated in. The carpet in the room was not clean due to finding several what looked like some sort of gummy candies on the floor. There were no trashbags in the trash cans,which were dirty as well. We had a terrible time falling asleep due to the pool being open until 11pm and children playing and screaming until then. I would defintely not recommend this hotel!Staff is really nice, the room is very clean and the bed was so comfortable. It's an older hotel so it's not perfect but my room was great. I've stayed in many hotels in the area and this is the best deal I've found. I will definitely be staying here again as my best friend only lives 5 minutes away.Very comfortable hotel with good air conditioning and soft beds. This is your average run of the mill hotel that has changed names over the years. I would not pay over 100.00 to stay here, good for one night as it is place to hang your head for the night. Located in North Charleston which has Holy City and Coast Brewery down the road not to mentioned EVO and The Brew Cellar a few of my favorite eateries and breweries when I'm in chuck town.CLOTHING STOLEN BY STAFF - Management would not help"STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL! My college age daughter stayed at this hotel July 2, 2015 through July 5, 2015. It was a horrible experience. She and her girlfriend left a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door, and the cleaning staff came in anyway. When they returned from their outing on Saturday, she realized her expensive shorts were stolen. The cleaning staff had moved her bag and other belongings off of the bed, but the shorts were gone. She had just worn them that morning, so she knew she had not misplaced them. When she told the front desk about what happened, they told her to fill out a report for "Lost and Found." I thought that was an ingenious way of covering up the incident.When my daughter returned to Atlanta, her dad called the hotel and spoke to the manager. She pays for her own clothes and expenses, so this was a big deal for her. He was not interested in helping us because he said that he has never had a problem with stealing before. This was very unprofessional of him to assume that my daughter was lying. We believe that the staff is very smart to steal one item at a time. Most people would assume that they mistakenly left their item at the hotel instead of assuming that it was stolen.As far as the quality of the hotel is concerned, it was WAY BELOW AVERAGE. My daughter said it smelled like mildew and the air conditioner was not operating properly.The hotel customer service was good. However, the rooms were not that great. The floors were damp and wet. The bath tub had little mold. The corners of the room was dusty. It only get 2 stars because we had a family reunion.Looks great in the lobby and from the outside. The rooms are a little outdated. The towels need replacing and the housekeepers could do a little better job. Not terrible for a business weekend, but I wouldn't recommend it for a couples weekend getaway in Charlestown. I'll stick to the larger chain hotels from now on.Many of the recent comments left by other folks (dirty, old, non-vacuumed and stained carpets, old furniture, etc) are entirely accurate, so I would not go over them again. To top those all off, my husband was extensively bitten by bed bugs during the first night of our stay. The front desk associate moved us to a room on the business level (cleaner, fresher than the first one, but not by much), yet he did not seem surprised at all to hear my complaints. Helpfulness and politeness don't really help in that case, given that we now have to disinfect all of our luggage from the trip. Another think that was terrible - the bathroom in the original room was rusty and looked very dirty. The business level one was slightly better, but not great either. Would not recommend this place at all.Totally surprised and wow.The Innplace Hotel is a definite eye opener when I drove up to the property after a good day sightseeing in downtown Charleston. I found Innplace on hotels.com and saw the hotel photos there and on the official hotel website. Often enough, you tend not to believe the hotel photos, but not this time. This property was pretty amazing. Very clean and bright. Immaculate and nothing short of glimmering and sparkly, to turn a phrase. I would like to say that this place mirrors higher end hotel brands like Marriott and Sheraton. And just maybe, dare I say, Westin too? It was a bit too perfect, but I didn't mind at all. The lobby was gorgeous and the property was nice, with many parking spaces for guests.The Innplace hotel - Charleston Airport is located near the Charleston regional airport, as the name implies. Right off the I-26, depending on which way you are coming from, but it was nice that it was right off the interstate when driving from downtown Charleston. I was here for just a night (Sunday, 2/16/2014) before driving back to Columbia, SC to fly out back to home. This was indeed a great choice I made. The check in process was very smooth and Brian was very nice. He even asked me about my marathon finisher's medal I was wearing. To which I replied, Myrtle Beach, which I ran yesterday. He told me he does various shorter events, but aims to do longer ones in the future. I received room #341, which was a King bed, that I booked for. It was great. Almost like a Sheraton in comfort and spaciousness. Definitely borderline luxury, but without the luxury price for sure. :) I was definitely happy.Among the room amenities, the big screen tv, a business desk with a chair, and a coffee maker. Too bad that there wasn't a microwave or a mini fridge, but its cool. There was ice maker machine on my floor, as well as vending machines as well. A little bit of style, but with a bit of basic necessities as well. There was room service options for breakfast here, but it was definitely pricy. I ended up driving back to Columbia airport and picked up McDonald's on the way for breakfast. Ha. Way cheaper! The bed was definitely comfortable. Must've gotten 7 blissful hours of sleep before the 1 1/2 hour drive back to Columbia, but it was worth the $80/night price tag. While I didn't use any other in house amenity, having a nice bed to lay my head and a quality stay is all I need. No need for extra comfort.The room was clean and very comfortable, so definitely no complaints about that. The check out process was okay. I had to wait till the hotel lobby phone rang and someone from the back came out to answer it. I had stood at the counter for a good 10 minutes and said hello, but nobody came out. It's okay though. The $80/night price tag is certainly a steal, so you may want to hang out here when your travels come through Charleston, South Carolina. Yes, definitely recommended for your accommodations. Best place to stay while on a budget, although you may need to check prices before booking. I probably just got lucky or it may be the low season (February).Support local!AQuiet, convenient, comfortable at a good price. Great location for anyone with a car needing to access both downtown and the airport. Not the right place if you want activities right outside your door - you're near a freeway. The lobby is nice but the rooms could use an update - especially the bathrooms. The shower drained slow and the toilet was a finicky flusher. Carpet had signs of wear and tear, plus many marks all over the walls. Nothing outright bad, it just shows signs of long term repeated use. Would be nicer if they had breakfast or mini refrigerators so you could bring your own. Only complaint was that maintenance knocked on our door and woke us up at 7am to fixed a clogged toilet - but it wasn't ours, they got the wrong room. And we even had the Do Not Disturb sign up, so that was frustrating. If you have a larger budget and want more updated room with breakfast, check out other options. If you're on a smaller budget, want a nice enough place and don't need breakfast - this is your spot! Bonus: the lobby is nice and there's an indoor/outdoor pool.After reading some previous reviews Hotel is slot nicer than I expected! Would have gotten 5 stars if there was a fridge in the room, ($15 rental fee) and breakfast was included with stay. Ok I am rerating my stay. We were here for 3 days and not once did housekeeping come in to service our room. We asked 3 times on the last day by calling and even visiting the front desk for our room to be serviced. Each time we were told it would be taken care of but never was. Finally when we came in late on the last night of our stay and our room still hadn't been cleaned, the front desk offered to move us to another room. That meant we had to pack up everything, and get situated in a new room when we already had to leave at 6am the following morning.Dont let the lobby and pool area fool you.Updating review after spending a couple nights here. PRO: Housekeeping was wonderful, delivered a second iron quickly when I had trouble with the first. (My fault, not theirs---it worked after delivery of second one of course). Room was spotless, came home each day to fresh towels, beds made well, trash emptied and bathroom clean--thanks.Hotel restaurant food very good for breakfast and dinner--not here for lunch.CON Had a slow draining toilet and some confusion when I called downstairs at 4 am as to when they would deliver my requested plunger. Delivered after 6 am and they insisted on doing the work, so that was appreciated. View from our room is of top of first floor roof, complete with air conditioning units and other industrial units. But it's fine with us as we are not here for the view out of our room.The pictures from hotels.com were deceiving. The lightbulb in the lamp between the beds was broken. The sheets were not 100% clean they had stains on them. When we asked for new sheets those sheets were the same as the sheets prior. The indoor pool stated that it was heated and it was not. If you have a baby bring your own pack and play or crib or you need to bring your own bumper if you're using their crib. Their crib is all metal frame. Don't plan on hot water for your showers, it's cold and if you're very patient possibly lukewarm. The overall look of the hotel looks like it is falling apart.I just held a Navy reunion at the Charleston Plaza Hotel in June. BEWARE! I realize they are going to renovate in Dec, but!! The rooms are sort of clean, but in dreadful shape...furniture beat-up, draperies askew, furniture & floors not very clean, rooms not refreshed some days, AND they tried to cheat me. I signed a contract for certain things. At the time of the reunion they tried to put us in a tiny banquet room...not what I signed for, said they did not have certain items for my use that they stated would be available in the contract & were not pleased when I demanded what I'd been promised. (Customer service skills are very lacking in all levels.) Today I discover they charged my credit card $150.00 for things I never used, saw or charged!! They say it was for incidentals & since I had none, that $150.00 was deleted from the bill I got at the end of my stay...BUT...was then sent to my credit card company. (My credit card company is now investigating as they said they do not understand what this hotel is trying to pull. ) Don't stay there if you can avoid it!
review_content_20: This hotel was horrible!! It was dirty, falling apart (our bathroom ceiling was collapsing over the shower), the corner wall in the bedroom area was rotting, the AC didn't work well for two days and we asked for a change or fixing it. They fixed it, then our keys didn't work. They reset the keys and upon checking out, they said, "didn't you move to a more expensive room?". We said no, as they never informed us of it. "Oh, ha, ha, here are the keys that should have been given to you." So, it is a mess from the building condition to the staff and management. If we had not been part of a reunion, we would have moved out after the first night!!This is certainly not a 3-star as advertised on Priceline.  You do get what you pay for.  I paid $95 for the room, glad I did not pay more.  It was moderately clean and very old. Wall paper hanging in corners from the wall and tile grout crumbling and falling off.   The sheets appeared to be clean.  The baseboards were filthy and our towels were not replaced for 3 days.  When we asked the lady with the cart in the hallway, the only response we got was "no intiendo."  How convenient!Although this property has very nice common area amenities (i.e. lobby and pool) the rooms have a little to be desired.  The room that I was in had a leak above in the bathroom, at least I assume, as the drywall ceiling was sagging and had a hole in it.  I felt the ceiling and it was wet.  The pictures of the rooms make them look much bigger than they really are.  If you are just staying overnight and going to the airport it is a good deal but I wouldn't stay there for more than a night.

review_content: Marriott is quickly becoming my preferred hotel brand due in part to experiences at their affordable Courtyard branded locations. This stay was another solid experience. We came to Charleston for the night and when researching hotels this location came up at about half the cost of a downtown hotel despite being a little over a mile away from the French Quarter. While the weather held steady on Saturday we found it was quite an easy walk into town. When the rain came later that night the uber back to the hotel was about $7. The hotel has a great location for the price. The room we stayed in was a bit small but clean and 2 complimentary water bottles and chocolates were provided. I was just happy they let us check in 4 hours early! We also went to the bar before heading out and the bartender was friendly and the happy hour pricing was very happy indeed. They have a huge outdoor verandah that I imagine is great for relaxing with some wine when the weather is warmer.The only downsides were this - there was construction going on during our visit which meant getting lost trying to find the functional elevator and the lights were out in the hallway when we first went to our room. The second and cautionary piece is that the water in the shower and sink will go from freezing to burning in just a few seconds so be careful!I was treated like a queen at the Starbucks this morning. When my food was a little slow, they brought out a complimentary muffin for me. A couple of the staff came over multiple times to check on me at breakfast. They honestly seemed like they cared so much--very refreshing! The rooms were so comfortable, with an amazing shower. I will definitely be staying here again!Overall, it was an ok experience. It was pretty cheap compared to the other hotels in the area. The rooms were small and mediocre, but thats what you get for this price. The "waterview" thet we were supposed to get from our hotel window wasn't really a water view, more like a patio view. The shuttle service they provided was pretty inconvenient, as it didn't come that often and was cramped. It also broke down at one point ans we had to take a taxi instead. Probably the biggest thing for me was the fact that they didn't clean the rooms! They replaced the towels once, but they didn't make the beds despite us leaving the sign down. They then left out an envelope for us to put a tip in which was pretty rude.Absolutely the worst customer service of my life. They refused to give us another room or upgrade us. We are gold members of the hotel chain. Then when my father left I sat on a bench to wait for a family member who had hone to the bathroom, the people at the front desk laughed at my father. They said that he shouldnt be acting like that, him just being a gold member and not platnium. We walked across the parking lot to the Hilton who gave us the upgraded rooms for $70 less on each.Beautiful view, nice enough room--nothing fancy. 1.5 miles to downtown is walkable, provided you have the time to burn. The issues: one elevator broken all 4 days, the other incredibly slow. We were near the elevator on 2nd floor and it took 8-10 minutes on average to get out of the hotel. This is really ridiculous if not also unsafe. I used uber frequently and they'd be waiting and waiting downstairs even though I ordered the car service as I was walking out my door.Our sink was also completely clogged. Running the water more than 30 seconds brought the level to near-flood. Try washing your face when you can barely speed-wash your hands. Tried to check out fitness center--equipment broken or not well-maintained. Can't imagine it's extremely popular so don't understand the level of wear & tear. They offer a "shuttle service" to the waterfront from the hotel. Roughly it runs every 30 mins. The issue? It's $6. Is this a joke?!?! My uber was $7 (tip included). That's me hiring a private car service, on my own time, which takes me door to door, with only a few moments notice--$1 more than sharing a rickety van with 6 strangers??? Either make it free or get rid of it.Place had great views for the sunset right from the deck and pool area. There is also a hot tub and great size pool that over looks the yachts and boats on water.Our romantic anniversary weekend consisted of finding out we slept on BLOODY SHEETS!!! 1) We checked in on Thursday and found our tub and sink were plugged.  While we were at a wedding they unplugged the tub but not the sink.  2) We returned incredibly late and went straight to sleep.  We woke up in the morning to my boyfriend sleeping on a dirty pillow.3) Laying in bed I looked over and found BLOOD on the bed.  I confirmed it was not from either of us and disgustingly realized, I had slept on someone else blood ALL NIGHT!!! Worse part was it was in the mid section, there were two large spots, it was more than obviously menstrual blood.4) The hotel somehow disengaged our keys so I was locked out of my room at 6am.  Had to go to the lobby and request another.  The receptionist just asked for my room# and tossed the key at me like I had bothered her.  Not even an acknowledgment of their mistake.5) When I called the manager regarding the blood, he took 3 HOURS, to return my call.6) When the manager did call back, he said, "I listened to my voicemail. Come down to the front desk, we have vouchers for a free night." No acknowledgment of the situation, apology or even status of if they were going to send someone up to clean the room.7) Returned to the room that night to find ZERO parking spots in the garage or connected lots.  Had to park in check-in parking.8) All we asked of the manager was to have the room clean to "check-in" standards.  Returned to our room to find pubic hair on the toilet seat and outer wall of the bath tub.  Also, dirt on the floor of tub where the maid had stepped in the tub to access the interior towel rack.9) Despite trying to bribe us to go away with offers of free hotels nights and breakfast, even on check out, nothing was received or acknowledged.  10) Still 3 days after check out we have still to receive the call we requested Friday night from management.  We did call corporate.  They were receptive and warm.  However, despite ruining our 2 night anniversary weekend getaway, we have received 10,000 points.  That sounds like alot till you realize a night in a normal average room is 30,000 a night.  Incredibly disappointing.  Hotel has tremendous potential.  Accidents happen, every hotel is going to have a blunder but to have a mistake of bloody sheets and not even take 30 seconds to come to the room or listen to what happened was disgraceful. Even after a full phone call, I still had to ask the manager if he was going to send someone up to clean up the blood since he had lacked even addressing the main issue.Hopefully others continue to have better stays than this awful experience. At least, stays that require management attention, they may just leave as disappointed as us.We have been staying here about once a year or so for the past 7 years.  It used to be a bit better than its current state. Slowest elevators on earth, carpeting worn, drain in bathroom sink about as slow as the elevator. Breakfast - everything tasted like grease.  I'm not a vegetarian but noted that no offerings there except fruit/cereal.  I'm not a coffee drinker and good thing I brought my own tea as the tea selection was limited to green tea or Lipton's. The exercise room was acceptable. Staff pleasant but looks like the ownership isn't paying attention. Guess if you sell out every night you don't have to.The views are great.  The staff has been wonderful.  I had issues getting my work laptop online and they were very helpful.  Everything is very clean.  The property hasn't been remodeled to the Courtyard Bistro type lobby but the waterfront patio is great.Dirty and in dire need of a major renovation. Mildew and mold everywhere...small rooms - terrible bathrooms...Not comparible to other hotels in the chain..Would definitely reccommend another hotel until they clean it up. Only stayed here because work booked me here!Beware balcony doors! I was staying by myself and shut the door behind me and the security bar fell locking me out on the balcony.I'm torn between a 3 star and 4 star review. Here's why.When we arrived on a Sunday afternoon, there was a busload of what looked like spring breakers from a local high school or college. They were everywhere. They were drunk. They were pushing past me, my pregnant wife, and my son in a stroller. They thought we were different people and had conversations with us. It was a crazy nut house.The poor front desk folks seems unaffected by everything going on around them. When we showed up, they didn't seem to care that it was our first time visiting and we'd just spent 5 straight hours in a car with a screaming kid. They handed us our keys and said no more.We upgraded our room to overlook the pool. This was crucial because our baby monitor reached the pool, so we could hang out outside while little one slept in the room.The hotel provided a pack and play for our one-year-old, which was pretty great. They didn't bother setting it up in the room, but no problems there. The pack and play was obviously used, had a few stains on it. Again, no problems.Our room had a mini fridge and a microwave, both of which were sufficient. The shower was standard, the size of the room was standard, everything was fine. We tried to order dinner at their restaurant on the main floor, but I think they're only open for breakfast, which I guess makes sense in Charleston.I really liked the main outdoor area with rocking chairs that overlooked the pool and marina. Probably one of the better hotel views in Charleston.Oh yeah, they have a policy not to change the sheets until 3 days in to your stay. But we asked if they could change them 2 days in, and they did it, no questions asked.Staying here and while the staff is nice, they are woefully understaffed for the number of people they have staying here.  The place is dirty, the carpet in the hallway hasn't been vacuumed in 3 days.  The place is worn and no one seems to be overseeing anything.  Good breakfast, rooms ok, we didn't get a view so what's the point? beds ok, towels are average, ...not sure I'd stay here again.Was staying downtown for a quick getaway and booked the first place I could using Marriott reward points. I lucked out for sure. The staff was great, room was clean, and the best part was the steaming hot outdoor jacuzzi - in December!!!Only drawback was the parking and the speed of the elevators. The garage parking is a bit limited. I went down to grab some coffee in the morning. When I tried to go back up, I waited at least 10 minutes for the elevator to come. Overall, great place.  The views of the marina and river are beautiful.We recently stayed at the hotel and had a pretty pleasant experience.  We switched rooms the second day (they moved our items for us while we were out) to a room with a view of the marina.  Sunsets were beautiful.We took advantage of the hot tub while the sun was setting, again, very pretty.Spent some time down at the bar in the evening.  Shannon was great and very friendly.  Knowing that the hotel usually holds wedding parties, one suggestion would be to plan to keep the bar open a little later to accommodate the flow of people returning to the hotel after an event.I would suggest having some dining options available such as room service, as there is no restaurants within walking distance.For the price( 300.00 plus) I was disappointed...room was fairly clean...but so over priced it made me laugh... location location so they say...whew... I have experience far better way more humble...go to Vacation Rentals by Owner...Oh my stars what fun awesome priced deals!!! I use this site always and have never gotten a bad experience!Okay hotel, abysmal customer service.I was overcharged for my stay. I booked through a third party who collected the money upfront. The hotel also charged me when I checked in on my incidental credit card- which I never would have known if I didn't check my credit card bill (the charge isn't on my receipt). The real kicker is when I tried to call them, the phone continually rang busy. So much for being able to rectify the situation. What kind of hotel doesn't have a working phone, or the ability to appropriately charge their customers for their stay?Marriott customer service emailed them on my behalf, but I don't count on getting a response.  Other than this epic fail in customer service, my stay was fine. The location is inconvenient, but the hotel is more reasonably priced than comparable hotels downtown.  However, based on this current headache and time-suck, I would most definitely NOT recommend staying here- you'll enjoy your stay but regret it afterward.Overall, its a nice Courtyard. Rooms have been upgraded to new Marriott Courtyard style, with flat screens. Property is nicer than your typical Courtyard with the courtyard area facing the waterfront where you can hangout. I don't believe breakfast should be $10+ per person at these type properties, so we skipped that. Its close enough to the real downtown Charleston by car or hotel bus, so location is fine. My only real issue was the internet access was kinda slow, and when you travel for work, fast internet is sometimes more important than a comfy bed.It may be slightly outside of downtown but beautiful.  Painted a beautiful yellow with white trim.  Overlooks the river and yachts.  They have a wonderful breakfast.  When I was there it was not free but you got so much for so little.  So, we filled up everyday thinking we would skip lunch.  We did t.  We ate way too much because of the great food in the city.The decorations were nice and there were plenty of places to Sit and relax.  Read a book etc.  There was a nice garage under the hotel and getting places was easy.  I liked this better than the Marriott location that was three blocks away.Rooms were clean and the staff was friendly.  Waterfront view was beautiful and you could sit outside and have your breakfast.  We were there in January so it was a little nippy.It is a hidden gem.We were upgraded to a beautiful water view room and we loved it. Clean, reasonably priced, friendly staff, and a great property.  The only downside was that in some brochures they advertise a free breakfast which we were under the impression they had.  It was a little disappointing that they didn't ad the breakfast choices to by are not amazing a little overpriced.  You are not within walking distance of the touristy things so we did have to drive which wasn't fun, but we didn't have to pay for parking which was nice.
review_content_20: It was a nice hotel, but I think that the name is deceiving.  The location was pretty inconvenient considering how close it was to downtown.  You are right next to highways going everywhere so forget about walking.The parking is free, which is cool.This is a beautiful hotel with a friendly staff.The rooms appear to be clean.The location on the water is splended.This hotel had a beautiful view and lovely premises (including an outdoor pool, fire pit, hot tub, plenty of indoor and outdoor seating), and is fairly close to downtown. The staff is very friendly and competent; in particular, the front desk clerk (Sara), the extremely hardworking breakfast staff, and the housekeeping staff.The view was 5 stars.  The staff was nice and helpful but on the downside... we didn't spend our time in the small room. We had to pay extra for breakfast but the overall experience was nice.Location: The waterfront view is cool. It is about 1.5-2 miles from the historic district so maybe not within walking distance in the Charleston summer heat.  There is a Marriott property right down the street also.Also, looks like it is within walking distance of some hospitals in the downtown area.Great view... Of a parking lot. Room could not be exchanged for twin-bed room, and waited a VERY long time to check in. Overall, nice lobby and pool area, but the view and balcony offerings are misleading- we were shocked to see a foot-wide balcony with a plastic table and chairs crammed onto it. Overall, a mediocre experience. Staff, however, were overall very friendly.I was in Charleston with friends who had their reception dinner at the Courtyard Charleston Waterfront. What I saw of the hotel was incredibly nice, they have a good location, the staff was very attentive and helpful, the views are amazing (overlooks the yachts in the marina) and the Food Was INCREDIBLE! They prepared a low country boil with shrimp, potato, sausage, and corn. I Had a great time! Although I did not stay in one of their rooms one of the employees mentioned all the rooms had just been renovated. My recommendation is based upon a reception dinner and not an actual stay at the hotel as I only attended a reception there.Great property with a awesome a harbor view !We chose this location rather than a downtown hotel to save a little on costs.  We were very happy with our choice - we had a rental car so no problem to drive into the historic area and pay a little for parking, it is too far to walk.  They have an hourly or twice an hour shuttle into downtown but it was cheaper for us to drive and park than pay the per person fee.  You can do an internet search to find a map of public parking garages in downtown.We've stayed in much nicer hotels, but we were happy with everything provided - covered parking and wifi included rather than an additional charge.  We stayed on the 4th floor and noise was not an issue.  Our room had a horrible view - of the VA medical center across the street.  A couple times we came back late and had to park outside which as only an issue due to the heat in the summer.  If we had known about the laundry machines we would have maybe packed a little lighter.  Cleaning staff were great - left a bag of fresh towels and bathroom stuff outside our door when we opted to skip the daily cleaning a couple of times. The pool and jacuzzi were adequate.  We had afternoon cocktails and sat on the deck a couple of times, and had the breakfast once.  I didn't feel well one night so H got cup of noodles from the food market behind the registration desk. The front desk has a cooler with fruit infused water - so if you're really looking to pinch pennies I guess you could fill your water bottle here before you head out into the heat.  Hotel staff were all very friendlyWe'll definitely look into Marriott Courtyard for future travel - as long as they have the same amenities.Only issues were - construction of some condos going on in the plot next door so there was some morning noiseAnd final issue which is not the hotel's fault/problem-entrance is only from the southbound direction of Lockwood, so you have to U turn if you are going northbound on Lockwood, or access Lockwood from Spring St.  Our navigation map incorrectly showed that you can turn from Bee street westbound to Lockwood southbound, but this is not true.  When you're at the intersection the arrows all direct you to turn north/right onto Lockwood.I give this Courtyard a less than desirable rating for two reasons.  1. The check-in process has you parking way out of the way and you cant get there from the parking area,2. The TVs have not been upgraded and should be high on their priority list of needs.This hotel is classic courtyard marriott.  The rooms are clean, fairly comfortable (courtyard marriott beds don't agree with me for some reason).  The hotel also has free parking which is a big deal if you are driving into town as parking downtown can be a nightmare.  The 3 stars comes from the location and desk staff.  The location is across a major road from downtown, so it is not really walkable unless the weather is perfect.  It is also near the hospital, so it is a bit sketchy at night, so to get to the old city downtown, one has the option of trying to find parking or catching a cab.Also, the front desk while nice was not all that helpful.  We arrived around 11pm on a Friday night (gotta love those O'hare delays), and the first lady at the desk could not give us the name of any place in the area that was open, and the second lady sent us to two places that after a 15 minute sketchy walk (see above) were also both closed.  We ended up ordering at 1am from pizza hut.Beautiful hotel with hot tub and pool!  We were here for a wedding at the Thomas Bennett house, so it was very convenient.  The staff was very friendly.  The room was comfortable.  Nicer than your average hotel ... no continental breakfast though -- bummer.Pretty location and the outdoor breakfast had great views and excellent service. The MUSC discount was about 1/2 price and conveniently located less than a mile from the hospital. The walls were pretty thin and there were few amenities, until I learned there were glasses and a coffee maker in the hutch. Lobby coffee was good. It was a comfortable stay.Great hotel on the water. Have some construction currently (fall 2012) but it is not intrusive. Staff was helpful, rooms great, breakfast average but well priced.  10 minutes from waterfront and historic district.Nice hotel, pretty convenient to get to places, but a little tricky to get back to from downtown.  The staff were very nice and helpful, I don't have any complaints at all.  I would definitely stay there again.

review_content: Sure I have stayed in more fancy hotels, plenty of them. I have stayed in much more expensive hotels, plenty of them. But this Holiday Inn was perfect for what it was and where it is in Charleston. Comfortable room, clean, modern. Nice lobby, nice little restaurant with an included breakfast. The price was reasonable. Easy walk to everything. We walked to the Battery from there and back which is a pleasant way to go through the historic district and be "looky loos".Worst IHG experience ever. Doesn't even deserve the 1 star given!!If there was a way to get my money back I would ask for it.  Valet is $16 per night plus tax and they damaged my car door.  Good thing car is under warranty because it was fixed for free.  The rate per night was $171(govt rate) but includes nothing, no free breakfast, wifi or even decent coffee.  The ONLY good thing about the hotel is the prime location.  Its close to EVERYTHING which we decided to walk everywhere due to limited parking in downtown Charleston.There was construction going on, no warning about it, which caused the entire hotel to shake from 8-5 like it was a constant earthquake.  It may my daughter sick to the point my parents switched hotels and eventually I did as well.  Then the smell throughout the hotel was disgusting, smelled like raw sewage ugh, the dryer was broke maintenance didn't know how to fix it, no microwaves in the rooms and apparently no daily housekeeping service either.  I wouldn't recommend this particular location to anyone.This hotel is as nice as it looks. The receptionist told me it had been redone 2.5 years ago, and it shows.I was only gonna stay one night, but I liked it so much I stayed two more. The saltwater pool is lovely, the staff is super-friendly, and it's convenient to walk downtown. I especially liked the giant shower stall, which is more pleasant to use than the cramped bathtubs you usually get in hotels. While you're in Charleston, I suggest you go to Shem Creek to see the dolphins in the afternoon, check out the lovely, quiet beaches of Sullivan's Island and tour the Slave Mart Museum.I ate at Charleston's Cafe one day, and it was fabulous.It is located in the dip of the inlet of Charleston.  The area is referred to as the "Culinary district."  Pro: walking distance to the bars, local shops,etc.  The staff was great!Con: Valet parking at $20 a day. No shuttle service within a 10 block radius. No buffet breakfast on Sunday.We were pleased with our stay at this Holiday Inn location in historic downtown Charleston, SC.  We received great services and accommodations from everyone whom we encountered.  1) This Holiday Inn doesn't offer self-parking.  Everything was done by the valet service.  However, the valet young men were very courteous.  If you are coming off I-26 (this interstate ends at downtown Charleston) and continuing onto Meeting St., turn onto Woolfe and then make a U-turn at one (1) of the commercial lots.  That way you can park at the "valet loading & unloading zone" and have the valet personnel take care the rest for you.  2) The check-in time is 1600 hour.  If you arrive early, you can check in and have your luggage restored before your room is ready.  3) Where the hotel is located is on the verge of "sketchy" and "touristy" areas.  I personally don't recommend you to head toward the I-26 direction unless you're very comfortable with the surroundings.  4) This Holiday Inn is about one (1) block east from King St.  Some Yelpers might disagree with me on this, but I liked the north-side portion of the King St. because there were some local eateries, fine dining, and places I saw local residents would hang out at.  5) The actual "market" would be located on the south side of downtown Charleston.  Parking in that area was a major struggle for us.  If you don't mind walking, it's approximately twenty (20) to thirty (30) minutes worth of walk.  6) They don't offer a complementary continental breakfast, yet they have a restaurant on site, which offers a buffet-style breakfast, happy hours, dinner, and late-night bar.  7) Complementary coffee was always plenty in the lobby.  8) The room was nice.  The AC was certainly strong and could be adjusted accordingly.  The only minor problem was the water leakage in the bathroom.  Otherwise, everything else was satisfactory.  9) If you need a taxi service to the airport or somewhere else, let the hotel front desk person know because they have a "chartered guy" they like to use.  For me, it was $15/person to CHS.  10) I wanted to give a shout-out to John, one of the Holiday Inn valet crew.  He was always on top of things and volunteered to help us with luggage.  Holiday Inn Charleston Historic Downtown could be one of the most affordable hotels in the area.  I will definitely consider stay here again if I ever come back to Charleston in the futureWe stayed here while downtown celebrating a friend's bachelorette weekend! They were great at accommodating us with checking in early. The front desk staff were all so friendly and we felt like friends by the end of our visit. They were attentive and helpful with all of our needs. The room was average sized with two full beds. The linens and pillows were great! They offered two firm and two soft pillows per bed, which was nice. Most hotels don't have such nice ones on the bed.The pool area was interesting. It is on the second floor and is oddly placed/shaped. We did find an area to lay out, but it was just... weird. The pool itself was very clean and the water felt fantastic.My complaint. The doors and walls are very thin. At 7am, we heard so many people in the hallway. Breakfasts being delivered, room service starting, others checking out. I felt as though they were practically in the room making this noise. It was quite frustrating when we weren't going to be getting up that early- after having a late night.We were worried about the construction when we checked in on Friday about 3pm, but it was in no way an issue. Noise stopped at 4pm, and we never heard another peep during our stay (checked out Sunday am). Awesome location, trolley stop right across the street, easy and short ride to anything you want to do. Room was big and comfy. We were happy and would stay there again on our next visit.This was a nice, clean, new hotel to stay in during my time in Charleston. It definitely looks new. The valet parking guys were really helpful in calling cabs for me (I didn't have a car). The room itself was large and well kept. It's not necessarily the most convenient location though if you don't have a car. I either had to do 30 minute walks to anywhere I had to go or I had to get my friend to pick me up. For the quality and the price it was worth it though.On a long weekend we stayed in the 5th floor corner suite. The suite was amazing. Great view of the bridge.We have two young kids and the suite provided extra room for them to play. Plus, when bed time came around we put one on the sleeper and one in a pack and play in the bedroom. The bathroom was huge!The room was not cheap but we thought it was worth it for the size and added convenience with two young kids.The hotel itself is modern, open, and feels welcoming.The staff was incredibly friendly and arranged an early check-in for us. They also have valet parking and the valet staff was prompt and helpful.One thing to be aware of: This hotel is on the very edge of the historic district. It's a short walk to the shopping on King Street. The historic district in Charleston is best experienced by walking so note that you'll do a bit more when staying here. It is also about a block into a part of the community that has not yet experienced the gentrification of the rest of the historic district.Walking distance to a lot of good bars and restaurants. The hotel itself is nice and clean. The staff if very friendly and was very willing to make suggestions on place to check out  around the area.   There is a "roof" top pool, on the 2nd floor.  It is on a roof, but its is not the very top of the building, which is 3 floors higher.    The rooms were clean and quiet, but views were not that spectacular.  Bed's were firm and comfy.  We didn't get one of the walkin shower rooms, but everything was still nice.  There is no free parking at this hotel.  You have to valet your car for ~$17 a night.  They have system of car elevators in which they store your car.  This valet is ran 24hrs a day though. I would not pay retail for this though, but do use priceline or something similar.Located about a 15-20 minute walk from the downtown area where most things are happening. Bathroom wasn't as clean as I would've liked. You can see some footprints and I also found two empty nip bottles on the shelves under the sink in the bathroom so I'm not sure how thorough the staff cleans.Also be mindful of your belongings and leaving them in your hotel room. On our last day there we went out briefly for a run and left the do not disturb sign on our door before heading out. When we got back to pack to leave, I realized all the cash in my wallet was missing. Reported it to the staff and management only to realize they don't have security cameras in the hallways. They were able to confirm based on the key card that someone did enter the room even though there was a do not disturb sign on the door. Also, just an fyi if something like this does happen to you, file the police report that moment. Since I had to rush to catch a flight, the manager said I could file a police report over the phone. When I got home to file the report, the police said that I can't file over the phone. Ultimately, the manager was able to help me file the report but this whole process has been dragged out longer than it needed to be. The whole process took more than a week before I was finally able to file the police report. The officer also informed me because it took a while for me to file the police report there's little they can do about it. Obviously the corporate Holiday Inn office and local office are playing tag and no one is taking responsibility for the inaccurate information and just keep dragging out this process. I expected more from a large chain like this. Overall, staff was friendly and the manager was willing (but inefficient) to help us with the ordeal but whether you can trust them or not, you can be the judge.I thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. Staff was super friendly and always available to answer any of our questions. They have valet parking.  Downtown is close by and it's just a quick walk away. Rooms were clean, turn down service was great.  Would definitely stay here again.This is a new location that just opened in February. On Meeting that is a couple blocks from restaurants, etc. this is another part of Charleston going through improvements.Hotel is great, nicely laid out, easy valet (you will not self park here) and a full restaurant and bar. As an FYI, THE GRITS HERE ARE SOME OF THE BEST!Holiday Inn is making many upgrades to current hotels and building new. I was impressed!I absolutely loved this hotel.  Great location, friendly staff, and an amazing room.  The pool was a plus too.  Worth the higher price.Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. We stayed 9/18-9/20. Jaime, one of the front desk girls (long dark hair and glasses) gave us great tourist and restaurant recommendations. Walking distance to great King Street finds! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Valet parking, but it is $16/day. Would definitely stay again.This place is great! Friendly service and really close to a really pretty park! You do have to request a river view in advance.My wife's $300 Oakely Sunglasses were stolen out of the room.  We called the manager and he more or less told us that we most likely lost them and they were not stolen.   They were definitely stolen and we know 100% that we left them next to the coffee maker on the table.  I highly suggest that you not stay at this hotel because they are thieves and the management will not help you in getting your STOLEN items back.  They should do a better job at doing background checks and keeping an eye on their house keeping staff.   They even know the woman that was I. Our room but said she left for the day.  Very condescending mangers running this place.My wife and I arrived today only to be told our reservations had been thwarted to another Holiday Inn. This was a complete mix up with a larger grouping agency(exped$&)...which whom we will never grace with our business EVER AGAIN. They were rude and unprofessional to say the very least. We had the ABSOLUTE PLEASURE of working with Tammy through this disaster of a debacle and she could not have been any more perfect. TAMMY needs a raise and complete utmost respect for making a bad situation not only tolerable but copesetic and compliant with all 4 parties involved. I honestly cannot say enough good things about this supervisor and will recommend this hotel to friends and family for years to come.Paul MatuszynskiThoroughly enjoyed the stay at this hotel.  Staff was friendly and helpful.  Room clean and comfortable.   Restaurant very good.  A little extra walking but no problem. Convenient to visitors center.  Free trolly was helpful.  Hope to return and would recommend this hotel.  Don O.The Holiday Inn Express chain has been a consistent performer for me as I have travelled across they country. I rarely experience anything out of the ordinary, and if there is an issue, they handle it quickly with a smile.This location is definitely one of the higher end designs of the chain with a very modern and open feel. The staff was super friendly and helpful, and they offer valet parking. They also have a GREAT restaurant inside of the hotel that offers up quite a few southern dishes with a spin.The room on the fourth floor was spacious, clean, modern, and had everything I needed. I also noticed that they stock the bathroom with Bath and Bodyworks products, so that is a nice feature.The only objectionable issues is due to their location. The room balcony did not offer up much of a view, and the hotel is a few blocks from the busy part of Charleston downtown, but it's definitely within walking distance. This is the best hotel that I have stayed in while visiting downtown Charleston; the right value, the right service, and the convenience makes this HIE location a great deal.
review_content_20: For a holiday inn, this is a really nice hotel. The outdoor is nice. Our group was less than a 5 minute walk to King St. Going out in the city was not a problem. The staff was friendly and helpful. If you are coming for any occasion, I strongly encourage this hotel.If you are a music promoter do NOT reserve here for your artists unless you are there with your credit card when they check in. They will not be able to check in and will end up endlessly debating bullshit with the front desk when they should be getting up for flights. Failing hard. Hard.Pros:The hotel is very modern looking and super clean. Tammy and Kristen at the front desk went above and beyond for us! The pool area was clean and a nice place to hang out and relax. The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The shower was huge and had great water pressure.Cons:It is a 15 to 20 minute walk to the market where all the tourist stuff is. The bartenders were not great. They were slow and didn't know how to make some drinks. The internet was slow and I was unable to print my boarding pass from the computers in the hall.My husband and 2 kids came to Charleston yesterday for a church conference for a week  .We have 2 adjoining rooms.If I could give a neg 5 stars rating right now, I would . Yesterday at check in it would have been 1 star and that was because the staff was polite, especially the person in charge.But this morning at 5:45a they are definitely in the negative.After check in , I walked into my room and smelt mold so strong ,it's been around for a while . I am head of Health and Safety at my job so I know mold when I smell it. I started my inspection of the room. Of course right by the air conditioning vent there is a panel full of mold.Gross!. We called the front desk,of course there were no rooms left that were adjoining. The guy in charge comes and offers to have house keeping come with bleach and wipe it off. This is what amateurs do .They wipe  the mold off the surface but the spores are still there and it comes right back .This is probably why it was such a strong mold smell in that room .I told him no, they had to replace the panel  and disinfect the area before putting the new one up. The head guy came with a ladder and did this himself while we went to eat. Where is maintenance? SMH !We returned to a new panel and a better smelling room.Tell me why at 5:30 this morning I hear water running in the bathroom . I wake up my husband to check it out and he comes back to tell me there's water coming through the light in the shower from upstairs. This is is truly crazy! We call the front desk. They were very nice .Still no empty adjoining rooms .Maintenance starts at 7 a. We have 4 people to get dress this morning. They offered for us to use the shower in a room on the other side of the hotel .Too inconvenient ! We will have to get up early and use the shower in the kids room so we won't be late. Go to use the shower in the kids room the shower door is missing a handle and the door swings. This is going to be a long week!Apparently this is a new location. Although some of the old reviews are still listed, I assure you they no longer apply. Read on if you are heading toward Charleston. White glove treatment from Kevin, the manager. We referred to him as The Handsome Professional. He also lead us to the most fun we've had on any trip and I'll highlight those places in other reviews here. Pleasantly caught off guard when the head housekeeper said, "Have a nice day Miss K!" When is the last time someone at a chain hotel greeted you by name or giggled along with you as you recounted your experiences? Although it looks like a chain hotel it has the service of a b & b. If there were 6 stars, I'd offer them to Jamie, Jessie, Brendan, Nicole, Kristen and Brooks... so many standouts. When they say Southern Hospitality, they mean that you will be welcomed and ushered into such fine and relaxing experiences. We were simply amazed by the service. The small pool was the perfect temperature both morning and evening. The place is immaculately clean. Designed with porcelain tile, contemporary furnishings and comfy beds. Wireless is easy and free. Bonus: it is just a block or two from King Street and all their valet/transportation arrangements are swift and easy. I see nothing standing in your way. Book it!I really enjoyed staying here during my five night visit.  I was in town for a friend's wedding and decided to make it a mini vacation.  The room was clean and spacious.  As a vacation hotel, this is a nice clean location.  Staff was friendly and efficient with check in and out.  It is about an easy flat 20 minute walk to the touristy part of Charleston.  One can walk, take a pedi-cab, or take the local free downtown bus.  There is a bus stop right across the street.  One block over is King Street with a number of bars and restaurants.  I preferred this location over downtown because of its location to King Street and its night life.  Only available parking is valet which adds to the cost of vacationing.  I would recommend skipping the car rental since everything is pretty easy to walk to and parking is difficult anywhere in downtown Charleston.  Parking is a premium anywhere in the main part of city since it is located on a peninsula.  Think San Francisco or Manhattan.The place is clean and convenient, but the staff is not the greatest. I stayed here for 2 weeks. The Internet went down multiple times. When the laundry machine was out of order they didn't help out. Their services close down before the time they advertise. We valeted our car once, and they said we'd be charged valet service for every day we were at the hotel. They will not go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable. Eh.Very clean modern hotel. The front desk employees were all extremely friendly and accommodating. Would recommend staying here.Had a great time while staying here a fee weeks ago. Jamie was on top of all of the front desk operations whether it was checking people in or handling guest issues she kept her kool and composure. She was also good with recommending good restaurants in the area. What impressed me the most was how she handled the question of "is this area safe?" To which she responded "it is under restoration" she did not skip a beat and is a great asset to your hotel.Clean room and friendly service.  We were there to visit the city, didn't use any of the amenities, but they looked nice.  We did use the valet parking because it was all they had.  Valet were nice and timely.  It's in good walking distance to downtown so we didn't take the car out very often.We just checked in today and are sorely disappointed. To begin with our rooms weren't ready and that's understandable because it was 1:00.  We were told they would call us when the rooms were ready and they didn't. We returned to the hotel at 4 and they were ready. Our friends got up to there room, pulled the covers back to slip in for a quick nap and the sheets were dirty!! There was hair and crumbs on the sheets, how gross is that? Of course the hotel changed the sheets, but not a great way to start this last leg of our trip. This hotel is on the absolute edge of town. It borders an area that has not been redeveloped and we didn't feel safe walking at night.  It is close to the Visitor's Center and the free trolley and in the daylight you wouldn't feel uncomfortable walking. The free trolley is a bust as it's extremely crowded and takes awhile to catch one and get around. There is a lot of traffic so driving isn't preferable, but since this hotel is so far from the heart of the Historic District you need your car, a cab or the funky trolley. Wish we'd stayed somewhere else.We stayed here for six days while attending the Family Circle Cup and had kind, attentive, and friendly service from EVERYONE (from the front desk to the valet dudes to the housekeepers.) Our requests ranged from, "Can you pull my car up immediately?" to "Do you have a bandaid?" to "Can we borrow an umbrella?" Yes, Yes, and Yes were the responses. Hospitality in Charleston is legendary and the staff at the Ho-Inn are no exception.Yes, it was a bit expensive, but (a) it's brand new(b) it was the FCC tournament(c) Charleston has a shortage of newer hotels that don't smell like the 1900s'Nuf said.This review is for the bar and happy hour.  What a great experience.  The staff was so accommodating.  They opened early just for us.  There was wireless in the bar area, so we were able to have our project meeting in the comfortable and beautiful surroundings.  Best part, the drinks were very reasonable and there was incredible food!  The chef came out and greeted us as brought wonderful tapas.  We had hummus, fresh made pickled vegetable, buffalo shrimp, and creme brulee all on the house.  This is now my favorite place for meetings.HOLY LORD! Bed BUGS!! My best friends sister AND dad just stayed here and found out that there were bed bugs!! Her sister said that after she saw a bug scurrying towards her at 1am, she put 2 and 2 together.  It was so big that originally she thought it was a baby cockroach!  The next morning she talked to the house keeping and the housekeeper said that she had a list and that my friends sisters room was ON THE LIST of rooms with bed bugs!! EEWWW!!! Their one saving grace was that after she found out that evening what they were, they immediately placed both her and her father in a new room, but how can you sleep after that?!  This place needs to shut down and call in the Orkin man!  DO NOT GO HERE!Holiday Inns can be hit or miss.  This one is a hit hit hit.  The only difference between this Holiday Inn and a business traveler's Marriott or Hilton was that it lacked an Executive Lounge.TWO WORDS: BED BUGS!My cousin got married two weeks ago in Charleston. The bridal party and the guest stayed at this hotel. My sister and father were in room 430. My sister stays up late because she works night shift. They flew in on Friday, the wedding was Saturday and their departure was Monday. SUNDAY night, I get at text from my sister saying they are in a brand new, clean hotel and a small "roach" the size of her pinkie finger nail came straight for her. Well that "roach" was a bed bug. And after she was attacked by 10 - I REPEAT 10- which she massacred, she woke my dad up to find that THREE were on his back. ONE FULL of blood. They called the front desk and were promptly moved to a different room. Mind you bed bugs can easily travel in suitcases or on linens- so they could have brought bed bugs from room 430 to the new room. (also the previous two nights she did not stay up to see the bed bugs, but did text me that she was bit by something). My problem is this 1. there were bed bugs- but the next day at check out the manager wanted to charge my sister and father for the room! they had to argue with him to be compensated- even after he wanted to charge them for valet parking! eventually, everything was comped. The front desk staff was very accommodating, efficient, and nice assisting my dad and sister. It was the manager on duty who did not want to comp the rooms. My dad and sister were not the only guest to get bed bugs either, other guest reported bites including the bridal party.Finally- CHECK ALL ROOMS AT ANY HOTEL YOU STAY AT FOR BED BUGS. You can do this by lifting up the mattress and visually inspecting for bugs, look around the wall, head board, and bed for rust colored stains. Never put your luggage close to the wall or bed, instead place on the luggage rack and put in the middle of the room- also invest in hard luggage that does not zip and bed bugs can not climb into those types of cases.Since this yelp review I have emailed HGI corporate and the manager of the hotel at Charleston both have assured me that this situation has been dealt with and that they have had bed bug inspectors and exterminators at the hotel and have been given a clean bill. So if anyone else stays here and finds bed bugs let the hotel know so they can promptly address the issue.Hotel was new, clean, friendly but it is not located any where near historic down town. You have to drive the few miles to get there. They only offer valet parking for $16 a day and every time you need your car you have to call for it and tipping gets pricey. You could try and park on the street but it's on the fringe of a shady part of town (ladies of the evening hanging across the street) and there is a lot of construction going on with new buildings going up making spots near the hotel impossible to find. Although we didn't hear any noise from the construction, our room was on that side and we had to make sure the drapes were shut. We had drinks that evening at the bar, and were the only ones in there. We ate breakfast at that restaurant, good food but not a lot. $2.50 for a cup of coffee. It's clear that they are rebuilding the area and it will be a nice place to stay once that's completed. If you don't mind tipping constantly to get your car and driving into historic downtown this will suit your needs fine. Again it's brand new(beds are still comfy, sheets soft) and the staff was very nice and accomodating.My boyfriend took me to Charleston for my birthday in April and chose to stay at this location to be downtown near bars, restaurants, and my friends from college.  It was amazing!  When we got there we were upgraded to a larger sutie, the girls at the front desk were awesome, especially Stephanie and Tracy? I think those are their names, but at any rate, the two young girls who worked there in the evenings on the weekends--they were obviously young in the hospitality industry but made us feel so welcome and went above and beyond to ensure we enjoyed our stay!  Kudos ladies and the new Holiday Inn-we'll definitely be staying here next time.A hospitality disappointment. Terrible experience. While the hotel is new it is in a transitioning area not the main downtown well-known historic district that comes to mind when thinking of Charleston. We booked & paid in advance through holiday inn website then hotel charged again for taxes & tried to tell us we had not paid for that expense yet.... Parking is only valet & cars are put on stacked lifts- no other parking options available. There were glasses & dishes outside of the rooms on our hallway which remained there for the duration of our stay (2 nights). If that is how they are with how they are with cleaning dishes & public hallways it makes one wonder where else they are skimping. At check-in we were offered just a cart without assistance for 3 ladies. I could imagine where this may not be a standard at a holiday inn express but for a main holiday inn I feel that it was lacking.

review_content: Clean room, friendly staff, nice property, good food on the breakfast bar. Will most definitely stay again on my next trip to Charleston.This Springhill Suites is dated.  It looks like they threw some paint on the walls, changed the bedding, threw in the wet bar and called it "recently renovated".  Our room is a bit musty, and the bathroom looked a bit worn with dated fixtures.  They have a free continental breakfast in the lobby each morning.  It was the usual disappointment that a "free continental breakfast" is.  Eggs, sausage and pancakes getting weird, and rubbery in warming dishes... bags and cheap bread for toast... out of season fruit (bananas, oranges, apples).  If it had been up to me, I would have rather paid for a real meal rather than eat that sad display.I stayed at Springhill Suites Marriott in May for a wedding, the room was approx. $200/night.  The reason we chose this location was because it was about half the price of the hotels in downtown Charleston.  It was a close to the city, 5-10 min. drive, about a $10 Uber ride, though only about 2 miles away, it was not really walk-able because of the bridges that separate this hotel from downtown.There was a nice walking/bike path down the street from the hotel, it weaved a few miles through a residential part of town.  That was probably the most enjoyable part about my stay at the Springhill Suites Marriott at Ripley Point.I really enjoyed my (brief) stay at this property last week. The king suite was a great value at $103+tax! My room was modern, clean, big enough, and had a small balcony. Front desk staff was friendly and honored my only two requests prior to arrival (high floor room and room far from elevator). I wasn't able to take advantage of some of the amenities such as the complimentary shuttle to downtown or breakfast, but it was nice to know they were available. If I return to Charleston again, I hope I can be a guest here again.Found this place for a last minute get away. Perfect size for our family. Breakfast was good with kids too. Best thing,,,the shuttle back and forth to downtown in the evenings. No parking hassles. Very clean and great customer service. This is our go to for family stays in Charleston.Nice, clean and very accommodating. All of the staff members were helpful and professional. Overall, an exceptional stay.Wonderful large rooms. Clean and neat.  Lobby is on the second floor but there is an elevator to take you up. Friendly and helpful staff. Free parking. Free wifi. Free hot and cold breakfast buffet. Free shuttle to the historic district.  Free cookies and hot drinks at night.  Right on the marina with some great views and photo shots. Only negative so far? No restaurants within walking distance but they do have menus for delivery options.  I was able to get a good price on Priceline of132. Reasonable for the location and items included. I would recommend it and stay here again.The accommodations were wonderful and the staff was exceptional. The breakfast was great and the closeness to downtown was a huge convenience. The staff was friendly, knowledgeable and eager to help. I had a great experience at Springhill Suites and I checkout with a smile on my face. This hotel gets my highest recommendation and I look forward to my next visit.TamaraNice place to stay overall. Very convenient shuttle to downtown starting at 5pm till 11pm, the drivers are all friendly, knowledgable, and great at engaging you during your trip. The room had 2 nice sized TVs, a clean king sized bed, and roomy bathroom. The room also had a large window, and plenty of lights. My only negative about the room are the pillows, may want to bring your own, mine were way to soft.Breakfast in the morning is fantastic, a huge variety of food, and everything I had (grits, corn beef hash, turkey bacon, bagels, and muffins) was a delight to eat.I would stay here again.A pretty hotel, but the beds seemed smaller than expected.  Still, the room was comfy & there was plenty of space.  It was however, impossible to shower without getting water all over the floor in our room- I think the shower curtain just wasn't long enough.  We were there when it was raining & the front desk clerk suggested we take the stairs off the lobby down to the parking lot- that was a mistake! The steps were SO slippery due to the rain that I went slipping & sliding down them (painful!). So, if it's raining, avoid those steps like the plague- otherwise it's a comfy hotel.  Breakfast was what you'd expect from a breakfast buffet at a hotel.  Edible, but you'd be better off getting breakfast in town.Great location to access downtown Charleston and quite a savings over downtown.  We didn't even use the free shuttle because of our schedule, but it's 5-10 easy minutes to the free parking along the Battery.  Can't beat it.  It was very convenient to be able to quickly jump back to the hotel and then go back downtown for dinner.  Staff was great and breakfast was definitely above par.Actually 3-1/2 stars.  The rooms are a contemporary take on a standard suite-style room.  We were on a recently renovated floor, which was bright and cheerful.  Our room was clean, and faced the marina (the other side faces a natural river wetland.  We booked here because it's a bargain compared to downtown hotels, parking is free, AND they've a free shuttle to/from downtown.  It's a 10 minute ride and has friendly drivers who know all the best places to eat in town.We arrived by rental car; did I say that parking is free?  That's a plus if you're planning on visiting the plantations along the Ashley River (15-20 minutes away.)  Note that there's an elevator to the 2nd floor lobby; we found it after we'd dragged our bags up the large open stair.  The staff was fantastically welcome and helpful.  Though I'm a Marriott preferred guest, most hotels in this chain simply record the number, add the points, and go about their business.  At this property, a gift bag with maps, bottled water, and cookies were handed to me at check-in.  Nice!A complimentary hot breakfast is included.  This includes scrambled eggs, home fries, and a breakfast meat, so this is a real plus.There were two issues (otherwise a 4-star rating), which we reported to the desk.  Hopefully they'll make the fixes and your stay will be even better:  Wifi connections were slow, and occasionally dropped out; the TV had a peculiar connection problem, where it worked when we swung the unit from the wall, but lost the signal when we pushed it back, flush to the wall.I booked this stay a few months back using a complimentary Marriott Certificate I had earned. The front desk personal was super friendly. The gentleman gave may a welcome gift local treat and a bottle of water. He also me offered another 2 beverages and a snack from the marketplace store.My room was located on the top floor and had a outdoor balcony and a view of the harborThey offer a shuttle here twice an hour to the downtown area if you don't have a car which is great. They also offer complimentary breakfast daily, although I didn't eat here.Overall I was happy with my stay here and would return again in the future.I would definitely stay here again. The hotel is right outside downtown Charleston (only a ten minute drive to King St). They had a very nice, hot complimentary breakfast every morning until 10:00 a.m. The hotel also offered free nightly shuttle service to downtown Charleston. We had a suite which was very large (included and kitchenette) and overlooked a marina. The only negative I have to say is that there could be more variety in the breakfast every morning (but hey, it was free) and the pool could have been bigger. But overall, I would stay here again!Giving this place 2 stars as it has some work to do to get to the 3 or 4 star range. First, the room was very nice and updated. Didn't really like the placement of the TV as it was hard to see if you were lying on the far side of the bed, but that is a small detail. The bed was really awkward. There wasn't a mattress cover, but a blanket under the fitted sheet. It moved anytime you moved in the bed and caused wrinkles that you could feel under the sheet. Next, the duvet did not have a cover on it. I would not imagine those are washed after each guest, so I would have wanted to see a cover on it. Also, the duvet was way too small for the bed. It barely reached the edges of the bed and did not work when there were 2 people sharing the bed. It was a war all night pulling back and forth to try and stay covered by the duvet.Now comes the worst part. We were woken up by construction at 7:45am. It sounded like someone was trying to come through the wall behind the bed. When I told the front desk about this, they stated that construction wasn't supposed to start until 9 or 10am. It's a little shocking that as a hotel manager, you didn't know that your hotel was having construction completed on it before it was scheduled. Also a little shocking, the construction manager was standing somewhere nearby and heard our conversation and came around to say sorry and ask if we wanted it stopped. Of course by that time, we were up and packed and nothing needed to be done. Didn't think it was too professional him stepping into our conversation while I was speaking to the manager, but that is not necessarily the hotel's fault. Also, the shuttle to downtown needs to stick to its schedule a little better. It was over 15 minutes late and we almost missed our dinner reservations due to this. Lastly, housekeeping needs to check the balconies when they are cleaning the rooms as we found a water-bottle full of cigarettes on our balcony. If the bed situation and construction can get under control, I would recommend this hotel as a good option versus the outrageously expensive hotels in DT Charleston.While not as well appointed as newer Springhill Suites, I found this to be a comfortable and well run hotel.  I have always been impressed with Marriott properties and found you can always count on them for a good stay.  As with most Marriott properties, the bed was very comfortable.  The room was spacious and clean and included a desk and pullout couch.  The only complaint would be the "crib" we requested for our child.  It turned out to just be a pack and play.   The staff was courteous and helpful.  The hotel has a mini mart in the lobby that included snacks, drinks, and alcohol.  The included breakfast was a full spread complete with waffles to make, fresh oatmeal, cereal, and fresh entrees.  The breakfast casserole was really good.The property also has a pool and hot tub.  The staff also organizes daily events for the guests.
